speaker: Sanaki
text: You have done excellent work, Ike. Thanks to you, the wound that has scarred Begnion for many long years can finally begin to heal. As promised, Begnion now offers its support to Crimea's restoration. However, Prime Minister Sephiran has yet to return, which limits the reinforcements I can provide. Be that as it may, what troops I can spare await your command. Use them as you see fit.

speaker: Ike
text: I understand. Thank you. That's good news, isn't it, Princess Elincia?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes. Yes it is.

speaker: Sanaki
text: This has taught me a valuable lesson...Our land needs the laguz. I also believe that beorc and laguz need each other to survive. The previous apostle, my grandmother, was desirous of such a world, as were my own parents. Princess Elincia, your father, King Ramon of Crimea, was a true pioneer in the area of beorc-laguz relations. In the very near future, I will give the imperial senate a few...suggestions on achieving a fully integrated society. I doubt the road will be easily traveled, but I can no longer turn a blind eye to these issues. Princess Elincia, you must rebuild Crimea. If you are sucessful, we will join forces and change the world.

speaker: Elincia
text: Empress Sanaki, your vision surpasses even my own... My father would be so pleased to hear your words.

speaker: Ike
text: Looks like you're through with me. I'll wait outside until you're finished talking.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Hold! I am most definitely NOT through with you.

speaker: Ike
text: Huh? What did I do now?

speaker: Sanaki
text: You're as impudent and impatient as ever. Heed me, Ike. If you are to help lead the Crimean Liberation Army, you must be given a more appropriate title.

speaker: Ike
text: If you're talking about making me a noble, I'll decline, thanks. That's not my kind of thing.

speaker: Sanaki
text: You are not in a position to refuse. Giving some nameless mercenary control of Begnion's troops would be...problematic. And more importantly, it would affect the troops. You will resign yourself to this and receive peerage from Princess Elincia.

speaker: Ike
text: What? No, wait! This is absurd...Blast! Of all the foolish...

speaker: Elincia
text: I'm...sorry about this. If you're absolutely opposed to it, I won't force you.

speaker: Ike
text: No, I have to do what's necessary. What am I supposed to do now?  Put on a funny hat or something?

speaker: Elincia
text: Um, will you...lend me your sword? Thank you. Now, may I ask you...to kneel before me?

speaker: Elincia
text: Th-thank you. All right... Let me begin. In the name of House Crimea, I hereby grant you the title and rank of lord and all the honors it conveys. Rise, Lord Ike.

speaker: Elincia
text: It is done.

speaker: Ike
text: What an odd feeling.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Aha! Your new rank suits you.

speaker: Sigrun
text: I completely agree.

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes, it truly does...

speaker: Ike
text: Hmm... I suppose. Not that it matters to me.

speaker: Ashnard
text: So they've left Begnion, have they?

speaker: Black Knight
text: According to our spy, they march with a regiment of Begnion's army. They plan to take a land route through Daein and then into Crimea.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Hah! They plan to cut across Daein? With nothing more than a single regiment at whose core is a tattered band of ragtag mercenaries? Gawain's son leads this rabble, yes? How does he stand up to his father's legacy?

speaker: Black Knight
text: He doesn't. He's just a boy, not yet worthy of his father's name.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Hmph. Disappointing.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Though his skill with the blade is rough, there is something...uncanny about him. People seem drawn to him. And not just Begnion's apostle, either. He's also gained the trust of the Serenes survivors...and of King Phoenicis as well.

speaker: Ashnard
text: The herons are alive?

speaker: Black Knight
text: It appears that two members of the royal family survived.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Heh heh... Look how nicely the table's been set for us. Bring one of them to me... I care not which one. And I want the medallion as well.

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...As you wish.

speaker: Ike
text: Once we cross that great wall, we'll be in Daein. Look there, atop that building!...Daein wyvern riders on patrol. They won't be happy to see us.

speaker: Tanith
text: Tell me, General Ike, have you faced wyvern riders in combat?

speaker: Ike
text: Only a few times. I got the impression that the Kilvas ravens were the more dangerous foe.

speaker: Tanith
text: If that's your impression, then you have yet to fight true wyvern riders.

speaker: Ike
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Tanith
text: I have no way of judging the ones we see here, but I know another unit, one that was attached to Begnion's temple guard. They had their reasons for leaving... But the important thing to remember is that they are exceedingly powerful.

speaker: Ike
text: Which explains why the apostle sent you to accompany us.

speaker: Tanith
text: That's right. Pegasus knights fare better than most against wyvern riders. We know the skies as well as they do.

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, I prefer to keep my feet on the ground, thank you. Can I entrust the flying business to you?

speaker: Tanith
text: Of course. We'll bring honor to the name of the apostle's sacred guards.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike. Are preparations complete?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes. The enemy should not yet be aware that we've come this far. We're going to launch a surprise attack and try to capture the wall on our first charge. Please wait for us at the base camp.

speaker: Elincia
text: Very well...

speaker: Ike
text: There's no need to look so worried. We're well prepared. And we've got you as our good luck charm.

speaker: Elincia
text: Thank you for that, but...Do be careful, my lord Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, don't worry! This may be our first battle as an official army, but we've fought Daein many times. We're going to win. After all, I can't lose my very first battle as a snooty noble, now can I?

speaker: Elincia
text: I believe in you, and I know that you will be victorious. Come back safe.

speaker: Kayachey
text: It appears the Crimean army has arrived. It's time to put our plan into action.

speaker: Naesala
text: The main body of the Kilvas army will wait atop the western summit. A small unit will remain here and cooperate with you. This is correct, is it not?

speaker: Kayachey
text: Mm, it is.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: What could His Majesty be thinking? Why does Daein ally herself with some backwater sub-human nation?

speaker: Kayachey
text: ...I don't know. There's no way we can expect to understand the supreme thoughts of the king. All we can do is perform the tasks set before us by His Highness. That is everything.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, of course!

speaker: Kayachey
text: The Crimean army has no idea we're aware of their every move. Bah! What vermin... What does that untrained group of vagabonds think they can do? I don't care how talented he is. Their commander is nothing more than a young mercenary with delusions of grandeur. We've nothing to fear.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: We'll show them what real war is like! And...the Kilvas ravens? How should we deal with them?

speaker: Kayachey
text: Those sub-human freaks! Let's use them as bait. We can sacrifice them and reduce our own human casualties.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: A fantastic idea!

speaker: Kayachey
text: Make sure that the men are thoroughly instructed.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Kayachey
text: You there! Halt! Mmm...you're an unfamiliar face.

speaker: Shinon
text: You'll know it soon enough.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Y-you filthy piece of offal! You will bow your head to a superior officer!

speaker: Kayachey
text: He's got a lot of nerve, hasn't he? Is he one of yours?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, sir! He's a new recruit who was only assigned to me today. Please accept my apologies for his lack of any training or manners whatsoever.

speaker: Kayachey
text: If he's good, I can overlook almost any character flaw. Go and kill as many Crimeans as you can! Help my name be remembered with honor and glory.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Shinon
text: ...Pah.

speaker: Kayachey
text: Come to me, dregs of Crimea! I will teach what it means to oppose the might of Daein.

speaker: Ike
text: Is everyone ready? Let's move out!

speaker: Elincia
text: Hold a moment, my lord Ike! In the sky...something's coming!

speaker: Ike
text: Who's that?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Ah, Ike! Well met. It appears that you're getting ready for your first battle as Crimea's army.

speaker: Ike
text: And you're escorting the heron siblings back to Phoenicis, right?

speaker: Tibarn
text: That was the original plan, but...Someone here insisted that we follow you. Quite unreasonably, I might add.

speaker: Reyson
text: You treated us with courtesy, beorc. We must act accordingly. Isn't that so, Leanne?

speaker: Leanne
text: (Yes, Yes, brother.)

speaker: Reyson
text: You said your name was Ike, correct?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes.

speaker: Reyson
text: You aided my sister and me during a time of danger. We herons hold courtesy in high esteem. We must repay our debt to you.

speaker: Ike
text: That's really not necessary.

speaker: Reyson
text: We are practitioners of seid magic. We cannot fight, but we can imbue our allies with strength. If you so wish it, I will travel with you. In this way I will repay you for what you have done.

speaker: Ike
text: You were lucky to find your sister; shouldn't you stay by her side?

speaker: Reyson
text: Leanne understands what I do.

speaker: Ike
text: I see. In that case, welcome.

speaker: Reyson
text: Thank you. I swear on the honor of my clan to do all I can to strengthen your cause.

speaker: Tibarn
text: It's settled then. And you'll get aid from me as well. Janaff!

speaker: Janaff
text: Right here, Your Majesty!

speaker: Tibarn
text: You'll go with the Crimean army and protect Reyson.

speaker: Janaff
text: Leave it to me!

speaker: Tibarn
text: You, too, Ulki. All right?

speaker: Ulki
text: Of course.

speaker: Reyson
text: Tibarn! It's too much, I cannot accept this. You're already watching over Leanne and my father as well.

speaker: Tibarn
text: These past twenty years... I know what it's been like for you living in Phoenicis. I'm only sorry I can't do more.

speaker: Reyson
text: Tibarn... I thank you, from the bottom of my heart.

speaker: Ike
text: King Phoenicis, I will guard Reyson well. When Crimea is retaken, I will see him safely returned to you.

speaker: Tibarn
text: I will take you at your word. Your actions have created a bond of trust between yourselves and the hawk and heron clans. If you find yourself in a dire position, you can call on me. No matter what, I will fly to your aid.

speaker: Elincia
text: We gained a strong ally where we had not thought to look for one, didn't we?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes. Beorc and laguz...Beast tribe and bird tribe...There's no difference between us. We finally understand one another.

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes, I think you're right.

speaker: Ike
text: Now, let's really get started! Everyone, move out!

speaker: Ulki
text: They're siding with Daein? Unbelievable!

speaker: Janaff
text: Hey, hey! What are those stupid crows doing here?

speaker: Reyson
text: Ravens! They betray not only me, but all laguz! Naesala, you dastard...

speaker: Rhys
text: Shinon!

speaker: Shinon
text: ...Oh, Rhys. Great. I can't believe I've run into you.

speaker: Rhys
text: It is great, isn't it? Oh, it's good to have you back. When you left us, I was really worried about what would happen, but--

speaker: Shinon
text: Hey, Rhys? Shut up. In case you hadn't noticed...we're enemies out here.

speaker: Rhys
text: What? You can't... You're not serious, are you?

speaker: Shinon
text: You honestly never thought this could happen? You're beyond good natured. You're a fool.

speaker: Rhys
text: Shinon... What are you saying? You've always been gruff, but...Are you serious?

speaker: Shinon
text: It's not like this is the first time I've called you out. You've never considered that people may not like you, have you? Know what? We were companions once, but if I'm getting paid, I'll gladly put an arrow through your eye.

speaker: Rhys
text: Shinon... Is there something you can't tell us that's forcing you to do this? Are you protecting someone? Has someone you love been taken hostage? If so, we could--

speaker: Shinon
text: No! There's nothing! Nothing but the right price, at least... You're overestimating me. Get going, pretty boy. Stick around any longer, and I'll start earning my pay with you!

speaker: Rolf
text: Shinon?

speaker: Shinon
text: Rolf...

speaker: Rolf
text: Shinon! It is you!

speaker: Shinon
text: Look at you. You've grown so much...You actually look like an archer.

speaker: Rolf
text: Really? Ha ha!

speaker: Shinon
text: You always did have what it takes. It's just like I told you--you train the right way, and you'll surpass both your brothers.

speaker: Rolf
text: I had a good teacher!

speaker: Shinon
text: Yeah, you did. You...haven't told anyone else about that, have you?

speaker: Rolf
text: Nope. Never said a word. I keep my promises.

speaker: Shinon
text: Good man.

speaker: Rolf
text: Ha ha ha! Um...Shinon?

speaker: Shinon
text: What?

speaker: Rolf
text: Are you...with the enemy?

speaker: Shinon
text: Yep.

speaker: Rolf
text: ...Sniff...sniff...

speaker: Shinon
text: Stop that. I told you things like this happen. Did you forget?

speaker: Rolf
text: ...But...it's...not...It's not...fair... Sniff...

speaker: Shinon
text: Ready your bow. It's time for the pupil to face his master.

speaker: Mist
text: Shi-Shinon? Ohmigosh...Why are you with the Daein army?!

speaker: Shinon
text: ...Tsk. None of your business, kid.

speaker: Mist
text: But that's... Oh, what should I do? You used to be one of us. I can't fight you!

speaker: Shinon
text: Stop whining. Didn't you ever think what it means to be a mercenary? We're enemies, kid. Get it? I'm ready to fight when you are. So what's it going to be?

speaker: Shinon
text: ...Yeah?

speaker: Mist
text: No! I won't fight you!

speaker: Shinon
text: Gah! What ARE you going to do then?

speaker: Mist
text: Come back to the Greil Mercenaries!

speaker: Shinon
text: What?

speaker: Mist
text: If you won't do that, then come work for the Crimean army! Please?

speaker: Shinon
text: Don't be stupid. Either way, Ike's in charge, right?

speaker: Mist
text: Yes, but I don't--

speaker: Shinon
text: I won't work for him. Get it? We used to be friends, so I'm going to let you go. Now get your naive little butt out of here!

speaker: Mist
text: Shinon... Sniff...sniff...Wh-wh-why...? Sniff... Whaaaaaaaaa!

speaker: Shinon
text: Crying's not going to help. Look, it doesn't matter who you send to talk to me. My answer's the same.

speaker: Mist
text: Even Rolf?

speaker: Shinon
text: ...Yeah. Even Rolf. Get out of here. The next time I see you, I'll stick an arrow in you. Count on it.

speaker: Kayachey
text: And now you will realize the true power of Daein!

speaker: Kayachey
text: I let them get...too close...

speaker: Shinon
text: ...My arrows will find you no matter where you run.

speaker: Shinon
text: Unh.........Messed that up, didn't I...Man...what a...lousy life...that was...

speaker: Shinon
text: Unnhh...Curses...

speaker: Ike
text: Don't move. You'll tear the wound wide open.

speaker: Shinon
text: What're you planning? D-do it...now...Finish me.

speaker: Shinon
text: ...Ha... Idiot...

speaker: Shinon
text: Unnnh...Curses...

speaker: Rolf
text: Shinon! Uncle Shinon!...Sniff...N-no...

speaker: Shinon
text: I told you... No crying...

speaker: Shinon
text: ...This is...for the best...I...can...

speaker: Rolf
text: Uncle Shinon...Nu, nuh, no...sniff...

speaker: Shinon
text: Crud, I lost... This was a plum chance for me to get a leg up in this world, too.

speaker: Ike
text: Shinon.

speaker: Shinon
text: Ha! And I can't believe that the one who defeats me is little lord Ikie. Looks like I've lost my edge. I'm ready, boy. Go on. Finish what you started.

speaker: Ike
text: Come back to the company.

speaker: Shinon
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Ike
text: You've never liked me. As far back as I can remember, you have never liked me.

speaker: Shinon
text: That's right. Still don't.

speaker: Ike
text: You... You called me a weakling. Said I was nothing without the help of my father. That's what you said, right? That's why you hated me.

speaker: Shinon
text: ...Sounds like me.

speaker: Ike
text: Don't you get it? I just beat you. So your reasons don't hold water anymore, do they?

speaker: Shinon
text: Pah! It's enough you beat me, now you gotta talk me to death?

speaker: Ike
text: I'll say it once more. Come back to the company. I acknowledge your abilities. As commander, I want you with us.

speaker: Shinon
text: ...Let's have another go around. I win, and I'm commander. Agreed?

speaker: Ike
text: I win, and you fall in line. Agreed?

speaker: Shinon
text: Don't worry, boy. I'll make it quick.

speaker: Ike
text: Let's go.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: General! We've seized control of the surrounding area, and the remaining Daein troops are retreating... General?

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, right. Understood.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: I beg your leave.

speaker: Ike
text: General, eh? Weird.

speaker: Nasir
text: You know, you never look relaxed.

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir. What's going on? We haven't seen much of you lately.

speaker: Nasir
text: I've been a bit busy. In order to leave Begnion, I had to sell my ship and dismiss the crew...There was a lot to take care of.

speaker: Ike
text: Is that so? Heh. It looks like you've been caught up in our struggle after all. Are you all right with that? I mean, I know you've got a lot of your own matters to handle.

speaker: Nasir
text: It's not like I've abandoned my own interests to join up with the Crimean army. For me, I've judged that there's value in traveling with you. So, don't worry about it overly much.

speaker: Ike
text: If you say so. You're a fairly knowledgable fellow, so it's nice having you around.

speaker: Nasir
text: Ha! I think that's mutual. Now then, I've got some good news.

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Nasir
text: Senior officials in Gallia are moving to action. Until now, they've been content to take a defensive stance and wait it out, but... It appears this neverending stalemate has exhausted their patience. Ike, this victory here today was a very important thing. It may prove to be a decisive first step in breaking Daein's power. News of it will spread like wildfire over the entire continent and give countries confidence to speak out against Daein. With Crimea as a rallying point, Gallia may well be moved to join this war. You just need to keep winning. If you can do that, the road will open before you.

speaker: Ike
text: History will be made...Could Daein truly fall at our hands? Can I make that happen? Me?

speaker: Nasir
text: Use what you've been given, and great things will happen. You have it in you to lead, Ike. For now, it's merely one portion of the bird tribes, but...your relationship is established. It's because you resolved to gain their trust, and then made it happen.

speaker: Ike
text: It's all due to my father...If my actions prove to be the right ones, it will be due to the way my father raised me. If you treat others in good faith, they will follow you of their own volition. That's what he taught me.

speaker: Nasir
text: He was a magnificent man, wasn't he?

speaker: Ike
text: When I was younger, I wanted nothing more than to be as strong as my father. And then I wanted to surpass him...Now, that is a goal I'll never achieve.

speaker: Naesala
text: What's that? The border's been breached?

speaker: Raven Laguz
text: Everyone was defeated. Not only the Daein troops, but our brigade as well. Cut down like wheat in a field.

speaker: Naesala
text: Huh! Well, that was impressively done. Er, for a band of sellswords, that is. There's nothing else to do. Send a message to the Daein command and tell them the enemy is stronger than expected.

speaker: Raven Laguz
text: At once.

speaker: Naesala
text: Wait! Hold a moment.

speaker: Raven Laguz
text: Yes?

speaker: Naesala
text: Send a Daein human instead. I don't care which one. Just don't use any of our troops.

speaker: Raven Laguz
text: But a wingless human will take such a long time to--

speaker: Naesala
text: General Petrine commands the next front. She's a very...temperamental woman... But go if you like! Tell her that the Kilvas ravens have been defeated... She'll roast you like a chicken and use your bones for stock!

speaker: Raven Laguz
text: Un-understood! I will find a human!

speaker: Nasir
text: Who's there?

speaker: Nasir
text: Soren? What are you doing here?

speaker: Soren
text: What are you planning?

speaker: Nasir
text: Where did that come from? I've no idea what you're talking about.

speaker: Soren
text: Don't play dumb with me. We're past that. Gallia's decision to join in this war was based on some new information they received, wasn't it?

speaker: Soren
text: Cat got your tongue? Fine. I'll tell you what you've been doing here... You were to deliver Princess Crimea to Begnion to see if she could garner any support for her cause. And--regardless of whether she got that assistance or not--to judge if she was worthy of laguz support. Am I wrong?

speaker: Nasir
text: If you've figured all of this out, why remain silent?

speaker: Soren
text: Because your actions were beneficial to Princess Crimea. I determined that even if left to your own devices, you would not harm the princess.

speaker: Nasir
text: It sounds like you don't think that's the case anymore.

speaker: Soren
text: You accomplished both missions, but you've come back anyway. To what end?

speaker: Nasir
text: I don't have to explain myself to you.

speaker: Soren
text: That's true only until I reveal your purpose to Ike.

speaker: Nasir
text: Everyone has a secret or two that he wants to bury somewhere deep. Including you...Soren.

speaker: Soren
text: ...I don't know what you mean.

speaker: Nasir
text: Oh, I trust that we understand each other. The army rises early tomorrow. I suggest we turn in.

speaker: Soren
text: The enemy knew we were coming today.

speaker: Nasir
text: And you think I'm responsible?

speaker: Soren
text: Yes, I do.

speaker: Nasir
text: My, oh, my... You really ARE suspicious, aren't you? Good night, Soren.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: General Ike. All troops are ready to move out.

speaker: Ike
text: All right. Can you have them wait?

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Do you want them to fall out and wait in their tents? Or would you rather they form up and stand at attention?

speaker: Ike
text: Go ahead and have them stand down. I'll call them when I'm ready.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Begging your pardon, sir! All troops have been ordered to stand down. However, General Tanith requests her orders. Are her pegasus knights to stand down as well?

speaker: Ike
text: Am I supposed to decide that, too?

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: General Ike... You've been given command of the entire army, sir. We will not move without your orders, sir.

speaker: Ike
text: General Tanith's troops...are to follow General Tanith's orders.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Understood, sir! General Tanith's pegasus knights will not be deployed unless there is a request for reinforcements. Those are the orders of General Tanith. By your leave, sir!

speaker: Ike
text: Tanith, do you have a moment?

speaker: Tanith
text: General Ike. What is it? Is there a problem?

speaker: Ike
text: I thought you might be able to provide me with some information.

speaker: Tanith
text: Yes?

speaker: Ike
text: What can you tell me about King Daein? I'd like to know something of him before I have to face him in battle.

speaker: Tanith
text: Truth be told, I've never fought him, either. I cannot give you any specifics, but I will tell you what little I do know.

speaker: Ike
text: Please. Whatever you can tell me would be appreciated.

speaker: Tanith
text: Ashnard's coronation, let me see... Yes, it was eighteen years ago. You see, a plague had struck the capital, spreading out to affect the surrounding region of Nevassa and beyond. Ashnard was crowned the year after that great tragedy finally subsided. In the entire history of Tellius, no calamity has claimed the lives of so many beorc and laguz--not since the great flood. Two years before, it struck Begnion, and the entire population of Serenes was nearly obliterated. The year after that, close to a thousand beorc--nobles and peasants alike--perished in Daein.

speaker: Ike
text: Nobles, you say? So the royal family fell victim to this plague as well?

speaker: Tanith
text: Yes. The reigning king and queen and some twenty or so princes and princesses fell ill. And everyone who fell ill perished. For a time, the people despaired of losing the entire royal bloodline of Daein. It seemed that none would survive.

speaker: Ike
text: And yet Ashnard survived.

speaker: Tanith
text: He did. It is quite interesting, in a sense. You see, his name was never mentioned in any talk of succession before that time. He was of such a distant bloodline that he was unlikely to be king. In another place though, his name was already well known.

speaker: Ike
text: Where was that?

speaker: Tanith
text: On the battlefield. As you know, Daein is home to many brave warriors. At the time, then-prince Ashnard was said to have been a match for an entire troop of pegasus knights. Begnion and Daein both keep close watch over their borders, and their patrols fought in many skirmishes. Although there was no war to speak of, these land disputes did end with Daein claiming a small portion of Begnion soil. It would be no exaggeration to say this was soley due to the strength of one man: Ashnard.

speaker: Tanith
text: Forgive me. I have spoken longer than I intended. It's about time we get back to the business of marching preparations.

speaker: Ike
text: No, thank you for telling me so much. If we have another chance, please share more of your stories.

speaker: Tanith
text: Understood.

speaker: Tormod
text: Ike! Which troop should we fall in with? We have received no orders yet.

speaker: Ike
text: Tormod, Muarim, I know I've asked you many times, but...Are you sure you want to be here?

speaker: Tormod
text: You keep asking that! Maybe you don't want us here.  Is that it? I don't know what to think!

speaker: Ike
text: No, it's not that at all. To be honest, the battle ahead is going to be hard... It looks bleak. I'd rather that those without direct ties to Crimea not get involved.

speaker: Tormod
text: A bleak battle? What about trying to free all the slaves in Begnion? Now THOSE were bleak battles. Bleak battles are our specialty. Right, Muarim?

speaker: Muarim
text: Yes, you are. Yet...thanks to Ike's time in Begnion, things have changed completely.

speaker: Ike
text: That's right. The apostle has promised to press her investigation until there's not a single laguz slave left in the entire nation. So, there's no reason for you two to continue fighting, is there? You don't owe me anything--

speaker: Tormod
text: We're going to fight with you, Ike. We want to help!

speaker: Muarim
text: It is our right to join you in this. Just as it is your right to refuse us.

speaker: Ike
text: To be perfectly frank, I would be willing to beg to get you to join us. Both of you, all right?

speaker: Muarim
text: All right.

speaker: Tormod
text: Ha ha! You can count on us!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Well, we're here! Welcome to Toha, Crimea's westernmost port city.

speaker: Ike
text: What's with this place? The people are going about their business. Why aren't they worried about Daein? About the war?

speaker: Ranulf
text: It's because this area is fairly isolated. Daein's army hasn't come this far, and so life goes on as before. Daein's plan is to seize the capital, then slowly and steadily expand its sphere of influence until it controls everything.

speaker: Ike
text: Surely these people have some idea of what's happening.

speaker: Soren
text: Ignorance is a form of bliss, is it not? These people don't know what it's like to lose a war. They don't want to know. Crimea as a nation has always been blessed by peace. Perhaps this is due to the temperament of its rulers, but the country hasn't seen serious warfare for centuries. While minor skirmishes with the kingdom of Daein have been legion, only the eastern borderlands have taken damage.

speaker: Ike
text: And yet even I know this peace will not last. When we met Daein forces on our scouting mission, they attacked us merely for being within the Crimean border.

speaker: Soren
text: Humans are shameless creatures that carelessly ignore any misfortune which does not befall them directly. They can--and often do--turn a blind eye to all manner of wickedness so long as it does not touch them or their kin. They will bow their heads, condemning those victims for bringing calamity upon themselves, and then they will cast their eyes toward heaven in thanks while their neighbors lay dying around them.

speaker: Ike
text: But the war is happening here. This is their home, not someone else's.

speaker: Soren
text: When the Daein army darkens their doorsteps, perhaps they will understand. When the peace they take for granted is shattered, and their sons and daughters slaughtered in the streets...Perhaps then will they comprehend the misfortunes they so long pretended not to see. I have no sympathy for them.

speaker: Ranulf
text: My goodness, the nastier the truth, the blunter he gets...Quite a delightful staff officer you have there.

speaker: Ike
text: He, um...he has an undeniable streak of severity in him but...but this? Something's bothering him, that's for sure.

speaker: Titania
text: It's to be expected. Even I'm a bit shocked by this place. Can they truly be as placid as they appear? Soren's a very empathetic young man. The emotions of this place may have proven to be too much for him.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ignoring impending doom because you cannot prevent it...Fatalism is by nature a disheartening beast. Well, for all those born with nothing, there are those born with everything. Perhaps those who never notice the difference are the ones we should envy.

speaker: Ike
text: What's that supposed to mean?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Huh? Oh, I was talking to myself. Pay me no mind.

speaker: Ike
text: Hmm...

speaker: Ranulf
text: Now then, I've got to see a man about a ship. While I'm gone, why don't you get your supplies squared away? I'm sure that the journey ahead will require a lot of packing.

speaker: Titania
text: Ranulf, I'll go with you.

speaker: Ranulf
text: No, no, that's all right. You should supervise the supply acquisition. You're going to be at sea for months, you know?

speaker: Titania
text: I know that, but...

speaker: Ike
text: What is it, Titania?

speaker: Ranulf
text: She's worried about me. She doesn't want to leave a solitary laguz wandering around a beorc city.

speaker: Ike
text: But I thought Crimea and Gallia were allied nations. Why would a wandering laguz be cause for concern?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Well, it shouldn't be, but...

speaker: Titania
text: Do you remember what King Caineghis told you? The friendship between Crimea and Gallia exists only between the ruling classes. It hasn't taken root in the minds of the common citizenry at all.

speaker: Ranulf
text: That being said, things have improved quite a bit since King Ramon ascended to the throne The reports of hunts and such other horrors have all but disappeared...Oh, don't worry! I'll be fine! I've got connections, see? It's not like I'll be roaming the docks begging for passage.

speaker: Ike
text: All right then, the job is yours. lease be careful.

speaker: Ranulf
text: You, too. Don't mess anything up!

speaker: Ike
text: We should be leaving, but...Looks like everyone's going to be a while, yet.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike are you ready to go?

speaker: Ike
text: Me? As long as I've got my sword, I'm always ready.

speaker: Elincia
text: A sword? That's it?

speaker: Ike
text: If I've got my cape, I can sleep just about anywhere. And as for food, well...Something always turns up.

speaker: Elincia
text: Hee hee! That's delightful.

speaker: Ike
text: It is?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes, very much so. Tee hee hee!

speaker: Ike
text: Princesses...I don't think I'll ever understand them.

speaker: Ike
text: What's going on? Why all the excitement?

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike! There's a crowd gathering at the town entrance...

speaker: Ike
text: That's--

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Attention citizens! We've received reports of Crimean army stragglers hiding in this town! From this point forth, the Daein army will blockade all points of entry! No one comes or goes without our leave! The harbor is also closed! No ships will be allowed to sail!!

speaker: Titania
text: Ike...Daein troops have--

speaker: Ike
text: I know. All we can do is move toward the docks and try not to be discovered.

speaker: Ike
text: Have you seen Ranulf?

speaker: Titania
text: Not yet.

speaker: Ike
text: Wait, here he comes now. Ranulf! Over here.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hoo! Things sure are heating up, aren't they?

speaker: Ike
text: How are things on your end?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Everything's set. All you need to do is sneak down to the harbor. You'll be met there by a man with a dusky pallor. His name is Nasir. Nasir is a man you can trust. I've explained your situation to him, and he's willing to help. If you can reach his ship safely, he'll take care of everything and deliver you to Begnion.

speaker: Ike
text: Ranulf, aren't you coming, too?

speaker: Ranulf
text: I was planning on it, but...Daein's movements have me concerned. I'll stay behind and see what's going on.

speaker: Woman
text: Oh, I'm sorry! I wasn't watching where I was going...

speaker: Ranulf
text: No, pardon me--

speaker: Woman
text: Ah! Eeeeeeek! Su-sub-human!!

speaker: Titania
text: Blast!

speaker: Youth
text: I-it's true! A sub-human! How dare you come prowling around here!

speaker: Man
text: Beast! Ya stinking sub-humans need to learn yer place! Human towns are too good for ya!

speaker: Lady
text: Eww! It's so hairy! Go on! Scat!

speaker: Woman
text: Get out of here! Monster!

speaker: Ike
text: Dang!

speaker: Ike
text: Mordecai!

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ike! We must leave!

speaker: Ike
text: What? No! We have to help Ranulf...

speaker: Mordecai
text: All of this noise will attract the attention of the Daein troops.

speaker: Ike
text: That's why we have to hurry up and help--

speaker: Lethe
text: He'll be fine! Leave him.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ranulf is strong. Even stronger than me. It's all right.

speaker: Ike
text: Ranulf has no intention of defending himself! Look, he's not even changing forms! I can't just stand by and watch as he gets murdered!

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ike! Wait!

speaker: Lethe
text: ...Idiot human...

speaker: Ike
text: Stop! Get out of my way! Keep your hands off him!

speaker: Man
text: Who do ya think ya are? Why would a human want to protect some sub-human?

speaker: Woman
text: He's a friend to this monster! I saw them talking earlier!

speaker: Ike
text: What's that to you?

speaker: Youth
text: Hey. the Crimean royals had sub-human companions, didn't they? Maybe you're one of those army guys the Daein troops are searching for!

speaker: Man
text: You there! Daein soldier! Ho! There are some suspicious folk over here!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Huh? That way! Hurry!

speaker: Ike
text: Are you mad?! Your king was murdered by Daein! And now you're going to cooperate with them?

speaker: Man
text: Well, um...

speaker: Youth
text: I heard the king was teamin' up with those sub-humans! That's what got him killed!

speaker: Lady
text: Yeah! That's right! If we need allies, I'll take flesh-and-blood Daein humans over some fanged sub-human freak!

speaker: Youth
text: Yeah! Yeah! At least we know what we're getting! Trust your own kind!

speaker: Ike
text: You people are insane!

speaker: Vigilante
text: Where's the sub-human everyone's screaming about?

speaker: Grandfather
text: Huzzah! The Toha vigilantes are here! Grab those guys and turn them over to the Daein army! That will prove our allegiance and gain our village favor!

speaker: Vigilante
text: Har har! If you want sub-humans hunted down, I'm your man!

speaker: Ike
text: Ranulf! Are you all right?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Why did you come back?

speaker: Ike
text: Because some fool was going to lay here and get beaten to death instead of defending himself!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ah, Ike. What would you have me do? Gallia and Crimea have formed an alliance. I cannot jeopardize that by harming these people, no matter what ill they may bear me.

speaker: Ike
text: Even if none of them care two figs for their own country?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Even if. They're citizens of Crimea, after all.

speaker: Ike
text: Well, I'm not Gallian, so there's no reason for me to hold anything back!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ike! Listen to me! They think that you and I are allies! If you attack, it's no different than if I do so myself! So...

speaker: Ike
text: Let me guess...you're telling me to avoid the Daein pursuit, leave the town vigilantes alone, get to the docks as soon as possible, find a man named Nasir and get everyone on his boat. Is that it?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Exactly! I don't care what anyone else says, I think you're pretty bright!

speaker: Ike
text: All right, I'll play along. But mark my words, if they attack, heads will roll!

speaker: Ranulf
text: What? Hey! That's not going to do us any good!

speaker: Ike
text: Titania! Soren! Get everyone together! We're getting out of here!

speaker: Mackoya
text: Listen to me! Do not let a single Crimean soldier escape our grasp. Sweep the entire town! Arrest anyone suspicious!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: General Mackoya! Sir, there's a group of vigilantes who want to help us. What shall I tell them?

speaker: Mackoya
text: Hmm...Very well. Let them do as they please.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Nasir
text: Pardon me, are you the commander of these forces?

speaker: Mackoya
text: I am. And who are you?

speaker: Nasir
text: I'm captain of the boat you see moored here. My name is Nasir. I stopped by to accomplish some brief piece of business, but...Your soldiers are now preventing me from setting sail. I need to leave this place.

speaker: Mackoya
text: I apologize for the inconvenience. However, we are trying to stop some Crimean soldiers from escaping. To that end we need the cooperation of all citizens...ship captains included.

speaker: Nasir
text: My ship is a simple merchant vessel, sailing under the flag of the Begnion Empire. If I present such documentation, surely it will prove I have no ties whatsoever with Crimea.

speaker: Mackoya
text: Under Daein rule, such...Begnion papers are nothing more than fishwrap.

speaker: Nasir
text: Yet--

speaker: Mackoya
text: You called yourself, Nasir, correct? Protest too loudly, Nasir, and we may think you a Crimean sympathizer. If that were to happen, who knows what...unfortunate fate might your simple merchant ship...

speaker: Nasir
text: ...I see. So be it.

speaker: Mackoya
text: You there! Soldier!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Sir?

speaker: Mackoya
text: Strengthen the watch on this ship. That man is up to something...I can feel it...No matter what happens, that ship must not be allowed to set sail. Burn her and sink her first!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Mackoya
text: Now then, where is our special guest?

speaker: Black Knight
text: I'm right here, General Mackoya.

speaker: Mackoya
text: Oh! Sir Black Knight! I hope I didn't keep you waiting.

speaker: Black Knight
text: No, I just arrived. Let us proceed...I would hear your report.

speaker: Mackoya
text: There are no problems whatsoever. I've nothing to report, save the tedium of it all. The farther west we travel, the weaker the Crimean fighting spirit becomes. Each town displays less and less resistance--now they literally throw wide the gates at first sign of our approach! With duty as humdrum as this, I worry that my troops may become sloppy and lose their edge.

speaker: Black Knight
text: As a fellow warrior, I can sympathize with your plight.

speaker: Mackoya
text: I thank you for your understanding.

speaker: Black Knight
text: This town was not scheduled for subjugation until much later...Tell me, why are you here now?

speaker: Mackoya
text: Yes, as to that...Mere days ago, a castle that held Crimean prisoners of war was attacked and the captives freed. The perpetrators were Crimean soldiers accompanied by sub-humans. According to our intelligence reports, their trail led here...

speaker: Black Knight
text: I see.

speaker: Mackoya
text: The princess of Crimea is said to have fled to Gallia. If we can capture this band, we may gain information on her location.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Do you require my assistance?

speaker: Mackoya
text: I thank you for the generous offer. However, if you were to enter the fray, it would be over in a twinkling. My men are starved for combat. I would beg your restraint so that they may be allowed some...entertainment.

speaker: Black Knight
text: As you will. The field is yours. Turn your soldiers loose, and may their blades run red with glory.

speaker: Mackoya
text: Your graciousness is greatly appreciated.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Good luck, Ike! You'll be fine. As for me...I think I'll play a little game of cat and mouse with these Daein fools.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: The Gallian sub-human! After him! Don't let him get away!

speaker: Ike
text: Everyone, move out for the harbor! Try to avoid conflict with the local vigilante group if you can. Let's go!

speaker: Zihark
text: Hey! Are there really sub-humans about?

speaker: Vigilante
text: Oh yeah, no mistake about it. And they'll as soon kill you as look at you!

speaker: Zihark
text: Where are they?

speaker: Vigilante
text: They're over there...Cunning beast! We're just about to start flushing them out of hiding.

speaker: Zihark
text: I see. If you find one, be sure to give me a call.

speaker: Vigilante
text: Har har! I like that guy. He came to our little town just for the chance to hunt sub-humans!

speaker: Zihark
text: Ah!

speaker: Lethe
text: Grrr! Flee. You're Crimean...I cannot fight you.

speaker: Zihark
text: Hold on! Please!...I am not an enemy to laguz.

speaker: Lethe
text: L-laguz...? How do you--

speaker: Zihark
text: I joined this vigilante group because I knew it would afford me a chance to help you flee. Listen, I'll distract the townspeople. While they're worried about me you can make good your escape.

speaker: Lethe
text: I cannot trust the word of a human.

speaker: Zihark
text: ...I see. Well, if I cut down these vigilantes, will you believe me?

speaker: Lethe
text: Huh?

speaker: Zihark
text: One? Two? All of them? How many do you want? Just give the word and I'll start the cutting!

speaker: Lethe
text: Hsss! Quiet! Why? Why would you...

speaker: Zihark
text: I want to help you....That's all.

speaker: Lethe
text: ...I see... You're not an enemy. That much I'll believe...

speaker: Zihark
text: Thank you. Now, you must hurry away from this place.

speaker: Lethe
text: No, I cannot flee. I have fr-friends with whom I must board a ship.

speaker: Zihark
text: Will you not desist? It's much too dangerous. The vigilantes and Daeins want nothing  more than to kill laguz!

speaker: Lethe
text: I'm not leaving.

speaker: Zihark
text: I see...If that's your stance, then I've no choice.

speaker: Lethe
text: Hm?

speaker: Zihark
text: I will join your group.

speaker: Lethe
text: Don't...Don't be ridiculous!

speaker: Zihark
text: What's your name?

speaker: Lethe
text: I am Lethe, but--

speaker: Zihark
text: That's a good name.

speaker: Lethe
text: That's beside the point! You--

speaker: Zihark
text: I am Zihark. Well met, Lethe! Whoops! I don't think we have time for formal introductions. Let's hurry!

speaker: Lethe
text: H-hold it! I have not agreed to this!

speaker: Zihark
text: Ah!

speaker: Mordecai
text: You are a vigilante. We must avoid vigilantes. You should flee.

speaker: Zihark
text: You would speak so to the vigilante group that's hunting you? You're a kind laguz, aren't you?

speaker: Mordecai
text: Hm? My words are not good. You must go quickly.

speaker: Zihark
text: No, you are the one who should flee. Leave the rest to me. I'll confuse the townsfolk and give you time to run.

speaker: Mordecai
text: What? Why?

speaker: Zihark
text: I don't want to see any laguz harmed, so I joined these vigilantes as a double agent.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Hmm...? I am confused. But...you do not smell like an enemy. Our group must get on that ship. We are taking it to Begnion.

speaker: Zihark
text: Will you not desist? It's much too dangerous. The vigilantes and the Daeins desire nothing more than to kill laguz!

speaker: Mordecai
text: Even so, we will go.

speaker: Zihark
text: I see...If that's your stance, then I've no choice.

speaker: Zihark
text: I will join your group.

speaker: Mordecai
text: You will betray your friends?

speaker: Zihark
text: I told you, they're not my friends. I am an ally to the laguz. What? You need proof? There!

speaker: Mordecai
text: Why do you drop your blade? That bright metal tool is your only fang.

speaker: Zihark
text: I want you to believe me....Please. You must believe me.

speaker: Mordecai
text: ...I believe you. I am Mordecai, warrior of Gallia. Who are you?

speaker: Zihark
text: I am Zihark. Well met, Mordecai! Whoops! I don't think we have time for formal introductions. Let's hurry!

speaker: Jill
text: Commander Haar! Awake! This is no time to be sleeping! A sub-human has been spotted! Come, let us join in the thrill of the hunt!

speaker: Haar
text: Yaaaawn...Mmm...let's not. Even if we don't lift a finger, Mackoya's pups will take care of everything.

speaker: Jill
text: Battle glory awaits! Would you allow others to steal this chance from beneath your very nose?

speaker: Haar
text: Yawn. Go entertain yourself, will you? Fight a soldier or lance a peasant or...what you will. But for the love of flying, stop interrupting my sleep!

speaker: Jill
text: Ooh! You're such a--

speaker: Haar
text: The fighting? Um...Wake me when it's done. Yaaaaawwnn...Zzzzzzz...

speaker: Jill
text: That's it!! I'm going by myself!

speaker: Haar
text: Zzzzzz...Snort! Wha--? Jill, hold a moment.

speaker: Jill
text: Yes? Have you changed your mind?

speaker: Haar
text: You'll wait here with the rest of us. We don't move unless we're attacked. That's the word from the top.

speaker: Jill
text: ...Graaarrr!

speaker: Black Knight
text: All these men, and they're still having problems? Did I make a miscalculation?

speaker: Ike
text: Ah! It's him!!

speaker: Black Knight
text: We meet again, son of Greil.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Why do you challenge me? You are not worthy of being my foe. Flee while you are able.

speaker: Ike
text: You...

speaker: Ike
text: You! Die! Die now! Aaaaaaaarrrr!

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...Fool.

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...Move. One such as you cannot stop me.

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...A sub-human warrior...I would test your strength.

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...Oh? You avoided my blow. Will you be so lucky next time?

speaker: Mackoya
text: Hmm...They're not fleeing...They're actually headed this way. It appears that we have underestimated the courage of our foe.

speaker: Mackoya
text: So we were the ones guilty of miscalculation...How shameful...Your Excellency...The rest is...up to you......

speaker: Zihark
text: I bear you no ill will, but I must...There are reasons I must fight.

speaker: Jill
text: Father, please lend me your protection in this, my first battle!

speaker: Man
text: What's that? Thieves are taking advantage of the commotion to sack our little town? We must close the front gate! Thanks for your help! Oh, I almost forgot! Please. take this as a token of thanks. Go on, take it!

speaker: Lady
text: AAAAAAHHH! S-s-sub-human! Noooooooo!!! H-h-heeeeelp!

speaker: Lady
text: Say, aren't you...You are! You're one of those Crimeans that the Daein soldiers are after, aren't you?...Go on, get moving. I'll pretend I didn't see anything. Don't worry, just go!  Wait a second..Here. Take this with you.

speaker: Woman
text: Yaaaaaaah! S-stay back! Sub-human beast! Aaaaiiieeeeee!

speaker: Woman
text: Ohmygosh...are you...Are you really fighting Daein? Ooo...that's so brave! We've heard so many rumors about Crimea's defeat...That's why everyone in town acts like they do. No one has the courage to stand up to these fierce Daein forces. Everyone believes that if they just cooperate, life here will go on as it always has. Please, take this magic scroll. It was my brother's...He was murdered by the Daein army. Fight for him, too.

speaker: Man
text: H-h-heavens! Please don't kill me! I'll give you whatever you want...Here, have some yarn! Uh... Dried fish?

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...The mercenaries boarded the ship safely. Now, how to proceed...

speaker: Ranulf
text: You're not impeding that ship. I won't allow it.

speaker: Black Knight
text: One of Gallia's beast warriors...I've met you once before. Yes...at the castle near the sea of trees.

speaker: Ranulf
text: From where I'm standing, we've actually met twice.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Oh?

speaker: Ranulf
text: I saw you that night...Standing in the light of the full moon. The night you murdered Sir Greil.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Ha ha! So you were the one traveling with the beast king, eh? Interesting. By measuring his aide's strength, I will naturally learn more of the king's true power.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hate to tell you this, but my king is not to be measured against the likes of me. He is far beyond that.

speaker: Black Knight
text: All the better. Now then, let us begin.

speaker: Ranulf
text: ...Ugh...why? Why do my attacks do nothing?

speaker: Black Knight
text: You fight impressively. However, you are no match for me.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Huh?

speaker: Black Knight
text: Hm?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Rise. Leave this to me.

speaker: Ranulf
text: You...you were one of the prisoners...

speaker: Sephiran
text: This knight will not raise his hand to me....Correct?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Go now, quickly!

speaker: Ranulf
text: If you insist! I'll give proper thanks when next we meet.

speaker: Jill
text: Commander Haar! Let us pursue the enemy ship! They're friends of the sub-humans! We cannot allow them to escape!

speaker: Haar
text: Uwaaaaaahhh...That was a good nap. Well, looks like the fighting's over. Form up.It's time to withdraw.

speaker: Haar
text: Listen to me, Jill. We're scheduled to return home tomorrow. If you were injured in a place like this, your lord father would not be pleased.

speaker: Jill
text: It's because of my father that I must not return home empty-handed. I must have something to show him! Please--

speaker: Haar
text: Simmer down, girl. The Black Knight has ordered us to withdraw. Would you ignore his word?

speaker: Jill
text: Th-that...

speaker: Haar
text: Would be suicide. Correct. So let's move out!

speaker: Jill
text: Blast.

speaker: Mackoya
text: M-my lord Black Knight! A ship is departing! If we ready our own ship and set sail without delay, we can overtake it immediately!

speaker: Sephiran
text: Listen to me, Daein general. You will withdraw from this place. I will not allow you to pursue that ship.

speaker: Mackoya
text: Who are you to speak to me so? Do you have any idea who I am?

speaker: Black Knight
text: Gather your men....Withdraw.

speaker: Mackoya
text: Yet we--

speaker: Black Knight
text: I will not repeat myself. Do it now.

speaker: Mackoya
text: Yes...yes, at once!

speaker: Norris
text: Are you sure that's true?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes! You can ask these two for more details.

speaker: Mister
text: The two of us, we're here representing the townsfolk.

speaker: Norris
text: You say that a green-haired lass boarded that ship?

speaker: Youth
text: Y-yes! She had a very noble bearing about her...And she was beautiful.

speaker: Man
text: Her name was...Ellie? Ellen? They called her something like that.

speaker: Norris
text: It's true! Princess Elincia...Ha ha!  My luck has changed.

speaker: Youth
text: All of us, all the townsfolk, are ready to cooperate in any way we can! If you would keep that in mind...Um...

speaker: Norris
text: Believe me, I understand your...loyalty.

speaker: Man
text: Well then...

speaker: Norris
text: You there! Come here!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, sir! Right here.

speaker: Norris
text: Get these two worms out of here. Find the hardest physical labor in this town and get these fools started. Work 'em from dusk to dawn without stopping. Work 'em until they can no longer move! You got that!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, sir! Understood, sir!

speaker: Youth
text: B-but, that's...

speaker: Man
text: Why? Why would you...

speaker: Norris
text: Stop your whining. How else am I to reward worms vile enough to sell their own princess to the enemy? Enjoy your payment, you greedy dastards! Ha ha ha ha ha ha!

speaker: Youth
text: Our own...princess? That's not...It can't be. It can't!

speaker: Man
text: No...Nooooooo!

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike! How wonderful! I didn't think you were going to make it...

speaker: Ike
text: I'm sorry to have worried you.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh, no, I'm just happy to see you well. So very...happy.

speaker: Mist
text: Brother, you stupid fool! Fighting a knight as strong as that...You idiot! I was...so scared...

speaker: Ike
text: I'm sorry, Mist.

speaker: Mist
text: Who cares...

speaker: Ike
text: You really were frightened...I'm sorry, I truly am.

speaker: Mist
text: ...All right...

speaker: Ranulf
text: Huff...huff...Whew! I doubt the enemy will pursue me this far.

speaker: Giffca
text: A warrior such as you, wounded? Did a beorc give you that bruise?[

speaker: Ranulf
text: Master Giffca! Owwwww!

speaker: Giffca
text: The king told me to come and check on you. Don't move...Hm, you're plenty banged up, but nothing appears to be broken.

speaker: Ranulf
text: There's one among the Daein army whose power is overwhelming. To move with such speed with all that armor...I tell you, it's not right! And now, the king's forced to use you, his shadow warrior, to check up on me...Our ministers are as obstinate as ever. No matter what happens, they will not approve of an alliance with the beorc.

speaker: Giffca
text: Nothing to be done about that. Every one of the older retainers has memories of laguz subordination. Even the king. If Princess Elincia were not King Ramon's orphan, I doubt he would be willing to aid her.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Perhaps you're right...At any rate, the princess and the others are now safely at sea.

speaker: Giffca
text: And the watchdog? No signs of carelessness, I presume.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Of course not.Even the elders will bend their ears to hear what that one says--that one is special, after all.

speaker: Giffca
text: And how do you see this? Princess Elincia's drive for the reconstruction of Crimea. Does she have a chance?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Eh, who can say? Which way the wheel turns depends on Ike and his mercenaries. Success and failure are but a hair removed.

speaker: Giffca
text: So this company, which has done nothing but flee, controls the fate of the kingdom? That's a dangerous gamble, isn't it?

speaker: Ranulf
text: All gambles are dangerous, Master Giffca. But no mistake about it, Daein's next target is Gallia. We must go home and prepare!

speaker: Ashnard
text: ...Princess Crimea, ]did she board the ship to Begnion with the remainder of Gawain's mercenaries?

speaker: Black Knight
text: Yes.

speaker: Ashnard
text: The hindrance that was Gawain is dead. The location of the medallion...will soon be known. Has our worm worked itself into the group?

speaker: Black Knight
text: It appears that our worm has been accepted as a trusted member of the company.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Heh heh heh. All is going as planned. Now, we let them swim as they please.

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...There is one thing. I met someone unexpected at the harbor.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Who?

speaker: Black Knight
text: The prime minister of the Begnion Empire...

speaker: Ashnard
text: What?!...Is that true? If he is nosing about, we must not make any mistakes. Did he give any indication he had caught on to our plans?

speaker: Black Knight
text: That...I do not know. He did tell me to deliver a message to you...Overreaching ambition invites disaster.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Pah. Nonsense. Our only concern is the princess of Crimea and the medallion. We must wait and watch until such time as we can strike.

speaker: Ashnard
text: In the interim, I want you to take charge of the invasion of Gallia. Be smart. You must not allow Gallia to bring their full might to bear. Understood?

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...As you will.

speaker: Man
text: Hey there, traveler! Do you have everything you need? If you stop by my humble shop, you'll find the best deals in town! Whattya say? Interested?

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, that sounds great. Listen, can I ask you a question?

speaker: Man
text: No problem! You can ask me anything.Especially if it's about my low, low prices!

speaker: Ike
text: What do the townspeople think of Daein? You knew that they were coming. Didn't anyone think to flee Crimea?

speaker: Man
text: Flee? Don't be absurd!

speaker: Ike
text: But Crimea lost the war.

speaker: Man
text: Yeah, I know. And honestly? That doesn't really affect us common folk, ya know? The truth is, we don't care who sitson the throne. To us, they're all just faceless beings who rule from on high. If they tried to raise taxes or something, you better believe we'd protest, but otherwise...

speaker: Man
text: I mean, take the king of Daein. He's just another man, right? If we keep working, he can keep living the high life. So it's not like he's going to treat us poorly or anything. As long as we can live our lives and have a little happiness, we aren't going to worry about it all too much.

speaker: Man
text: Oh, but if we were invaded by Gallia, well, that's a different story altogether. If our country were overrun by those savage beasts, who knows what could happen? Now THAT scares me!

speaker: Man
text: What the? Hey! Wait! Come back! What about my low, low prices?! Now what was that all about?

speaker: Vigilante
text: Pardon me, buddy. I haven't seen you around town before. You a traveling mercenary?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, I suppose you could say that.

speaker: Vigilante
text: Nice sword...You look like a man who knows his business. If you're looking for work, I've a proposition for you.

speaker: Ike
text: A proposition?

speaker: Vigilante
text: I run a vigilante group that helps keep our fair town safe. A strong man like you would be most welcome.

speaker: Ike
text: Thanks, but I've got something lined up.

speaker: Vigilante
text: Oh, really? That's too bad. Heading out to sea?

speaker: Ike
text: Maybe.

speaker: Vigilante
text: Har har! Cautious to the end! I like that! Well, just in case you are...I want you to have this.

speaker: Ike
text: Hm? What's this?

speaker: Vigilante
text: It's a special sword. It'll come in handy if you ever...find yourself at sea. Not that you would! Har har!

speaker: Ike
text: Really? You're giving me a sword? Are you sure?

speaker: Vigilante
text: Well, there is one condition...Once you've finished your job, you come back and see me. I'd like you to reconsider that vigilante position.

speaker: Ike
text: Understood. Thanks again for the blade.

speaker: Ike
text: Princess!

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike...

speaker: Ike
text: Why are you here all by yourself? That's not very safe.

speaker: Elincia
text: I was looking at the town. I'm unfamiliar with the world outside the imperial villa where I was raised. This is the first time I've been able to see how other people live. Everything is so new and different to my eyes. This...is a town, isn't it? There's so much energy, and everyone seems to be enjoying themselves.

speaker: Ike
text: With all the boats coming in and out of the harbor, this town's livelier than most. That's for sure.

speaker: Elincia
text: It's like nothing has happened. All the death and destruction we've seen feels like horrible dream...

speaker: Ike
text: Mmm...

speaker: Kieran
text: Haa! Yaaa! Hiiii-yaaaa!!

speaker: Ike
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Kieran
text: I'm trying to regain the superb physique I lost when I was being held prisoner.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you ready to board the ship?

speaker: Kieran
text: I was born ready! Hoooo-ha! I don't need anything! Even as we speak, many of my fellow Crimeans are suffering at the hands of Daein. If I cannot rush to their aid today, then I can at least prepare myself for the day when I can.

speaker: Ike
text: I see. Well, when we're ready, I'll let you know.

speaker: Kieran
text: Understood.

speaker: Ike
text: Sorry to have interrupted you.

speaker: Kieran
text: My lord Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Kieran
text: You rescued and cared for Princes Elincia. You have my heartfelt thanks. She...For us, she is our one solitary hope.

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah.

speaker: Kieran
text: Right, enough talking.

speaker: Kieran
text: Until we make our triumphant return to Melior, all I can do is keep training! Haaa! Nyaaa! Whaaaaaaaaaaa!!

speaker: Ike
text: Careful! Don't pull anything...

speaker: Ike
text: What are you looking at?

speaker: Brom
text: Oh, just this. It's sort of a good-luck charm. My family gave it to me when I left home. We never had much money, so my parents gathered some stones from our farm back home and put them in this leather pouch. It's not much to look at, but it means a lot to me Every day, I take them out and talk to them like they're my family. How is everyone? I'm out here doing the best I can. Don't worry. I'll be home soon. Just stuff like that. I know it sounds foolish, but if I don't do this...I won't...I won't have the courage to fight.

speaker: Brom
text: Don't worry about my feelings. You can laugh. Acting like this at my age, what a silly man I am!

speaker: Ike
text: It's not silly, Brom. You're a strong man who has decided to fight for the sake of his family. I know that your family is very proud of you.

speaker: Brom
text: ...Sniff...S-s-sniff...Mm. Thank you, Ike. Sniff... Thank you.

speaker: Nephenee
text: Well, that's that.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you ready to go, Nephenee?

speaker: Nephenee
text: Ah! Ike...

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Nephenee
text: ...Um...Nope! Nothin'! I'm fine.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Nephenee
text: Yeah! Sure I'm sure!

speaker: Ike
text: You know, it's hard being a prisoner. It's physically and mentally demanding...I need to know: can you fight?

speaker: Nephenee
text: Not a problem

speaker: Ike
text: It's easy for you to say, but you sound like you're about to fall over.

speaker: Nephenee
text: That? Aw, no! That's a habit...It's just the way I talk. Just talkin'!...Sorry.

speaker: Ike
text: No need to apologize. As long as you're not feeling ill, everything's fine. All right, I'll see you later.

speaker: Nephenee
text: Right then...

speaker: Kasatai
text: What? Are you telling me that His Majesty has not yet returned?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, sir! We've sent many messengers, but we have yet to receive any sort of official response.

speaker: Kasatai
text: The Crimean army is on our doorstep...What is His Highness thinking? If we want to protect the capital, we need a leader equal to one of the Four Riders. Just in case...

speaker: Ena
text: I'm sure the king has considered this.

speaker: Kasatai
text: Lady Ena! I don't understand how you're able to remain so calm!

speaker: Ena
text: Daein soldiers are the most elite warriors on the continent. In addition, our numbers are far superior to the Crimeans.

speaker: Kasatai
text: And, and yet they march on Nevassa! This is the Daein capital! If there's any danger of it falling into enemy hands, we can let nothing stop us from protecting it! No offense, Lady Ena, but as a general, I do not feel you're ready for such a vital command.

speaker: Ena
text: I...I think you are exactly right.

speaker: Kasatai
text: Th-then... When this command was given to you, why did you not firmly refuse?

speaker: Ena
text: Do you really think that wise, General? Would you refuse a direct order from the king?

speaker: Kasatai
text: Um...

speaker: Ena
text: ...Let me tell you something that I've discovered. If we are...unable to hold the capital, I do not believe the king will be all that upset. Ashnard does not hold a strong attachment to the country of Daein.

speaker: Kasatai
text: What are you talking about? Do you...Do you understand exactly what it is you are saying?

speaker: Ena
text: Yes.

speaker: Kasatai
text: Ridiculous! There isn't a monarch in the world who would not be moved by the loss of his own country! Such a preposterous notion is beyond comprehension!

speaker: Ena
text: General Kasatai. Do not avert your eyes from reality.

speaker: Kasatai
text: Reality? Ha! What reality is that? All I see is your guesswork.

speaker: Ena
text: Then tell me...why did the king suddenly order the invasion of Crimea?

speaker: Kasatai
text: As...as...sanctions for that nation choosing to ally itself with those evil and treacherous sub-humans.

speaker: Ena
text: On the surface, that would seem to be so. But doesn't the action strike you as odd? To apply sanctions properly, it would be necessary to speak with Begnion first. Begnion is the suzerain state, and Crimea answers to her. We needed Begnion's leave to make a formal declaration of war. Daein's disregard for that process made us a pariah in the eyes of our neighbors, and opened us to attack from all sides. And yet, not only did the king not do this, but he chose to invade without warning. It was the worst possible strategy. Furthermore, once the king conquered Crimea through strength of arms, he seized the castle and set up residence. And now he uses it as a stepping stone for an invasion of Gallia. Which means, the king's goal was never to apply sanctions, or even to defeat Crimea. If Ashnard moves against Gallia, it's easy to envision Phoenicis, Kilvas, and Goldoa joining the conflict. And if that happens, Begnion would be forced to ally itself with Daein rather than side with the sub-humans. Look where that leads us...A continent embroiled in war. Is that not the true desire of the king?

speaker: Kasatai
text: If... If you consider it in that way, your words do begin to make sense. Yet...to accomplish that, the citizens of Crimea would have to be sacrificed. That would be an act of madness!

speaker: Ena
text: Let's return to the topic at hand. The king has gained himself a new castle, and I believe he considers whatever land he occupies to be his kingdom. Daein and its people are already behind him. He need not look back.

speaker: Kasatai
text: Pah! If the king wished to rule the world, he would want as much military strength as possible! To forsake even a portion of the strength he currently possesses willingly, why, it would be sheer folly...

speaker: Ena
text: That doesn't matter. What's important is that we recognize the chance which Daein has been given. We must stop the Crimeans here. If we do not show the king our value, we are doomed. Make no mistake about it.

speaker: Kasatai
text: This is complete lunacy...

speaker: Ena
text: We will receive no reinforcements. We must hold nothing back. It is our only chance of survival.

speaker: Kasatai
text: This...I cannot... Why is this--

speaker: Ena
text: Be strong. The king has provided us, and the capital, with one final measure. We will use it to weather this storm. However, to use it, I need you, General Kasatai. Your cooperation is imperative. If you want to win, you must trust me.

speaker: Kasatai
text: ...Understood. In this time, let us cling to any hope we can find. Lady... No... General Ena, I place my trust in you.

speaker: Ike
text: So this is the Daein capital, eh? If we can just defeat King Ashnard, this war will be over.

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike... Here you are.

speaker: Ike
text: What is it, Nasir?

speaker: Nasir
text: Are you sure that you have enough soldiers to lay siege to the capital? Your opponent is called Mad King Ashnard, after all. Who knows what sort of traps he has in store for you?

speaker: Titania
text: He may indeed have something planned. Surely they've received reports of our advancement. Yet it's so quiet...

speaker: Soren
text: It looks like every able-bodied man has been conscripted into the army, while women and children have evacuated the area.

speaker: Ike
text: We're not invaders. We wouldn't lay a hand on the citizenry...

speaker: Soren
text: There's no way for them to know that. They do know what their army did to the people of Crimea, however. If they fear they will be punished for that, I'm sure they decided to err on the side of caution.

speaker: Elincia
text: What? What happened to the Crimean people? Surely only the soldiers were imprisoned or killed...

speaker: Soren
text: ...You truly have no idea how to rule a nation. Do you know what happens to a country that loses a war? Everything is destroyed. Homes, land, crops...everything. And the citizens... They're not even treated as human. Crimeans, especially those near the capital where Daein's presence is strongest, are treated worse than sub-hum...than laguz.

speaker: Elincia
text: That's... Why would they...That's horrible...

speaker: Soren
text: The people understand this, which is why they pay for protection in the form of taxes. For the royals and nobles who are charged with protecting the people, there is no greater sin than to be defeated in war. It is the ultimate betrayal of the people's trust.

speaker: Elincia
text: Sniff... Ah, by the goddess, I am a fool......Sniff...

speaker: Ike
text: Soren! Enough!

speaker: Titania
text: Princess, be that as it may, the majority of people want to see the royal family restored to power. They believe that you will help them reclaim their old lives and restore peace.

speaker: Ike
text: Now it's time for us to throw down Ashnard and drive his army from Crimean soil. You're the only one who can do that. Do you understand?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes...yes, I do. I... I will save the people of Crimea. This I swear.

speaker: Ike
text: As I've said before, I won't be turned away. If there are traps, we just fight our way through. This war ends here!

speaker: Titania
text: Yes! I'm with you all the way!

speaker: Soren
text: I hope it all goes as planned. I will do my best to make it so.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: General Ike! Sir, the castle gates are open!

speaker: Ike
text: That's not good. What are they planning?

speaker: Elincia
text: It must be a trap.

speaker: Soren
text: This is unexpected. Making us lay siege would be far and away to their advantage. I have no idea what they're playing at.

speaker: Titania
text: Even so, we will not back down. Right, Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: Right. If we can't tell what they're planning, it matters not how we proceed. Let's just fight as we go. Move out! Keep your guard up, everyone!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Enemy troops have entered the castle!

speaker: Kasatai
text: They're moving already? Such recklessness! Don't they suspect a trap? I can't believe they've fallen for it.

speaker: Ena
text: Crimea follows a general named Ike. Perhaps he follows no procedure. Perhaps he relies solely on instinct.

speaker: Kasatai
text: I don't know if he's brave or merely reckless. It's unbelievable...

speaker: Ena
text: Regardless, we continue as planned. Close the gate and seal off their escape route. This contest will be decided here.

speaker: Kasatai
text: N-now then, it's time for the final measure you spoke of earlier. Will you show us what His Majesty left for us? What could possibly allow us to destroy an army in one fell swoop...provided we can herd them here?

speaker: Ena
text: General Kasatai...No matter what I show you, do not be shocked. You must continue to trust me without question.

speaker: Kasatai
text: I swear it. On my name as a royal knight of Daein, I will not betray you, General Ena.

speaker: Ena
text: Thank you...

speaker: Kasatai
text: Ge-General Ena! You're...

speaker: Kasatai
text: Aaaaaaah!

speaker: Ena
text: General Kasatai! Have you forgotten your vow? No matter what happens, we will protect the capital, yes?

speaker: Kasatai
text: Ah... Ah... Yes, of course...I...understand. This is His Majesty's--Why he left you here...

speaker: Ena
text: Yes.

speaker: Kasatai
text: We will win this battle! A legendary dragon of Goldoa is on our side! It is a powerful omen! Daein cannot lose! The Daein army is indestructible! We will crush the dogs of Crimea and use their skulls as goblets!

speaker: Ike
text: Stop, all of you! Get ahold of yourselves! You must not panic! No one has attacked!

speaker: Titania
text: Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: Titania! Where is Princess Elincia?

speaker: Titania
text: She's fine. She's with the supply convoy. They're all under very close guard.

speaker: Ike
text: Soren, is this the enemy trap?

speaker: Soren
text: ...It could be...

speaker: Titania
text: If so, to what end?

speaker: Soren
text: Well, the goal obviously isn't to divide our troops and reduce our fighting strength. We're all packed in here together. Whatever they are planning, it appears that they want us all to experience it at the same time.

speaker: Titania
text: Daein must have something which they believe gives them an insurmountable advantage. Some kind of ultimate weapon.

speaker: Ike
text: So they're absolutely sure they'll win, is that it? King Ashnard of Daein...You'll regret underestimating us.

speaker: Soren
text: No matter what, we must be cautious. We can spare no efforts to protect the princess. We should put together an elite team and head for the throne room. Choose the members of this team with care. Everything will rest on their shoulders.

speaker: Ike
text: Understood.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Glory to Daein!

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Sir! The gates have just closed behind us! Look out!

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: We're trapped in this castle! Run! Ruuuun!

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Attack! We're under attack! They're going to kill us!

speaker: Kasatai
text: For us there is no tomorrow. We cannot be beaten, nor can we withdraw! We must defeat the Crimean army and bring His Majesty back to us.

speaker: Kasatai
text: I cannot...stop your march...But...we are not yet defeated...General...Ena...Protect...the...capital...

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Ah ha ha! I will cut you down with ease and leave your corpse for the rats!

speaker: Tauroneo
text: Combat...was my life...Now...it is...my death...Ah, how fitting...

speaker: Ike
text: Ashnard! Show yourself!

speaker: Ena
text: I've been waiting for you. You are General Ike, are you not?

speaker: Ike
text: How did... Who are you?

speaker: Ena
text: My name is Ena. By the orders of the king, I am the protector of this capital.

speaker: Ike
text: Withdraw. I've no desire to fight a useless battle with you. It's Ashnard I'm after.

speaker: Ena
text: I regret to inform you that the king is not here.

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Ena
text: The king and the main body of the Daein army remain in Crimea, where they have been since it fell.

speaker: Ike
text: What are you saying? The king's abandoned the capital?

speaker: Ena
text: ...I share your desire to see this conflict end. So rather than see you travel to Crimea to fight Ashnard, I felt it would be much faster for me to defeat you and your army here. Don't you agree?

speaker: Ike
text: That's one way to look at it. The problem is that I'll never let you do as you please with Crimea!

speaker: Ena
text: We cannot have it both ways. We both want what is in our own interest, and that is why we have conflict. If neither one of us will yield, our conflict will continue until only the stronger of us remains. I have my own reasons for fighting...And I will see you fall.

speaker: Ike
text: Hi-yaaaah!

speaker: Ena
text: If you had wished to extend your short life span, then you should not have appeared before me.

speaker: Ena
text: You are strong. I have lost.

speaker: Ike
text: Then calm yourself and surrender. There's no reason for you to die.

speaker: Ena
text: That I cannot do.

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Ena
text: I... I must go to him...

speaker: Ike
text: No! Wait!

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir! Good timing. Grab her, will you?

speaker: Nasir
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir?

speaker: Ike
text: Urgh!

speaker: Soren
text: Ike!

speaker: Titania
text: Nasir! What are you doing?

speaker: Nasir
text: Go now. Hurry!

speaker: Ike
text: So you were the traitor?

speaker: Ike
text: Someone's been giving information to the enemy. Was that you, too? And...Mist's medallion?

speaker: Ike
text: Are you telling me you've been working for Daein this whole time? But you're a laguz! Why? Talk to me! Ah, this is useless. Get him out of here! His traitorous face is making me ill!

speaker: Ike
text: Blast!

speaker: Ike
text: Until this has been cleared up, you'll be held in custody.

speaker: Ike
text: I won't question you anymore. When you decide to talk, let me know.

speaker: Nasir
text: ...Go to Palmeni Temple.

speaker: Ike
text: What did you say?

speaker: Ashnard
text: So the capital's fallen, eh? Ha! I knew it would come to this! Still...how disappointing. It doesn't matter how well you train an army--if they don't fight, they become weak. What's the life of a soldier without a steady diet of war? Blood and pain are the foods of a true warrior!

speaker: Petrine
text: Suh-speaking of soldiers, Your Highness...The majority of our forces have been moved here--

speaker: Ashnard
text: I left more than enough soldiers! And yet they could not prevail... I may have overestimated Ena. Even if she is a dragon, I suppose that was the best she could do.

speaker: Petrine
text: I suppose...

speaker: Ashnard
text: But the important thing is the Black Knight. Where's he gotten to? Did you see him in the capital?

speaker: Petrine
text: I did. He bid me present this to Your Majesty...

speaker: Ashnard
text: Ah! It's found its way back to my hands at long last. Unwrap it! Quickly! Unwrap it and show it to me...

speaker: Petrine
text: V-very well--

speaker: Ashnard
text: Do be careful not to touch it, Petrine. It wouldn't do to have you go mad...I'd hate to have to kill you! Aha ha ha!

speaker: Petrine
text: H-here it is, Y-Your Majesty...

speaker: Ashnard
text: Behold... Ah, how wonderful! See how it reacts to the war I have brought to this pathetic land?

speaker: Petrine
text: Th-this is Lehran's Medallion?

speaker: Ashnard
