text: Yes. And inside...inside is a dark god of immeasurable power and cruelty. It once caused a flood so great that all continents save Tellius were submerged in a watery tomb.

speaker: Petrine
text: That...blue light...

speaker: Ashnard
text: You... Me... Even this very castle itself...We all radiate various forms of chaotic energy, and the dark god is pure chaos! The light you see is that energy calling out to the chaos around us. That is why some scholars refer to it as the Fire Emblem.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Heee! Heee har har! Look how you tremble! This light has the power to bewitch the human soul, you know? It calls to our chaotic impulses--like the urge to slaughter every living thing in sight... Do you feel its invitation? The permission to act on any base emotion that resides in your heart, no matter how unspeakable?

speaker: Petrine
text: I... My report...is not...finished...

speaker: Ashnard
text: Heee har har! Ah, Petrine...Guard!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, Your Highness?

speaker: Ashnard
text: Wrap the medallion and place it in the vault.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: At once!

speaker: Ashnard
text: ...Go on. The report?

speaker: Petrine
text: O-of course... Yes...As Your Majesty ordered, the Black Knight moves to capture Princess Serenes. At last report, he was on his way to Phoenicis.

speaker: Ashnard
text: I see. So he's decided on the princess and not the prince, eh? Did he give any reasons?

speaker: Petrine
text: Yes, Your Highness. It was based on the findings of a group of scholars. Because the princess was isolated for over twenty years, they feel her magic will be stronger than her brother's.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Yet... Can the Black Knight outwit the hawk king of Phoenicis and steal her away?

speaker: Petrine
text: The hawk king is not always at her side. Plus, as you know, the Black Knight is in possession of warp powder. If someone of his might has the ability to appear and disappear at will, it may be that he is without equal...W-with the exception of Your Majesty, of course!! I... I mean...

speaker: Ashnard
text: Ha ha. I will have to test that someday...But not today. It's not often that one finds a tool as useful as he is.

speaker: Petrine
text: Well spoken, Your Majesty.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Now then, Petrine. My dear Petrine...You have made one blunder after another. How will you prove your worth to me...? If you wish to remain in my service, you must show me results. Unless you, too, wish to become food for Rajaion here?

speaker: Petrine
text: Y-Your Majesty! I will redouble my efforts! I won't... I won't let you down again!

speaker: Ashnard
text: You can be a general or you can be dinner. I don't really care which... But do try to show a little initiative, won't you?

speaker: Petrine
text: Yes, Your Highness... B-by your leave...

speaker: Ashnard
text: Hold. I forgot one thing. What happened to Ena when the capital fell?

speaker: Petrine
text: According to all reports, she escaped. Her current location is unknown. However... This is Ena we're speaking of. She will return to Your Majesty, will she not?

speaker: Ashnard
text: Kill her.

speaker: Petrine
text: What?

speaker: Ashnard
text: I've no further use for her. Oh, but if it's too much for you to kill her outright... Use her trust and stab her in the back.

speaker: Petrine
text: As...as you wish...

speaker: Jill
text: Um, General? Thank you.

speaker: Mist
text: Hm?

speaker: Jill
text: The people of Talrega were the enemy, yet you treated them with kindness. I don't know how to thank you.

speaker: Mist
text: Oh, the provisions? It wasn't enough, but I wanted to do whatever I could. It's nothing for you to worry about, though.

speaker: Jill
text: General Ike...

speaker: Unknown
text: My, my lady! Is that you? Lady Fizzart?

speaker: Jill
text: Huh?

speaker: Woman
text: Oh, it is you! Lord Shiharam's lovely daughter! Thank heavens you're still alive!

speaker: Jill
text: You're...from Talrega.

speaker: Woman
text: That's right. I'm Sophie, from the village of Luma! I can't live there anymore, so I brought my two sisters here to the capital. After that battle, I was sure that you'd been claimed by the Dark Angel, just like Lord Shiharam. But here you are!

speaker: Jill
text: Is this your bodyguard? Ooo, so strong! You watch out for milady, you hear? She's Lord Shiharam's precious little girl! You keep an eye on her, and don't let those nasty Crimeans get near her!

speaker: Ike
text: Um...

speaker: Jill
text: Actually... We're...

speaker: Woman
text: Please listen to me, milady! We understand all about those floodgates! Lord Shiharam would've never done such a thing if he had any other choice! We know it was those Crimeans that did it! Why, when he wasn't on duty, Lord Shiharam and his men used to help us with the plowing and the planting. And once when my sister got sick, he loaded her up onto his own wyvern and brought her to the capital to see a doctor. He's the only one who ever cared about us country folk. He opened his heart to each and every one of us.

speaker: Jill
text: He... He was a good man...

speaker: Woman
text: Those dirty Crimeans are to blame! If they'd never come to Daein, that battle wouldn't have happened. And Lord Shiharam would still be with us.

speaker: Girl
text: Sister... I'm hungry...

speaker: Woman
text: You're going to be all right. I'll find you something to eat in a little while. Just be patient.

speaker: Girl
text: That soldier over there gave me this. Can I eat it?

speaker: Woman
text: Don't be stupid! Throw that away right now! We'll starve to death before we take charity from Crimean killers!

speaker: Girl
text: Waaaaaa...Waaaaaaaaaaaa!

speaker: Woman
text: Milady! The Crimean army is nearby! Run! You must escape and survive. We're gonna live. Even if we have to eat mud and weeds, we'll do it. And one day we'll have our revenge on those bloodthirsty Crimeans. If I can't do it, my children will...And if they can't, then my grandchildren will! We'll get them someday! I swear it! I have to go. Promise me, milady. You must go on for Lord Shiharam's sake. You mustn't get yourself killed!

speaker: Jill
text: Um...

speaker: Jill
text: ...S-sorry....Oh, I'm so sorry...

speaker: Ike
text: Don't be...

speaker: Mist
text: ...Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Are you all right?

speaker: Mist
text: ...We've come a long way, haven't we? Do you think we can beat King Ashnard?

speaker: Ike
text: Of course we can! We have to. If we lose, Crimea may never be rebuilt.

speaker: Mist
text: ...What are we going to do, Brother? I'm...frightened... The medallion was my protection. Now that it's gone, my confidence has vanished.

speaker: Ike
text: Mist...

speaker: Mist
text: For as long as I can remember, I would talk to the medallion like I was talking to Mother. After Father died, I felt like I was talking to them both...Where could it have gone?

speaker: Ike
text: We'll find it. And even though it's gone, Father and Mother are looking down on us and protecting us.

speaker: Mist
text: ... You're right... I'm sorry. Father and Mother are in my heart, and I've got you and everyone else at my side. So even without the medallion, I'm all right. Everything's going to turn out fine. I know it.

speaker: Ike
text: That's the spirit.

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike, Mist, if you're going to chat, why not go inside? Even if the snows are beginning to melt, it's still cold out here.

speaker: Mist
text: Oh, hi, Nasir.

speaker: Ike
text: You're right. I do feel a bit cold. Shall we go back to the tent?

speaker: Mist
text: Uh-huh! Let's go, Ike!  You, too, Nasir!

speaker: Nasir
text: ...Forgive me.

speaker: Mist
text: Nasir? What's wrong? Hurry up!

speaker: Nasir
text: Oh... Of course.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: General Ike! Sir, reinforcements have arrived from Begnion!

speaker: Ike
text: Reinforcements? I haven't heard anything about this.

speaker: Ike
text: Have you, Princess Elincia?

speaker: Elincia
text: No, not a word.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you sure they're Begnion troops?

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Yes, sir! They fly Begnion's insignia. There can be no doubt of their authenticity. And the man in command is one of Begnion's most beloved heroes, General Zelgius! There's no mistaking him, sir!

speaker: Ike
text: Allow me to meet with him first.

speaker: Zelgius
text: I beg your pardon. Are you General Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: I am. And you are?

speaker: Zelgius
text: I am Zelgius, earl of Kadohl. I've been dispatched from Begnion with a battalion to support your army.

speaker: Ike
text: Your assistance is much appreciated, but...This is very unexpected.

speaker: Zelgius
text: I understand your surprise. For Begnion's imperial senate, this decision was made with unusual haste.

speaker: Ike
text: I imagine so. It took forever just to get the soldiers I have now.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Well, there's a reason behind this expedited decision. Duke Persis has returned home.

speaker: Ike
text: Do you mean Sephiran?

speaker: Zelgius
text: Correct. Duke Persis is also senior statesman of the imperial senate. The duke returned from his travels and began working immediately to settle pressing affairs of state. First, he met with the apostle, and they exchanged reports on both foreign and domestic matters. Then they discussed Begnion's position in relation to the current conflict, and possible courses of action. In less than half a day, they brought the entire imperial senate into line and sent us here to you.

speaker: Ike
text: ...So you're saying that Begnion has allied itself with Crimea. Is that it?

speaker: Zelgius
text: That's it exactly. I am at your service, General Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh... Um...wow. Thank you.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Now then, please tell me what you would have my men do. I'm ordered to help in any way possible.

speaker: Ike
text: Um... You've caught me off guard. I can't think of anything right now.

speaker: Zelgius
text: In that case, do I have permission to make camp around the palace and rest my troops?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, please do. That's no problem.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Thank you. Please do not hesitate to call if you have need of us. We are at your disposal.

speaker: Titania
text: Begnion reinforcements... That was unexpected, wasn't it?

speaker: Ike
text: It certainly was! It seems the apostle and Sephiran did the impossible by getting them to us.

speaker: Elincia
text: All for our little army... It's hard to believe they would go to all this trouble.

speaker: Titania
text: First we take Daein's capital, and now this. Things are looking up.

speaker: Ike
text: You're right. Even if we don't receive help from Gallia, we still may be able to defeat Ashnard.

speaker: Elincia
text: That's true. It's...like a dream.

speaker: Soren
text: I have to disagree.

speaker: Titania
text: Oh, look. Soren is upset again. Who knew?! What is it this time?

speaker: Soren
text: If the Crimean army is not the crux of Daein's defeat, this war means nothing.

speaker: Titania
text: What does that have to do with the arrival of these reinforcements?

speaker: Soren
text: The battalion that just arrived is greater in numbers than the one we originally received. Not only that, but all of these soldiers are marching under Begnion's name.

speaker: Ike
text: So?

speaker: Soren
text: So... If these reinforcements are responsible for defeating King Daein, what do you think will happen? That achievement, the very victory itself, will belong to the Begnion Empire. Not to Crimea. If that happens, Crimea will be rebuilt however Begnion sees fit, and Princess Elincia will be a mere figurehead. And then, the deeds of an unknown mercenary company will be expertly covered up. We'll receive some paltry sum of money and be swept under a rug somewhere. Mark my words.

speaker: Elincia
text: Soren, you're being so rude! Surely the apostle, of all people, would never do such a thing!

speaker: Ike
text: And this General Zelgius seems sincere enough to me.

speaker: Titania
text: Come, Soren. I have heard of situations like that which you describe, but whether this is such a case... We've been fortunate to receive this good will. Must we always search for such ulterior motives?

speaker: Soren
text: Yes! We must! Have you forgotten Nasir?! It's that sort of naive attitude that allowed him to remain undetected for so long! You people don't seem to get it. We are at WAR! All doubts, no matter how small, must be extinguished. If they aren't, we could well be ignoring something that will lead to our defeat. Or to our death.

speaker: Ike
text: Let's take Soren's comments under consideration and discuss this at length. We meet in one hour.

speaker: Zelgius
text: So you're going to lead a small unit out on a survey mission?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, that's the plan. However...Though we've taken the castle, there are still pockets of Daein resistance. It's possible they may try to mount an attack and retake the palace. I want you to be in charge of the watch.

speaker: Zelgius
text: That is, of course, not a problem. However, you're taking the princess along. Don't you think it would be safer to take more troops? Even if we split our battalion, we have enough men to handle both tasks.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm just not used to moving around with such a large group. And for this mission... I'd like to keep the number of people involved as low as possible.

speaker: Zelgius
text: It's not that I don't understand how you feel, but...we will compromise.

speaker: Ike
text: You know, for someone from Begnion, you're pretty flexible. It speeds things up considerably.

speaker: Zelgius
text: To be a soldier, one must be able to quickly adapt to circumstances around him.

speaker: Ike
text: All right. We'll be back later.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Take care.

speaker: Ike
text: This is the place Nasir mentioned. Palmeni Temple. I hope whatever he was trying to tell me will become clear once we get inside and look around.

speaker: Elincia
text: I still can't believe Nasir was on Daein's side... I just can't. And he let that dragon girl get away... Although I'm sure he had reasons for that, as well.

speaker: Mist
text: I wonder... Was it really Nasir? Although, besides my family, the only people I showed the medallion to were Titania, Princess Elincia, and Nasir... I thought I could trust him... I really did. Why? Why did he do it?

speaker: Elincia
text: Mist...

speaker: Ike
text: Thinking about the past isn't going to help. Let's take a look at this temple.

speaker: Ike
text: Here we are. This is Palmeni Temple.

speaker: Schaeferr
text: What did you say? The Crimean army is here?

speaker: Tomenami
text: They want to investigate the temple. What should I tell them?

speaker: Schaeferr
text: Crud! This ain't good. I don't know what they're after, but if they find us mercenaries who sided with Daein, they'll wipe us out!

speaker: Tomenami
text: It is all the will of the goddess. Resign yourself to your fate... Accept it.

speaker: Schaeferr
text: Bat dung! No one's gonna roll over and die! Dying's for sissies! So tell me, how many are there?

speaker: Tomenami
text: There appears to be ten or so, including the women.

speaker: Schaeferr
text: Gahar har har! That's good news!

speaker: Tomenami
text: It is?

speaker: Schaeferr
text: If that's the lot of them, we can take care of this on our own. It'll be like stealin' a baby from the cradle! Right, then, here's the plan. Pretend like you wanna help 'em, then lead 'em inside. And listen good! You'd best not whisper a word about us being here! Or else...Kkkkccchhhhh!

speaker: Tomenami
text: B-but I couldn't... What you ask is beyond me--

speaker: Schaeferr
text: KKKKCCCCHHHHH!!! Don't forget, we've got all the other priests under our control. Unless you want 'em to meet the goddess early, do as you're told!

speaker: Ike
text: All right, we'd like to take a look around. Please show us each room.

speaker: Tomenami
text: Um...very well... Th-th-this...is...Er... A v-very large room... Um...

speaker: Ike
text: Are you all right? Why are you shaking like that?

speaker: Tomenami
text: Oh, Goddess... Please...forgive me...

speaker: Ike
text: It's a trap!

speaker: Schaeferr
text: Gahar har har har! You did it!

speaker: Tomenami
text: Please...forgive me...

speaker: Ike
text: I thought something like this might happen.

speaker: Schaeferr
text: I don't know how you got wind of us, but showing up in such a small group means you're outta luck! None of ya are gettin' outta here alive!

speaker: Ike
text: We've just fought our way to the Daein capital. You're not even going to slow us down!

speaker: Schaeferr
text: Cocky, ain't ya? But who said this was gonna be a fair fight?

speaker: Tomenami
text: Eh?

speaker: Tomenami
text: What, what are you doing?

speaker: Schaeferr
text: Hey! Bring out the others!

speaker: Schaeferr
text: You fools are gonna be our shields.

speaker: Tomenami
text: What?

speaker: Schaeferr
text: Gahar har har! Gahar har har har! See? You ain't so useless after all!

speaker: Ike
text: You filthy dogs! Those are innocent people! You can't...

speaker: Tomenami
text: Oh...mercy... Please help me...

speaker: Schaeferr
text: Hey! If ya don't want them perty robes of yours to turn red, you'll attack these scum! If ya even think about betraying us, I'll kill every one of ya!

speaker: Tomenami
text: B-but...you can't......Crimeans, please... Forgive us...We cannot allow our brothers to die.

speaker: Ike
text: This cowardice will not stand! These priests are being made to fight against their will. We've got to try and save as many of them as possible! Let's go!

speaker: Schaeferr
text: Hey, robes! If I get so much as scratched, you better get to healing!

speaker: Schaeferr
text: ...Gwaar... Haaaarr... Haaaaaa...Shoulda brought...more priests...Or some...babies... Dang...

speaker: Daein Bishop
text: Thank you very much. I never imagined that we would be rescued by soldiers of an enemy nation.

speaker: Ike
text: There was no way we'd cut down innocent priests being forced to fight against their wills. And yet, we were not able to save everyone...

speaker: Daein Bishop
text: Peace, my lord. We were expecting to be killed at once. Yet somehow you rescued so many of us...I'm sure that even our departed Bishop Tomenami is grateful for your aid.

speaker: Elincia
text: Father, we bear no ill will toward the kingdom of Daein itself. We wish only to reclaim the homeland which was unjustly taken from us. That is the reason we fight. We had no desire to invade this land. If nothing else, please believe that.

speaker: Daein Bishop
text: I beg your pardon. May I have the favor of your name?

speaker: Elincia
text: Elincia Ridell Crimea. I'm the sole survivor of the Crimean royal family.

speaker: Daein Bishop
text: Oh! You... Let us give thanks that you are alive and well! And please, I beg your understanding as well. There are many Daeins who do not support the king's actions.

speaker: Elincia
text: I understand.

speaker: Tomenami
text: Thank you very much. I never imagined that we would be rescued by soldiers of an enemy nation.

speaker: Ike
text: There was no way we'd cut down innocent priests being forced to fight against their wills.

speaker: Elincia
text: Father, we bear no ill will toward the kingdom of Daein itself. We wish only to reclaim the homeland which was unjustly taken from us. That is the reason we fight. We had no desire to invade this land. If nothing else, please believe that.

speaker: Tomenami
text: I beg your pardon. May I have the favor of your name?

speaker: Elincia
text: Elincia Ridell Crimea. I'm the sole survivor of the Crimean royal family.

speaker: Tomenami
text: Oh! You... Let us give thanks that you are alive and well! And please, I beg your understanding as well. There are many Daeins who do not support the king's actions.

speaker: Elincia
text: I understand.

speaker: Tomenami
text: My young general, this is for you.

speaker: Ike
text: Huh?

speaker: Tomenami
text: As thanks for saving our lives.

speaker: Ike
text: Now it's time to search this place.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike. May I join you?

speaker: Ike
text: Sure, why not? Everyone's lending a--

speaker: Mist
text: Ike! Ike! Where are you?

speaker: Ike
text: Mist? I'm over here.

speaker: Mist
text: Ike! This way! Quickly! Reyson's in trouble!

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Ike
text: Reyson? What is it?

speaker: Mist
text: He's been like this from the moment he set foot in this room. He's just staring at the walls.

speaker: Ike
text: What is all this?

speaker: Elincia
text: Every wall has the same pattern on it.

speaker: Soren
text: It's not a pattern. It's an ancient language. All chants and spells in magic scrolls are written thusly.

speaker: Ike
text: Can you read it, Soren?

speaker: Soren
text: Some, but not all. Spells are simple, whereas this is a complex narrative. I think Prince Reyson could read it.

speaker: Ike
text: I bet this is the same language that Leanne was speaking.

speaker: Soren
text: It is. It's the Serenes' language...Their chants are all in this language, too.

speaker: Mist
text: So Reyson is reading what's written on the walls?

speaker: Titania
text: It appears that way...

speaker: Ike
text: Shall we leave him be? There's a lot of writing here. This could take hours.

speaker: Elincia
text: I think that's a good idea.

speaker: Soren
text: Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Soren
text: From what I could gather, I think a person was locked in this room sometime in the past.

speaker: Ike
text: ...You don't know who it was, do you?

speaker: Soren
text: I wasn't able to read enough of the writing, but... I found this under the bed.

speaker: Ike
text: Is this...?

speaker: Soren
text: I think it may have belonged to whoever was imprisoned in this room.

speaker: Reyson
text: I apologize. I took up much of your time.

speaker: Ike
text: Reyson, you don't look so good. Why don't you rest for a bit?

speaker: Reyson
text: No, I'm fine. It's more important that we talk.

speaker: Ike
text: About the owner of this feather?

speaker: Reyson
text: ...Was it in that room?

speaker: Ike
text: Soren found it. Whose was it?

speaker: Reyson
text: Lillia... My older sister. The writing on the walls is hers.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...You have an older sister, too?

speaker: Ike
text: Will you tell us about it?

speaker: Reyson
text: She was kidnapped twenty years ago, on the night of the Serenes Massacre. I...I thought that Lillia had been murdered along with my other brothers and sisters. I believed that until today...

speaker: Ike
text: Who took her?

speaker: Reyson
text: The walls say only that he was a large human. She probably never knew who it was. He thrust a clan treasure at her and demanded that she use her magic to revive the thing sealed inside it. He exhorted her again and again, but to no avail. Lillia refused his request every time...because she did not possess that power.

speaker: Elincia
text: Someone wanted to revive the dark god...

speaker: Reyson
text: Shortly after she was brought here, Lillia fell ill and collapsed. I'm not surprised...it was a terrible time... She was imprisoned in that tiny room with no view of earth or sky...

speaker: Mist
text: Oh, that's awf...sniff.........sniff...

speaker: Titania
text: Mist...

speaker: Mist
text: I'm sorry...I just feel...so sad for Lillia...and for...for Reyson, too...

speaker: Reyson
text: I beg your pardon. Let me continue. A young beorc began coming to the room to care for Lillia. She had bluish hair and blue eyes...And her heart was unusually pure for a beorc. In time, Lillia and she came to be friends, and shared a mutual trust.

speaker: Mist
text: Ah!

speaker: Reyson
text: Lillia decided to entrust her hopes to the woman. They shared no common language, so it took some time. But eventually, the beorc woman understood what it was Lillia wanted... Which was to take the treasure and the song...and flee this temple.

speaker: Mist
text: B-Brother!

speaker: Ike
text: Was there anything else written about this beorc woman? A name, perhaps...

speaker: Reyson
text: (Elena....) Translated into our language, it was probably Elena.

speaker: Mist
text: I knew it! Mother! It was our mother!

speaker: Reyson
text: What?

speaker: Elincia
text: Are, are you sure?

speaker: Ike
text: Our mother's name was Elena. Like me, her hair was blue...as were her eyes. Reyson, the object you refer to as your clan treasure was an aged, bronze medallion, wasn't it?

speaker: Reyson
text: How... How did you know that?

speaker: Ike
text: The medallion became my mother's keepsake. The song, too... My parents both gave their lives to protect it.

speaker: Reyson
text: Ike! You and Mist are Elena's children? Then Lehran's Medallion is here?

speaker: Mist
text: Um...

speaker: Ike
text: The medallion was stolen. Probably by Daein.

speaker: Reyson
text: It can't... This is...unbelievable. Can a thing like this be chance?

speaker: Ike
text: To be honest, I don't fully understand all that's happened. But...it all makes sense. It all comes together...

speaker: Reyson
text: Ah!

speaker: Elincia
text: Mist...That's the song that... But...the melody's a little different, isn't it?

speaker: Ike
text: It's similar to the song Reyson and Leanne sang in the forest. My mother used to sing it as a lullaby.

speaker: Reyson
text: It is the song of release. The one Lillia entrusted to Elena.

speaker: Mist
text: B-but...I wore the medallion and sang that song almost every single night! And nothing ever happened.

speaker: Reyson
text: The magical effect of the song is awakened by the power of the singer. ...It can't be unleashed by just anyone. The true song of release can only be sung by a girl named Altina...Lillia wanted your mother to take the melody to Altina and return the medallion to its rightful place in Serenes Forest.

speaker: Ike
text: The story's becoming clearer and clearer. My father fled Daein to protect my mother, who was carrying the amulet.

speaker: Titania
text: Ike? How did you know--

speaker: Ike
text: Volke told me. He told me about my father's past, and the amulet, and the dark god, too.

speaker: Titania
text: So you know everything...

speaker: Reyson
text: King Ashnard took Lillia, didn't he?

speaker: Ike
text: That would be the final piece of the puzzle. After all, the man who found my father was the king's henchman.

speaker: Titania
text: Ike! Are you saying you know who killed Commander Greil? You never said anything about that! We all thought his murderer was unknown... Why didn't you say anything?

speaker: Ike
text: ...I don't know. I never felt like talking about it.

speaker: Titania
text: He was a Daein soldier, wasn't he? Who was it? Who was the man who killed Commander Greil?

speaker: Titania
text: IKE!! TELL ME!!

speaker: Soren
text: Can we discuss this later?

speaker: Titania
text: ...Oh... Yes... Yes. Of course.

speaker: Soren
text: Up to this point, we've all been fighting for the liberation of Crimea. Even if we now add to that stopping the dark god from being released and punishing Commander Greil's killer... Our enemy remains unchanged. King Daein and his henchman are the ones we must defeat.

speaker: Elincia
text: It's mysterious, isn't it? I mean, Reyson said the same thing earlier, but... Could all of this really be mere coincidence? The fall of Crimea... Ike's parents... The death of Reyson's sister... The fact that everything leads back to Daein...

speaker: Jorge
text: Hey, Ike! Er... General Ike! Wait up! Say, if there's an enemy in my way, but I don't want to kill him, what do you think I should do?

speaker: Ike
text: ...Is this about that stupid game again?

speaker: Jorge
text: Well, it's all your fault! You had to go and tutor Daniel, and now I've been on this losing streak!

speaker: Ike
text: Tutor? You mean back when we were onboard the ship? It was just one hint!

speaker: Jorge
text: Daniel isn't like me! He's smart. I'm the one who thought up this game, but he's the one who's getting better and better. I hardly ever win anymore!

speaker: Ike
text: Instead of playing that game, why don't you try some real combat?

speaker: Jorge
text: Stop joking around. We're happy-go-lucky traveling merchants. We don't know anything about fighting.

speaker: Ike
text: Give me a break! It's nice you're having fun and all, but please... Can you save your stupid game for someone who's not fighting for their life day in and day out?

speaker: Jorge
text: Well, what do you expect? Everything's war, war, war, and there's no place for us. All we can do is play this game. Sorry... I'll just go lose again...

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, for heaven's sake...Look, if there's an opponent you don't want to kill, just shove him out of the way. Then you don't have to fight him.

speaker: Jorge
text: Huh? Oh, t-thanks. ...Um...You know, we are what we are, but we'll be with you till the end. I hope we can continue to be of service. All right?

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, thanks. Sorry for being so irritable.

speaker: Jorge
text: That's all right. I know how much stress you've been under.

speaker: Ike
text: Something on your mind?

speaker: Sothe
text: Oh, Commander Ike! Oops! I guess I'm supposed to call you General now, huh?

speaker: Ike
text: Commander's fine. So what's going on? Are you thinking about that person you were looking for?

speaker: Sothe
text: That's...all settled. Actually, no... it's not really settled. It's just...I figured that worrying about it all the time wasn't doing me any good. I turned over every rock in Begnion during my search, but... It's just easier to assume that everything's going well...somewhere...

speaker: Ike
text: Well, as long as you're happy, I won't say a word. So...what were you thinking about then?

speaker: Sothe
text: I...I didn't say anything before, but Daein is my homeland.

speaker: Ike
text: Is that so? Sothe Yeah. Until a few years back, I lived in the slums of Nevassa and stole for a living.

speaker: Sothe
text: So anyway, I went back to my old stomping grounds and saw some friends. The rest of the city's empty, but they're still here. They've got no other place to go, you know?

speaker: Ike
text: And what did they have to say?

speaker: Sothe
text: Every one was mad that Crimea had won. They said if the king had been here, there's no way they would've been defeated. It's so weird. Until now, all they had ever done was complain about this place.

speaker: Ike
text: I see.

speaker: Sothe
text: You know, Ashnard wasn't such a bad king. At least, as far as we could see. If you were strong enough, you could rise up and become a knight one day. You could escape the filthy slums. He was the only king who ever gave us that chance. That hope.

speaker: Sothe
text: Don't get me wrong. I don't mind fighting with all of you. But still, seeing your homeland scarred and trampled like this is tough. I'm sorry. I know Crimea is suffering in the same way, but... I can't change how I feel.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Is that it?

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Wait, there's more! It seems that Prince Reyson was able to escape Duke Tanas's villa and make his way safely to Serenes Forest. However...we have word that Tanas's men have entered the forest in hopes of recapturing the prince. We've not a moment to waste! Please, O king of hawks! Reach out your mighty talons, strike down these wretched humans, and rescue Prince Reyson. I implore you, Your Majesty, take wing at once!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Why is Naesala not here?

speaker: Nealuchi
text: That...er... His Highness must not be seen here at this time... It's--

speaker: Janaff
text: What's going on, you old buzzard? King Kilvas is the White Prince's friend, isn't he?

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Well...how do I put this? Hm, it's all very complicated...

speaker: Tibarn
text: I care not for excuses. If anything happens to Reyson, blood will be spilled.

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Oh, no! Please! There's no cause for worry. Duke Tanas treats his works of art with a delicacy so extreme that it could best be called...abnormal. He would never let any harm befall Prince Reyson....He probably can't even bring himself to touch him. The king himself told me so. That is the only reason he accepted this proposal--

speaker: Ulki
text: Proposal?

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Ah! Um... What I mean is...Er...

speaker: Janaff
text: Hold it! You crows set the prince up?!

speaker: Nealuchi
text: S-set up? Set up? Oh, no, no! Well...not exactly. Um...Please don't hurt me!

speaker: Tibarn
text: So that's the truth of it, eh? Naesala treated Reyson like a piece of merchandise and sold him. To a human...

speaker: Nealuchi
text: No, that's not... The only one who referred to him as merchandise was Duke Tanas. We never--

speaker: Tibarn
text: It doesn't matter! Claiming ignorance does not grant you innocence. You treated Reyson like a trinket in a public market!

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Oooh, dear...

speaker: Tibarn
text: If Reyson hadn't escaped on his own, perhaps the crow king would have rescued him when things cooled down. Regardless, Reyson trusted in his friend and followed him into the trap... And Naesala spit on that friendship. That, I cannot forgive!

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Your assessment of this old bird is correct. I am a worm, nothing more. But please, I beg of you... Temper your outrage. Let it cool.

speaker: Janaff
text: You're unbelievable. What is it with you crows, anyway? Everything you do is so dirty and deceptive. We will never understand your ways. Do you hear me, greywings?

speaker: Nealuchi
text: I hear you well, young hawk. But our nation... Our nation has... It has its own issues.

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Please, this is not the time to yell at a tired old man. You must hurry to Prince Reyson's side! Once he is safe, you can punish me in any way that you see fit...

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Tear me limb from limb if you wish...But please! Go to Prince Reyson! I beg of you!

speaker: Tibarn
text: This begging is unseemly and unwanted. We would rescue Reyson regardless of this pathetic show of tears. Return to Kilvas and report these events to your accursed king. Tell him that when this is over, King Tibarn of Phoenicis will be paying him a visit.

speaker: Nealuchi
text: ...Y-yes, Your Highness!

speaker: Janaff
text: Sigh... I know he deserves it, but I still feel bad for badgering the old coot.

speaker: Ulki
text: Your Majesty, what will we do now?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Ulki, use your ears to pick out the sound of Reyson's wings, then tell me the direction from which it comes.

speaker: Ulki
text: At once!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Janaff, use your eyes to peer between the trees and find me a road.

speaker: Janaff
text: You got it!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Human scum...If you think to replay that night from twenty years ago, you'll get no quarter from me.

speaker: Ike
text: Hm? Is that you, Soren? You're up early.

speaker: Soren
text: Actually, I'm always awake at this time.

speaker: Ike
text: Really?

speaker: Soren
text: Yes. You're the one who's up earlier than normal.

speaker: Ike
text: I want to finish our mission today. I think my nervous energy woke me up.

speaker: Soren
text: I understand... The last two days spent searching Serenes Forest for that heronhave been frustrating and fruitless. I'm sure he's in there somewhere, but...

speaker: Ike
text: I agree. And Duke Tanas's men are still hunting away. They must think the heron is there as well.

speaker: Soren
text: The only place left is the forest's heart. That's where we should go today. With luck, we may finally locate our target.

speaker: Ike
text: I get the feeling it's going to be a long day.

speaker: Soren
text: I believe this is the place where we ended our search yesterday.

speaker: Ike
text: I realized something a couple of days ago...Even in this forest, you always know exactly where you are, don't you?

speaker: Soren
text: Hm?

speaker: Ike
text: How do you do that? I think it's the lack of color, but these woods are starting to look the same to me.

speaker: Soren
text: Yes, that's a problem...

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike! We're approaching a large clearing. I think we should have the apostle and some of the others wait there.

speaker: Ike
text: Good idea. Even if we find the heron today, there's no need for them to tramp through the forest with us.

speaker: Soren
text: Mmm...

speaker: Ike
text: We're going to head deeper into the forest and continue the search. Please wait here. If we find the heron, we'll send for you immediately.

speaker: Elincia
text: I understand. My lord Ike, everyone, please be careful.

speaker: Sanaki
text: ...We're counting on you.

speaker: Ike
text: Sigrun? Tanith? May I entrust the princess to your care?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Of course.

speaker: Tanith
text: You've no need to worry. We will protect her with our lives.

speaker: Ike
text: Very well. Until later.

speaker: Ike
text: All right. Greil Mercenaries, move out!

speaker: Oliver
text: Gah! Haven't you fools found my precious little bird yet? I've no doubt the poor thing is even now quivering with loneliness and cold.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Duke Tanas! I've just received word that the mercenaries who invaded your villa are in this forest!

speaker: Oliver
text: Blast! Those wretches... They're here to steal my bird! Their souls are black with greed and jealousy! I have found beauty incarnate, and I will not relinquish it! Only I, Duke Tanas, can appreciate its worth!

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Um...I'm...sure that's true, Your Grace, but what about the mercenaries? What should we do about them?

speaker: Oliver
text: Hunt them down like dogs! Let none leave this forest alive! They will not rob me of my prize.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: But, Your Grace, they serve at the pleasure of the apostle herself! Striking them would be--

speaker: Oliver
text: Leave the apostle to me! I can deal with her once this is finished! All I need from you is silence and obedience. Is that clear?

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Yes, Your Grace! I beg your pardon.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: There they are! Do as Duke Oliver commanded! Slay them where they stand! Let none leave the forest alive, not man, woman, or child!

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, not the duke's soldiers again...I think it's about time we put an end to these fools. Listen up, everyone! Let's end this here!

speaker: Tibarn
text: What was that sound?

speaker: Janaff
text: I heard something, too.

speaker: Ulki
text: It came from the northeast. It's unlike anything I've ever heard.

speaker: Janaff
text: To the northeast...? Aha! There are ruins over there. Perhaps the White Prince found them to be a good hiding place.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Let's check it out. Maybe we can find him and escape while the humans fight amongst themselves.

speaker: Janaff
text: What are those humans thinking? Why would they be trying to lop each others' heads off?

speaker: Ulki
text: Shall I make an inquiry?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Leave them. They're nothing but trouble.

speaker: Janaff
text: I second that! Now, if we want to avoid the human skirmish, we should head...thataway! Through these trees!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Let's go.

speaker: Ulki
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Ike
text: Curses! They just keep coming! How many soldiers does he have?

speaker: Soren
text: There's no telling. He is a bishop and a senator, and he holds peerage, and that means he could command many men.

speaker: Ike
text: All right, let's figure out where to go next.

speaker: Mist
text: Brother!

speaker: Ike
text: What is it, Mist?

speaker: Mist
text: Did you...hear a sound just now?

speaker: Ike
text: Huh? No, I didn't.

speaker: Mist
text: Really? I guess it was just me then.

speaker: Lethe
text: That sound you heard, was it high-pitched, like the chiming of a bell?

speaker: Mist
text: Ah! Yes, it was! That's it exactly!

speaker: Mordecai
text: I heard it, too. It was very beautiful.

speaker: Ike
text: I didn't hear a thing.

speaker: Lethe
text: It created only a slight disturbance in the air. It could only be heard by those possessed of extraordinary hearing... So, your sister's hearing is on par with that of the laguz.

speaker: Mist
text: Wow! Did you hear that? Neat!

speaker: Ike
text: Don't let it go to your head. A sound that beorc can't hear...Hmm... That's interesting.

speaker: Nasir
text: It is said that those of the heron clan all practice the art of seid magic. Perhaps this sound is related to that?

speaker: Mist
text: Seid magic? What's that?

speaker: Nasir
text: It involves arcane songs known as galdrar. The effects of galdrar on the listener depend on the lyrics and melody. For example, a galdr can restore lost strength and vitality to those who hear it. And if the singer is of royal blood, the galdr may be powerful enough to move its listener to extraordinary feats. I've even heard tales of a galdr that could give one the speed to do the work of two men. The galdrar grant many powers.

speaker: Mist
text: Wow... That sounds incredible, doesn't it, Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah. But even with all that power, they were still wiped out by the beorc.

speaker: Mist
text: Right...

speaker: Nasir
text: Herons are highly attuned to the forces of balance. Even if they had the means to resist, I doubt they would have used them.

speaker: Ike
text: ...We leave as soon as our reinforcements arrive. Duke Tanas must not succeed! Let's rescue the heron while there's time!

speaker: Mist
text: All right!

speaker: Lethe
text: We should head toward the ruins in the northeast. I sense something odd there.

speaker: Ike
text: Got it. Thanks for the information.

speaker: Lethe
text: It is nothing. It is only natural...to aid one's companions.

speaker: Ike
text: I couldn't agree more.

speaker: Reyson
text: Cursed humans... How dare they defile this forest again! I will brook their savagery no more! The forest whispered earlier, but I must drive these wretches out before I can speak to it further. I will go to the altar...I will give voice to the forbidden magic and destroy the humans utterly!

speaker: Ike
text: Listen, everyone! We must make our way to the ruins in the northeast. Fight if you must, but keep up!

speaker: Soren
text: Ike! What about the reinforcements?

speaker: Ike
text: They'll have to catch up. We can't wait any longer!

speaker: Soren
text: Understood.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: There they are! The Crimean mercenaries! Surround them! They must all die!

speaker: Ike
text: Whew...we finally made it. Let's split up and search the surrounding area.

speaker: Titania
text: Commander, do you think we should call more reinforcements?

speaker: Ike
text: The duke's army seems nearly limitless, and I'm worried about our weapon situation. Let's do it.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, what's this?

speaker: Titania
text: What is it, Commander?

speaker: Ike
text: Look here. This is the only place in these ruins where I've seen healthy grass growing.

speaker: Titania
text: You're right. I wonder why?

speaker: Ike
text: And I found this...

speaker: Titania
text: A white feather? So we were right. The heron is around here somewhere.

speaker: Ike
text: It's possible, but...

speaker: Unknown
text: Ike! Over here!

speaker: Ike
text: What now?

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir! What have you found?

speaker: Nasir
text: ...A heron.

speaker: Leanne
text: Whatever is this...?

speaker: Ike
text: ...Um... That's a girl. Nasir, you said that the male heron we met was the only surviving member of the race.

speaker: Nasir
text: I believed it to be true. To find another survivor...It's a miracle.

speaker: Leanne
text: Who are you?

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, wait, please! I must speak--

speaker: Leanne
text: Yaaaa...!Stay away, human!

speaker: Ike
text: Come on. Wake up.

speaker: Titania
text: She's fainted dead away.

speaker: Ike
text: I guess there's nothing I can do but wait for her to come around. I wasn't trying to frighten her.

speaker: Oliver
text: Oh! Oh! Oh! I've found you at last! My beautiful treasure!

speaker: Ike
text: It's about time you showed your bloated face, Duke Tanas!

speaker: Oliver
text: Oh! Oh... No mistake about it. That is the spectacular work of art I paid so much to obtain...

speaker: Ike
text: You still claim ownership, do you?

speaker: Oliver
text: No, wait... Something's different...This is...a female!? You mean to tell me that yet another lives? How spectacular! Men! Bring me that heron! But do her no harm!

speaker: Ike
text: You'll never have her!

speaker: Ike
text: Again? Will this corpulent windbag never learn? Form up, troops! We must protect the heron!

speaker: Oliver
text: Aaa...aaarrrrrgggghhhh! What vexatious wretches! I am...overmatched! I can't believe I'm saying this, but... there's another white heron! Re-retreat! Leave them their prize!

speaker: Ike
text: Blast! Duke Tanas has escaped!

speaker: Soren
text: Ike? Perhaps trying to fight with that heron on your back is not the wisest of ideas. Why don't we take her to the apostle before moving on?

speaker: Ike
text: We've finally got Duke Tanas on the run! I don't intend to stop until we've captured or killed that monster!

speaker: Soren
text: I understand, but shouldn't we at least let someone else carry the heron?

speaker: Ike
text: Truth be told, she's unbelievably light. I barely know she's there.

speaker: Soren
text: Is... Is that so?

speaker: Ike
text: I think she weighs... Oh, I'd say about half as much as Mist.

speaker: Mist
text: Wow! I'm surprised!

speaker: Boyd
text: I'll bet you are...

speaker: Mist
text: What are you grinning about, Boyd?

speaker: Boyd
text: Oh, nothing... I'm just amazed...Did you know you're two times heavier than she is!? I'm glad I don't have to carry you around! It'd be like wearing an extra suit of armor!

speaker: Mist
text: You... You pig! You're the worst!

speaker: Boyd
text: Gaaa!

speaker: Ike
text: All right, maybe I exaggerated a bit. But she's still lighter than you.

speaker: Mist
text: Well, what do you expect? She's a bird!!!

speaker: Titania
text: Commander, if this battle is going to continue, I think we should get more reinforcements.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Reyson! Are you well?

speaker: Reyson
text: Tibarn! How did you--

speaker: Tibarn
text: Nealuchi told us everything.

speaker: Reyson
text: Oh... Allow me to apologize. I left on my own without a word to you, and this is what happened.

speaker: Tibarn
text: As long as you're unharmed, all is well. Let's go home.

speaker: Reyson
text: Please, give me a little time. I cannot allow these humans to remain in the forest.

speaker: Tibarn
text: I understand how you feel, but we're completely outnumbered. Let us wait for another day--

speaker: Reyson
text: Once I stand at the altar, I can take care of them. Every one of them.

speaker: Tibarn
text: You can't mean... Are you thinking of using the forbidden magic?

speaker: Reyson
text: ...Yes. I will sing those monsters the dirge of ruin.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Are you mad?! You mustn't! I can't allow it!

speaker: Reyson
text: With permission or without, I do what I must! It is retribution for genocide! Retribution for this forest!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Reyson! You must not let yourself be ruled by despair! Each member of the heron tribe is an embodiment of balance! Do this, and you warp your very existence!

speaker: Reyson
text: That's what they all said...My family. My tribe. And then...they died. The humans were drunk with joy. They laughed! They sang! ...And then they slaughtered us like livestock. My mother, my brother, my elder sisters... Even my infant sister, Leanne! All killed in a single night.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Reyson...

speaker: Reyson
text: I know. This thing I intend to do brings dishonor to my house. And yet...I cannot forgive. And their past actions weren't enough; now, they violate the sanctity of the forest without a trace of regret! Accursed humans...I will never forgive them!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Don't you think we understand that?

speaker: Janaff
text: That's right! Prince Reyson, there's no need for you to reject your honor based on the likes of them!

speaker: Ulki
text: The tragedy of the herons...The horror and pain of that night...lives on in all of us.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Let's return to Phoenicis, and think of a plan. You are right. This will not stand. The full power of the hawk nation is behind you. The humans will pay.

speaker: Reyson
text: ...As you wish...

speaker: Ike
text: Enough already! Lay down your arms and surrender. We will let you live!

speaker: Oliver
text: Grrrrrr... No! Never! I'm not giving up! I'm not finished yet! Out of my way, penniless wretches! Your very existence is an insult to all that is beautiful! All you really want is my wealth and beauty! Miserable curs... You reek of poverty and envy! Oh, but I understand your emotions...Yes, I do. How could you sad vagabonds not want to be me?

speaker: Ike
text: ...That's the last thing in the world--

speaker: Oliver
text: Silence! I am not one to be daunted by mean beggars such as you. Oh ho ho ho! In the name of the goddess, I, Oliver, duke of Tanas, will smite your hideous evil!

speaker: Ike
text: Um...

speaker: Oliver
text: To arms! To arms! Defend me with all the strength you possess! Oh, and bring me the little bird that blue-haired lout is carrying while you're at it...

speaker: Ike
text: ...Oh, please.

speaker: Ike
text: Here they come! Combat formation, everyone!

speaker: Janaff
text: Uh-oh! They're still going at it over here. Shall we go around?

speaker: Tibarn
text: I suppose so. Two human armies bashing one anothers' brains out...I wonder what they're after.

speaker: Reyson
text: Ah!

speaker: Tibarn
text: There's that sound again. Reyson, are you doing that?

speaker: Tibarn
text: No, I suppose not.

speaker: Reyson
text: ...The forest is whispering something. (What is it?)...What are you trying to tell me?

speaker: Janaff
text: King Tibarn! Prince Reyson! Look! There!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Eh?

speaker: Reyson
text: Ah?

speaker: Janaff
text: The blue-haired human is carrying something on his back...No, it can't be...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Is that...another heron?

speaker: Reyson
text: ...But...that's not...

speaker: Tibarn
text: I think some of the humans might be fighting to protect the heron. Grr... It's against my nature, but...we shall aid them! Janaff! Ulki! To me!

speaker: Ulki
text: Right!

speaker: Janaff
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Reyson
text: Tibarn! (Please....) Allow me to go with you.

speaker: Tibarn
text: If you forswear the forbidden magic, you may come.

speaker: Reyson
text: Agreed.

speaker: Oliver
text: Listen to me, you boors! You cannot possibly understand the pursuit of beauty. You are savages! You are a blight on the world, and you must die!

speaker: Oliver
text: Ohhh...ahhh...I...cannot...fall here...It cannot...be...Such a...loss...to beauty...

speaker: Ike
text: It's you!

speaker: Reyson
text: On your back... Who is it you carry?

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, the girl? I think she may be somebody you know, but...

speaker: Reyson
text: Leanne!

speaker: Leanne
text: Reyson, my brother?  Brother!

speaker: Reyson
text: Is it really you, Leanne? This is no dream? How is this possible? How did you survive all this time?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Leanne? Do you know who I am?

speaker: Leanne
text: Tibarn? Of the hawk tribe, yes?

speaker: Tibarn
text: That's right. You remember my name. Have you been here by yourself for all these years?

speaker: Leanne
text: I don't know...that night... My sisters took me and hid me in the small shrine. I'm sure they sang a galdr to me...And then I became so sleepy...

speaker: Reyson
text: The forest protected her. It kept her asleep for so long...There's no way to express my gratitude. Thank you for...With all that I am,  I thank you.

speaker: Tibarn
text: You there, beorc.

speaker: Ike
text: Me?

speaker: Tibarn
text: I am Tibarn, king of Phoenicis. Since the loss of their homeland, the Serenes royal family has been under my guardianship. Who are you, and why do you aid the herons?

speaker: Ike
text: My name is Ike. I am commander of the Greil Mercenaries. I am under orders of the empress, the apostle Sanaki, to protect the herons.

speaker: Tibarn
text: The empress of this country wants to protect the herons? Ha! That is an interesting tale. The herons were blamed for the assassination of the last empress. They were massacred on hearsay. And now her ancestor wants to help them? Touching.

speaker: Ike
text: The empress Sanaki knows that the herons are not murderers. And now, she is trying to atone for the crimes of her people.

speaker: Reyson
text: ...No. I cannot believe that.

speaker: Reyson
text: Pathetic apologies and half-baked platitudes are easily spoken! Humans burned Serenes Forest. They killed my family. I cannot trust one who allies himself with them.

speaker: Ike
text: Please, withhold judgment until you speak with the apostle. She's waiting at the forest's edge.

speaker: Reyson
text: The apostle is here?

speaker: Reyson
text: So you...are the apostle?

speaker: Sanaki
text: I am.

speaker: Sanaki
text: ...I'm...sorry...I am ignorant as to what words of contrition will be appropriate to one of the heron tribe. Yet I stand before you as a representative of my people... From the depths of my heart I apologize to you... I am sorry... So truly sorry...

speaker: Sigrun
text: Emp-Empress Sanaki! What are you doing? You are the apostle! You cannot bend your knee to another!

speaker: Ike
text: Peace! Let her speak her heart.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I'm sorry...I'm sorry...

speaker: Leanne
text: (That is enough...)

speaker: Reyson
text: Leanne?

speaker: Leanne
text: (Please rise, Apostle Sanaki.)

speaker: Sanaki
text: You... What is it you want? Are you telling me to stand?

speaker: Sanaki
text: You...

speaker: Leanne
text: (It is enough. It was not your fault.)

speaker: Reyson
text: Leanne!

speaker: Leanne
text: (Brother..it is enough, is it not? Forgive this child. Her apology is...so sincere.)

speaker: Reyson
text: Leanne! You cannot ask me to forgive them! You were asleep... You don't know what these humans did to us...

speaker: Leanne
text: (...I do know.  The forests...told me everything.)

speaker: Reyson
text: You...know?

speaker: Leanne
text: (Everyone is...gone, aren't they?)

speaker: Reyson
text: That's right... Everyone is gone. That's why I cannot release my hatred.

speaker: Leanne
text: (Brother... My loving brother, Reyson. The pain and sadness is in you, Brother. It clouds your very soul. To see you like this, to watch you. It hurts me. Please...do not lose yourself to hate.)

speaker: Reyson
text: (Leanne my sister.) I understand. If that is how you feel...

speaker: Reyson
text: Apostle Sanaki... We accept your apology. We may not be able to release our hatred of hum-- of beorc, but...You need not let the fate of Serenes Forest trouble you any longer. You are absolved of that guilt......

speaker: Sanaki
text: Th-thank  you...

speaker: Ike
text: That was well done.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Yes...

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike, what will happen now?

speaker: Ike
text: The heron siblings said there would be some sort of ceremony, but I don't know what that entails.

speaker: Janaff
text: You there! Beorc mercenaries! Prince Reyson wants all of you to come to the Serenes altar. The presence of Princess Crimea and the apostle is also requested.

speaker: Ike
text: Altar?

speaker: Janaff
text: Just come with me. It's this way.

speaker: Elincia
text: Empress Sanaki, Commander Sigrun, let us go.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Very well.

speaker: Mist
text: Let's hurry, Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: Right.

speaker: Nasir
text: Ah, excellent. The gap between laguz and beorc has been bridged. I think this may be enough...

speaker: Titania
text: What's wrong, Soren? You look so grim. What are you looking at?

speaker: Soren
text: It's nothing. Nothing at all.

speaker: Titania
text: Wait, Soren! What in the world is wrong with him?

speaker: Tibarn
text: That was excellent.

speaker: Elincia
text: It's so beautiful...

speaker: Sanaki
text: The Serenes Forest, beloved of the goddess, is alive once more.

speaker: Sigrun
text: You spoke so well earlier, Empress Sanaki. You fill my heart with pride... Sniff...

speaker: Sanaki
text: Here now! None of that. This is no place for tears!

speaker: Sigrun
text: I'm sorry... I'm just so happy...

speaker: Tanith
text: Commander Ike! A priest from Duke Tanas's villa insists on speaking with you.

speaker: Ike
text: Yes? What is it?

speaker: Servant
text: Um... Master mercenary. It is my understanding that you...you pursue Duke Tanas. I hear that you're searching Serenes Forest in hopes of capturing him.

speaker: Ike
text: And if I am?

speaker: Servant
text: Duke Tanas's property borders the forest, and he knows much about its layout. For quite some time now, he's been sending men into the forest to look for any herons who may still live there.

speaker: Ike
text: I see... So you're saying that his troops know the forest well.

speaker: Servant
text: I, too, have been taken into the forest.

speaker: Ike
text: You? Why take a priest?

speaker: Servant
text: He thought that herons would make themselves known if a priest called to them. He's also taken dozens of chaste maidens and tried having them call to the herons as well.

speaker: Ike
text: But he didn't find any, did he?

speaker: Servant
text: No. And yet, this time...The joy he expressed after paying such an exorbitant price for the Serenes royal was aberrant. It was...not natural. The duke has gone mad. To think that he would dare to defy the apostle...He is damned.

speaker: Ike
text: And here you stand. You're going to tell me what you remember about the forest, even though it means you're betraying Tanas...right?

speaker: Servant
text: Hmm... You read me well. To begin with, the heart of the forest was divided into three large sections. Maybe more. It was nearly colorless, and difficult to see far. The muddy floor pulled at our feet, and progress was slow. Many of the soldiers around me were afraid that they didn't bring enough supplies. They said a person would need them if he got lost, because getting out again would be no easy task.

speaker: Ike
text: What can you tell me about Duke Tanas's forces?

speaker: Servant
text: There were a lot of them...He had soldiers of every type. It was said that his mounted units and magic users were especially powerful. So at the very least, you should be prepared to deal with those two groups.

speaker: Ike
text: Thank you.

speaker: Servant
text: ...My parents... They both participated in the Serenes massacre. They're nearing the ends of their lives, but even now they lie awake at night and beg the goddess for forgiveness. I became a priest in order to help my parents, but then I was assigned to work at Duke Tanas's villa...I knew of his terrible deeds, but his position as an imperial senator frightened me. I have been silent for far too long. Master mercenary... You must rescue that Serenes youth. I beg of you. May the goddess guide your hand.

speaker: Ike
text: Don't worry. I have no intention of letting that villain steal him from before my very eyes.

speaker: Ike
text: Here you are.

speaker: Ike
text: We've been in Begnion for a while now. So tell me something...Why are you still here? Are you pretending to be our friend so you can lance us in the back?

speaker: Jill
text: ...You have to understand...I...I didn't know anything. I was born and raised in the Talrega region of Daein. It's a very remote area. My father was a soldier, and I grew up thinking that I, too, would one day be a soldier. A soldier to make my father proud. My life was simple... I questioned nothing. Doubted nothing.

speaker: Jill
text: Do you know the first thing we're taught in Daein schools? Sub-humans are evil. Sub-humans are the enemy. Sub-humans must be eradicated. The army stages periodic sub-human hunts. We'd find refugees from Begnion hiding in our mountains and forests...

speaker: Ike
text: You participated?

speaker: Jill
text: You don't get it! That's just how things are in Daein! No one taught me the word laguz! No one taught me that sub-humans could be... could be like this. No one cared.

speaker: Jill
text: When I saw the bird tribes at sea, I was convinced that the teachings were true. They were inhuman monsters. But later, I saw the dragons push your ship off of the reef, and it confused me. What if I had been raised to believe a lie? My heart pounded at the thought of it. And my doubts only grew with time.

speaker: Ike
text: So you decided to remain aboard in order to ascertain the truth. That's your true motive, isn't it?

speaker: Jill
text: How did you know?

speaker: Ike
text: I've known a lot of soldiers, and none would ever accept charity from an enemy. It would wound their pride. You obviously have pride to spare, so I knew there was some other factor at play.

speaker: Jill
text: Oh...

speaker: Ike
text: Well, have you reached a conclusion? What will you do?

speaker: Jill
text: I...want to stay here. At first, I thought I could protect my old life, that I could prove the sub-humans were monsters. But I was wrong. And now things are different. The sub-hu-- I'm sorry, the laguz... I want to know the truth about them, and I need to base that on what I see, not what I am told by others.

speaker: Ike
text: In that case, you can stay as long as you like.

speaker: Jill
text: I appreciate it. I think meeting all of you... was a very good thing.

speaker: Devdan
text: La la la! La la laaaaaa! Hmmmm...La laaaa hmmmmmlaaaaaa!La de di da de laaaaaa...

speaker: Ike
text: ...Um... Hey there, you. Have a minute?

speaker: Devdan
text: Oh, Captain! How are you today?

speaker: Ike
text: It's commander. Not captain. Well...you seem to be enjoying yourself.

speaker: Devdan
text: That's because this garden is so pretty. Devdan loves all plants and flowers. How about you, Commander?

speaker: Ike
text: They're all right, I suppose.

speaker: Devdan
text: That makes Devdan rather sad. All right is not a very strong feeling. It is boring. You should be a more emotional commander. Even things you're used to will show you something new if you look hard enough. And discoveries are exciting! That's what life is all about! At least, that's what Devdan thinks. Some disagree...and that makes Devdan upset!

speaker: Ike
text: ...You may be on to something. In Crimea, when my father was still alive, I think I was more open to such things. But now...I just don't have the time. Honestly, all I can think about is defeating Daein. I've no energy left to spend on flowers.

speaker: Devdan
text: ...If you talk like that, you will never defeat Daein.

speaker: Ike
text: What did you say?

speaker: Devdan
text: The war is new. If you are already so focused on preparations, you'll wear out before the fighting begins.

speaker: Ike
text: Hold on a minute!...

speaker: Mist
text: Ike?

speaker: Mist
text: What's bothering you? You've been moping around ever since we came aboard.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm...just a little seasick.

speaker: Mist
text: Seasick? You're such a bad liar. You never even get regular sick. You're not the type to get seasick!

speaker: Ike
text: Really, it's nothing.

speaker: Mist
text: Come on, talk to me. You've been doing so much lately. I just want the chance to help you for a change.

speaker: Ike
text: Well...All right. I'll tell you what's been bothering me. It's that incident back in Toha.

speaker: Mist
text: Go on.

speaker: Ike
text: When everyone discovered Ranulf was a laguz, all those people--they changed, just like that. Up until that instant, they'd seemed like such kind and decent people. I just...I had no idea beorc prejudice against the laguz was so strong. Why do they hate them so much? How are we so different, Ranulf and I?

speaker: Mist
text: I have to say, at first, I was scared, too. When I saw how they could change...They can do things that we hu--I mean, we beorc can't do. They're not like us...

speaker: Ike
text: Mist, you can't honestly feel...

speaker: Mist
text: It's different now! Everyone's so very nice. But, you know, that's because of all the time we've spent together. I've seen how they are; I've gotten to know them. That's why I've changed. I'm not scared or nervous around them, but other people don't get that chance. I think that's why they're frightened.

speaker: Ike
text: Maybe you're right...Maybe people like me are the odd ones, the people who accept others as they are.

speaker: Mist
text: I wish more people were like that. I mean, no one really wants to fight, do they? Doesn't everyone WANT peace? I guess it's just hard to put all of those fears behind us.

speaker: Unknown
text: You're right. It is very hard.

speaker: Mist
text: Nasir! What's the big idea, eavesdropping on us like that?

speaker: Nasir
text: How do you find sailing? Have you gotten sick at all?

speaker: Ike
text: We're fine. But answer a question for me, would you? Why are you here? Why do you associate with the laguz?

speaker: Nasir
text: Why? Besides the obvious financial benefits, I suppose I do so because I am one.

speaker: Mist
text: What? No, you're not a laguz! I don't see any tail or anything!

speaker: Nasir
text: Because I've chosen to live among beorc, I've taken certain steps to make sure I'm not recognized. I've had to change my attire, my feeding habits...I've done many things.

speaker: Ike
text: Why would you do that?

speaker: Nasir
text: Laguz cannot survive in isolation, nor can beorc. If both races are to thrive, they must learn to coexist. I have spent many years searching for a way to make this happen.

speaker: Ike
text: You think that laguz and beorc can live together? After everything you must have seen? I'm impressed.

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike, you will never truly understand a matter unless you look at it from each party's perspective. As you say, the laguz are indeed now persecuted by the beorc. But long ago, these roles were reversed.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Whatever happened in the past does not justify what we do to the laguz now.

speaker: Nasir
text: That is the thinking of an honest man. Keep things simple and pure. I like that. Still, the strength of your conviction comes from your youth and your innocence. Trust me: it will be tested. When your journey is over, how will you be changed? I pray your conviction is not lost to despair.

speaker: Ike
text: Talking to you is hard work.

speaker: Nasir
text: Someday, you'll understand. For now, my role is simply to deliver you safely to Begnion. Ranulf has paid me quite handsomely with money from the king of Gallia himself,and I will not let him down.

speaker: Ike
text: We're out of our element here at sea, so you're all we have to depend on. Thank you for your help.

speaker: Nasir
text: I will do what I am able.

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir, what is it?

speaker: Nasir
text: Nothing. Nothing we can do anything about, at any rate. We're being followed by pirates.

speaker: Ike
text: Really? I don't see any ships...

speaker: Nasir
text: Not by sea. By air. Look up.

speaker: Ike
text: Are those...birds? If they are, they must be huge...

speaker: Titania
text: Those are laguz, Ike.

speaker: Soren
text: Ravens from Kilvas. Their black wings are an ill omen for all who see them.

speaker: Ike
text: Titania, Soren, you noticed them coming as well?

speaker: Titania
text: Yes, Soren and I saw them when we were discussing our plans from the aft decks.

speaker: Ike
text: I'd heard stories, but...they're really flying. Wow.

speaker: Nasir
text: We're still out of their range, but airborne foes can be especially troublesome. I'd prefer to avoid them altogether. Let's see if we can outrun them.

speaker: Titania
text: From what I've been told, the flying corsairs of Kilvas and Phoenicis are far more cruel than any beast laguz.

speaker: Ike
text: Winged pirates...How am I supposed to fight against that? Wha-what was that?

speaker: Titania
text: Oof...It felt like we hit something.

speaker: Nasir
text: Blast...We've run aground! We must be caught on a reef or something! Move it, lads!Get the ship free!

speaker: Seeker
text: Predictable humans. Sailed right into our trap without fail.

speaker: Raven Laguz
text: Let's finish this quickly! It won't be long before Phoenicis or Goldoa takes an interest in what's happening here!

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike, the crows are coming!

speaker: Ike
text: Pull everyone together! Looks like we're in for a fight!

speaker: Ike
text: Soren! Do you have a plan?

speaker: Soren
text: I've done research in the past. All members of the bird tribes are vulnerable to wind magic. I think it's safe to assume that they are also as susceptible to arrows as any other flyer.

speaker: Ike
text: Wind magic and bows...All right! Everyone gather your weapons and prepare to meetthe enemy on the deck! I want a small group to remain belowdecks to protect Princess Elincia and the crew. We've never faced an enemy like this. I want everyone to stay together. Let's go!

speaker: Jill
text: Caught up...at last. I'll do this on my own. I will not let them escape! Huh? What are those things? Giant birds? Disgusting! Could they be...Are they...bird half-breeds?

speaker: Jill
text: You! Why are you lollygagging about?

speaker: Ike
text: Who are...

speaker: Jill
text: I am Jill Fizzart, wyvern rider of Daein, attached to Commander Haar's battalion. I offer a truce! I cannot sit by  and allow a human vessel to be attacked by sub-human degenerates! I will fight with you!

speaker: Ike
text: We will accept no help from Daein!

speaker: Jill
text: This is no place for foolish pride! At this rate, the sub-humans will[ devour you--

speaker: Ike
text: I will not accept aid from anyone who thinks laguz are sub-human.

speaker: Jill
text: What are you babbling about? I'm on your side! We'll talk after I chase off these crows! Bleed the half-breed!

speaker: Ike
text: Hold it! What...What in the world is going on?

speaker: Seeker
text: Plunder away! King Naesala has given us his blessings!

speaker: Seeker
text: Argg...I'm falling...

speaker: Ike
text: Is everyone all right?

speaker: Soren
text: I'll check on injuries.

speaker: Titania
text: Those crows make fierce opponents.

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir, how's the ship?

speaker: Nasir
text: Completely immobilized. We can't shake free of this reef.

speaker: Ike
text: I feel useless just waiting around here. There has to be something I can do to help.

speaker: Mist
text: Hey! Ike! Where are you going? Should you be leaving the ship!?

speaker: Ike
text: Nothing's getting done sitting around here. I just want to go ashore and see what I can see.

speaker: Nasir
text: What? Hold on, Ike! You can't...That's--

speaker: Mist
text: Ah! Ike! Behind you!

speaker: Red Dragon Laguz
text: You there! What are you doing?

speaker: Ike
text: Huh?

speaker: Nasir
text: This could be trouble...

speaker: Red Dragon Laguz
text: This is Goldoan territory. Outsiders are not permitted.

speaker: Ike
text: No, wait, you don't understand! Our ship has run aground. There's nothing we can do! We're stuck here!

speaker: Red Dragon
text: Then return to your ship. What happens to beorc is none of our affair.

speaker: Ike
text: That's ridiculous! You're a complete--

speaker: Red Dragon Laguz
text: You have been warned. You will not be warned a second time. Hey!

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Cease this at once! What do you think you're doing?

speaker: Red Dragon Laguz
text: My...My lord prince.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Man of the beorc. My countrymen were discourteous. I ask that you forgive them.

speaker: Ike
text: Who are you? I am Kurthnaga, prince of Goldoa.

speaker: Ike
text: The prince? Now we're getting somewhere. Thanks to some Kilvas pirates, our ship's run aground. Can you lend us any help?

speaker: Ike
text: What is it? You can't help us, can you?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: I am not used to being addressed in such a direct manner. I was...taken off guard. My apologies.

speaker: Ike
text: No, I didn't--If anyone should apologize here, it's me. My father had a great deal to say about my lack of etiquette. I'm sorry. I didn't mean to offend you.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Please, pay it no mind. I am more concerned with the misfortune your journey has met.Of late, the ravens have grown ever more barbarous, and this cannot stand. My father will lodge a formal protest with Kilvas, I assure you. In the meantime, we shall help you with your ship. Gareth, direct the others to push their ship free.

speaker: Gareth
text: At once!

speaker: Mist
text: Dragons! They're all dragons! They're huge! And so strong! It's incredible!

speaker: Elincia
text: It's overwhelming...

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah...it is.

speaker: Titania
text: Goldoa is the land of the dragons. More than any other laguz tribe, they are known for their longevity. I've heard tales of Goldoans still living who flew the skies when the goddess herself still walked the land.

speaker: Ike
text: How is it you know so much about Goldoa?

speaker: Titania
text: Everything I've learned comes from books. Goldoa itself no longer has any contact with the outside world. Seeing them now, it's like a dream...

speaker: Ike
text: So this is good fortune, is that what you're saying?

speaker: Mist
text: She's saying we got lucky! For once, your recklessness actually got us] OUT of trouble!

speaker: Ike
text: What's that supposed to mean?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: We have moved your ship safely and without harm to you or your vessel.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: My subjects tell me your ship was indeed lodged against a reef. However, there was no structural damage to your ship. You need not interrupt your journey.

speaker: Ike
text: That's good news. Thank you.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Is there anything else you require? If you need food or fresh water, we can replenish your supplies.

speaker: Ike
text: That would be most appreciated. We are beginning to run low on water. As for food, anyfruit, meat, fish...anything fresh would be wonderful

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: It shall be done. Gareth, will you see to it?

speaker: Gareth
text: Yes, at once.

speaker: Ike
text: I know that Goldoa does not engage in trade with other nations, but will you accept gold in payment?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Do not worry about payment.

speaker: Ike
text: But you've done so much for us when you could have left us to die out there. We must repay you somehow.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Sweet courtesy is ever the herald of hospitality. Will this suffice to explain my actions?

speaker: Ike
text: Hospitality? Isn't that for guests?

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: As you know, Goldoa prefers isolation. We rarely see foreigners, especially beorc, and even more rarely do we treat with them. Chance has brought us together, and I am grateful for this opportunity. In fact, I wish we could feast a while and converse. However, my father would never allow it.

speaker: Ike
text: You can't expect us to accept so generous a gift--

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: But I do. I insist that you consider it a personal gift from Goldoa's prince. However, I have made you uncomfortable, so if you feel you must decline...

speaker: Ike
text: No, of course not. We will be happy to accept your gift. We appreciate it.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: I'm so pleased you understand.

speaker: Titania
text: Ike! Captain Nasir wants to depart as soon as possible.

speaker: Ike
text: Understood.

speaker: Ike
text: Well then, I beg your leave. Prince Kurthnaga, I won't forget your kindness. Thank you!

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: It was my pleasure. Take care.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: Farewell, beorc! May your journey be safe!

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike, is something amiss?

speaker: Ike
text: First, those ravens attack us, and then a band of Goldoan dragons rescues us. I can't understand how they are all considered laguz. Is that strange?

speaker: Elincia
text: No, I see what you're saying...Just as there are both good and evil beorc, there must be good and evil laguz as well. But they are so distinct in appearance...It is tempting to assume each race is, as a whole, intrinsically good or evil.

speaker: Ike
text: Aye, that it is. The beast tribes of Gallia and the dragons of Goldoa seem sohonorable...and the birds of Kilvas and Phoenicis seem so cruel. It seems so easy to reduce them all to good or evil.

speaker: Elincia
text: I'm sure it can't be as simple as that...

speaker: Ike
text: Look at us beorc: Daeins are evil, and Crimeans are not. It's as simple as that.Well, wait...There were those prejudiced fools we met in port. They weren't all that honorable. Maybe you're right.

speaker: Nasir
text: Much of what seems good and evil is simply a matter of perspective, Ike. Many conditions affect our judgment. Drawing a definitive line is nigh impossible.

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir! Where have you been? You vanished without a trace.

speaker: Nasir
text: I am uncomfortable around dragons. I thought it would be better if I stayed below in my cabin. My apologies.

speaker: Ike
text: Now that you mention it, Soren seems to have disappeared as well. Have you seen him?

speaker: Nasir
text: Perhaps he's feeling nauseated. For one unaccustomed to sea travel, it's not uncommon.

speaker: Ike
text: Right...I think I'll check up on him later.

speaker: Nasir
text: The wind is picking up. I believe I will go and check on the condition of our sails. Keep yourselves warm up here. It's a chill wind that blows in these waters.

speaker: Ike
text: Princess Elincia, you should be returning to your cabin.

speaker: Elincia
text: What about you, my lord Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: I'll stay on deck a while longer. I have a lot to think about.

speaker: Elincia
text: Would you mind if I stayed here with you? I won't be any bother.

speaker: Ike
text: Hm? It's all right with me...

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh, thank you.

speaker: Unknown
text: Ah, Ike! Grab that boy!

speaker: Ike
text: What's going on?

speaker: Sothe
text: Mm!

speaker: Nasir
text: No more running for you.

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir, who is this?

speaker: Ike
text: A stowaway. I gather he boarded the ship at Toha.

speaker: Ike
text: What are you doing here? Why did you sneak aboard the ship?

speaker: Ike
text: You won't talk? In that case...

speaker: Sothe
text: Hm? Ow...oouuuch!

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike, there's no need to be so rough!

speaker: Ike
text: I'm not going to waste my time playing games with this urchin. You want me to let you go? Open your mouth and start talking.

speaker: Sothe
text: Owowow! Quit it! I'll talk!!

speaker: Sothe
text: ...That hurt! I thought you were gonna break my face...

speaker: Ike
text: Well? What's your name? What are you doing here?

speaker: Sothe
text: I'm...Sothe. I'm...I'm a thief, but...I didn't come onboard this ship to steal anything.

speaker: Sothe
text: Stop scowling at me like that! You're making me uncomfortable.

speaker: Nasir
text: It's not just you. Ike always looks like that. Don't mind him; just keep talking.

speaker: Sothe
text: I'm...looking for someone. I heard this ship was sailing for Begnion, so I decided to climb aboard.

speaker: Nasir
text: This person you're after is in Begnion?

speaker: Sothe
text: I don't know. The trail went cold in Toha, and...I couldn't think of anywhere else to go from there.

speaker: Ike
text: Is it family?

speaker: Sothe
text: Huh?

speaker: Ike
text: The person you're looking for.

speaker: Sothe
