text: Yeah. I mean, we're not related by blood or anything, but...we're definitely family.

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir, my mercenary company will look after this boy. He won't be a burden to you or your crew.

speaker: Nasir
text: If that's what you want to do, it's fine with me.

speaker: Sothe
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Ike
text: You're going to be put to work. I hope you're prepared.

speaker: Sothe
text: Sure, no problem! I'll..I'll do whatever you need!

speaker: Ike
text: I wish we could help you, but we have our own troubles to deal with.

speaker: Nasir
text: I see your point...This is a very difficult time for all of you.

speaker: Nasir
text: I see no other option. I'll take you on as a junior member of my crew.

speaker: Sothe
text: Really?

speaker: Nasir
text: It's either that or I toss you overboard, and I suspect you'd prefer I didn't.

speaker: Sothe
text: Thank you! I'll repay you somehow! I swear it!

speaker: Nasir
text: Don't worry about the boy, Ike. We'll take care of him.

speaker: Ike
text: It's your ship. You can do as you please.

speaker: Nasir
text: Well then, it's settled. Sothe, was it? Come, and I'll introduce you to the rest of my crew.

speaker: Sothe
text: Sure!

speaker: Ike
text: You're a lucky boy.

speaker: Sothe
text: I'm just happy I don't have to hide anymore!

speaker: Ike
text: ...Volke?

speaker: Ike
text: Right here.

speaker: Ike
text: Gah! Where've you been? You disappeared the moment we got on this ship!

speaker: Volke
text: Don't worry about it. I'll be there when you need me.

speaker: Ike
text: It's not me; it's my sister. You've never once shown up for a meal, and she thinks you're dying of hunger.

speaker: Volke
text: Did we ever eat together while we were on land?

speaker: Ike
text: All right, listen. Land? Big. Ship? Small. It's not the same thing! I don't want Mist roaming the ship with a plate of food anymore. So please, eat one meal a day with us.

speaker: Volke
text: One hundred gold.

speaker: Ike
text: You're going to charge me? To make you eat? And that's more than you charge to pick a lock! Why?

speaker: Volke
text: I don't like large groups. Bye. Call me if you decide it's worth it.

speaker: Ike
text: Maybe I should just tell Mist he's dead...

speaker: Ike
text: Do you have a minute?

speaker: Zihark
text: Of course, Commander Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: You and I haven't had very many opportunities to talk, and I--

speaker: Zihark
text: You don't think you can trust me?

speaker: Ike
text: No, it's not that. I'm just curious--I was surprised to see anyone in Toha who chose to fight on the side of the laguz.

speaker: Zihark
text: I joined the Toha vigilantes solely for the purpose of saving laguz. I'm not from Crimea, but when I heard she had joined with Gallia, I envisioned my perfect world, one in which the laguz could live normal lives, free of oppression. However, when I came to Crimea, I found things were no different there than in any other beorc nation.

speaker: Ike
text: It was the same for me. I couldn't allow myself to ignore these problems any longer.

speaker: Zihark
text: I'm happy to hear it. Of all the beorc I've ever met, you're the only one who shares my conviction.

speaker: Ike
text: Zihark, is there...some other reason you defend the laguz?

speaker: Zihark
text: I don't follow you.

speaker: Ike
text: You see, I was born in Gallia, or so I've been told. I just wondered if you had a similar reason guiding you.

speaker: Zihark
text: ...Of course I have my reasons. Would you be upset if I didn't want to discuss them? My reasons are...extremely personal.

speaker: Ike
text: No, it's no problem. I wanted a better understanding of what kind of man you are, and I have that now.

speaker: Zihark
text: Can I ask what that is?

speaker: Ike
text: You are a good man. I'm glad to have you along.

speaker: Zihark
text: I'm glad to be here. I feel I'm finally able to do the kind of good I've longed to do for years.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Ooo...

speaker: Ike
text: You don't look so well. Are you all right?

speaker: Ilyana
text: I'm...seasick...When I was traveling with the merchants, we sometimes used...ships...Every time was the same... Urp...I'm...sorry.

speaker: Ike
text: Did you travel with Muston and the others for a long time?

speaker: Ilyana
text: About four years, all told. I had just left home, you see...I was all alone, and I couldn't find work. In my hometown, I had so many people I could depend on...but once I left, everything changed. If Muston's group hadn't found me by the side of the road, I'd probably be dead by now.

speaker: Ike
text: Hm...You seem to have led quite an adventurous life. It's a bit surprising.

speaker: Ilyana
text: I get that a lot.

speaker: Ike
text: I find it hard to imagine that you couldn't find work, though. Your magic skills are amazing.

speaker: Ilyana
text: Aren't they, though? Hee hee! I'm always happy when people notice...Whew...Wow! I feel so much better now. I'm actually starting to get hungry.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm glad to hear it. Just stay above deck, and when you start to feel sick, look off at the horizon, all right?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Ah, well met. From the looks of things, the battle ended in our favor.

speaker: Ike
text: We claimed victory. Yet Daein had more troops than we expected, and it was a hard-fought battle.

speaker: Tibarn
text: I don't have the best news to report, either.

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Tibarn
text: As the day ended, we withdrew as planned. But as we were leaving, reinforcements began flooding in from the capital.

speaker: Ike
text: Mmm... That's a piece of ill news.

speaker: Tibarn
text: The men that were originally guarding the castle were nothing special, but...There was one who appeared midbattle and crushed an entire unit by himself. He was so much stronger than the others, it was as if a wolf had appeared in a kennel of blind, newborn pups.

speaker: Ike
text: What did he look like?

speaker: Tibarn
text: He was covered from toe to tip in black armor. That made it difficult to judge his size, but I think he was bigger than me. If my intuition's right, he is the villian you've all been talking about.

speaker: Ike
text: The Black Knight... He's in that castle!

speaker: Bastian
text: General Ike! Please come with me. We're getting ready to have a war council and discuss tomorrow's battle.

speaker: Titania
text: So the Black Knight's in that castle, is he?

speaker: Ike
text: There's little doubt of it.

speaker: Ranulf
text: That beorc's a real handful. Even when I attacked him in cat form, I barely scratched him!

speaker: Ike
text: It's his armor. It's apparently blessed by the goddess. Ordinary weapons, natural or no, can't damage it.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Oh, that's just swell. So how are we supposed to defeat him? Angry looks?

speaker: Ike
text: Leave that to me. I've got a sword that should be effective against him...

speaker: Tibarn
text: I don't like it, but I suppose there's no choice. We don't use weapons or shields. Those are beorc tools for beorc alone.

speaker: Bastian
text: Very well, if the villain in question appears, we'll leave him to General Ike. Now then, shall we determine who among us storms the castle?

speaker: Mist
text: Ike... Can I talk to you?

speaker: Ike
text: Not right now, Mist. We're discussing battle strategy.

speaker: Mist
text: I know that. Even so... Please? It'll only take a moment.

speaker: Ike
text: Mist... I promise I'll make time later. Be patient and wait quietly.

speaker: Bastian
text: What is it, O beauteous one?

speaker: Elincia
text: I feel...a bit dizzy. May I rest a moment?

speaker: Bastian
text: Oh, what foul deed is this that rears its head? The gods of war do charge a heavy toll. Bewitch us, and attack our very minds! The princess, she is faint and o'er tired. Forgive your humble servant this trespass.

speaker: Bastian
text: Hark, my dear, and bless me with your arm. Good folk, we shall retire for a spell.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Of course. Princess, please rest and allow us to proceed with these preparations.

speaker: Elincia
text: Th-thank you. I'm sorry.

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Ike
text: Come on, Mist. You realize the princess was making time for you to talk with me, don't you?

speaker: Mist
text: ...Well, um... I thought I could talk to you later, but then I changed my mind and wanted to talk to you now.

speaker: Ike
text: I've been hoping to talk to you, too. I haven't heard very much from you since the other day.

speaker: Mist
text: Yeah... I'm sorry. When you told us that story...I was so shocked...That's why.

speaker: Ike
text: The part about Mother's death...and about Father, right?

speaker: Mist
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Ike
text: That's only natural. So, you have come to some kind of understanding with it all? Is that it?

speaker: Mist
text: At first, I couldn't believe it. The stuff about the medallion and the revival of the dark god and all of that? None of it... None of it sounded real. And everything about Father...That was even more unbelievable.

speaker: Mist
text: It was all I could think about. But...But I didn't want to think about it anymore. It made my head hurt. I didn't know what to do. I couldn't even sleep. I would just lie awake at night and stare at the tent walls.

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, I was the same way.

speaker: Mist
text: I guess my body finally reached its limit. Last night, I fell asleep. And when I woke up this morning...I don't know. It was all gone. I only had one emotion left.

speaker: Ike
text: One emotion? What was it?

speaker: Mist
text: It's hard to say... Sympathy, I suppose.

speaker: Ike
text: For Mother?

speaker: Mist
text: Uh-huh. And for Father. I think more for him than anyone else... Father and Mother were in love, weren't they? And then the medallion, it made Father go...what did you say? Berserk?

speaker: Mist
text: When he returned to himself, he found Mother...When, when Father died, it hurt so much...I thought I was going to die. Father must have felt the same. No, he must have felt even worse.

speaker: Ike
text: I think you're right. And Father kept it all to himself, too. Mother, the medallion, being hunted...He never said a word to us. It was his burden alone.

speaker: Mist
text: The man who killed Father was that knight we saw in Port Toha. Right? The one in the black armor?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes.

speaker: Mist
text: You're going to fight him, aren't you. For Father.

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, I am. That's one thing I won't let anyone else do in my stead.

speaker: Mist
text: Trying to stop you is pointless. I know. If I were stronger, if I were a swordfighter, I'd be doing the same thing.

speaker: Ike
text: Mist...

speaker: Mist
text: But...you must keep your promise. You promised to lead the company in Father's place, and to protect me. If you go and get yourself killed, I'll never forgive you.

speaker: Ike
text: I understand. That's why I'm not going to lose!

speaker: Mist
text: ...I know!

speaker: Bastian
text: How are you feeling, Princess?

speaker: Elincia
text: Um... It was a lie. I'm not feeling unwell at all. I'm sorry I fooled you.

speaker: Bastian
text: Ah, I knew it all along. It was all for Ike and Mist, was it not? It would appear, my dear Princess, that you care for them greatly.

speaker: Elincia
text: I witnessed the death of both my father and mother...Soldiers fell one after the other...And then I...I was separated from Geoffrey...It was Ike and his friends who rescued me. If not for them, I...I'm sure I would be dead now. My lord Ike and Mist, too, know the pain that I carry with me. The pain of losing one's parents in war. That may account for why the two of them, right from the beginning, were so warm and friendly. They gave me the support I needed to survive. Mist and I have continuously encouraged each other to go on. So...

speaker: Bastian
text: They rescued you and are your patrons. There are those among the soldiers who complain in jealousy of Ike's station, but...It is a trivial matter. We, the retainers of House Crimea, find this general very much to our liking.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Ah, Bastian. I'm pleased to hear it.

speaker: Bastian
text: Enough plain speaking! I must ready my silver tongue anew! Shall we return to the council?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes.

speaker: Hafedd
text: Sir Knight. The Crimean army will renew their assault of the castle momentarily. The troops we face are not the half-breeds we fought yesterday. It is the army that bested General Bertram. They are not what one would call an easy opponent.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Hmph. Resolve it.

speaker: Hafedd
text: I beg your pardon?

speaker: Black Knight
text: Hafedd, you are in command. The castle defenses are on your shoulders. I have business with General Ena.

speaker: Hafedd
text: Understood.

speaker: Ike
text: Is everyone ready? The castle's strength has been bolstered with reinforcements from the capital. We must strike now, before any more can arrive. If the Black Knight appears, don't try to engage him. He is mine. I will take care of him!

speaker: Hafedd
text: If not for a whim of His Majesty, I would not be facing you here. For a warrior, meeting a powerful foe is a joy above all others... And for this I give thanks to the king! Now, let us enjoy the gift we have been given.

speaker: Hafedd
text: It appears...this is the end...Gwaaa... Hurrrkkk... Aaahhhh...

speaker: Ike
text: The one I seek is behind these doors. Don't follow me. I'm going in alone.

speaker: Soren
text: Ike! Wait! I'm going with--

speaker: Titania
text: No, Soren. We have to let Ike go alone. The Black Knight is his. Defeating him is a crucial step that Ike must take in order to truly get over the death of his father.

speaker: Soren
text: Idiocy! I'll hear no more of this naive nonsense! What if something happens to him? What then?

speaker: Titania
text: I think Ike has gained the composure to keep calm and judge whether or not he can match an opponent. If, in fact, he can't...it means he's reached his full potential, and that's all there is to him. We just have to accept that. But I believe in Ike. I trust him. His life is not his alone any longer. I don't believe he's so irresponsible as to leave his companions behind by choosing to engage in a contest he cannot win. Please, Soren, you must feel the same way. Don't you?

speaker: Soren
text: ...I don't like it. Sometimes, bravery and good judgment aren't enough.

speaker: Titania
text: Commander Greil... Watch over your son.

speaker: Titania
text: Commander, can I speak to you for a moment?

speaker: Ike
text: What is it, Titania?

speaker: Titania
text: I have...something important to ask of you.

speaker: Ike
text: All right, what is it?

speaker: Titania
text: I want you to tell me...about the night Commander Greil was killed. I understand that it's difficult for you. However, I need to know. I have to. Just tell it once... It's all I ask. If you can't, I... His death will be something I'll never be able to face.

speaker: Ike
text: I feel I've done you a terrible disservice by not telling you earlier. It's just that... There was a lot I had to get clear in my own mind. I know I've kept you waiting.

speaker: Titania
text: So you'll tell me?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes. I think I've finally come to a point where I can face it.

speaker: Titania
text: All right. Whenever you're ready.

speaker: Ike
text: That night... I've already told you everything up to where I was on my way into the forest, right? At the head of the path, Father had told me to go back to the fort--but I had a bad feeling and followed him anyway. When I entered the clearing, he and the Black Knight were already fighting. They seemed to be evenly matched at first. Then they exchanged a few more blows, and suddenly Father was sent flying. They spoke to each other for a moment, but...I was so far away, I couldn't hear what they said. Then the Black Knight threw a sword at Father's feet. I think he wanted Father to pick it up and use it.

speaker: Ike
text: But Father didn't touch the sword. He just readied his axe again and charged.......It was over in an instant. I...I couldn't believe my own eyes. They...they looked like they were embracing...Just... Standing there. Frozen. But, I saw the Black Knight's blade...It was protruding from Father's back, and shining in the moonlight.

speaker: Titania
text: Oh, Greil...

speaker: Ike
text: When the knight pulled his sword out, Father sagged and fell backwards... I ran and tried to catch him, but I couldn't hold him, and we both fell to the ground. The wound Father had taken was terrible, but at that point, he was still alive.

speaker: Ike
text: The Black Knight approached and said, Give it to me. I had no idea what he was talking about. I do now, though. He had been sent by King Ashnard to retrieve the medallion. Father told him he'd thrown the medallion away, but the knight didn't believe him. Then he tried to get Father to talk by threatening to kill me...and Mist. I was so angry, I leapt up and attacked him, but it was useless. I didn't give up, though. I didn't care what happened to me, and I attacked again.

speaker: Titania
text: Of all the stubbornness...

speaker: Ike
text: If King Gallia hadn't been nearby, I probably would have died that night, too.

speaker: Ike
text: After the Black Knight vanished, I simply...All I could think was that I didn't want Father to die. He... He was still alive. I thought if I could just get him back to the fort, we could save him. I clung to that...false hope...and started walking toward the light of the fort... I just kept walking...

speaker: Titania
text: ...Thank you, Ike. It must have been so hard for you.

speaker: Ike
text: Titania...

speaker: Titania
text: Commander Greil died on your back. His last moments must have been...much happier than I had imagined......Thank you... Now I can finally...move past my grief...

speaker: Ike
text: ...Titania.

speaker: Titania
text: Yes?

speaker: Ike
text: I, um... There's something else I haven't told you about.

speaker: Ike
text: I...met him... I met the Black Knight again.

speaker: Titania
text: What?

speaker: Ike
text: We fought.

speaker: Titania
text: You did well to keep your life.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm not the same boy I was on that night. I've grown a lot. I've worked hard. Yet, even so, I wasn't able to defeat him.

speaker: Titania
text: There's nothing you can do about that. Not even Commander Greil could defeat him. You're not ready to--

speaker: Ike
text: It's not that. It's not that my blade work wasn't good enough.

speaker: Titania
text: Then, what do you mean?

speaker: Ike
text: Titania, it's his armor. It's impervious to damage.

speaker: Titania
text: What? That's not possible. Even the strongest--

speaker: Ike
text: He said his armor had been blessed by the goddess. He said only weapons that were also blessed could hurt him.

speaker: Titania
text: Where are we supposed to get something like that?

speaker: Ike
text: I have one here.

speaker: Titania
text: Ah! Ike! That sword... Where...

speaker: Ike
text: The night after Father died, I went back to that clearing by myself. I'd hoped to...I'd hoped to find some clues that might help me hunt down the knight. The sword was still there. I brought it back with me, and I've been hiding it ever since. I wasn't thinking about using it. I believed that if I just carried the sword with me, I'd meet the Black Knight again.  And it worked.

speaker: Titania
text: So this sword will work against him?

speaker: Ike
text: It's supposed to. It was made to contest Alondite, which is the sword wielded by the Black Knight.

speaker: Titania
text: Do you think you have a chance?

speaker: Ike
text: ...I'll win.

speaker: Titania
text: All right. I won't stop you. Use that sword to avenge Commander Greil. But listen, Ike... You must promise me one thing.

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Titania
text: When you meet him, you'll exchange blows. If, at that moment, you don't feel you stand a chance...you must flee. There are times when running away is not the same as losing.

speaker: Ike
text: Don't you believe in me, Titania?

speaker: Titania
text: Of course I do. One day, you will defeat the Black Knight. I'm sure of it. That's why I don't want you to lose your life on the first go-around. When the time comes, I promise not to interfere. And I won't let anyone else interfere, either. I want you to face him, one-on-one. And I want you to be calm and use your own best judgement. At times, withdrawing can be the key that unlocks a future victory. Don't forget that.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Understood.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Why did you return to Crimea? You had the perfect opportunity to escape.

speaker: Ena
text: ...I'm going to the capital.

speaker: Black Knight
text: No. You are not. The king has ordered me to put an end to you.

speaker: Ena
text: I thought as much... So be it. I am prepared.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Will you not resist?

speaker: Ena
text: I do not believe I could prevail against one of your power.

speaker: Black Knight
text: How extremely frank.

speaker: Ena
text: My only wish was to be beside the one I love. If that is not to be, then it matters not what happens to me.

speaker: Black Knight
text: As my last act of compassion, I shall make your end a swift and merciful one. Do you have any final words?

speaker: Ena
text: ...If you see Nasir, tell him that Ena was sorry.

speaker: Black Knight
text: If I have the opportunity, I will so tell him. Rest in peace.

speaker: Ena
text: ...My...love...

speaker: Ike
text: Turn and face me, Black Knight!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Hmph. I've been waiting for you, child.

speaker: Ike
text: Ah! Did you kill that girl?

speaker: Black Knight
text: Despite my promise, the blow was not clean. She breathes still.

speaker: Ike
text: I'll take her.

speaker: Black Knight
text: You'll have to do so by force. You brought the sacred sword Ragnell, did you not?

speaker: Ike
text: It's right here. If using it is the only condition I need fulfill to defeat you, I will not hesitate!

speaker: Black Knight
text: It appears you've grown smarter. Good. There is no challenge in killing a fool. Shall we begin?

speaker: Mist
text: Brother!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist? No! Stay back!

speaker: Mist
text: I... I will fight you! I'll never let you kill my brother!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist, you--

speaker: Black Knight
text: Gawain's daughter, eh? Good. Now I can pull out the entire family tree by the root.

speaker: Ike
text: You're not to interfere, Mist! This craven wretch is mine!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Hmph! Do as you will. This time, we begin in earnest!

speaker: Black Knight
text: What an odd fate. This will be the third time I have defeated you. The first was in the forest of Gallia. The second at Delbray in Crimea.

speaker: Ike
text: We've met twice, and I've lost twice. But the third time will be different.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Oh?

speaker: Ike
text: My sword-fighting skills were given to me by my father. If I stay true to them, I cannot lose.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Did you never think that using your father's techniques on the man who killed him would be futile?

speaker: Ike
text: My father robbed himself of using his stronger arm. If he had, he would not have lost to the likes of you.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Hah... You think so? Let us test your stronger arm then. Come, son of Gawain...Show me your strength.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Protect the Black Knight!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Do not interfere! This man is my prey! I need no assistance.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Oh! Then...uh... Hey, get that girl! Kill her before she flees!

speaker: Ike
text: Get out of here, Mist!

speaker: Mist
text: No!! I'm not leaving you! I can protect myself. I won't run away!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Will you flee? How appropriate. Tuck tail and run, child of Gawain! It is what dogs do best, after all. I like how you tremble with fear at the realization that you are no match for me. It suits you.

speaker: Ike
text: Foul villain! I do not flee. I will never turn my back on you and run away!

speaker: Black Knight
text: You've grown stronger...I...commend you...

speaker: Ike
text: Haaaah... Haaaaa...

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Th-the Black Knight's fallen! How can this be? D-don't... Don't think you're going to walk out of here, though! Now! Activate the traps now!

speaker: Ike
text: What's going on? This rumbling...

speaker: Ena
text: ...Nasir?

speaker: Nasir
text: Ena!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist, we have to go!

speaker: Mist
text: A-all right...

speaker: Ike
text: Hurry!

speaker: Ike
text: ...Father......I...finally...I stopped him...Father...

speaker: Mist
text: B-Brother! Thank goodness...I'm so happy you're alive!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist... I avenged Father.

speaker: Mist
text: I know.

speaker: Ike
text: Even now, though, I'm not as good as Father was. There's no way I could ever defeat him...Defeating the Black Knight was my way...I wanted to show him how strong Father really was.

speaker: Mist
text: I know, Ike. I know.

speaker: Ike
text: Our Father was the best in the world...A great man.

speaker: Mist
text: That's right! Dad was great...and so was Mom...And so are you, Brother. I love you all! I'm so proud of my fantastic, wonderful family!

speaker: Titania
text: Ike! Mist! Both of you...You did so well...

speaker: Ike
text: I really had you worried, didn't I? But now it's--

speaker: Titania
text: Don't say anything. I understand.

speaker: Ike
text: Let's get back to the others...I can't do anything else today.

speaker: Mist
text: Right!

speaker: Ike
text: How's she doing?

speaker: Titania
text: She's going to be all right. She's sleeping in the back.

speaker: Ike
text: And Nasir?

speaker: Titania
text: He's there with her. He's been taking care of her the entire time.

speaker: Ike
text: I see.

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir.

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike. I am sorry for escaping and...causing all the problems I did. When we arrived in Crimea, I sensed Ena...I had to go and look for her.

speaker: Ike
text: Is that so?

speaker: Nasir
text: You...you saved her, didn't you? I don't know how to thank you.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm not worried about it. I just want you to talk to me. What's the connection between you and Ena?

speaker: Nasir
text: Ena...is my only granddaughter.

speaker: Ike
text: Your granddaughter? That can't be.You're not old enough to...

speaker: Nasir
text: It may be difficult for you beorc to believe, but...We of the dragon tribe live for a very, very long time. When we reach a certain maturity, we stop showing almost all signs of further aging. For example, do you remember Prince Kurthnaga whom you met in Goldoa?

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, he was a nice kid.

speaker: Nasir
text: The prince is the youngest in all of Goldoa, yet for all his apparent youth, he's at least a hundred years old.

speaker: Ike
text: A hundred...

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike...

speaker: Ike
text: Yes?

speaker: Nasir
text: Why did you save Ena? She was your foe, after all...

speaker: Ike
text: You were willing to put yourself in danger so she could escape. I assumed she must be dear to you.

speaker: Nasir
text: You did that for a dirty traitor? Under the guise of providing information to Gallia, I gave the same information to Daein. I also took Mist's medallion and gave it to King Ashnard... And even so, you...

speaker: Ike
text: You helped us many times over. If there are reasons for all this, would you tell me about them? I'd like to help.

speaker: Nasir
text: I cannot. At least not yet...

speaker: Ike
text: That's not the answer I wanted, Nasir.

speaker: Nasir
text: Please. I want you to believe me. I am not your enemy. King Daein had Ena with him. For her sake, there was nothing else I could do. Forgive me.

speaker: Ike
text: Tell me, are you willing to display your loyalty?

speaker: Nasir
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Ike
text: Ashnard is in the Crimean capital. If we hope to defeat him, it would help to have the cooperation of one who's been close to him. If you're not our enemy, then prove it by aiding us.

speaker: Nasir
text: All right, I understand. On the strength of your belief in me, I swear I will not betray you again.

speaker: Ike
text: There's one other thing I need to hear. How much do you know about the medallion? Did you realize what it was when you gave it to Ashnard?

speaker: Nasir
text: I'm fairly sure that I know more about it than you do. I can't go into details, but... Merely gaining possession of the idol does not allow King Daein to release the dark god. The reason for that is--

speaker: Ike
text: The only one who can sing the galdr of release is a girl named Altina. Right?

speaker: Nasir
text: That's correct. I, too, investigated Palmeni Temple.

speaker: Ike
text: Yet King Daein doesn't know that, and he's kidnapped Leanne. Based on what happened in the past, who knows what he may do...

speaker: Nasir
text: Earlier, I was able to speak briefly with Ena. It sounded like she knew where the heron princess is being held. When she awakes, we shall ask her about it.

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: Is that you, Nasir? What are you doing here?

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike, I'll take over from here. Hurry and leave this place.

speaker: Ike
text: You know I can't do that. Besides, the Black Knight can't be defeated--not without this blade.

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike, I cannot allow you to die here. Please...take care of the girl, Ena.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Nasir...I didn't expect to see you here. What a fool.

speaker: Ena
text: ...Aahh......Ah! Nasir!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Uargh... Yet, that's not nearly enough...

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike! The castle's collapsing!! Get out now!

speaker: Black Knight
text: What's this? It can't be...this entire castle...I...Ungh! I-I can't move! This c-can't be...happening...

speaker: Nasir
text: ...Ike. Now's your chance...Take...Ena. Take care of Ena!

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir!

speaker: Ena
text: Nasir...

speaker: Titania
text: Ike! Mist! Both of you...You did so well...

speaker: Ike
text: I really had you worried, didn't I? But now it's--

speaker: Titania
text: Don't say anything. I understand.

speaker: Ike
text: Let's get back to the others...I can't do anything else today.

speaker: Mist
text: Right!

speaker: Titania
text: Ike. She's awake.

speaker: Ike
text: Good.

speaker: Ike
text: How are you feeling?

speaker: Ena
text: Where am I?

speaker: Ike
text: In our camp.

speaker: Ena
text: ...You saved me, didn't you? Why?

speaker: Ike
text: Because Nasir asked me to.

speaker: Ena
text: What? Where is he? I...I must speak to him!

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir is dead...

speaker: Ena
text: What?

speaker: Ike
text: He protected me and engaged the Black Knight. The castle fell around them both...

speaker: Ena
text: Is that...so...So, it wasn't a dream......

speaker: Ike
text: Just who...who were you to him? Why were you serving King Daein?

speaker: Ena
text: I am Ena... He... Nasir was my grandfather.

speaker: Ike
text: You're Nasir's granddaughter?

speaker: Ena
text: It seems impossible for beorc to believe it, but we of the dragon tribe live for thousands of years. Once we reach a certain maturity, we show no further outward signs of aging.

speaker: Ike
text: A thousand years... I can't begin to imagine.

speaker: Ena
text: And...um...about Nasir...You must be aware that he betrayed you. And yet you saved me. I, who had once been your enemy. Why?

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir helped us time and time again. No matter what, I couldn't see him as a true enemy. If there are reasons for all this, would you tell me about them? I'd like to help. In Nasir's stead.

speaker: Ena
text: I...I can't tell you now.

speaker: Ike
text: That's not the answer I was hoping for.

speaker: Ena
text: However, in payment of my debt to you, I can provide information. I will tell you where the heron princess is being held.

speaker: Ike
text: Ah. That's a good start.

speaker: Mist
text: Are you all right?

speaker: Ike
text: Nn... Yeah, I’ll be fine.

speaker: Greil
text: So, the sleeping prince awakens!

speaker: Mist
text: Father! can’t believe you! I know those are practice swords, but they’re still heavy! You have no right to be so rough on Ike.

speaker: Greil
text: If this is too much for the boy, he’ll never make it as a mercenary.

speaker: Mist
text: But–

speaker: Ike
text: You don’t have to worry. I told you, I’m fine.

speaker: Greil
text: Ha! You’d better be. Now grab your sword and get ready!

speaker: Mist
text: What? Don’t tell me you’re going at it again! But–

speaker: Ike
text: Just until I land a single blow. I’m not giving up until I can get one good hit in on Father.

speaker: Greil
text: I like your resolve, Ike. But it takes more than a strong will to... Hm?

speaker: Boyd
text: Aha! I knew I’d find you here!

speaker: Mist
text: Hi, Boyd. What brings you here?

speaker: Boyd
text: Nothing special. You said you were going to get the boss, but you never came back. I got picked to check up on you.

speaker: Mist
text: Oh! Sorry, I got caught up with Ike and my father.

speaker: Boyd
text: It’s nothing. Besides, I figured I’d get a good laugh watching Ike get worked over by the boss. You...look fine.What happened?

speaker: Ike
text: Nothing at all. I’m sorry to disappoint you.

speaker: Mist
text: You just missed it. Just a minute ago, he was out cold.

speaker: Ike
text: Mist!

speaker: Mist
text: Ha ha! Sorry.

speaker: Greil
text: You came at just the right time, Boyd. You can be Ike’s sparring partner.

speaker: Boyd
text: What? Me?

speaker: Greil
text: I’m beginning to think it would be better if he sparred with someone closer to his own skill.

speaker: Ike
text: ...I understand.

speaker: Ike
text: Thanks for your help, Boyd.

speaker: Boyd
text: Hmph! I don’t know about this to his skill business, but I’m ready!

speaker: Boyd
text: All right. I’m ready for you! Let’s go!

speaker: Mist
text: Not that way, Ike!

speaker: Mist
text: Did you hear me? Not that way!

speaker: Mist
text: Hey! Are you even listening to me?

speaker: Mist
text: You can do it! Boyd’s got nothing! Take him out!

speaker: Boyd
text: Nothing!? I don’t have nothing. I mean, I have– I mean...

speaker: Boyd
text: Hey! What’s the holdup? Let’s get started already.

speaker: Ike
text: I’m coming. Wait right there!

speaker: Boyd
text: Hurry up, will you? Or are you afraid of me?

speaker: Boyd
text: Come on! What are you doing? Are you sure you really want to learn how to fight?

speaker: Boyd
text: Yaaaawn... You know, I’m getting sleepy.

speaker: Boyd
text: Ha ha! I’m not done yet. We’re just getting started.

speaker: Boyd
text: Whoa! Come on! What’s that all about? You’re wasting our time!

speaker: Mist
text: Ah!

speaker: Mist
text: I can’t believe this! If you throw your weapon away,how do you expect to fight? Let me help... Here you go, Ike. Here’s your sword.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh...thanks.

speaker: Mist
text: Try to be a little more careful!

speaker: Boyd
text: That–that wasn’t too bad.

speaker: Mist
text: Boyd, you’re such a loser.

speaker: Boyd
text: Shut your trap!

speaker: Greil
text: Good work, Boyd. That’s enough.

speaker: Boyd
text: Oh, all right!

speaker: Greil
text: Your swordsmanship was decent enough, Ike. Don’t forget how it felt. It won’t always be this easy.

speaker: Ike
text: I know.

speaker: Greil
text: Now that you’re done warming up, it’s time for you to face me again.

speaker: Ike
text: I was hoping you’d say that.

speaker: Greil
text: But first...Mist!

speaker: Mist
text: Right here!

speaker: Mist
text: Here you go, Ike! It’s a vulnerary.

speaker: Mist
text: I’d recommend using it now, before you fight Father. Last time, he knocked you silly.

speaker: Greil
text: Always take time to heal your wounds in a battle–even small ones. By the time you think you’re in trouble, it’s probably too late...Don’t get into that situation.

speaker: Greil
text: Give it your all!

speaker: Greil
text: Get ready, Ike–here I come!

speaker: Greil
text: Come on, boy! You going to give me a challenge this time around?

speaker: Greil
text: Ungh...

speaker: Mist
text: Ike! You were great!

speaker: Ike
text: Father, you were holding back, weren’t you?

speaker: Mist
text: What? Is that true?

speaker: Greil
text: If you could tell the difference, that means you’re improving.

speaker: Boyd
text: You know, I wasn’t really giving it my all either...

speaker: Mist
text: That is such a lie.

speaker: Boyd
text: Bah.

speaker: Ike
text: So, Father, does that mean you finally admit that I’m ready?

speaker: Greil
text: What, to join the company? To take on a job?

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah. I mean, Boyd’s already out there on the battlefield. I’m ready. I’m tired of being a trainee.

speaker: Boyd
text: Listen, the difference between you and me is that I’m a professional.

speaker: Mist
text: A professional who just got beat.

speaker: Boyd
text: That was just random chance. Random chance.

speaker: Greil
text: You’ve got a point, Ike... All right. Tomorrow will be your first day as a full-fledged mercenary.

speaker: Ike
text: Really?

speaker: Greil
text: But! If I think it’s too much, you’re back to trainee status. You’d better work hard.

speaker: Ike
text: No problem. Watch– I’ll catch up to everyone in no time.

speaker: Greil
text: We’ll see. We’d better be heading back to the fort. Everyone’s waiting.

speaker: Ike
text: For the past year, I’ve been focused on winning this war. I stand here today as a testament to your fortitude and commitment. I understand this will never suffice, but I wanted to take a moment to say something to you all. Thank you. I hope I may continue to rely on you.

speaker: Soren
text: Of course. I hope that I may continue to be of service.

speaker: Soren
text: There’s only one place for me to be, Ike...and it’s by your side.

speaker: Titania
text: You’ve grown so much... I would like nothing better than if Commander Greil and Elena could see you now...

speaker: Titania
text: You’ve become a great man, Ike. For now and ever more, please continue to be our commander.

speaker: Oscar
text: What a long road we’ve traveled! And yet, in many ways, it seemed to pass so quickly. I’m proud to have fought beside you, Ike.

speaker: Mist
text: We did well, didn’t we? I’m sure Mom and Dad would be proud of us.

speaker: Boyd
text: Great job, Ike! Of course, if I hadn’t been by your side the whole time, victory might have slipped away...

speaker: Rolf
text: Ike! Ike! Er... I mean, Commander Ike! I’m going to keep practicing so I can be better than ever! Thanks for having faith in me!

speaker: Rhys
text: Finally...it’s finally over. At long last, we can return to a life without war. Praise the goddess.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Ike! Are we going to go back to being mercenaries? I’m a great soldier and all, but... The easygoing life of a mercenary is the only life for me. Tee hee! Now let’s go find some good-looking lasses!

speaker: Shinon
text: ...Bah. I suppose you want some kind of congratulations now, right? Well, too bad. You’re a snot-nosed whelp, and I’m still better than you. Don’t ever forget that.

speaker: Mia
text: Heya, Boss! We did it! Whooo-hooo! You know, I am completely in love with your fighting style. If I could train under you, it would be great! So let me stick around for a while. All right?

speaker: Volke
text: I’ve no more work here. I will be leaving you shortly. If you have need of my services, you know how to reach me.

speaker: Ike
text: Elincia. You’ve had to wait a long time, but I finally fulfilled my contract. The mission is complete.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike... On behalf of all Crimea and my departed father, mother, and uncle, I thank you once again...

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, stop! Come on, will you please stop doing that?

speaker: Elincia
text: Pardon?

speaker: Ike
text: I think I’ve gotten used to a few of these noble customs and whatnot, but I still can’t handle the bowing. It makes me antsy...and itchy, too.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh, my lord Ike... Hee hee!

speaker: Ike
text: I think I’ve gotten used to a few of these noble customs and whatnot, but I still can’t handle the bowing. It looks painful, and it’s so cold and formal. Just talk to me without all the ceremony.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike... That’s, um...

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah?

speaker: Elincia
text: N-nothing! It’s nothing...

speaker: Bastian
text: Oh, glorious day of sweet victory! Praises upon the day the goddess did see fit to send Sir Ike to save our land.

speaker: Lucia
text: Thank you, General Ike. Because of you, I believe we better understand how best to serve Princess Elincia.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Through your strength, the dark clouds that blanketed Crimea have been dispelled. From this day forth, we will give our all to see the restoration of this land and its people.

speaker: Kieran
text: General, you are Crimea’s savior! For your meritorious service, I salute you! Huzzah! Nay, a thousand huzzahs!

speaker: Brom
text: Whew! Am I glad that’s over! When I saw King Daein, I was sure I was done for! Or that he’d torture me... But you were a bull! Thank you! Now I can go home and see my family once more!

speaker: Nephenee
text: When I get back to the countryside, I’m gonna boast to all my family and friends that I fought under you.

speaker: Calill
text: General, I owe you a debt of gratitude. I’m going to stay in Crimea and open a shop in the city. I do hope you’ll come by!

speaker: Largo
text: You know, I owe you a lot. I think I’m going to stick around and open an inn. Hope you’ll come by and visit.

speaker: Calill
text: Largo and I are going to stay here and open up a shop.

speaker: Largo
text: With Crimea undergoing reconstruction, there are going to be a lot of people moving about. We’ll open an inn with good food and drink. And free butter on every table! We’ll be rich in no time!

speaker: Calill
text: We’ll let you know when everything’s all set up. You can drop in anytime.

speaker: Largo
text: We’ll even give you special rates! Hmm... Maybe we should call it General Ike’s Inn!

speaker: Tanith
text: General Ike, I will be taking my leave of you for the time being. I must return to Begnion and present a report on the war’s outcome.

speaker: Ike
text: Aren’t you going to take Begnion’s soldiers with you? You lent us quite a few.

speaker: Tanith
text: Though the war may be over, it will take many weeks to see the country secure. I spoke with the princess earlier, and she asked that we help if possible. So I’ll leave them in your care a while longer.

speaker: Ike
text: We really do owe Begnion a lot, don’t we? In the end, we got not only you, but a whole battalion of reinforcements. General Zelgius and his troops are the reason we were able to minimize casualties during the final battle. He and his men took care of the retreating Daeins and allowed us to focus on the enemies before us.

speaker: Tanith
text: No matter the assistance you had, the victory itself is a result of your strength and leadership. I know two people who will be very pleased to learn of your triumph.

speaker: Ike
text: Please give my thanks to both the apostle and Sephiran. I plan to go and thank them myself someday, but...

speaker: Tanith
text: Understood. Fare well, General Ike. I look forward to seeing you again.

speaker: Ike
text: Fare well.

speaker: Zelgius
text: It was a glorious victory, General.

speaker: Ike
text: General Zelgius! What are you doing here?

speaker: Zelgius
text: Looking at it now, and it all may seem a bit impertinent, but... I came with reinforcements in case things took a turn for the worst. Your opponent was the Mad King Ashnard after all, and if worse had come to worst... well, you might have needed the help. Duke Perseus ordered us to join in the fight and rescue Princess Elincia at the very least.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, I see.

speaker: Zelgius
text: My apologies.

speaker: Ike
text: No, no... I appreciate the concern. It was a dangerous day.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Your Crimean army proved up to the task. Let me offer you my congratulations. You did well to win the day. I’m certain the troops we lent you, and the apostle herself, are quite pleased.

speaker: Ike
text: Our success was thanks to the Begnion shield protecting our flank. Not the soldiers you lent us, but your reinforcements capturing and holding the retreating Daein soldiers. Because of that, we were able to concentrate on the enemies before us without concern for our rear guard.

speaker: Zelgius
text: I was merely following the orders of my superiors.

speaker: Ike
text: In that case, please express my appreciation to the apostle and Sephiran. One day, I will go and thank them in person.

speaker: Zelgius
text: Understood. Now then, I will return to Daein.

speaker: Ike
text: What about the troops you’ve lent us?

speaker: Zelgius
text: Though the war may be over, it will take many weeks to see the country secure. I spoke with the princess earlier, and she asked that we help if possible. So I’ll leave them in your care a while longer.

speaker: Ike
text: I see. It’s very appreciated.

speaker: Zelgius
text: It’s our pleasure. By your leave.

speaker: Marcia
text: Ike! Hey, handsome! I’ve decided to return to service in the Begnion pegasus knights! Cool beans, huh?! Oh, I owe so much to you, Ike. Thank you so very much! I’ll see ‘ya around!

speaker: Makalov
text: I think I may try to start over in Begnion. Maybe it’s too much, too soon... But I just want to live a more responsible life. Plus I’m tired of men threatening to break my knees... Good-bye, Ike!

speaker: Astrid
text: Good-bye, General Ike. This war has given me the confidence to enter the service of the Begnion knights. Thank you so much!

speaker: Devdan
text: Devdan is glad all the fighting stopped. Devdan prefers the peace and quiet. War is not good for anything.

speaker: Tormod
text: ...Well, we’re going home. All of our desert friends are waiting for us. And wow, do we have some stories to share with them!

speaker: Muarim
text: Laguz and beorc... Perhaps the gap between us has narrowed. War is horrible. Yet, maybe we’ve gained something of value, after all.

speaker: Stefan
text: Find me when you come to the dunes. We can sit and talk, with no fighting.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you leaving already?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Yep! I’m outta here. I’ve got some important guests to convey to the king.

speaker: Ike
text: Guests?

speaker: Leanne
text: (Master Ike! Thank you for everything.)

speaker: Reyson
text: He’s talking about us. We’re taking my father to visit Gallia for a while. We herons prefer to live near the forests, after all. Tibarn spoke with King Caineghis on our behalf.

speaker: Ike
text: You’re not returning to Serenes?

speaker: Reyson
text: While we made our peace with the apostle, we’re not ready to live there again.

speaker: Ike
text: I see. You’ll be able to return someday. Beorc and laguz will come to understand and respect one another.

speaker: Reyson
text: You may be right. I hope you are.

speaker: Giffca
text: Are you ready? We should be leaving soon.

speaker: Ike
text: Giffca, I’m in your debt as well. Gallia’s a very special place to me... I’d like to visit again someday, if I may.

speaker: Giffca
text: Come whenever you are able. The king will be pleased to see you.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Oh, and another thing. You’ll be seeing me again soon. Gallia’s decided not to spare any effort in aiding Crimea’s reconstruction. I’ll be back shortly with a whole army of workers and laborers. Look for us!

speaker: Ike
text: All right, we’ll be waiting.

speaker: Mist
text: Oh, wait! Reyson! Leanne!

speaker: Reyson
text: What is it?

speaker: Mist
text: Um...do you think...I could touch the medallion one last time? For my mom? ...And dad?

speaker: Leanne
text: (Yes. It’s all right, isn’t it, brother?)

speaker: Mist
text: All right. ... Thank you very much.

speaker: Reyson
text: Is that enough?

speaker: Mist
text: Yes. I just wanted to... say good-bye.

speaker: Reyson
text: Thank you.

speaker: Mist
text: Hm?

speaker: Reyson
text: And you, too, Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Reyson
text: And I’d also like to give our heartfelt thanks to your parents as well. For fulfilling the hopes of our sister... Thank you.

speaker: Leanne
text: (Thank you, our kind-hearted Beorc friends.)

speaker: Mist
text: Mmm...yes!

speaker: Mist
text: You... You’re welcome!

speaker: Reyson
text: So, Ike, when you come to Gallia, you must visit us as well. Understand?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, I’ll be there. Take care.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ike! I will help rebuild Crimea, too. I will lend you much strength!

speaker: Lethe
text: I can’t believe I’m doing this, but... I must admit that you’ve done well. You were a good fighter. Too good to leave with these beorc. We’ll meet again.

speaker: Lethe
text: I don’t know when, but... If that thing we talked about happened...that would be fine. I guess. Not that I care. So...good-bye.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Well, it’s about time for us to take wing.

speaker: Ike
text: We’ve built quite a close bond, haven’t we?

speaker: Tibarn
text: This is true. We’re especially grateful for your help in Serenes Forest. The next time you’re visiting the southern coast, come to Phoenicis. The entire country will celebrate your arrival.

speaker: Ike
text: The country of the hawk tribe, eh? That would be fun. I’m interested in what kinds of food you eat.

speaker: Tibarn
text: We collect berries from trees on peaks that no beorc could climb. The juices and desserts made from it are beyond compare. We have ocean delicacies, mountain treats... We have everything.

speaker: Ike
text: I’ll pass on the desserts... But I’ll take extra helpings of meat!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Ha ha! Leave it to me.

speaker: Naesala
text: I hate to interrupt your gleeful chat, but I thought I should tell you... You don’t have to visit Kilvas. It’s our policy not to invite beorc into our home. Unless they pay well...

speaker: Ike
text: Ah, King Kilvas... Despite all of your posturing, you came to our aid in the end! You turned out to be a better ally than I dared hope for.

speaker: Naesala
text: Pah! Keep your foolish tongue inside your foolish head! ...And don’t tell anyone! I have a reputation to think of.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Fare well. And I’m serious about Phoenicis, too. Come anytime!

speaker: Ulki
text: General, the bird tribes are in your debt. ...We are grateful. Please take care.

speaker: Janaff
text: If you ever have need of the king’s eyes, fire a flaming arrow from a high place. I’ll see it and come flying! Um, that is, if I’m not busy on an errand for the king.

speaker: Jill
text: ...General Ike. I, I will never, ever forget you. Thank you for showing me the error of my ways.

speaker: Haar
text: I’m just glad that it’s finally over. Maybe now, I can get some sleep. Yaaawwwnn... Zzzzzzz...

speaker: Sothe
text: Things are going to be rough in Daein, too. I don’t know what the future holds, but I’m heading back. It’s my homeland, after all.

speaker: Tauroneo
text: ...I have played my part. All that remains is for me to take my leave of this place. History will judge my actions...

speaker: Ilyana
text: Muston and the others are going to Daein, and I think I’m going to go with them. Thank you for everything, General Ike. Hmm... I hope they packed enough food... I’m pretty hungry...

speaker: Zihark
text: Crimea’s an interesting place, but I’ve decided to travel to Daein. Perhaps fate will bring us together again.

speaker: Ike
text: How odd, Ena. We’ve been both enemies and allies.

speaker: Ena
text: Thanks to you, Rajaion was saved. And...so was I... Thank you.

speaker: Ike
text: So, you were with King Daein because you were trying to save Rajaion?

speaker: Ena
text: Yes.

speaker: Nasir
text: Ena’s fiance went missing many years ago. After Ena finally found him, she came to me for help. She told me that Rajaion was with King Daein, and that he had been warped almost beyond recognition. Long ago, Ena’s parents died, and I was unable to do anything for her. Even so, she still came to me for help. No matter what, I had to help her... It was to that end that I used you...... I am so sorry.

speaker: Ike
text: It’s all in the past now. There’s nothing for you to worry about any longer.

speaker: Nasir
text: Thank you, Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: Will Ena return to Goldoa?

speaker: Nasir
text: Yes. We must take Rajaion back to his hometown.

speaker: Ike
text: We? Are you going, too, Nasir?

speaker: Nasir
text: Yes, I am. For the first time in decades, I will walk on Goldoan soil.

speaker: Ike
text: That’ll be nice. Take care of yourself. And give my regards to Kurthnaga.

speaker: Nasir
text: I will. Until we meet again.

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir!

speaker: Nasir
text: Hm?

speaker: Ike
text: I don’t know what you thought, but I... I always trusted you. Except for that one moment when I learned of your deception, I never thought of you as an enemy.

speaker: Nasir
text: Huh. Even now you defy my prediction.

speaker: Ike
text: Prediction?

speaker: Nasir
text: When we were sailing off the coast of Phoenicis, remember? I said that war would change how you look at things. And yet... Through all that’s happened, you’ve remained the same.

speaker: Ike
text: I just can’t pretend to be anything I’m not. I’ve never been any good at that.

speaker: Nasir
text: Please stay that way, Ike. Don’t change for anyone.

speaker: Ike
text: I’ll see you again, won’t I?

speaker: Nasir
text: Yes, I’m sure of it.

speaker: Mist
text: Hah...I’m so tired I could fall over! Peace is all well and good, but it sure is busy.

speaker: Ike
text: We’re rebuilding a country that was completely devastated by war. It’s bound to be tough.

speaker: Mist
text: You’re right. I bet Princess Elincia and the people in the palace are twice as busy.

speaker: Ike
text: Speaking of Elincia, what’s she doing?

speaker: Mist
text: She’s in that room over there, surrounded by court officials. They seem really busy. I feel so sorry for her.

speaker: Ike
text: As long as she’s getting at least a little bit of rest, I’m not worried. But she probably isn’t...

speaker: Mist
text: Maybe if I sang her a lullaby... Ah! Oh, no! I forgot!

speaker: Ike
text: You forgot what?

speaker: Mist
text: I gave the medallion to Reyson, but I forgot all about the galdr! Ike, what should we do?!

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, yeah... We never did find out who Altina is, did we? She was the only one who could sing the galdr... Well, when things calm down, we’ll have to head out and search for her.
Is that Altina you speak of? One of the three who defeated the dark god?

speaker: Mist
text: Hey!

speaker: Ike
text: Sephiran! So you made it, did you?

speaker: Sephiran
text: I arrived mere moments ago. Let me congratulate you on a successful end to your journey.

speaker: Ike
text: Thank you. Please tell me, do you know who Altina is?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Of course. Altina founded my homeland of Begnion.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, then it was a mistake... We can’t give a song to someone who died so long ago...

speaker: Sephiran
text: There is one who yet shares both bloodline and name–the true heir of Altina.

speaker: Ike
text: Who is it?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Sanaki Kirsch Altina... None other than the apostle herself.

speaker: Ike
text: The apostle? Is this something everyone in Begnion would be aware of?

speaker: Sephiran
text: No, there are very few who know that name. Why do you ask?

speaker: Ike
text: The apostle is Altina...

speaker: Mist
text: Oh, I’m so relieved! And exhausted, too! Ike, I’m going back to my room. See you later, Sephiran.

speaker: Sephiran
text: That was rather sudden. Did I say something to cause her distress?

speaker: Ike
text: ...No, nothing like that. It’s just that so much has happened between Begnion and Serenes...

speaker: Sephiran
text: Would you tell me about it? I would hear what you have to say on this matter.

speaker: Ike
text: Sure. To tell the truth...

speaker: Sephiran
text: I see... The assassination of the apostle, the Serenes massacre, and the use of the medallion to revive the dark god... All of it was part of Ashnard’s grand scheme.

speaker: Ike
text: That’s the conclusion we came to.

speaker: Sephiran
text: ...You have me at a loss.

speaker: Ike
text: Why is that?

speaker: Sephiran
text: For many years, I have walked these lands. Watching... Listening... And never did I uncover what you have found. Now that you have presented me with this information, I don’t know what to say.

speaker: Ike
text: I merely fulfilled the hopes of my father and mother.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Now you speak from hindsight. Rescuing Princess Crimea, winning the apostle’s trust, and defeating King Daein... With laguz at your side, no less! You have accomplished all of these miraculous things.

speaker: Ike
text: I had trusted and valiant companions at my side. It was only through their support that I was able to do these things.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Ever the humble one, eh? Now then, before I return home, may I hear the galdr of release? I must convey it to the apostle.

speaker: Ike
text: You would do that?

speaker: Sephiran
text: None of you can leave Crimea. The new queen will need your strength.

speaker: Ike
text: ...I suppose that will be the case for a little while, won’t it?

speaker: Sephiran
text: ...A little while? You are the hero of Crimea, General Ike. If you wish it, no post will be beyond your reach.

speaker: Ike
text: I don’t care about any of that. It’s more trouble than it’s worth. And I don’t see the value of being some fancy lord. When the country’s safe, I’m giving up that title and everything and going back to being a simple mercenary.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Ha ha... T-truly...you are a... Wha ha ha ha ha!

speaker: Ike
text: Is something strange?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Yes. It’s very... Haaaa ha ha haaaaa!

speaker: Ike
text: Um, I think that’s enough.

speaker: Sephiran
text: I’m...I’m s-s-sorry. ...Hee! Hee... Ahem...

speaker: Ike
text: Unbelievable. Despite all appearances, you’re really quite rude.

speaker: Titania
text: Commander? May I have a minute?

speaker: Ike
text: Sure. What is it, Titania?

speaker: Titania
text: Princess Elincia... Oops! It’s Queen Elincia, isn’t it? The court ministers want Queen Elincia and you to come out onto the balcony and greet the people.

speaker: Ike
text: What? Greet the people? ...Me?

speaker: Titania
text: Yes, you. I’ve done what I was asked to do! Now hurry up and get going!

speaker: Ike
text: H-hey! Titania! Ah, nuts! Why do I... What’s going on?

speaker: Sephiran
text: The people of Crimea wish to see their hero and to sing his praises–even if the hero himself protests.

speaker: Ike
text: If they want a greeting, surely their new queen, Elincia, would suffice. I’ll go speak to her.

speaker: Ike
text: What’s wrong?

speaker: Ike
text: Everyone’s waiting to see you.

speaker: Elincia
text: I’m nervous. I’ve spent my whole life in hiding. No one ever taught me how to rule a kingdom. I don’t think I’m ready to be their queen. I don’t think I’m ever really going to be ready.

speaker: Ike
text: What’s the matter with you?

speaker: Elincia
text: Ike, stop it! How can I–

speaker: Ike
text: Did anyone teach you how to hire mercenaries?

speaker: Elincia
text: No, but that’s not the same–

speaker: Ike
text: How to win back lost allies? How to win back your lost kingdom?

speaker: Elincia
text: But that’s… That’s different.

speaker: Ike
text: No, it’s not.

speaker: Ike
text: You’ve done such an amazing job. And I think you always will.

speaker: Elincia
text: I see.

speaker: Ike
text: All right, come on. We’ll do this together.

speaker: Elincia
text: Thank you, my lord Ike. I am… I am so blessed to have met you.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Blazes, why does it have to be so blamed humid? If we weren’t being chased, I’d strip off this armor here and now!

speaker: Titania
text: Then I’m almost glad that we ARE being pursued. I suppose you’ll have to grin and bear it, won’t you?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Hm, I suppose I will.

speaker: Titania
text: Right. So enough of your griping. You’re merely wasting energy. Still, this heat is appalling.

speaker: Shinon
text: Dense forests such as these are not made for us delicate humans. The sub-humans love ’em, though.

speaker: Ike
text: These...sub-humans...Are they really so different from us?

speaker: Shinon
text: What, you mean to tell me you’ve never seen a beast-man before?

speaker: Ike
text: No, never.

speaker: Shinon
text: Well, I have. They’re a hairy bunch, I’ll tell you. And ugly as sin, too. Their faces are all fangs and whisker. Their claws are like daggers, razor sharp and deadly. And even though they can speak our language, they’re beasts through and through. Savages, every one.

speaker: Ike
text: Are there more than one type?

speaker: Soren
text: The ones Shinon calls sub-humans can be divided into three groups, each one named for its physical characteristics. First, the beast tribe, next, the bird tribe, and finally, the dragon tribe. They are traditionally called laguz. The laguz tribe residing here in Gallia is the beast tribe, who possess those feline qualities of which Shinon spoke.

speaker: Shinon
text: To the south are the islands where the bird-men live. The dragons are in Goldoa. It’s something every mercenary should know. Looks like you know even less than I gave you credit for, Ike, my boy.

speaker: Ike
text: Hm...Perhaps.

speaker: Soren
text: ...A little farther, and we’ll be out of these trees, Ike.

speaker: Shinon
text: Really? That means Gallia proper! Compared to this forest, even a kingdom of half-breeds will seem like heaven.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: ...And that’s when we lost track of them. I assigned a squad to pursue them and returned so I could give you this report.

speaker: Petrine
text: Understood. You may step down.

speaker: Petrine
text: So Princess Elincia is making her way through the forest to Gallia...Ena!

speaker: Petrine
text: It appears your advice was sound. Well done. You have earned my praise.

speaker: Ena
text: Thank you.

speaker: Petrine
text: When the king assigned me a tactician, I wondered what I had done to lose his trust. When I saw it was a young girl,I burned with anger at the king’s judgment. Still, it’s worked out better than I had expected. Keep up the good work.

speaker: Ena
text: Of course.

speaker: Petrine
text: Now then, it’s time for the hunt to begin.

speaker: Greil
text: Hold it right there, everyone. We’re coming to the edge of the forest. Form up. Combat positions.

speaker: Titania
text: I don’t suppose our Daein pursuers were willing to let us just slip away.

speaker: Soren
text: There is no doubt that they will attack again. Without knowing their numbers, it is difficult to advise a course of action.

speaker: Greil
text: Take your best guess, Soren. With the limited information we have, what is the best way to proceed?

speaker: Soren
text: ...Some of our group cannot fight. If we are caught, we’ll have a difficult time defending them and attacking the Daeins. I propose we separate into two groups: a small fighting force to engage the enemy and buy the main group some time, and the rest of us–who will escort the princess to Gallia at full speed.

speaker: Oscar
text: You want to divide our combat strength? The main force aside, don’t you think the risk to the smaller group is too high?

speaker: Soren
text: I believe this is the only way to achieve our goal and keep casualties to a minimum.It’s possible there’s an ambush waiting for us at the edge of the forest. If we proceed with no plan, we may be caught between the pursuit and the ambush, which would be the end of us all.

speaker: Greil
text: Looks like we’ve no choice but to give it a go.

speaker: Greil
text: All right, let’s split up. The diversionary team will be Gatrie, Shinon, and me. The rest of you guard Princess Elincia and proceed to Gallia straightaway. Got it?

speaker: Ike
text: Are you sure you’re taking enough men?

speaker: Shinon
text: Idiot pup. Smaller numbers mean better mobility. Your time would be better spent worrying about yourself than about us.

speaker: Greil
text: Listen up! This will probably prove to be the biggest fight this company’s faced. Remember–you’ve got only one life. I don’t want any of you dying on me.In times like these, it matters not what our blood ties are. We are family. If you don’t want to cause your family any grief, then live! Ike will be commanding the main force. Titania, you’re his support. All right, let’s move out! See you all in Gallia!

speaker: Ike
text: So they’re waiting for us after all...

speaker: Soren
text: There are...more of them than I’d imagined there would be. I thought they would have been spread out across the forest border...I didn’t expect to see so many in one place.

speaker: Ike
text: Do we rethink our strategy?

speaker: Soren
text: No, we’ve already split up. It’s too late to reconsider now.

speaker: Ike
text: Isn’t there some way we can at least get the princess, Mist, and Rolf to the far shore safely?

speaker: Soren
text: There are two bridges...This thicket extends to the edge of the westernmost bridge. If we can use the trees as cover, we might be able to reach the bridge undetected. From there,we can launch a surprise attack.

speaker: Ike
text: We’ll be creating a diversion, right?

speaker: Soren
text: Correct. While we keep the enemy’s attention, the princess and the others can cross the bridge to safety.

speaker: Ike
text: We’ve no time for discussion. That’s the plan we go with.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike, I...I will fight with you!

speaker: Ike
text: ...No, you won’t.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord?

speaker: Ike
text: I cannot let you expose yourself to danger of any kind. Everyone here is risking his life to ensure your safety. If you understand that, you’ll cooperate and do as I ask.

speaker: Elincia
text: I see...I will do my part.

speaker: Titania
text: It’s settled then.

speaker: Ike
text: Right! Let’s break through their lines!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist! Rolf! Take care of the princess. Do not let yourselves be seen!

speaker: Mist
text: Right! Be careful, everyone!

speaker: Rolf
text: Leave it to us, Ike! We’ll just pretend it’s a game of hide-and-seek. And I never lose at hide-and-seek!

speaker: Ike
text: Everyone ready? Let’s go!

speaker: Emil
text: We’ve spotted the mercenaries! You there! Inform General Petrine at once! Request that she gather the troops!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Emil
text: What’s this? They’re not bad! Let’s go, men! Hit those mercenary scum with everything you have!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Reinforcements have arrived!

speaker: Emil
text: Very good! Let’s crush these sellswords once and for all!

speaker: Emil
text: Try me! I’ll not let even a single soldier get past!

speaker: Emil
text: Oooh...My life ends here...But...though you flee to Gallia...you will...fall to Daein...

speaker: Ike
text: I don’t know how, but we made it...

speaker: Mist
text: Brother!

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist! Princess, Rolf...Are you all well?

speaker: Rolf
text: Yep! We’re fine.

speaker: Mist
text: Is this Gallia? We made it, didn’t we? We’re safe now, right? I thought I would feel different, but I don’t.

speaker: Elincia
text: This is all due to your efforts. Thank you...

speaker: Ike
text: Princess Elincia...

speaker: Soren
text: It’s still too early to rest easy. The others haven’t rejoined us yet.

speaker: Elincia
text: Ah!

speaker: Titania
text: We are talking about the commander. I don’t think there’s anything to worry about.

speaker: Ike
text: Father...Shinon...Gatrie...

speaker: Ike
text: ...Princess Elincia, I’m afraid we’re going to have to part ways here.

speaker: Elincia
text: But what do you mean?

speaker: Ike
text: We’re going back to aid our companions. So I want you to continue with Mist to the royal palace of Gallia.

speaker: Mist
text: What? No, Ike! I’m going to stay with you!

speaker: Ike
text: Listen to me, Mist! We must do it this way so that everyone gets out of here alive!

speaker: Mist
text: Mm...

speaker: Ike
text: Father and I will catch up to you right away! Don’t worry. Have Father or I ever broken a promise to you?

speaker: Mist
text: Well...no. All right, then. We’ll go ahead.

speaker: Titania
text: Thank you, Mist. We’ll see you soon.

speaker: Mist
text: All right. Titania...Please take care of my brother. Promise?

speaker: Titania
text: You have my word on it.

speaker: Rolf
text: Oscar...Boyd...Don’t get killed out there, all right?

speaker: Oscar
text: Rolf...

speaker: Boyd
text: Knock it off, both of you! You’re like a couple of old women. We’re gonna be fine. Nothing bad’s gonna happen while I’m around!

speaker: Elincia
text: Pardon, my lord Rhys...

speaker: Rhys
text: Y-yes?

speaker: Elincia
text: Take this with you, please.

speaker: Elincia
text: This is a mend staff, isn’t it? Er, are you sure this is all right?

speaker: Elincia
text: Every one of you is putting yourself in harm’s way on my account. I only hope that staff can mitigate your risks even slightly.

speaker: Rhys
text: Thank you very much! This will help greatly. I will use it to aid the others in your name.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Thank you. Please...be careful.

speaker: Rhys
text: If you’ll excuse me.

speaker: Elincia
text: O benevolent Ashera...Grant them all your blessings...

speaker: Mist
text: All right, we’re going to go now.

speaker: Ike
text: Good luck. Watch your step, and be careful.

speaker: Elincia
text: We’ll see all of you again...I’m sure of it! I know you will all be safe.

speaker: Ike
text: Let’s get moving! Where to, Soren?

speaker: Soren
text: We go east on the road we used before. Let’s find the commander before the enemy reinforcements show up.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Can it be?

speaker: Bastian
text: There is no mistake in my words. The princess has returned to Crimea! Lady Lucia serves as her guide. They should be on their way here as we speak.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: How long it's been since we've seen the princess...We have been living for the day where we  steal the eyes from Daein's army and bring her home. And now it has come.

speaker: Bastian
text: Indeed. For His Majesty, for the Queen, and..for Crown Prince Renning as well...We must act as one and support our beloved Princess Elincia.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Yes. If all goes well...our dearest wish will soon come to fulfillment.

speaker: Bastian
text: There's no time to wait. If we wish to properly greet the princess and her retinue, there is much to be done.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Right! Let's let everyone know! We must divide the tasks and begin preparations for a feast at once!

speaker: Bastian
text: And flowers must be prepared for the princess's chamber! Oh, we mustn't forget music and entertainment, either.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: I suppose I shall have to polish the silver tableware I was hiding, too.

speaker: Bastian
text: You? You possess such refined things? I figured a rustic boor like you would have sold them for a lamb shank.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: I received the silver from His Majesty when I was awarded my knighthood... I have been saving it for just such an occasion.

speaker: Bastian
text: Well done! Get ready! We are going to be very, very busy! Ha ha! What a fantastic day this will be!

speaker: Ike
text: The Crimean retainers are waiting for us at this Castle Delbray?

speaker: Lucia
text: Yes. In your absence, Princess, we used the cellars beneath the castle as a secret meeting place. It is from there that we contacted other retainers who were hiding throughout the land.

speaker: Ike
text: And no one was discovered?

speaker: Lucia
text: We disguised ourselves as merchants or peasants, and Daein looked right past us. Their arrogance is without equal...However, now that we've heard of your return, we are bringing out our hidden Crimean armor and polishing away!

speaker: Elincia
text: Merchants? Ha! Geoffrey is one thing, but I cannot imagine Bastian as a shopkeeper.

speaker: Lucia
text: No one could. That's why he dressed as a street performer.

speaker: Elincia
text: Now that, I can see! I'm sure it suited him perfectly. Did he juggle and gambol about? Hee hee!!

speaker: Lucia
text: And Geoffrey... Never have you seen a merchant with such perfect posture!

speaker: Elincia
text: Hee hee hee! That sounds just like him.

speaker: Mist
text: Princess Elincia seems to be having a wonderful time. She's been smiling and laughing for hours.

speaker: Ranulf
text: It seems she and Lucia grew up together. She feels completely at ease around her.

speaker: Ike
text: The princess seemed to be of good cheer when she was with us as well, but...I suppose she was putting on a brave face.

speaker: Titania
text: When I see her in this light, I'm reminded that she's still only a young woman. What we see now is the princess as she was before Daein's attack. That is the true Princess Elincia.

speaker: Ranulf
text: It's good to be home, isn't it? We've still many battles ahead, but for tonight, we should relax and let ourselves forget our cares. No one can continue under this much stress forever, right?

speaker: Ike
text: I suppose you're right.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Today's the happy day the princess returns, yet the goddess sees fit to bring rain...

speaker: Bastian
text: Calm rain is like a kiss upon the face. A scent and feel unparalleled in kind. Reunions in the rain are most heartfelt.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Say, Bastian... How far do you suppose the princess and her escort have come? Why aren't they here yet?

speaker: Bastian
text: ...Sigh. Listen, friend. You have asked me that same question fifty-eight times. And I have responded fifty-seven times. But now, fifty-eight comes anon...You. Need. To. Calm. Yourself.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: I know, but--

speaker: Bastian
text: It's only a little while longer. Make no mistake, our princess will arrive today. I understand your impatience, I really do. But you're the general of our little army. If you act so, the men will react in kind.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: You, you're right...

speaker: Bastian
text: A true knight is the essence of composure. Take a deep breath. Breathe in...and out...

speaker: Geoffrey
text: ...Sigh......Woooooo...!...Whew...

speaker: Bastian
text: See? Don't you feel better?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: ...Hmmm...Ah, blast! It's no good! I'm going to go...uh... Check on...stuff!

speaker: Bastian
text: What am I supposed to do with him?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: They're here! I see them!

speaker: Bastian
text: What? Really?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: That's them, isn't it? The princess's army?

speaker: Bastian
text: Where? Show me where you're looking. Geoffrey, that's not the princess...Those are...Daein troops!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: What? No! Please tell me you're joking...

speaker: Lucia
text: Once we cross the hills, we'll be in Delbray territory. Count Bastian went ahead of us, so they should know of your return by now. Speaking of which...here he comes now! I suppose he couldn't wait any longer and came riding to meet you. How sweet.

speaker: Unknown
text: Princess Elincia! Lady Lucia!

speaker: Elincia
text: Bastian! There's no need for you to rush so! I'm coming in your direction anyway--

speaker: Bastian
text: We've been attacked! Castle Delbray is surrounded by enemy troops!

speaker: Elincia
text: No!

speaker: Lucia
text: It can't be...

speaker: Bastian
text: Geoffrey's acting as a decoy. You must continue on this road to the southwest.

speaker: Lucia
text: So the enemy's found us, eh?

speaker: Lucia
text: Nothing to do about it but change course. I'll lead you to another hiding place.

speaker: Elincia
text: Wh-what are you saying, Lucia? We must help Geoffrey! Bastian?

speaker: Lucia
text: Luck was not with us, Princess. We have no choice. We'll have to abandon our companions in Castle Delbray.

speaker: Elincia
text: No!! We will not!! Geoffrey and the others have survived so much already... I will not abandon them!

speaker: Lucia
text: Princess, please understand. If we could do so without danger to you, we would gladly risk our lives to go back.

speaker: Elincia
text: We cannot do this! Please, Lucia! We must go to the castle! ...Bastian! You must not do this thing!

speaker: Bastian
text: Geoffrey is a knight. In the name of our friend's honor, Princess, you must escape.

speaker: Elincia
text: No... No! They've survived this long! They're alive! NO!!!

speaker: Lucia
text: General Ike... We don't have much time. While we stand here squabbling, Daein scouts may spot our position. Please move the army southwest on this road.

speaker: Ike
text: No.

speaker: Lucia
text: Pardon? What did you say?

speaker: Ike
text: We're going to the castle. If it's surrounded by Daein troops, we cut our way through and join the other knights. Understood?

speaker: Lucia
text: Weren't you listening? I said we had no choice but to leave them behind! They were lost to us the moment the enemy discovered and surrounded them!

speaker: Ike
text: They're not so lost that we can't take them back.

speaker: Lucia
text: You are the general of Crimea's army, are you not?...Even if only for the moment? I would hope that you would act more in accordance with your responsibilities.

speaker: Ike
text: I didn't choose or ask to be general. I was put here by matters of time and circumstance. But, as a mercenary, I have a contract with Princess Elincia that's still in effect. That means she's my employer. And right now, my employer says she wants to go and save the people stuck in that castle. Is that correct, Elincia?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes. I don't want... I don't want anyone else to be sacrificed.

speaker: Ike
text: So...we're going to help them. If you're so worried about the princess, I'll leave her here with you, and you can keep her safe.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike...

speaker: Ike
text: They're coming into view! Combat formations!

speaker: Ike
text: Our goal is to rescue those knights near the castle!

speaker: Ike
text: Attention! Greil's Mercenaries, move out! The enemy awaits, and we go to meet him!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Until the princess's army is out of sight, we must not let the enemy spot them! Do what you must to draw their attention!

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Rikard
text: These Crimean refugees are no easy meat. And there are more of them than I expected. Hmm...

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: G-General Rikard! Enemy reinforcements are approaching from the east!

speaker: Rikard
text: What?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: It appears to be troops from Princess Crimea's army!

speaker: Rikard
text: The army that brushed aside our troops in Daein and defeated General Petrine at the Riven Bridge? They're marching towards us? Fantastic! I was getting bored hunting stragglers. Let's smash all of these curs and wrap ourselves in glory.

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: G-General Geoffrey! It's the Crimean army! Princess Elincia's army is headed this way!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Fools! What are you thinking, Bastian? Oh, Princess... It's not too late. Please take wing and flee!

speaker: Elincia
text: Lucia, Bastian... Are you sure you want to do this?

speaker: Bastian
text: The words of Ike ring yet on in my ears...
