speaker: Lucia
text: We were so trapped by our own ideas that we were unable to sympathize with your feelings. I'm terribly sorry.

speaker: Elincia
text: Because the two of you think to put me above all else, you say you will sacrifice your lives for me. Yet... Even if I'm able to borrow of Ike's strength and win back Crimea... If the cost of that victory is the lives of the two of you, I shall never smile again. And joy? Never again would that emotion fill my heart...

speaker: Lucia
text: Princess Elincia...

speaker: Elincia
text: Please aid Ike and rescue Geoffrey and the others. Then return to me. Come back alive.

speaker: Bastian
text: For you, we would the world itself depart.

speaker: Lucia
text: We'll be back.

speaker: Bastian
text: H-hold a moment! Please, my brave general!

speaker: Ike
text: You again?

speaker: Bastian
text: I was but a humble court official in the service of our late king. My name is Bastian, Count of Fayre. Allow me to give you proper greeting and respects, General Ike. Many thanks are due to you! I am here to formally request your permission to join in the battle taking place in the--

speaker: Ike
text: Shut up! We're in combat! If you want to prattle on and on like this, do so after we defeat the enemy!

speaker: Bastian
text: Oh, yes, but of course...Well! It seems I've found yet another font of good humor... Hmph.

speaker: Lucia
text: General Ike! Allow me to apologize for my earlier remarks! I've a selfish request, but... I would like to join--

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, all right, fine. Now hurry up!

speaker: Lucia
text: Eh?

speaker: Ike
text: If you've got the time to apologize, you've got time to take out some enemies!

speaker: Lucia
text: Of course! To save my companions, I will give my all!

speaker: Ike
text: Fantastic. Now let's go!

speaker: Ike
text: Are you Sir Geoffrey?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Eh? Who are you?

speaker: Ike
text: I'm Ike. I'm leading the Crimean army for Princess Elincia!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: The princess, where is she?

speaker: Ike
text: Don't worry. I didn't bring her to the battlefield with me.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: I see... Thank goodness...Thank you for that regard!

speaker: Ike
text: Are the other soldiers inside the castle?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Yes. I'm sure they're staving off any attacks by enemy infiltrators.

speaker: Ike
text: Good. I'm glad we made it in time. Let's combine forces and finish this!

speaker: Bastian
text: Are you well, my friend?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Bastian...? Why did you come back?

speaker: Bastian
text: I'll explain it to you later! For the sake of the princess, expend your energy on living!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Understood!

speaker: Lucia
text: Geoffrey! I'm so glad we made it in time!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Lucia, my sister...What are you doing? Why did you leave the side of the princess!

speaker: Lucia
text: There's no time to discuss it now! Just know that she is safe. If you want to see her yourself, you'd best try and survive!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Sister! Wait! ...Blast!

speaker: Kieran
text: Crimean Royal Knight, Fifth Platoon Captain Kieran reporting for duty, sir!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Kieran! You live?

speaker: Kieran
text: Yes sir, General! I was taken prisoner by Daein and held in the dungeon of Canteus Castle. Oh, it was a vile place! They tried all manner of terrible tortures on me...but I resisted to the last! Then I was freed by a company of mercenaries in the hire of Princess Elincia! Since that time, I have been faithfully at the side of the princess protecting her from all harm!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Is the princess in good spirits?

speaker: Kieran
text: She is! General Geoffrey, it is her great wish that you live, so that she may see you once again!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Is that...so? Very well! Now that I've heard that, I must stay alive at any cost! Rally your hearts, men of Crimea! We will fight and we will win! The princess needs her castle!

speaker: Woman
text: Oh, thank the goddess! The Crimean army has arrived. We who have suffered so much under Daein's rule will finally be free! We can put our faith in that, can't we? If there's anything we can do to help, we'll do it. Please, rescue our beloved Crimea.

speaker: Man
text: You're part of the army that brought the princess, aren't you? Oh, you've done a great thing! I've been hiding this scroll so I could give it to you. Use it to drive Daein out of our homeland! You can do it!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Is that the Crimean army?...Where is Gawain's son?...Ah... He's much improved...He is his father's son after all. Contrary to my initial estimation, he may prove to be worthy.

speaker: Ike
text: What? Him...It's him!

speaker: Titania
text: Ike! The castle has fallen to the enemy!

speaker: Ike
text: Curses! We were too slow.

speaker: Rikard
text: I am Rikard! Your corpse will be the sustenance that feeds my hunger for fame!

speaker: Rikard
text: No matter one's proven deeds,...one defeat unmans us all...And so...it ends...

speaker: Black Knight
text: Fool! Run now, and I'll let you live.

speaker: Ike
text: Urghgg... I'm......not strong...enough...yet...

speaker: Black Knight
text: Is that all you have? It seems you do not possess the talents to surpass your father after all. A pity.

speaker: Black Knight
text: And yet another general of Daein is defeated...I wonder how powerful you will become, army of Crimea. I look forward to our next meeting...

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: Princess Elincia! So you came after all.

speaker: Elincia
text: Thanks to your words, both of my friends came to understand how vital it was.

speaker: Ike
text: I don't understand the feelings of knights. But, I do understand how important your former retainers are to you. And I also understand the strong support with which they provide you. I'm happy we were able to save them.

speaker: Elincia
text: As am I!

speaker: Ike
text: All right, shall we return? If I'm going to be fighting with them, I should probably introduce myself.

speaker: Elincia
text: Wait, my lord Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: Yes?

speaker: Elincia
text: As you said, Lucia and the others are very important to me. They are family. I may presume too much, but...well...My lord Ike, you and the others are also irreplaceable to me, so... I ask for your continued support!

speaker: Ike
text: Of course. It's an honor.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Princess!

speaker: Elincia
text: Geoffrey!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Princess... Ah, to behold you again...It's... It's...

speaker: Elincia
text: If you had lost your life today, this reunion would not be taking place. Geoffrey, do you hear me? Be careful!

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Yes, Princess. Lucia...told me of what occurred. Our country and princess now exist as one. It was never our intent to sacrifice your feelings for the sake of the nation. Please forgive us.

speaker: Bastian
text: But soft! What luck that we do feel fate's kiss? Anon, the clouds do part, the rains do stop. Heaven itself does sing and thus rejoice. At the return of our one true ruler! Oh, Princess... Until world's end, do you we vow to follow! We are planets of your fair blazing sun!

speaker: Lucia
text: No longer will we think of honor and dying in so cavalier a fashion. No matter the difficulties we face, we will choose the road that allows us to continue living at your side.

speaker: Ike
text: Why appear now? Do you mean to tell me you purposely waited until the battle was over?

speaker: Black Knight
text: Hmph. I know how your mind works. I assumed you would attack the moment you saw me. But perhaps you've learned to judge the importance of time and place.

speaker: Ike
text: To a mercenary, nothing's more important than the contract between him and his employer.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Shall we call off our contest then? When you die here, you'll be in breach of contract after all.

speaker: Ike
text: That's not a problem. All I have to do is win... Ready yourself!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Hmph.

speaker: Black Knight
text: You're not as overly clumsy as I had feared. It is regrettable that your weapon is so poorly made.

speaker: Ike
text: Why do my attacks have no effect?

speaker: Black Knight
text: My armor is blessed by the goddess. Only weapons that are also blessed can so much as scratch it.

speaker: Ike
text: Grrr... So common weaponry is useless? Is that it?

speaker: Black Knight
text: You should not worry about such trivialities. You possess the sacred blade Ragnell, do you not?

speaker: Ike
text: Ah!

speaker: Black Knight
text: It is the counterpart to my blade, Alondite. Tell me you were not idiot enough to leave it in that place. You took it with you, did you not? Along with your father's corpse?

speaker: Ike
text: That...that sword? The one you threw to my father like an act of charity? The one he refused? That's Ragnell?

speaker: Black Knight
text: I claim victory today. When next we meet, bring Ragnell. Without the proper weapon, I grow bored.

speaker: Marcia
text: Ah! Ike! There, hiding in the shadows of that tent! Grab him!

speaker: Ike
text: Huh? What?

speaker: Makalov
text: Hey! Ouch! Come on, you gotta let me go!

speaker: Marcia
text: Stop whining you little baby! Get over here!

speaker: Marcia
text: You spineless sop! You never learn, do you?

speaker: Ike
text: What's going on?

speaker: Marcia
text: Listen to this, Ike! While I was changing my clothes, my dear brother here tried stealing from my purse again!

speaker: Makalov
text: Don't do this here! You don't need to tell the whole camp about it, do you?

speaker: Marcia
text: Who's created this situation in the first place! And here I was thinking that you'd finally turned yourself around... Even as we speak, Mother is at home weeping in her soup! You chowderhead!

speaker: Makalov
text: Don't worry about Mom! Dad's there to take care of her.

speaker: Marcia
text: You brainless eunuch! Gaaaaaa!!!

speaker: Makalov
text: M-Marcia! Ow! Ow! My foot! You're crushing it! I heard something crunch! Help! I'm being crippled!

speaker: Marcia
text: And no one cares!

speaker: Ike
text: All right, all right. I think that's enough.

speaker: Marcia
text: Hmph! It's one thing that you're a guppy-brained lout... But it's worse that you never, ever change! You're ALWAYS being chased by thugs, and I ALWAYS have to go looking for you. Do you have any idea how much I worry? Would it hurt you to think of others once in a while? You're my OLDER brother, remember?

speaker: Makalov
text: Marcia...

speaker: Makalov
text: I'm sorry! I'll give up gambling. I'll work hard and repay all of my debts! Please, you've gotta believe me!

speaker: Ike
text: Why not forgive him? He's the only brother you've got, right?

speaker: Marcia
text: ...Well, if Ike insists...

speaker: Makalov
text: R-really? Do you forgive me?

speaker: Marcia
text: Only if you keep your word! This is the absolute last time!

speaker: Makalov
text: I swear! I swear on Dad's grave.

speaker: Marcia
text: Heh... That's not going to work, you twit! Dad's still alive.

speaker: Makalov
text: Made you laugh! 'Bout time, too.

speaker: Ike
text: Straighten up and don't trouble your sister anymore.

speaker: Makalov
text: Say, Marcia?

speaker: Marcia
text: What is it, Makalov?

speaker: Makalov
text: You want to bet on how long I can keep my promise? I'll give you four-to-one odds!

speaker: Marcia
text: AAAHHH!!!

speaker: Soren
text: Good morning, Ike. May I have a moment of your time?

speaker: Ike
text: What is it? I’m listening.

speaker: Soren
text: Our expenses, our ability to fight...The current status of our troops...These are all things that you must know.

speaker: Ike
text: I see. Having a grasp of that is part of the commander’s job, too, right? Understood. Let me hear it.

speaker: Soren
text: Very well.

speaker: Soren
text: And that’s it.

speaker: Ike
text: Ugh...

speaker: Soren
text: Ike? Is something wrong?

speaker: Ike
text: Even though I was aware of the numbers, hearing it in a report like this is...hard.

speaker: Soren
text: Do you mean the casualites and refugees?

speaker: Ike
text: Death and destruction are all part of war. My father said that a lot. The first casualties of war are those without strength and those without luck. And there’s nothing you can do about it. Live with bravery, be daring and fearless. Live for those who have died. And yet...I can’t help but think f I were more powerful...I could save more people. Couldn’t I?

speaker: Soren
text: Ike...

speaker: Ike
text: ...Blast!

speaker: Soren
text: Indeed.

speaker: Ike
text: Forgive me. I got carried away.

speaker: Soren
text: No, not at all... Um, perhaps I should...

speaker: Ike
text: Thank you for the report. I will need more of the same from here on. Keep up the good work.

speaker: Soren
text: Thank you, Commander. I will do my best. But if I have your leave, I must be going.

speaker: Soren
text: ...That’s it.

speaker: Ike
text: I think I’ve got most of it.

speaker: Soren
text: I’ll give you a report before each battle. I hope that it helps.

speaker: Ike
text: I’m sure it will. Thank you. I’m relying on you for all the details. Keep up the good work.

speaker: Titania
text: This place brings back such memories. It hasn’t changed in the slightest.

speaker: Ike
text: Titania, have you been to Gallia before?

speaker: Titania
text: A long time ago...When I was still a knight of Crimea. I volunteered for a military officer exchange program and spent some time studying at Gallia’s royal palace.

speaker: Ike
text: I get it now...That’s why you weren’t surprised when we saw the laguz.

speaker: Titania
text: That’s right. Ah, I’ve missed the sea. When the setting sun strikes the water, it’s almost as though the horizon itself is on fire.

speaker: Ike
text: Hmm. Now that I think about it, my father knew where that old castle was...He sure acted like someone who’d been to Gallia before. Was he here with you?

speaker: Titania
text: Mm-hm. And we weren’t the only ones. You’ve been here, too, Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Unknown
text: Ike!

speaker: Titania
text: It’s Mordecai. You’d better answer him.

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, but...

speaker: Titania
text: We can finish our talk later, after we’ve reached the castle.

speaker: Ike
text: Well, that was cryptic.

speaker: Ike
text: What is it, Mordecai?

speaker: Mordecai
text: Do you tire? Should we rest here?

speaker: Ike
text: No, I think we’re all right.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Good.

speaker: Lethe
text: Beorc are such a weak species. A distance like this is nothing. Any laguz worth his claws could cross it in a single bound.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Lethe!

speaker: Lethe
text: Hmph! It is the truth!

speaker: Mordecai
text: If you persist in this way, you will shame the king. You sound like a fool.

speaker: Lethe
text: Hsss! You are my subordinate! Never speak to me in such a way![

speaker: Mordecai
text: What’s wrong is wrong. You are a fierce warrior, Lethe, but when it comes to the beorc, you are far too stubborn.

speaker: Lethe
text: What did you say?!

speaker: Ike
text: Come on now, both of you...Let’s calm down.

speaker: Lethe
text: ...Mordecai?

speaker: Mordecai
text: ...Wait...

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Mordecai
text: That smell on the wind...It’s iron. The smell of beorc. Heavily armored. Well armed.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: General Kotaff! The Crimean mercenaries have entered our area of operations!

speaker: Kotaff
text: Ha! They’re trapped! Call every last man. Ready for battle! We stop the enemy here!

speaker: Soren
text: Black armor...They’re Daein men, all right.

speaker: Ike
text: You’re saying that some of the invasion force is still around?

speaker: Lethe
text: Daein worms...They strut about the Gallian forests as though they own them. I won’t stand for it!

speaker: Mordecai
text: Grrr...The castle to the south.Many beorc are inside. They carry iron weapons. I smell them.

speaker: Ike
text: Not good...Titania! Gather everyone together!

speaker: Titania
text: Ha! Understood!

speaker: Lethe
text: What now?

speaker: Ike
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Lethe
text: If you hope to crush the worms, you’d do well to capture the ruins in the south. Since you probably want to flee, there is an escape route...

speaker: Ike
text: We’re going to fight.

speaker: Lethe
text: Oh?

speaker: Ike
text: There are times when running has its advantages, but I don’t think we’ll lose here.

speaker: Lethe
text: ...I see.

speaker: Mordecai
text: I will also fight.

speaker: Ike
text: Good. We could use the help.

speaker: Titania
text: Ike! Everyone’s here!

speaker: Ike
text: All right, let’s go!

speaker: Ike
text: I want you two to take Mist and Rolf and retreat to the rear.

speaker: Jorge
text: Of course.

speaker: Daniel
text: We’re counting on you. Be careful!

speaker: Ike
text: Everyone who can fight, grab a weapon! Greil Mercenaries...Move out!

speaker: Mist
text: Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist! You and Rolf clear out of here! Stay back, no matter what!

speaker: Mist
text: No, Ike! We’re going to fight with you–both of us.

speaker: Ike
text: What? No. That’s not going to happen. Be serious, Mist...The two of you can’t even wield weapons.

speaker: Mist
text: I’ve got this!

speaker: Ike
text: A heal staff?

speaker: Mist
text: Yeah! I made Rhys teach me how to use it. I can heal injuries! I mean, just little ones, but still...

speaker: Ike
text: Little ones? No. There’s no way I’m letting you on this battlefield...Huh?

speaker: Boyd
text: Rolf! Stop being such a brat, you little twerp!

speaker: Rolf
text: I’m going to fight, too! I’m good with a bow!

speaker: Boyd
text: Really? That’s news to me. Is that the best lie you could come up with?

speaker: Rolf
text: It’s no lie!

speaker: Mist
text: That’s right! He’s not lying.

speaker: Boyd
text: Of course he is!

speaker: Ike
text: What are you talking about, Mist?

speaker: Mist
text: Rolf’s always practicing with his bow. And he’s really good! Aren’t you?!

speaker: Rolf
text: I sure am!

speaker: Ike
text: And when did you learn to use a bow?

speaker: Rolf
text: Well, let’s see...Um...I guess I just...sorta...picked it up naturally?

speaker: Boyd
text: Stop lying, you booger-eating brat! You can’t just pick up a weapon and start firing away! Someone has to teach you the basics!

speaker: Rolf
text: Well, maybe I’m just a prodigy, cause I learned it all myself!

speaker: Boyd
text: You little...

speaker: Mist
text: You don’t know anything, Boyd!

speaker: Rolf
text: That’s right!

speaker: Boyd
text: This is ridiculous!

speaker: Ike
text: Enough. You two go back.

speaker: Mist
text: No! We don’t want to! All Rolf and I do is sit and wait and worry about all of you. We’re tired of waiting! We want to fight by your side!

speaker: Ike
text: Is that so?

speaker: Boyd
text: How about it, Rolf? Is that how you feel, too?

speaker: Rolf
text: Uh-huh. No doubt, we’d rather be with you.

speaker: Boyd
text: Sigh...

speaker: Boyd
text: What now, Commander?

speaker: Ike
text: We take them with us. We’re too pressed for time to sit around here bickering. And at least if they’re nearby, they’ll be easier to protect.

speaker: Mist
text: Are you serious?!

speaker: Rolf
text: Yes! You won’t regret this, Ike! I promise!

speaker: Boyd
text: I hope not.

speaker: Marcia
text: Let’s see now...Where are they? Aha! I’ve found them!

speaker: Nedata
text: Yar har ho!

speaker: Pirate
text: Yo ho har!

speaker: Nedata
text: Scallywags of the sea are we!

speaker: Pirate
text: We fight like beasts, an’ men do flee!

speaker: Nedata
text: We earn our gold with axes bold...Yar! Ye scurvy bilge rat! Why aren’t ya singin’?

speaker: Pirate
text: Har! Over there, Nedata! Fix yer eyes on that. Do ye sees what I sees?

speaker: Nedata
text: Oh ho ho! What’s this, then? Humans battling humans here in Gallia? What in the briny beard of Shanty Pete is going on?

speaker: Pirate
text: Oy! Do ya think they may be the king’s curs out to capture us and claim the bounty?

speaker: Nedata
text: Gahar har har!

speaker: Pirate
text: Shall we unfurl the mainsail and steer for calmer waters?

speaker: Nedata
text: Bite yer tongue, ye kelp-brained idjit! We’re pirates! We don’t turn tail from government scum! I’m goin’ ashore! Watch me, and you’ll see a true sea-dog in action.

speaker: Pirate
text: Yar, well said! You’ve set me blood aboil! I’m with ye all the way, matey!

speaker: Nedata
text: Aarrr! Let’s see what we can see then!

speaker: Pirate
text: Yar! Me axe is sharp, and me spirit is bold!

speaker: Nedata
text: Yar har ho!

speaker: Pirate
text: Yo ho har!

speaker: Lethe
text: By the way...

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Lethe
text: If there is some special task you would ask of us, we are willing to listen.

speaker: Ike
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Lethe
text: Bah! Open your ears! If you wish it, we shall...follow your orders. Hssss! But you must Direct us.

speaker: Ike
text: Really? You’re willing to take orders from me?

speaker: Lethe
text: This is a beorc fight. If you don’t Direct us, then we have no reason for being here. So spoke our king.

speaker: Ike
text: But last night, you...

speaker: Lethe
text: THAT...That was an...emergency.

speaker: Mordecai
text: We thought you were in danger.

speaker: Ike
text: You thought correctly. We were in danger. I thank you. We were greatly aided by your arrival.

speaker: Mordecai
text: You are welcome.

speaker: Lethe
text: Hmm.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Very well. Let us fight together. If you choose not to Direct us, we shall do as we please. Do you find this acceptable?

speaker: Ike
text: Of course. Well then, good fortune to us all.

speaker: Marcia
text: Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: You! You’re that...

speaker: Marcia
text: That’s right. It’s me! Marcia! As promised, I’m here to pay my debt...I’m going to join your group!

speaker: Ike
text: Join us? But I thought you were one of the holy pegasus knights of Begnion...

speaker: Marcia
text: Pfff! I resigned So what do you say? Are you going to let me in or what? Come on!

speaker: Ike
text: Are you sure about this? I mean, I’ll be honest with you. We’re a destitute band of mercenaries. Your wages will be a pittance compared to what you’re used to.

speaker: Marcia
text: So, what? Are you saying no?

speaker: Ike
text: No, I’m simply pointing out that you’ll be losing almost all of...

speaker: Marcia
text: Pfff! I won’t lose out on anything! Plus, I’ll work twice as hard as anyone else. C’mon, please let me join? PLEEEEASE!

speaker: Ike
text: Well, if that’s what you want, I guess we’ll give it a shot. We’re shorthanded though, so you’re going to be busy.

speaker: Marcia
text: Huzzah! That’s great! Just tell me what needs doing!

speaker: Boyd
text: Rolf, stay by my side.

speaker: Rolf
text: You got it!

speaker: Boyd
text: Hold a minute. That was too easy. What’s going on?

speaker: Rolf
text: Nothing. But if I’m close to you, I can protect you. So you have no need to worry.

speaker: Boyd
text: What? Hey, that’s my line!

speaker: Oscar
text: Rolf!

speaker: Rolf
text: I’m...I’m sorry!

speaker: Oscar
text: Huh Why are you apologizing?

speaker: Rolf
text: What? But...Aren’t you here to yell at me?

speaker: Oscar
text: Why? Did you do something to make me mad?

speaker: Rolf
text: I thought maybe my whole decision to fight and stuff...I made that on my own. I thought that it might upset you.

speaker: Oscar
text: I won’t complain about the commander’s decisions.

speaker: Rolf
text: So, you’re all right with it?

speaker: Oscar
text: I suppose. But I want you to stay close, so I can watch out for you.

speaker: Rolf
text: Got it!

speaker: Oscar
text: Wait! There is one thing. When did you learn to use a bow?

speaker: Rolf
text: Um, it’s a secret!

speaker: Oscar
text: That’s no answer. Rolf! Blast! I told you to stay close!

speaker: Female Cat Laguz
text: Eeeek! Hu-hu-humans! Yaaaaah!

speaker: Ike
text: Um...

speaker: Female Cat Laguz
text: Urk! Urk! Ahhh...Oh, come on! You are so rude! If you can’t tell, I’m playing dead. So go away! Huh? Why? Because my mother told me, If you ever meet a beorc, play dead, and it will leave you be. It’s not true, is it? Hsss! I knew it wasn’t true! I knew it! Well then, take this, and get out of here! Quickly! I HATE humans! I don’t want to talk to you!Hsss! SHOO!!

speaker: Cat Laguz
text: You’re from Crimea, aren’t you? I’m a warrior of the beast tribe. Lord Ranulf spoke of you.  Doubtless you have noticed that Fort Tatana has been taken by Daein forces. Watch your step around that bunch. There’s a dangerous mage with them. We of the beast tribe find magic, and especially fire magic, particularly threatening. I am waiting for friends and cannot take leave of this house, but...I would give you this. If you use it, your magical resistance will increase. It will help you fight that mage. Take care.

speaker: Nedata
text: Scallywags of the sea are we! We earn our gold with axes bold!

speaker: Nedata
text: Scallywags of the sea...are we...An end like this is quite...worthy!

speaker: Kotaff
text: Death to the rogues who defy Daein! Defend our brethren! Erase their shame!

speaker: Kotaff
text: Arrgh...urr...urg...In the name...of the empire...Cleanse...my shame...

speaker: Ike
text: We defeated their commander, but we still don’t know what they were after.

speaker: Titania
text: It seems unlikely that they were merely pursuing Princess Elincia. I wonder if Daein is planning to invade Gallia. Perhaps Crimea was only a stone on which to whet their blades.

speaker: Soren
text: No matter the motive, the fact remains that Daein crossed the border. Under such circumstances, hostilities between Daein and Gallia could break out at any time.

speaker: Ike
text: So, it’s war...Again.

speaker: Titania
text: If war erupts between the beorc and laguz, it’s only a matter of time before other nations become involved. Could Daein truly mean to set the land aflame in a blaze of war? If that happens, many of our citizens will be sacrificed on the altar of their ambition.

speaker: Soren
text: We, too, need to choose which way to move, whose side to take...

speaker: Titania
text: Whose side? We shall never support Daein! Unthinkable!

speaker: Soren
text: Captain Titania, we are human. Would you truly have us side with sub–with laguz against other humans? THAT is unthinkable.

speaker: Ike
text: Beorc and laguz...

speaker: Lethe
text: Are you going to sit here and argue about a war that hasn’t started? You beorc are all so timid! It’s pathetic.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Lethe! You must not say such things.

speaker: Ike
text: Mordecai? Lethe? What do you think? Will it come to war?

speaker: Lethe
text: Our claws are sharp. If Daein invades Gallia, we are ready for battle. If our king wills it, war will come.

speaker: Mordecai
text: I like it not...War brings pain. Sorrow.

speaker: Ike
text: This is troubling...

speaker: Lethe
text: Enough. We have lost much time. Let us make for the palace. We must reach tonight’s camp before the sun sets.

speaker: Ike
text: Is the palace still far?

speaker: Lethe
text: On your skinny beorc legs, it is very far. But we will do as we can.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike! Everyone!

speaker: Ike
text: Princess Elincia.

speaker: Elincia
text: I heard about...Commander Greil. I...I don’t know what to say.

speaker: Ike
text: Don’t worry. We’re all right. We’re getting by...somehow.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Oh, Ike...

speaker: Cat Laguz
text: The king has arrived.

speaker: Ike
text: Um... Hey there.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Thank you for coming to Gallia Palace. I am Caineghis, ruler of the kingdom of Gallia.

speaker: Ike
text: These are the Greil Mercenaries. I am Ike, their commander.

speaker: Caineghis
text: You have been raised well, young pup. I didn’t recognize you.

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Titania
text: When last you were here, you were still a small child.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Is that you, Titania? It’s good to see you.

speaker: Titania
text: The pleasure is all mine, Your Majesty.

speaker: Ike
text: The two of you are friends? How...How does the king know me?

speaker: Caineghis
text: Mm. I have something I must tell you about your father, Greil...

speaker: Caineghis
text: Lethe. Mordecai. Leave us now. Prepare rooms, so our guests may have a place to rest and heal their wounds.

speaker: Lethe
text: At once, my lord!

speaker: Elincia
text: Would it be best if I were to leave as well?

speaker: Caineghis
text: No, Princess. I would have you stay. And this one also will stay.

speaker: Caineghis
text: This is Giffca, my shadow. Pay him no more heed than you would the air.

speaker: Ike
text: Understood. I would have Titania and Soren stay with me, as well.

speaker: Soren
text: Me?

speaker: Caineghis
text: So be it. Now then, where to begin?

speaker: Caineghis
text: Titania? How much did Greil tell his son?

speaker: Titania
text: Ike was raised with no knowledge of Gallia whatsoever, nor does he recall ever having been here.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Is that so? Then it is best for me to tell him all that I know. ...Although that is not much.

speaker: Ike
text: That’s all right. Whatever you can tell me would be much appreciated. I want to know more of my father.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Hmm...You have good eyes. Honest and brave.I see your father in them. Long ago, Greil...your father...worked as a mercenary for Gallia. We forged a strong bond, he and I. To speak truly, I still do not trust the beorc. But your father was different.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Princess Elincia’s father, King Ramon, and his brother, Lord Renning, are also of a different kind. All are...or were...exceptional men. Men in whom one could put his trust.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Oh ho! Titania! You are an exception as well! Among beorc females, you are unique.

speaker: Titania
text: You are most gracious, Your Majesty.

speaker: Ike
text: My father was a mercenary for Gallia...?

speaker: Caineghis
text: Correct. And you and your sister? You were both born here in Gallia. You stayed only for a short time, but part of your childhood was spent within these borders.

speaker: Ike
text: Mist and I were born here? Is that so? I don’t remember any of this at all.

speaker: Caineghis
text: I feel your parents were carrying a dark secret. Someone was hunting them, I’m sure of it. Once, over ten years ago...and after your mother had been slain...Your father chose to leave Gallia. Before he left, I went to him and asked him to share his tale. I asked him, Why are you being chased? Is there anything I can do to help? But I was unable to loosen his tongue. And then I heard he had returned to Gallia, and I thought I had another chance to hear his tale. His fate was black indeed. If I had been faster, if I had hastened my steps, perhaps things would be different.

speaker: Ike
text: Wait! Now I understand. The voice I heard...That was you, wasn’t it?

speaker: Caineghis
text: His wound was fatal. I could do nothing. I thought it best not to interfere in his final moments, so I remained hidden. Tell me, Ike... At his last, did he confess anything to you? The identity of the Black Knight...Did he reveal it?

speaker: Ike
text: The Black Knight? No. I don’t know who he was. My father entrusted me with his command, told me to trust King Caineghis and to live peacefully in Gallia. He said to forget everything else.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Is that so? Well then, let me do as I can. If any of your mercenaries desire to live here, I will so arrange it. I will vouchsafe them homes and land.

speaker: Ike
text: Your kindness is truly appreciated. But, speaking for myself, I couldn’t live here in peace. Not now. I will avenge my father. I cannot so quickly forget the past...Or the Black Knight.

speaker: Titania
text: But, Ike! That’s not...

speaker: Ike
text: I know. I’m not...I’m not strong enough. An opponent who could defeat my father is well beyond my reach...But that’s why I’ve devoted myself to growing stronger. I will lead my father’s mercenaries and prepare for the day when my chance for revenge arrives.

speaker: Caineghis
text: A prudent course of action. You look as one who would be more impulsive, but you are Greil’s son after all.

speaker: Titania
text: Ha! You’ve matured, Ike. It seems like yesterday that you were merely a child.

speaker: Ike
text: Titania...

speaker: Caineghis
text: And now, I would ask a boon of you.

speaker: Caineghis
text: The strength of your mecenary band, Ike, would you lend it to Princess Elincia?

speaker: Ike
text: Are you serious?

speaker: Elincia
text: King Caineghis!

speaker: Caineghis
text: Gallia and Crimea are allied nations, that cannot be denied. However, this alliance in reality binds only the royal families. It is not respected by our citizenry.

speaker: Titania
text: The people of Gallia are seldom seen in Crimea, are they? Even though our nations are friends, the people of Crimea have little real understanding of the laguz. Many of our people still use that undignified name, sub-human, when they speak of the laguz...

speaker: Elincia
text: ...My father’s heart was filled with shame and sorrow over what you describe. More than any king in our history, he wanted to deepen relations between our people, and then...

speaker: Caineghis
text: Perhaps that is why Daein targeted him. Their hatred of the laguz is well known.

speaker: Ike
text: Could it be...?

speaker: Caineghis
text: In my heart of hearts, I would like to take guardianship of Princess Elincia and assist in the rebuilding of Crimea. However, anti-beorc sentiment is running high here in Gallia. If we were to offer safe harbor to Elincia, I feel many of our elder statesmen would protest. They would say that we are giving Daein an ideal excuse to attack.

speaker: Ike
text: Which means Gallia can’t offer Princess Elincia any relief at all...Is that it?

speaker: Caineghis
text: Unfortunately, it is true.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike, King Caineghis has advised me to turn to the Begnion Theocracy for aid in Crimea’s restoration. He says we should make of Begnion a formal request and gain the support of their shields.

speaker: Titania
text: Passage to Begnion will require several months at sea. An escort will be necessary...

speaker: Ike
text: As you know, we lack the numbers to serve as a complete mercenary army. So, if the princess were willing to hire us as an escort, it would be an offer beyond our expectations.

speaker: Ike
text: Titania! Soren! I think perhaps we should accept the king’s offer. What do you say?

speaker: Titania
text: It’s what you want, right, Commander? Well then, it’s our job to follow you.

speaker: Soren
text: However you wish to proceed is fine. I will do all in my power to ensure that our road leads to success.

speaker: Ike
text: Understood. As of now, the Greil Mercenaries shall assume the honor of serving as escort to the princess of Crimea.

speaker: Ike
text: Princess Elincia, our journey together will undoubtedly be a long one. May we serve you well.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh, thank you very much! I only pray that I, in turn, may be worthy of your service!

speaker: Ike
text: I got it.

speaker: Soren
text: Ike, just a bit more...Would you mind hearing my report on our last battle?

speaker: Ike
text: Uh, sure. Go ahead, please.

speaker: Soren
text: Very well.

speaker: Soren
text: ...This can only mean one thing: the enemy knows exactly how we are going to move. With your permission, I'll begin an investigation to see if there's anyone suspicious among the troops......Ike?

speaker: Soren
text: Ike? Are you all right?

speaker: Ike
text: Hm? , yes...Sorry. What is it?

speaker: Soren
text: Nothing. I was just giving you the standard update. Shall I put it off till later?

speaker: Ike
text: No, sorry, but can you start over from the beginning? I'll pay attention this time.

speaker: Soren
text: Understood.

speaker: Titania
text: Good morning, you two. What's wrong, Ike? You look so sleepy!

speaker: Ike
text: I've...had a lot on my mind. I meant to sleep last night, but I was up thinking. Before I knew it, it was morning.

speaker: Titania
text: Really? I never thought I'd hear that. Ike didn't sleep because he was thinking. I wonder if Soren will start being polite...

speaker: Ike
text: Listen, Titania... Can I just--

speaker: Mist
text: B-Brother! Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: What's wrong, Mist?

speaker: Mist
text: What am I going to do, Ike? My medallion's gone!

speaker: Ike
text: What? It's gone?

speaker: Titania
text: No!!

speaker: Mist
text: What am I going to do? It was my only memento of Mother--

speaker: Ike
text: Did you drop it? Or put it somewhere and forget? Something like that?

speaker: Mist
text: No! I always carry it with me! I would never lose it! I had it before I went to bed last night... It vanished while I was sleeping! Sniff...waaaa...

speaker: Ike
text: Don't cry. It's not your fault.

speaker: Mist
text: But...but...

speaker: Ike
text: I said don't cry! I'll find it! All right?!

speaker: Mist
text: All...right... Sorry...

speaker: Soren
text: Ike, just a bit more...Would you mind hearing my report on our last battle?

speaker: Ike
text: Uh, sure. Go ahead, please.

speaker: Shiharam
text: A-are you serious?

speaker: Petrine
text: You are to begin immediately.

speaker: Shiharam
text: Yet, that's... General Petrine! If we do this thing, Daein will suffer.

speaker: Petrine
text: It's for the good of the country. Besides, it's only one territory! Stop mewling like an old woman.

speaker: Shiharam
text: I hear you, and yet...If the goal is merely to stop the Crimean army, this is not necessary. The strength of my troops will suffice to--

speaker: Petrine
text: The last idiot who told me that ended up on a corpse pile! Now listen to me, and listen well. No matter how passionate you are when you tell me you'll defeat Crimea, I'll never pin my hopes on a bunch of foreigners. All you have to do is stop their forward progress. That's all. My plan will accomplish this.

speaker: Shiharam
text: General Petrine! Do you truly think so little of us? It's true that we were born in Begnion and not Daein, but my men and I have been loyal to this country for eighteen years. We have spared no effort to learn all the proper manners and customs of this land. But now, after all of that, to be dismissed as a bunch of foreigners...

speaker: Petrine
text: No one asked how long you've lived here. Want to know why? Because no one cares! Certainly not me! Where were you born? Huh? Where were you raised? Ha! This country doesn't need squatters like you! The only people Daein can count on in times of crisis are Daeins themselves! Everyone else is just gutter leavings!

speaker: Shiharam
text: So we're useless...Is that what you're saying?

speaker: Petrine
text: You tell me, migrant! Why is it that your unit, which was trained to be an elite royal guard, is here patrolling this hick-infested backwater? The answer's clear to me! How about you?

speaker: Petrine
text: Oh, I'm sorry... Am I offending you? Well, here's your chance to show us your worth. Halt Crimea's advance! If you are as skilled as you claim, you should be able to limit the damage to its bare minimum, should you not?

speaker: Shiharam
text: Grrr...

speaker: Petrine
text: Hmph! Angry is a good look for you. I look forward to seeing the results of your work. Get going, outlander.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: G-General Shiharam... Must we truly go through with this? It's such a horrific act! It's only recently that the citizens hereabouts have even come to trust us.

speaker: Shiharam
text: We have no choice but to obey. It's as the woman says. The only thing we can do is ensure the Crimean army is defeated as soon as possible.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: General--

speaker: Shiharam
text: Open the floodgates. DO IT NOW!

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike, were you able to find the medallion?

speaker: Ike
text: No. It's gone. I fear that Daein may have somehow stolen it.

speaker: Elincia
text: What? Is such a thing possible?

speaker: Ike
text: I don't know to what degree, but there can be no questioning Daein's involvment.

speaker: Elincia
text: Is the medallion...special?

speaker: Ike
text: ...Yes...Oh, yes...

speaker: Elincia
text: ...I beg your pardon.

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Elincia
text: My question may have touched a sensitive area.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, no... It's not that I don't want to discuss it with you personally. I just can't really talk about it to anyone. It's a private matter.

speaker: Elincia
text: Ah, I see.

speaker: Ulki
text: Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: What is it, Ulki?

speaker: Ulki
text: I hear the sound of rushing water just ahead. A lot of it.

speaker: Ike
text: Rushing water?

speaker: Soren
text: According to the map, there's a large river up ahead.

speaker: Ike
text: That must be what you hear.

speaker: Ulki
text: This is unnatural. Warped. It is not the sound of a normal river...

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: General Ike! Sir, we've got trouble! The road ahead is blocked by water!

speaker: Elincia
text: What? How can that be?

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Perhaps a local river has flooded. The whole region is soaking wet.

speaker: Ike
text: Is the road completely impassable?

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: No, sir! We can move forward, but the water's turned the ground to mud. And the water is still flowing at a tremendous rate, sir! This is going to cut back our speed dramatically.

speaker: Soren
text: This is the work of Daein. They thought to impede our progress in order to gain some time for themselves. And they've succeeded.

speaker: Titania
text: Blast! Is there nothing we can do?

speaker: Soren
text: Well... If they were able to flood the road only when we approached, there must be floodgates in the area.

speaker: Ike
text: So if we can close them, we'll shut off the flow of water, right? That makes sense. Let's get some scouts looking for gates.

speaker: Janaff
text: What's that? Hey, if you're looking for something, leave it to me. I AM the hawk king's eyes, after all!

speaker: Ike
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Janaff
text: These peepers of mine can see for miles and miles. They're quite handy. It would be a shame not to use them.

speaker: Ike
text: Is that some laguz power? You're a hawk with the eyes of a...hawk?

speaker: Janaff
text: It beats your fantastic wit! My eyesight isn't a racial ability, it's just my own natural talent. Heck, my pal Ulki has ears that can hear grass growing on the other side of the country.

speaker: Ike
text: I see. Well then, the job's yours. Do you think you can find the floodgates?

speaker: Janaff
text: I just look for some openings with a lot of water pouring out, right? Yeah, I can handle that!

speaker: Shiharam
text: The Crimean army is here! All troops! Combat formations! Hit them fast and hard! We can't let this battle drag out!

speaker: Ike
text: So those are the floodgates.

speaker: Soren
text: If we can get them closed, the water will recede in about twelve hours or so.

speaker: Ike
text: All right, let's get going!

speaker: Ike
text: Are you all right? You look rather pale.

speaker: Jill
text: Oh, General Ike...

speaker: Ike
text: What is it? Mist is worried that you're not feeling well.

speaker: Jill
text: To be honest... The man leading the enemy forces, General Shiharam...He's my father.

speaker: Ike
text: What? Hmm... That's not good. Do you really want to face your father in combat?

speaker: Jill
text: I joined this army based on my own convictions. I think I can meet my father with my head held high.

speaker: Ike
text: Well, if you're sure... Just remember, if you change your mind, let me know. There's no need for you to be in the vanguard if you don't want to be.

speaker: Jill
text: Thank you...

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Lady Jill, is that you? What are you doing with the Crimeans?

speaker: Jill
text: I'm sorry... I've chosen the path that's right for me.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Pah! You would betray your own father?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: You...traitor!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: My lady Jill... No...Why does this have to be...

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Ge-General! How long are the floodgates to remain open?

speaker: Shiharam
text: Until the Crimean army has been defeated.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Sir! If we wait that long, all of the neighboring farmland will be drowned! The locals are already quite upset. They may not abide this much further.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: General!

speaker: Haar
text: Enough, soldier! If you've got the time to be bellyaching, take your butt out to the battlefield and kill some Crimean soldiers.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Captain Haar! Do you support this action? This is inhumane! Lives will be ruined! Daein citizens will die! Even if we claim that it's necessary in order to achieve victory... This is too much!

speaker: Haar
text: This is Daein's way. Are you ready to disobey the king and be put to the death for your troubles?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: I would rather die than kill innocent Daein civilians.

speaker: Haar
text: If you're executed as a traitor to the throne, your parents and siblings will also pay. Are you still prepared?

speaker: Haar
text: Now do you understand what I'm trying to tell you? Go. Fight bravely.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: ...Y-yes, sir!

speaker: Shiharam
text: To gain the trust of the king, we've become cruel and heartless. First hunting and executing the laguz...And now flooding the lands these people call home?

speaker: Haar
text: General Shiharam... If someone hears you use the word laguz in this country, you'll be branded a traitor.

speaker: Shiharam
text: Hmm...you're right as always. To live in this land, where laguz prejudice is so virulent, we've had to seal away everything we know and teach our children to hate all sub-humans. All that just to survive here.

speaker: Haar
text: It's Ashnard's fault this country has become what it is today. Ah, what a terrible miscalculation we made...Even so, I... I hated the idea of furthering the corruption of the imperial senate. I will continue to support your reasons for leaving Begnion.

speaker: Shiharam
text: ...I wonder if Jill has distanced herself from the Crimean forces.

speaker: Haar
text: I did...give her warning.

speaker: Shiharam
text: Above all else, I would like to avoid meeting my daughter in combat.

speaker: Haar
text: I pray that she does not take to the field this day. Knowing her temperament, talking with you would only increase both of your sorrows.

speaker: Shiharam
text: I have but one favor to ask of you.

speaker: Haar
text: Say it, and it will be done.

speaker: Shiharam
text: Do not fight today.

speaker: Haar
text: What?

speaker: Shiharam
text: Only one side can win a battle. If we are defeated in the end, I want you to care for the survivors and their families.

speaker: Haar
text: ...Yes, sir...Commander Shiharam.

speaker: Shiharam
text: Commander... It's been many a long year since you last called me that.

speaker: Haar
text: May the fortunes of war be with you. Through all that's...happened... It's been an honor to serve with you.

speaker: Shiharam
text: Mmm...

speaker: Soren
text: Ike! It's no use! The water's too high!

speaker: Ike
text: I...wasn't fast enough... No!

speaker: Titania
text: Ike... We must retreat! I'm sorry, but...we lose.

speaker: Ike
text: How can this be? Father...forgive me.

speaker: Jill
text: Father!

speaker: Shiharam
text: Jill...is that you?

speaker: Jill
text: Why...Why are you doing this terrible thing? You must close the floodgates now! The fields will be lost, but there may be time to save the homes.

speaker: Shiharam
text: I cannot...

speaker: Jill
text: Father?

speaker: Shiharam
text: If you wish to stop the water, you must defeat your father. That is...the...only way...

speaker: Jill
text: What is it? There has to be a reason! I know that an act like this cannot be what you desire.

speaker: Shiharam
text: ...Jill, you must leave. Please! If you can't do that, then slay me! There's no more time!

speaker: Jill
text: ...Very well! In that case, I will fight with you.

speaker: Shiharam
text: What did you say?

speaker: Jill
text: Not as a soldier of Daein, but as one of your soldiers. I will fight.

speaker: Shiharam
text: Jill, calm yourself. You mustn't get caught up in the emotions of the moment and lose your way.

speaker: Jill
text: Joining the Crimean army opened my eyes. For the first time, I was able to think about what I fight for. Until that moment, I only did as I was ordered...It was all for fame and glory. Now I finally understand. I fight for those I wish to protect. Father, I want to fight for you.

speaker: Shiharam
text: Even if you come to regret it?

speaker: Jill
text: Yes. I'm prepared for that. I...Jill Fizzart, hereby return myself to the command of General Shiharam. What are your orders, sir?

speaker: Grandma
text: Hold on, youngster! Who do you think you are? You can't just come barging into people's homes! Let me tell you something! You can ransack my home all you want, but you'll find nothing of value here. All our young men have been dragged off to war, and all that's left are women and children. If it's gold you're after, take that scroll on the floor there. You may be able to sell it. It's just something I picked up, so I don't know if it has any value. But take it anyway, you dirty thief!

speaker: Grandpa
text: You! You filthy Crimean! Get out! Get out now! There's nothing in this shack that would make you happy!

speaker: Grandpa
text: Oh, so you won't leave till you get something, is that it? Here, take this old staff! Now hit the road! You've no need to steal anything else from us! Or will you take my life, as well?! In that last skirmish... My boy, my only son... You stole his life, curse you! I hope you're satisfied!

speaker: Shiharam
text: Neither of us desires a drawn-out battle. Come! Hold nothing back!

speaker: Shiharam
text: ...Haar... The rest...is up...to you.........Ji...ll...

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: General Ike, sir! The floodgates have been closed!

speaker: Ike
text: Soren, what's the damage to the surrounding area?

speaker: Soren
text: It's terrible. All of the fields and homes have been completely destroyed.

speaker: Ike
text: I see...

speaker: Titania
text: ...I don't think this is what the enemy general wanted, either. So why did this have to happen?

speaker: Elincia
text: It's heartless... What will happen to those who've lost their homes? Can we do anything to help them?

speaker: Soren
text: You want to aid the people of our enemy? That is time and energy we cannot afford.

speaker: Ike
text: Soren. Take a portion of our supplies and distribute it among the locals.

speaker: Soren
text: What? Are you serious?

speaker: Ike
text: Our opponent is the Daein army. We've no quarrel with these people.

speaker: Soren
text: Ike, I know you feel for these people, but this is war! We don't have--

speaker: Ike
text: I don't know what it will accomplish, Soren. But, moving on without lifting a finger is something I cannot do.

speaker: Titania
text: I understand. I'd rather regret something I had done than regret taking no action at all.

speaker: Elincia
text: I would like to help, too. Perhaps I can aid the injured.

speaker: Soren
text: ...Idiocy...

speaker: Petrine
text: Well, that's that. We gained some time by flooding the river, but it won't hold them for long. I knew that foreign cur was useless... It looks like the decisive battle will be fought near the capital.

speaker: Ena
text: Preparations are complete, General Petrine. In order to ease command for you, Sir Bryan will serve as your deputy. Regarding strategy, it would be easiest if you spoke with him directly--

speaker: Petrine
text: Sorry to tell you this, Ena, but I'm not the one who'll be directing our forces in the capital.

speaker: Ena
text: Will it be the Black Knight then? Hmm...the plans must be adjusted slightly. I'll select someone else to act as deputy...

speaker: Petrine
text: No. Not him either. His Majesty wishes you to direct the defenses, Ena.

speaker: Ena
text: Me? I am to take command...of the army?

speaker: Petrine
text: That's right. You're moving up in the world, General Ena.

speaker: Ena
text: I...it's too much for me... I must confirm this with the king...

speaker: Petrine
text: Ha! What a rare sight this is. I've never seen you so flustered! Listen, if you wish to meet with His Majesty, you must fulfill your duties. He's ordered that there be no communications until that time.

speaker: Black Knight
text: I'm a bit late.

speaker: Petrine
text: Well, if it isn't the big Black Knight! It's been such a long time. You're always so very busy, aren't you? Here one day, there the next... Your secret maneuvers are--

speaker: Black Knight
text: They are proof of the trust His Majesty has placed in me. Ena, go to the east gate. You have a visitor.

speaker: Ena
text: Very well...

speaker: Petrine
text: Is it the Worm? Did he bring it with him?

speaker: Black Knight
text: It appears so. He insists that he give it directly over to Ena, though.

speaker: Petrine
text: Hmph! As long as it is ours, it makes no difference.

speaker: Black Knight
text: When Ena returns, you will be the one to take it directly to the king. Show care that it is not unwrapped on the way there. That could be...unfortunate.

speaker: Petrine
text: I don't need to be told that! More importantly, what will you do now?

speaker: Black Knight
text: Me? I will...

speaker: Unknown
text: Ena... Have you been well?

speaker: Ena
text: Where is Lehran's Medallion?

speaker: Unknown
text: Right here. Take it, please.

speaker: Ena
text: It feels so heavy...and it's not all the wrapping, either. Could this be the chaotic energy... of an evil god?

speaker: Unknown
text: So, you can now return to King Ashnard's side, can you not?

speaker: Ena
text: No. Not yet.

speaker: Unknown
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Ena
text: I've been entrusted with the defense of the capital. I...must face the Crimean army.

speaker: Unknown
text: No!

speaker: Ena
text: Thank you. You've done so much for me...But now, it's... It's enough. Please...Reclaim your freedom. There's no need for you to follow Daein's orders any longer.

speaker: Unknown
text: And you? Do you mean to die?

speaker: Ena
text: No... I cannot retreat. Even if I have to slaughter the entire Crimean army... I will return to him...

speaker: Unknown
text: Yet he thinks nothing of you...

speaker: Ena
text: That matters not. The only place I belong is at his side. I will most likely never see you again... I will pray for your eternal happiness.

speaker: Unknown
text: Ena! Wait!

speaker: Ena
text: Forget about me. That is my final request. Farewell...Nasir.

speaker: Jill
text: Oh, Father...

speaker: Ike
text: Jill... No matter the reasons, I'm the one who took your father from you. I can't use this war as an excuse.

speaker: Ike
text: If you want revenge on me for your father, I understand. You have...that right.

speaker: Ike
text: Once you've had some time to think things through, let me know what you will do. I'd like to have you stay with us, but... It's really up to you. That's all I had to say.

speaker: Jill
text: ...Sniff. ...Sn...sniff......

speaker: Haar
text: One, two, three... Five in all. We're lucky to have that many.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Captain Haar... What are we supposed to do now? General Shiharam is dead, and our homes are gone. What are we to do with our families?

speaker: Haar
text: What do you want to do? We've lost any right we had to stay here. So that leaves Begnion or Crimea...

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: General Shiharam was slain by Crimea...Joining with them now is not...It's not possible.

speaker: Haar
text: Then all you can do is return to Begnion. I doubt you'll get a hero's welcome, but...I've an old friend in the pegasus knights. Shall I contact her?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Sniff... Ah, gods. Eighteen long years...What does any of it mean now?

speaker: Haar
text: Don't say that! No matter what, I'm proud to have served under General Shiharam.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: You're right... It was an honor...

speaker: Calill
text: Yoo-hoo! You there! Young man! I have business with the general of this army. Would you convey a message?

speaker: Ike
text: Who are you?

speaker: Calill
text: ...Who am I? What kind of low-born greeting is that? My name is Calill, and I am a first-class mage.

speaker: Ike
text: And what would a first-class mage want with this army?

speaker: Calill
text: What's your problem? You look as if you don't believe me! Well,  suppose I can't hold that against you...It's not often you find beauty like this coupled with intelligence like mine. But it's true nonetheless.

speaker: Ike
text: A mage, huh? Well, I guess you can never have too many mages lying around.

speaker: Calill
text: Oh, and as a bonus, I'm quite skilled with a knife, as well. Beauty, brains, and brawn... Sigh! The goddess has seen fit to put the abilities of three people into one delectable package.Sounds like favoritism, doesn't it? A...Um...hellooooo? Are you listening to me? There's a beautiful woman talking!

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, the point is that you want to join the Crimean army, right? How much are you planning to charge?

speaker: Calill
text: Well, aren't you the little businessman? Let's see... How does free sound?

speaker: Ike
text: Suspicious. What's the catch?

speaker: Calill
text: I like my fees to be based on performance. Watch how I do in combat, and make me an offer.Depending on what it is, I'll decide whether or not to grace you with my assistance.

speaker: Ike
text: You're not lacking for confidence, are you?

speaker: Calill
text: Of course not! I already told you, I'm a first-class mage.

speaker: Ike
text: All right, you're in.

speaker: Calill
text: What? Are you allowed to make decisions like that on your own? Perhaps I should speak to the general!

speaker: Ike
text: I am the general.

speaker: Calill
text: Whaaaaaat?!

speaker: Ike
text: Reyson! Could you come down here for a moment?

speaker: Reyson
text: What do you need?

speaker: Ike
text: I've got something I want to ask you about.

speaker: Reyson
text: If I can help, I will.

speaker: Ike
text: Your... Your ancestors............

speaker: Ike
text: Forget it. It's nothing.

speaker: Reyson
text: What? Is something wrong?

speaker: Ike
text: I apologize. Please let it go.

speaker: Reyson
text: It seems like something important has happened, but if you do not want to discuss it, that is your right.However, if this weren't a battlefield, your secret might not be safe. Please take care in the future.

speaker: Ike
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Reyson
text: We of the heron clan...If we choose to, we can read the thoughts of others.

speaker: Ike
text: Seriously?

speaker: Reyson
text: However, this power is only available to us in a calm and peaceful environment.Here, in this desperate maelstrom of chaotic emotion, it avails me not. Energy here is warped and distorted.

speaker: Ike
text: You know, now that you mention it...Reyson, are you feeling sick?

speaker: Ike
text: You're so pale that it's hard to tell, but I think your face looks more wan than usual.

speaker: Reyson
text: Pay it no mind. I'm...fine.

speaker: Ike
text: You've got nothing to prove. Why don't you stay off the battlefield for a while?

speaker: Reyson
text: Ike! I'm fine, I promise. Please, do not give me special treatment.

speaker: Ike
text: As far as giving you special treatment goes, I don't really have a choice.I promised King Phoenicis I wouldn't push you too hard.If anything were to happen to you, I'd be at war with Daein and the bird clans at the same time!

speaker: Reyson
text: ...I see.I came to repay my debt, but I'm really just being a burden.

speaker: Ike
text: That was not my intention. Hold on a moment! Who said anything about you being a burden?

speaker: Reyson
text: I cannot engage in combat, so I'm nothing more than an obstacle in the field.

speaker: Ike
text: Reyson, no! That's absurd! Don't you understand how useful your abilities are?No one else can do the things that you can. You're irreplaceable.So if you're not feeling well and try to do too much, you may not be there when we really need you.

speaker: Reyson
text: I'm of use to you, then?

speaker: Ike
text: That's what I've been trying to tell you. We depend on you, and that's why I need to make sure you stay healthy.

speaker: Reyson
text: In that case... I wouldn't mind taking a short break. But you can call me anytime. I'll come right away.

speaker: Nasir
text: It appears that Leanne is being held in Gritnea Tower, to the south. That's right, isn't it, Ena?

speaker: Ena
text: Yes. That is correct.

speaker: Ike
text: How do you know that?

speaker: Ena
text: I was searching for information, and that search led me to a troop of Daein soldiers that had been assigned to the tower. It was the extra knowledge I needed.

speaker: Ike
text: You won't tell me any more than that, will you? No matter how important it might be to our upcoming fight.

speaker: Nasir
text: ...I beg your pardon.

speaker: Ike
text: I figured as much. I've already decided to trust you, so all that's left to do is move out.

speaker: Ike
text: That's Gritnea Tower, right?

speaker: Nasir
text: I believe so.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Say, Ike... There's something...really odd about that tower... Sniff...I mean REALLY odd...

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Ranulf
text: I sense several of the beast tribe, but...what is that? ...Sniff... Ugh! Something smells terrible!

speaker: Ena
text: The tower holds laguz who have been given toxins, foul potions that warp their true shape.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you talking about the laguz that can't change forms? Like the ones we fought in Begnion?

speaker: Ena
text: ...Yes.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Do you know how many and what type are in there?

speaker: Ena
text: As far as numbers...a conservative estimate would be thirty. Types? There are tigers and cats from the beast tribes, hawks and ravens from the bird tribes, and...dragons...

speaker: Ranulf
text: There are some from the dragon tribes as well?

speaker: Ena
text: No more than ten. Er...Probably no more than ten...

speaker: Ike
text: We have to fight ten dragons like you?

speaker: Ena
text: They are not like me, Master Ike. They are much stronger.

speaker: Ike
text: ...That's hardly encouraging...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Regardless, we must hurry. It's going to be dark soon. It's rather embarrassing, but we of the bird tribes don't move well in the dark.

speaker: Reyson
text: Sad but true. Of course, the same can be said for those on the enemy side as well.

speaker: Ranulf
text: On the other hand, darkness means next to nothing for my kind. Depending on who we face, it could prove to be a significant--

speaker: Ena
text: There are more of the beast tribe than any other. It is because we are close to Gallia.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Listen, you... Are you sure you want to be on our side?

speaker: Ena
text: ...Hm? Yes, of course. That is why I provide accurate information.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Nasir!

speaker: Nasir
text: What do you think, Ranulf? My grandchild is impressive, is she not?

speaker: Ranulf
text: That's not what I was going to say, Grandpa--

speaker: Ike
text: So once it gets dark, we're going to be at a disadvantage. Right? All right, as long as we know that, we can plan for it.

speaker: Ranulf
text: You're too calm about this for my tastes. This is going to be a--

speaker: Ike
text: Enough, Ranulf! We don't have time for complaints. We need to find the entrance to the tower.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Yeah, yeah. I'm coming.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Look at this, will you? What a glorious mix of birds, beasts, and dragons we have to greet us.

speaker: Ranulf
text: King of hawks! This is no joking matter! They--

speaker: Tibarn
text: Hold on, my brothers. Just a little longer. Soon, I will grant you all release.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Oh...

speaker: Reyson
text: Tibarn is not the only one who is filled with rage. To warp the gift that the goddess has granted us...This crime shall not go unpunished! Yaaaaa!!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Prince Reyson...

speaker: Ike
text: Come, Ranulf, let's join them. We must rescue Leanne as soon as possible...for Reyson's sake as much as anything else.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Those poor laguz... Someone will die for this today!

speaker: Leanne
text: (...Ahh? ...Where am I...)

speaker: Izuka
text: Whee hee hee! It appears that she's finally coming around!

speaker: Izuka
text: We brought this girl here on direct orders from His Majesty. Simple stuff, yes? Very easy, very nice. Then he gives all these special commands! Don't let her escape. Don't let her get sick. Don't let people kill her...More than anyone else, His Highness should know how hard it is to keep one of these birdies healthy...

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Is there a problem?

speaker: Izuka
text: Eh? Who do you think you are? Why is it you disturb my meditations! I'm thinking here!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Um... I'm here to relieve you on guard duty.

speaker: Izuka
text: Standing guard, eh? Don't see much reason for a guard in this place. But armies always have all their rules and regulations and appearances and hullabaloo...Ah, no way around it, I suppose.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: I believe that guards and watches are important.

speaker: Izuka
text: Wheee! In other places, yes. But Gritnea Tower is currently overflowing with veteran soldiers. Not to mention those repulsive beasts...Those Feral Ones, you know? Trying to escape from this place is the same as committing suicide! Not that I've tried, mind you.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: So a watch is necessary.

speaker: Izuka
text: Hmmm? Wheee! What's that now? Who said that?! Oh, it's you. Important, eh? Why's that?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Weeell...if the girl were to leave her room, we would be unable to stop her from getting killed.

speaker: Izuka
text: Ooo! You found a blind spot! That's the problem with us scholars! We concentrate on one thing and miss something as fundamental as--

speaker: Izuka
text: Blast! They're getting riled up again... Listen, you! You stay right here and stand guard. Don't let that heron girl take one step outside this room! Do you understand me? Wheee! I told you we needed guards!

speaker: Naesala
text: ...Sigh... Don't worry. I'll take care of everything.

speaker: Izuka
text: Bah! Always when I'm in the middle of something... Snaggle-toothed, cheese-stealing...

speaker: Naesala
text: Finally! Methinks that guy fell a little far from the nest...Hello, little heron girl. There's nothing to be afraid of. I won't hurt you. Just sit there and be quiet, all right?

speaker: Leanne
text: (Where is..this place? Who are you.....?)

speaker: Izuka
text: That took longer than I'd expected. Cursed sub-humans...flea-bitten wretches...Huh? Where's the heron girl? And the...guard? Helloooo? Guard? Bird girl? Wheeeeee? This can't... NO! I've been had! Nooooooooo! What do I do? If this is discovered, His Majesty will... He'll hang me up by my thumbs! Oh, no... Oooooh noooo...! No, no, no! I will not report this!Um... Uh... Think, Izuka, think! Hmmm...If I can somehow divert attention from myself...

speaker: Unknown
text: Master Izuka!

speaker: Izuka
text: Gyaaaa!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Master Izuka! We've got trouble! A strange group of insurgents approaches the tower! They are well armed, sir!...Master Izuka?

speaker: Izuka
text: Eh? Insurgents? Wheeee-- Um... Ahem! Did you say insurgents have appeared?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, sir! A mixed group of sub-humans and humans.

speaker: Izuka
text: Ah... I see, I see. Then we must give them a warm reception, no?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: General Heddwyn's mages have engaged them, but they're not nearly enough. We must apply to the capital for more reinforcements to--

speaker: Izuka
text: Release the Feral Ones.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Th-those monsters? But...

speaker: Izuka
text: No need to worry. I have just given them their medication. They've all been trained not to attack any Daein soldiers.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: V-very well, I--

speaker: Izuka
text: Do it now! The enemy must not be allowed inside the tower.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Y-yes, sir!

speaker: Izuka
text: ...Feh feh feh! Wheeeeeeee!!! What fortuitous timing. Now then, I will take this moment and prepare to make my escape.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: ...Whew. I thought as much when I first snuck in here, but this really is an unbelievable place. What in Ashera's name is going on? Why are all these crazed laguz creeping about?

speaker: Leanne
text: (I hate this!)

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Hm? Oh, you don't like this, eh? Neither do I. This helmet and armor are horribly restrictive, you know?

speaker: Naesala
text: How's that, Leanne? It's been twenty years, but I'm still quite an eyeful. Don't you agree?

speaker: Leanne
text: (You're very handsome, Naesala.)

speaker: Naesala
text: Yeah, I haven't changed much, eh? And you knew it was me back there right away, didn't you? Ah, I'm glad you survived. It's very good to see you again.

speaker: Leanne
text: (Yes..I am also pleased.)

speaker: Naesala
text: Now, on to the problem at hand. We went to the trouble of escaping that tower, so I'd hate to end up a meal for one of our insane cousins. Our objective is to rendezvous with Nealuchi. Here we go, Leanne. Hold on tight.

speaker: Leanne
text: (Yes I will!)

speaker: Naesala
text: What's going on? They're all looking the same direction.

speaker: Leanne
text: (Naesala! Over there!)

speaker: Naesala
text: Tibarn and friends, eh? Oh, very good. This will work out nicely...

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Ne-nestling!! We've found you at last!

speaker: Naesala
text: Nealuchi! You're here sooner than expected. You pushed your old wings to the limit, didn't you?

speaker: Nealuchi
text: I couldn't be late to the rescue of the dear lady Leanne, now could I?

speaker: Leanne
text: (Nealuchi! You came for me, too?)

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Oh! What a glorious sight...You look so much like your dear, departed mother...Sniff...

speaker: Leanne
text: (Don't cry, Nealuchi!)

speaker: Naesala
text: Hey, save your tears for later. While Tibarn and the others take care of the enemy, we must escape.

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Y-yes, of course! This way!

speaker: Heddwyn
text: This is not good... They're closing in. There are not enough Feral Ones. Someone! Anyone? Haaaalp! Go find Master Izuka at once!

speaker: Heddwyn
text: Master Izuka... Call...him...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Oof! I can't believe I'm saying this, but...I must withdraw.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ike! Any sign of her?

speaker: Ike
text: No, I don't see her anywhere.

speaker: Reyson
text: Leanne... Where have you gone?

speaker: Naesala
text: Hello, everyone. Are you having some sort of problem?

speaker: Reyson
text: Naesala!

speaker: Ike
text: Oh. King Kilvas. How nice.

speaker: Naesala
text: I believe I have what you seek right here.

speaker: Leanne
text: (Brother! Oh, my brother!)

speaker: Reyson
text: Leanne! You're safe!

speaker: Leanne
text: (Brother! Brother!)

speaker: Ike
text: ...You? You rescued her?

speaker: Naesala
text: Listen, and listen good. I don't want there to be any misunderstandings here. It was Tibarn! He forced me to do this. It wasn't any sense of charity or anything. It was a sort of...payment for the debt I had incurred.

speaker: Tibarn
text: I knew choosing you would pay off. Excellently done.

speaker: Naesala
text: Flatter me all you like, hawk king. You'll get nothing in return. As promised, the Duke Tanas account has been completely settled.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Yes, as agreed.

speaker: Naesala
text: Well then, I take my leave of you.

speaker: Tibarn
text: There's no need to rush off. Is there? Since you've come all this way, why not stay and help us with King Daein?

speaker: Ike
text: What a splendid idea.

speaker: Naesala
text: What? Enough of your nonsense. I prefer to keep my life intact, thank you.

speaker: Leanne
text: (Naesala, are you leaving?)

speaker: Naesala
text: Listen to me, Leanne. I have no good reason to fight the king of Daein.

speaker: Reyson
text: No good reason? And what about your fellow Kilvans? King Daein has taken their natural identity and warped it beyond repair!

speaker: Naesala
text: They left Kilvas of their own accord. How far should my responsibility for them extend?

speaker: Reyson
text: You...

speaker: Nasir
text: I hate to interrupt, but...

speaker: Ike
text: What is it, Nasir?

speaker: Nasir
text: I have something I want to show you all. Will you please come below?

speaker: Tibarn
text: This tower has a basement?

speaker: Nasir
text: We just discovered a hidden staircase.

speaker: Ike
text: Let's go.

speaker: Ike
text: What is that smell?

speaker: Nasir
text: ...It is...corruption.

speaker: Ike
text: It's too dark to see anything. We need light...

speaker: Ranulf
text: ...What, what is this? Oh, by the goddess...

speaker: Ranulf
text: W-what is this...?! Nasir! Answer me!

speaker: Ike
text: Ranulf?

speaker: Ena
text: Laguz... At one time, they were...laguz...

speaker: Elincia
text: I hope Ranulf and the others are all right. They behaved as if nothing had happened, but...I could sense they were in pain.

speaker: Ike
text: That dungeon was the most vile thing I have ever seen. I'm glad you weren't there.

speaker: Elincia
text: Was it that bad?

speaker: Ike
text: It was barbaric beyond description... There were more laguz corpses than we could count...They had been tortured. Twisted and warped beyond all recognition.

speaker: Elincia
text: Ah...such horrors...

speaker: Ike
text: Why would Ashnard do such things? What could be his purpose here?

speaker: Ena
text: ...The king called powerful beorc to his cause. But he had to see if they were worthy. He would test them by pitting them against those laguz. Ashnard considers laguz to be tools in service to his own mad ends. Nothing more. They are instruments to be used as he sees fit. I heard that he  ordered his scholars to perform all kinds of experiments...They used elixirs to drive them mad and keep them locked in their changed states...Their life spans were much shortened, but for a brief time, they became extremely powerful...they...

speaker: Ike
text: ...Thank you for telling us. Thanks to you, we found Leanne. You're free now. You can do whatever you like.

speaker: Ena
text: ...I will go to the capital. Please accept me into your army.

speaker: Ike
text: You don't have to do that. Fighting against your former companions could prove difficult.

speaker: Ena
text: Take me with you. There is something that I have to do. Please, Master Ike.

speaker: Nasir
text: I ask it of you as well. Please.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Very well. Let's fight together.

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: General Ike, the army has arrived at the outskirts of Melior. We await your deployment orders, sir.

speaker: Ike
text: Very well. Tell the men to stand down and await my command.

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: ...At last, we face the king of Daein.

speaker: Ike
text: Yes... The war is coming to an end.

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: It appears so.

speaker: Ike
text: Hm? Is there something bothering you?

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: No, of course not. It's nothing like that. But...

speaker: Ike
text: But what?

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: Some... Some of the soldiers are saying that when the war's over, their chances for promotion will dry up.

speaker: Ike
text: They want to continue fighting? Even though Crimea--and Daein, too-- have suffered so much?

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: No, that's not what I mean...I apologize. I will go inform the men.

speaker: Tanith
text: Well done! You've improved dramatically in a very short period of time.

speaker: Elincia
text: Do you think so?

speaker: Tanith
text: I do not know how to lie or offer false praise. I am deputy commander of the apostle's bodyguards. If you were not destined for greater things, I would petition the apostle herself for your enlistment.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh, thank you! I can't believe it myself. If not for your instruction, Tanith...This would not be possible.

speaker: Tanith
text: Training new recruits has long been my duty. And yet...I believe this is the first time anyone has been so appreciative. My other pupils commonly referred to me as the Great Demon. Isn't that so, Marcia?

speaker: Marcia
text: Great Demon? Mutton chops, no! D-don't be silly! We all adored our sincere and devoted deputy commander. Great Demon. Pfff! More like Great...uh...Angel...Lady...

speaker: Tanith
text: Ha! Sure. Seriously though, you've improved so much, Princess... Perhaps we should try something special...

speaker: Marcia
text: What? N-not that! She's not ready for that! You're crazy!

speaker: Elincia
text: Tanith, I...I'm not sure that I'm ready...

speaker: Tanith
text: Listen to me, Princess. The foes we are facing are Daein's elite troops, led by King Ashnard himself. How do you expect to fight them without at least one killing attack under your belt?

speaker: Marcia
text: You do it, Deputy Commander, and we'll keep practicing. Right, Princess Elincia?

speaker: Elincia
text: I... I will try it.

speaker: Marcia
text: Whaaaaat?!

speaker: Elincia
text: I want...to grow stronger. To reach that goal, I will do whatever it takes.

speaker: Tanith
text: Well spoken! Now then...to match your desire, I will fall back on the methods I used while training the apostle's bodyguards.

speaker: Elincia
text: All...right...

speaker: Marcia
text: Oh, horsemeat...

speaker: Tanith
text: Come, we have little time for niceties. Both of you, follow me! Now!!! Come on, maggots, do you want to live forever?!!!

speaker: Elincia
text: Y-yes, ma'am!

speaker: Marcia
text: Ugh... She really is a demon.

speaker: Ike
text: Hmm... The three of them look...busy...I think I'll wait until later to talk to them.

speaker: Mist
text: Father! Brother! It’s that lady Ike rescued...She’s awake!

speaker: Ike
text: Really?

speaker: Greil
text: Come on. Let’s greet our guest.

speaker: Greil
text: So, how are you feeling?

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh, I...I’m fine...And you are?

speaker: Greil
text: The name’s Greil. I’m the commander of this mercenary company.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Greil...You are the one who came to my aid, are you not? I don’t know how to thank you...

speaker: Greil
text: Hold on. The one who found you and brought you here is my son, Ike. If you want to thank someone, thank him.

speaker: Ike
text: No, please, that’s not–

speaker: Elincia
text: Lord...Ike, was it? You have my gratitude.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh...

speaker: Greil
text: Pardon my bluntness, but I have some questions for you. Tell me, who are you? What were you doing in that place?

speaker: Greil
text: The place where Ike found you was evidently the site of a fierce battle between Crimean and Daein forces. Do you have some relation to the Crimean royal family?

speaker: Ike
text: I make no promises, but we may be able to help you. Will you share your story with us?

speaker: Elincia
