text: You took me in and cared for me. I will...place my trust in you. Elincia Ridell Crimea. I am the daughter of King Ramon of Crimea.

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Greil
text: You say you are the princess of Crimea?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes.

speaker: Greil
text: That’s an odd claim to make. I’ve never heard of King Crimea having any children.

speaker: Elincia
text: That is...to be expected. My heritage, my very existence, has never been made public.

speaker: Ike
text: Why’s that?

speaker: Elincia
text: To avoid national turmoil. You see, I was born after my uncle, Lord Renning, was named as successor to the throne. So...

speaker: Greil
text: They kept you a secret to avert a possible blood feud. Yes, I’m willing to accept that for the time being. Very well, let’s suppose that you truly are Princess Crimea. You must know what’s become of the king and your uncle. I would like to hear that news.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...My father and my mother are dead...They fell at the hand of Ashnard, King of Daein...My lord uncle and the royal knights are still battling the Daein army, I believe.

speaker: Greil
text: I see.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...I...fled the castle...to follow my lord uncle’s orders and seek refuge in the kingdom of Gallia...

speaker: Greil
text: In Gallia?

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Yes. We believed that King Caineghis would grant me sanctuary. So that’s where I was going...But we were discovered by Daein troops, and I lost my escort of knights...My life–the life I have now–was purchased...with the blood of those brave knights...

speaker: Ike
text: Does King Daein know of your existence?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes. I was told the royals of each nation were informed of my identity in the event of dire circumstances...

speaker: Greil
text: If that’s the case, they must be searching frantically for you.

speaker: Elincia
text: Master Greil, my lord Ike, you said that you were mercenaries, did you not? Please...Would you help me to gain Gallia? I beg of you! I have...no one...no one else to turn to.

speaker: Titania
text: Princess Crimea? Truly?

speaker: Ike
text: Father spoke to her as if he believed she were telling the truth.

speaker: Titania
text: I see...

speaker: Ike
text: What is it, Titania?

speaker: Titania
text: Mm, it’s nothing. I was just remembering something from the past.

speaker: Ike
text: From the past? Back when you were still a Crimean royal knight?

speaker: Titania
text: What? How do you know about that?

speaker: Titania
text: A long time ago, I overheard Shinon and some others talking about it.

speaker: Titania
text: They keep such loose tongues.

speaker: Ike
text: Was it a secret?

speaker: Titania
text: No, it wasn’t, but...Much like I have more experience than you, I also have many more things to worry about.

speaker: Ike
text: Like Princess Crimea?

speaker: Titania
text: Well...yes. I myself was unaware of the princess’s existence, but...Now that I think about it, she does bear a striking resemblance to both the king and queen.

speaker: Ike
text: So she probably is the true princess. I wonder what Father will do. Will he take on her request?

speaker: Rolf
text: We’ve got trouble! There are soldiers! A lot of them!

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Greil
text: Is everyone here?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes.

speaker: Shinon
text: Commander, what are the Daein dogs saying?

speaker: Greil
text: Turn over Princess Crimea and leave the area immediately. Comply now, or we will attack.Pretty straightforward.

speaker: Gatrie
text: What are we going to do?

speaker: Greil
text: That’s what we’re here to decide. One thing has been made clear by the arrival of our friends outside.

speaker: Soren
text: So, I would say this confirms her identity as Princess Crimea, wouldn’t you?

speaker: Greil
text: Yes, but what do we do now? I’d like to hear the opinion of everyone here. Titania,I’d like to hear from you first.

speaker: Titania
text: The blame for this war rests on Daein. If we ally ourselves with them,the company’s reputation will surely suffer. Conversely, if we deliver Princess Crimea safely, our stock will risein the eyes of our primary employers. Our road is clear.

speaker: Greil
text: Soren, how about you?

speaker: Soren
text: There’s nothing to think about. We must deliver the princess to Daein immediately.

speaker: Greil
text: Even if Crimea is in the right?

speaker: Soren
text: We are mercenaries. Our actions are dictated only by self-interest. If we want to ensure our future, we need Daein in our debt. They will win this war, after all, and nothing else serves us better.

speaker: Greil
text: Shinon? Gatrie?

speaker: Shinon
text: Soren’s a pompous, superior whelp, but he’s got the right idea. Besides, the destination’s Gallia, so it’s a moot question. I don’t care how much we get paid; there’s no way under the sun I’m going to stinking beast country.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Princess Elincia...She does possess a certain regal beauty... There’s a lot to be said for that, you know. However I do prefer country girls...A bit cuter, and not quite so standoffish...Oh! Forget I said that.Whatever you decide is good for me, Commander. Yep, uh-huh, yep...

speaker: Greil
text: Oscar, Boyd, what about the two of you?

speaker: Oscar
text: I agree with Captain Titania. If we turn the princess over to the Daein army, we’re essentially giving them permission to kill her.

speaker: Boyd
text: I’m in favor of helping her. That’s what heroes are supposed to do.

speaker: Greil
text: Well, Rhys? What’s your opinion?

speaker: Rhys
text: I believe...that none of this hinges on whether she’s a princess or not. Refusing to aid someone in need is not something we should ever do. That’s what I think.

speaker: Rolf
text: That’s right! Let’s help her!

speaker: Mist
text: Please! We have to help her!

speaker: Greil
text: And what about you, Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: I agree with Titania. I say we help her and take her to Gallia.

speaker: Greil
text: I see. I think I know where you all stand.......Well then, here’s my decision.

speaker: Greil
text: We escort the princess to Gallia.

speaker: Shinon
text: ...Tsk.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Are you sure that’s for the best, Father?

speaker: Greil
text: Yes. Besides, I think the choice has been taken out of our hands.

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Greil
text: Open your ears and listen. Listen! All of you.

speaker: Boyd
text: Huh?...What is it?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Uh...I don’t hear a thing...

speaker: Shinon
text: Idiot! That’s the problem. Don’t you think that’s a bit odd? Complete silence, in all four directions.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Oh, so that’s what you’re talking about!

speaker: Ike
text: We’re surrounded. The soldiers aren’t waiting for an answer. They already decided to attack.

speaker: Titania
text: It would appear they had no intention of keeping their side of the proposed bargain.

speaker: Soren
text: They were planning on lulling us into a false sense of security and destroying every one of us.

speaker: Greil
text: Probably so. But the deal is, we’re not so naive or inexperienced as to fall for their trap. take your positions! We’re going to settle this right now!

speaker: Greil
text: I’ll go and hold the rear entrance. Ike! You’re in command here! Don’t let the enemy take the front.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Got it! Be careful, Commander!

speaker: Greil
text: Hah. I’ll give it a shot.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Reporting in, sir! The mercenaries have taken up arms and formed up in the bailey!

speaker: Dakova
text: Oh...so they’ve sniffed out our plan, have they? Which means they’re not an opponent that will be easily fooled. We’ll need something special.[

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Shall we continue with the planned attack?

speaker: Dakova
text: No...Princess Crimea is somewhere within that fort. If we use flaming arrows to try to smoke them out, we might bring the princess to harm. We’ve been told to do our best to deliver her alive and uninjured. It would be preferable if they were to come out of their own accord. If they do, slay all but the princess!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Dakova
text: What’s going on? Weren’t they supposed to be completely surrounded?

speaker: Dakova
text: I...don’t believe it...What went wrong...

speaker: Dakova
text: Grr...How’ve they lasted this long? Just who are these mercenaries? Knowing your enemy’s strength is vital to any strategy...Soldiers! Retreat! We fall back for now!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: General Dakova! No, not...the general...Not at the hands of these scum...I will not allow it! Aaaaah! Face me, and breathe your last, you wretched scum!

speaker: Soren
text: Ike! The enemy’s taken the fort!

speaker: Ike
text: Oh no! Mist and the others...

speaker: Titania
text: ...Ike...It’s too bad, but...We’ve been defeated.

speaker: Ike
text: How...? Father...forgive me...

speaker: Soren
text: We’ve cleared the surrounding area of Daein troops.

speaker: Ike
text: There’s no question about it. We’re enemies of the Daein kingdom now, aren’t we?

speaker: Greil
text: We’ve no time for rest! Everyone, pack your things now! We leave at once, before the enemy brings reinforcements!

speaker: Oscar
text: Understood! Boyd! Come with me.

speaker: Boyd
text: Right behind you, Brother!

speaker: Mist
text: Ah! We’ve got to hurry, too! Come on, Rolf! We’ve got to pack as much food and supplies as we can!

speaker: Rolf
text: Uh, whatever you say! Let’s go, Mist!

speaker: Greil
text: Titania! Take Shinon and Gatrie and make sure we have a secure road from here to the great forest. We’ll make our way to Gallia through the sea of trees.

speaker: Titania
text: On my way, sir!

speaker: Greil
text: Rhys, you stay with me. I want you to help me pull essential documents from the library. Everything else we burn.

speaker: Rhys
text: Y-yes, sir!

speaker: Greil
text: Ike! You’re in charge of the princess.

speaker: Ike
text: All right.

speaker: Ike
text: Princess Elincia! I’m going to ready a horse for you. What should we have you do...I know–go to the mess hall.

speaker: Elincia
text: I’m sorry?

speaker: Ike
text: Time will go by faster if you’re helping Mist than it will if you’re just sitting around waiting for me.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh, I understand. I can do that!

speaker: Mist
text: Sorry, this is kind of awkward. Making a princess help with packing...

speaker: Elincia
text: Please don’t worry, Mist. I just hope that I don’t end up slowing you down by getting in your way.

speaker: Mist
text: Don’t be silly! You’re so much better at this than I am. It’s a big help! Are all princesses as good at this sort of thing as you are?

speaker: Elincia
text: Ha ha! I wasn’t raised at court, so my life was a bit different than other princesses. I cooked,cleaned, sewed...Why, I did all manner of things.

speaker: Mist
text: Really? That’s surprising. I would never have guessed that by looking at you.

speaker: Elincia
text: Let’s see, I also rode horses, practiced swordfighting...Ah, Mist. What’s that around your neck?

speaker: Mist
text: What? Oh, ah...

speaker: Elincia
text: I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to...

speaker: Mist
text: ...I guess I can show it to you, Princess Elincia.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh...It’s a lovely... That’s an incredible medallion, isn’t it? I wonder what that light is.

speaker: Mist
text: It used to belong to my mother. It’s all I have to remember her by. Hmm...I don’t know where the light comes from. It didn’t used to be like that. A while back, it just started glowing.

speaker: Elincia
text: The world is full of mysteries, isn’t it? One thing is clear, though...It certainly is beautiful.

speaker: Mist
text: I wonder what that light means...

speaker: Petrine
text: What? What did you just say? I think I must be hearing things. I thought you said, They got away.

speaker: Dakova
text: Ge-General Petrine. I am deeply ashamed. By my honor...

speaker: Petrine
text: Honor? I care nothing for your pathetic honor. Have you forgotten the Daein army’s motto? Success or failure, life or death. Hey, you! Get this trash out of here!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, ma’am! Move it, you.

speaker: Dakova
text: W-wait! General Petrine, have mercy...

speaker: Petrine
text: Dog’s breath! I’m surrounded by worthless imbeciles. Ena!

speaker: Petrine
text: Tell me which way we should move to catch these mercenaries and the girl.

speaker: Ena
text: ...The Crimean capital, Melior, is already under King Ashnard’s control...The remnants of the Crimean army are neglible...Which means the only place left for the princess to turn is south, to the kingdom of Gallia.

speaker: Petrine
text: Hah! So the girl, like her dead father before her, seeks the friendship of those hairy devils, eh? What an absolutely stupefying world we live in.

speaker: Ena
text: If she gains sanctuary in Gallia, capturing the princess will become that much more difficult....The mercenaries she has escorting her are a powerful group, not one to be taken lightly. I will gather intelligence on them as quickly as...

speaker: Petrine
text: It’s not necessary. I will head up the pursuit of our wandering princess.

speaker: Ena
text: General Petrine, you will go...yourself?

speaker: Petrine
text: If we know where the princess and her band are headed, there’s no need for subtlety. I’ll just hunt them down and kill them. Mercenaries? Hah! What’re they to me? Remember, I am General Petrine! No matter who I face, I have never failed, nor will I ever! Ha ha ha...

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hey, Ike! I heard you're leaving. Going to Begnion, eh?

speaker: Ike
text: Hello, Ranulf. I was hoping I'd see you. I'd wanted to thank you for everything you've done. I'm glad to have the chance before I leave.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Well, aren't you the dutiful one! Hey, that reminds me...you were born here in Gallia, right? I knew there was something odd about you. You're awfully friendly for a beorc, you know! Oh, you might not know, but a beorc is what--

speaker: Ike
text: I know what it means. It's what you call us humans, right?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Oh, knew that, did you? Well then, let me tell you something else. When we use the word human, we mean it much the way you beorc do when you call us sub-human.

speaker: Ike
text: Really? It's an insult to be called human? I'm glad you told me. I would never have guessed.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I should warn you, if you run across any laguz who call you that, be careful. They are no friend of yours.

speaker: Ike
text: Got it. Thanks. I won't forget.

speaker: Ranulf
text: But I've digressed long enough. Let me explain why I'm here.

speaker: Ike
text: Huh?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Princess Elincia, may I have a moment of your time?

speaker: Elincia
text: Y-yes. Of course.

speaker: Ranulf
text: The king asked that I give you this. Please, accept it as a gift.

speaker: Elincia
text: What? May I ask--

speaker: Ranulf
text: Within that leather pouch is twenty thousand gold pieces. Beorc currency, of course.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh...I truly appreciate this generous offer, but a gift of this magnitude is not something I can accept. King Caineghis has done so much more than necessary already...

speaker: Ranulf
text: The king is ashamed that he cannot, at this time, provide any personal support. Please. Will you accept his apology and acknowledge his desire to aid you?

speaker: Elincia
text: But...

speaker: Ranulf
text: No? Well then, let's try this...

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes?

speaker: Ranulf
text: You accept the king's gift. Then, as payment for conducting you safely to Gallia,you hand it over to Ike...

speaker: Elincia
text: Um...

speaker: Ike
text: Come on, Ranulf. You can't expect her to accept this. And it's an outrageous fee, no matter how you look at it.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Twenty thousand gold for the life of a princess? Perfectly reasonable. In fact, it almost borders on insulting! Consider how you have suffered, the lives you have lost...Ten, no, a hundred times this amount would not be unreasonable.

speaker: Elincia
text: I... I have reconsidered. I will accept the king's kindness. In turn, I will present it to my lord Ike...You will accept it, will you not?

speaker: Ike
text: I...I will. Thank you.

speaker: Elincia
text: No, my lord Ike. It is I who must thank you.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Well, now that that's settled, let's move on. Unfortunately, we do not have any ships here in Gallia. If you are to find a ship that will take you to Begnion, you must return to occupied Crimea.

speaker: Ike
text: If there's no other way, then we'll just have to risk it.

speaker: Ranulf
text: No matter how cautiously you proceed, you're certain to run into Daein forces. Keep that in mind.

speaker: Ike
text: I understand. It's too bad we're so short on soldiers...Still, there's not much we can do about that now. However, I will review our supplies carefully before we depart.

speaker: Ranulf
text: In regard to your personnel problems, the king has decided to lend you what aid he can. Lethe! Mordecai!

speaker: Mordecai
text: I will join you.

speaker: Ike
text: Mordecai! And Lethe? Both of you? Are you sure?

speaker: Lethe
text: None of the others could stand the idea of traveling with humans. I myself tremble with loathing at the thought of going to Begnion, but...When the king gives an order,obedience is the only option.

speaker: Ike
text: That may be, but having witnessed the combat prowess of the Gallians for myself, I know how fortunate we are.

speaker: Mordecai
text: We will not fail you.

speaker: Lethe
text: Hsss! I've no intention of becoming friends! Do not forget that...And stay out of my way!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ha ha! You must forgive Lethe. Her tongue cuts as deep as her claws do. I will return once I've reported to the king. While I'm gone, please finish your preparations for departure.

speaker: Ike
text: Very well.

speaker: Soren
text: Ike, here's a summary of our last battle.

speaker: Soren
text: There were no casualties, and no one suffered permanent injury. We fought excellently.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hey, Ike! Hold up a moment. You know, I was thinking...Since this castle is on the way, we should probably stop by.

speaker: Ike
text: Um...really? Why? Is there something special about this place?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Why yes! There is! This is Canteus Castle! Daein seized it early on in the war Now, it serves as a camp for prisoners. I've even heard there are a number of Crimean retainers being held captive in the dungeon beneath the castle.

speaker: Elincia
text: What?! Are you certain?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Princess, I'm hurt! Of course my information is reliable.

speaker: Titania
text: If we can rescue some Crimean soldiers they might decide to join us. That would be quite a boon, would it not?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, it would. I think it's worth the risk.

speaker: Ranulf
text: The question now is how do you open these cells and free the prisoners?

speaker: Ike
text: The cells are certain to be locked, so in order to open them--

speaker: Soren
text: Logic would dictate that the keys will be in the possession of the jailer. We've no choice but to steal them. If we're lucky, the guards will have keys as well...In either case, we must move with caution. We don't want to trade blows with the entire castle garrison.

speaker: Ike
text: Which means we stay close to the walls and avoid being seen or heard, right? All right, then. Our first priority is to get our hands on the cell keys...

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hey! You there!

speaker: Volke
text: I have business with Sir Greil. Where is he?

speaker: Soren
text: You're sorely lacking in social etiquette, aren't you? State your business.

speaker: Volke
text: I'll speak with Sir Greil and Sir Greil alone. Now take me to him.

speaker: Titania
text: What you ask is impossible. Commander Greil is dead.

speaker: Volke
text: Well. That is a problem.

speaker: Titania
text: Just who are you, anyway?

speaker: Volke
text: Call me Volke. Sir Greil hired me. I'm in...intelligence.

speaker: Ike
text: My father hired you?

speaker: Volke
text: You are Sir Greil's son, correct? You'll do. Sir Greil hired me to investigate something. You pay my price, and I'll give you my report. Deal?

speaker: Ike
text: How much?

speaker: Volke
text: Fifty thousand.

speaker: Ike
text: That's a bit steep.

speaker: Volke
text: And worth every penny.

speaker: Ike
text: I don't have that much...Give me some time.

speaker: Volke
text: So, you're willing to pay?

speaker: Ike
text: My father hired you. He must have had a good reason.

speaker: Titania
text: Are you sure, Commander? We have no way of knowing if he's telling the truth.

speaker: Ike
text: We'll know when we see the contents of that report. Until then, let's have him travel with us.

speaker: Volke
text: So that's your plan, eh? Listen, you get the report when I get paid, and I'm not waiting around until then. I'll keep my information for the time being. Call me when you've got the gold. Stop into any tavern along your way. Tell the barkeep you've need of a fireman. You'll see me within an hour.

speaker: Soren
text: Hold a moment!

speaker: Soren
text: Intelligence...You said you were in intelligence, right? Is information the only thing you sell?

speaker: Volke
text: Come out with it. What are you asking?

speaker: Soren
text: Locks. Can you open locks?

speaker: Volke
text: Sure. Fifty gold per lock.

speaker: Ike
text: You're going to have him open the cell doors?

speaker: Titania
text: Is that wise? We've only just met him. There's no telling if we can trust him.

speaker: Ike
text: Volke, will you help us break into these cells?

speaker: Volke
text: As long as I get paid, I've got no complaint.

speaker: Ike
text: Titania? Objections?

speaker: Titania
text: I told you before, didn't I? You're the commander. If you decide on a course of action, I will but follow.

speaker: Ike
text: Volke, I beg your pardon, but let's pretend this little talk never happened.

speaker: Volke
text: Hm. If that's how you want things, so be it. I wouldn't have objected to traveling with you, not if it meant steady work, but...

speaker: Ike
text: Any objections, Soren?

speaker: Soren
text: I abide your decisions, Ike, as always.

speaker: Ike
text: What do the two of you think?

speaker: Titania
text: Under the circumstances, I think trusting a man about whom we know nothing is dangerous. I am opposed to this.

speaker: Soren
text: If we want to get those cells open, I think risk is going to be inevitable. If we don't have to steal keys, we can reduce that risk and improve our chances of rescuing the prisoners. It's worth a shot.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Righto! I'm off. Good luck and all that.

speaker: Ike
text: What? Wait! You're not going to help us here?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Much as I would like to, I have a job to do. I will rejoin you when I'm finished.

speaker: Ike
text: Hmm... I see. Well, good luck to you then.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Yes, and to you as well!

speaker: Brom
text: Uh...tell me something, will you? What's going to happen to us? Those Daein soldiers took my friends away, and they didn't never come back. What did they do to them?! Oh, something bad happened! I just know it!

speaker: Kieran
text: Quiet, fool! Keep your cowardly mutterings to yourself. It matters not what vile torture they devise. A true knight of Crimea is bold, steadfast, and strong. I care not if they pull out my nails with tongs or insert pins into the soft flesh of my underbelly or yank--

speaker: Brom
text: STOP IT! I can't bear torture! I'm not a professional soldier! I'm just part of the militia! I can't believe I left my family behind for this...Will I ever see them again? Oh, I want to go home.

speaker: Kieran
text: Curses...If only I had a weapon of some sort.

speaker: Nephenee
text: Help...will...come. I will not...give up...

speaker: Ike
text: You there! We've come to rescue you.

speaker: Ike
text: You're not a soldier, are you? Your clothing gives you away.

speaker: Sephiran
text: I am...a pilgrim. My name is Sephiran.

speaker: Ike
text: You're a monk? Why would they imprison you?

speaker: Sephiran
text: I was arrested in a nearby village, where I was tending to wounded Crimean knights. I received no trial but have nevertheless been kept prisoner in this place ever since.

speaker: Ike
text: I see... That explains it. We've come here to liberate the prisoners of war. You should take this opportunity to escape.

speaker: Sephiran
text: You will set me free? That is most gracious of you. If you've no objection, I would ask your name.

speaker: Ike
text: I am Ike of the Greil Mercenaries. Please, the cell door is open. You should leave while you can.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Thank you. Perhaps we will meet again, Ike.

speaker: Oscar
text: You're from Crimea, right? Come on--we're here to rescue you. We've opened your cell. Now's the time to escape.

speaker: Kieran
text: Ah! It's you!

speaker: Kieran
text: I could never forget that squint! Knights of Crimea, twelfth regiment...your name is Oscar!

speaker: Oscar
text: And you're... Wait a moment...You're Kieran, right?

speaker: Kieran
text: That is correct! I am Kieran...The same Kieran who has sworn himself to be your eternal rival!

speaker: Oscar
text: Uh...Right...Kieran...So...how've you been? You look good.

speaker: Kieran
text: As always, your manner is listless and inappropriate. It befits one who would call me foe! You were discharged three years ago...What are you doing here now? Aha! Could it be...You dastard! You've turned your coat and gone over to Daein, haven't you? Rarrrrr! What despicable, contemptible behavior! Unforgivable! Have you no shame? You were my one true rival! Where has your pride gone?

speaker: Oscar
text: The mercenary company I'm attached to serves under the command of the princess of Crimea! We came here to free any Crimean prisoners.

speaker: Kieran
text: The princess of Crimea?!? You're not part of the royal guard! How do you know about the princess?

speaker: Oscar
text: Well, like I said, the princess is our employer and--

speaker: Oscar
text: Aha! So that's your scheme, is it? You hope to distinguish yourself by meritorious service and gain the glory that is rightfully mine! Admit it!

speaker: Oscar
text: Look, my duty is...

speaker: Kieran
text: Blast you! Curse your name! Curse the name of Oscar and all who call him kin! I will never let you surpass me! Princess! I'm coming! Kieran will be forever at your side!

speaker: Oscar
text: Whoa...He's even more excitable than I remember. Hard to believe he's actually a decent knight...

speaker: Ike
text: You're a Crimean soldier, right? I've opened your cell. Let's get out of here.

speaker: Nephenee
text: Who...are you?

speaker: Ike
text: I'm Ike. I'm with a mercenary company hired by Princess Crimea. I can fill you in on the details later. For the time being, you'll just have to trust me.

speaker: Nephenee
text: ...Very well.

speaker: Ike
text: You're a Crimean soldier, right? Come on! I'm here to rescue you!

speaker: Brom
text: S-seriously? I'm not dreaming again, am I?

speaker: Ike
text: I'm a mercenary in the employ of Princess Elincia. I'll give you all the details later. For now, we have to move!

speaker: Brom
text: What? The princess? Oh, happy day! Wait, let me stretch a bit...Ooo...Sorry, I'm stiff from this hard floor...Ow! Ow ow ow! Cramp! Cramp!

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, for the love of--Come on! This way!

speaker: Brom
text: All, all right! Hold on a second...I don't remember the king having any children...

speaker: Ike
text: There's no time to explain! Hurry up!

speaker: Brom
text: Oh! Uh, c-c-coming!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: L-Look out! We're under attack!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Gwaah! Enemy soldiers!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Commander Danomill! The castle defenses have been breached! What are your orders, sir?

speaker: Danomill
text: What fortunate timing. We were starting to run low on prisoners. Do try to capture them alive. I won't have you robbing me of my fun!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: As you command, sir!

speaker: Ike
text: We've been spotted. There's nothing left to do but fight!

speaker: Danomill
text: Look who's come to play! I am so VERY happy to see you. Now then, are you ready to become my prisoners and live a life of eternal bliss within my lovely dungeon?

speaker: Danomill
text: You'll not escape...I will see all of you...dead...You will be exe...cu...ted...

speaker: Ike
text: I've brought one of the Crimean soldiers who was being held prisoner.

speaker: Elincia
text: Ahem...I'm sure you are unaware of this, but I am..

speaker: Kieran
text: Princess Elincia!

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh...yes. Quite right.

speaker: Kieran
text: I am Kieran! I served under General Geoffrey, as leader of Crimea's fifth platoon. My platoon had the honor of escorting you from the palace during Daein's attack!

speaker: Elincia
text: Really? You were there when...

speaker: Kieran
text: I was! Lord Renning ordered my platoon to accompany General Geoffrey and serve as your escort. Our mission was to see you safely out of Crimea to Gallia's king. But we failed you...And when you were lost to us...I believed my worthless life was at its end...Yet here you are! To think that I would be so blessed as to see you again...Such emotion...I...The tears...sniff...

speaker: Elincia
text: Kieran, were there any others?

speaker: Kieran
text: Such terrific emotion...So--I beg your pardon?

speaker: Elincia
text: Did anyone other than yourself survive?

speaker: Kieran
text: Of course! Though I was the only one unfortunate enough to suffer the misery of captivity. General Geoffrey and several of his soldiers fought off the Daein attack. They were able to slip away. Even now, they wait in Crimea, hoping for one last chance to strike a blow against Daein.

speaker: Elincia
text: Geoffrey...He is alive? Ah...How those words drive off the shadows across my heart...Thank you, Kieran. Thank you...for surviving.

speaker: Kieran
text: You are too kind, Your Highness. The opportunity to serve you again is the greatest reward I could ask for. For as long as I draw breath, I will stand ready at your side! This, I swear.

speaker: Ike
text: All right, we all know where Kieran stands...How about you two? Will you recognize Princess Elincia as the rightful heir to the Crimean throne? Will you fight for her?

speaker: Brom
text: Look here. My name's Brom, and this lass is Nephenee. We're just simple country militiamen from the same territory. Now, we don't know much about nobles and stuff. Kings and queens don't matter much when you're workin' the fields. 'Course, we know we'll be in trouble if someone takes our fields away from us, so that's why we joined the militia! This king of Daein's no friend of ours. And I hear he's doing terrible things, too... Vile tortures with rusty nails and...and more! What's going to happen to my family? I left them all back home, and I'm so worried I can hardly see straight.

speaker: Nephenee
text: If you can defeat the king of Daein, will this country return to the way it used to be? Is that what you're after?

speaker: Elincia
text: It is my hope. I may not be as powerful as my father, but I will never abandon Crimea.

speaker: Brom
text: You sound like a lady who stands by her word. Looks like my choice is easy!

speaker: Nephenee
text: Mine too.

speaker: Brom
text: I'll fight in your name. I'll help you and yours, and we'll send those Daein egg suckers packing!

speaker: Elincia
text: Thank you.

speaker: Unknown
text: I beg your pardon...

speaker: Ike
text: You're...

speaker: Nephenee
text: O blessed saint...

speaker: Brom
text: Master Sephiran! You live!

speaker: Sephiran
text: Brom, Nephenee...Are either of you wounded?

speaker: Brom
text: We're fine, but what about you? You were jailed for helping us...I'm so sorry! Oh, I hope they didn't hurt you!

speaker: Sephiran
text: It is nothing to fret about. Everyone is safe, and that is what matters.

speaker: Nephenee
text: O blessed one...

speaker: Sephiran
text: Pardon me...May I have a moment of your time?

speaker: Ike
text: Who are you?

speaker: Sephiran
text: I am a monk on pilgrimage. My name is Sephiran. Thanks to your efforts, I have been freed from my imprisonment.

speaker: Ike
text: A monk? Why did the Daein army arrest you?

speaker: Sephiran
text: I was arrested in a nearby village where I was treating wounded Crimean knights. I received no trial but taken prisoner nevertheless. I was scheduled to be executed on the morrow. I owe you my life. I thank you from the bottom of my heart.

speaker: Ike
text: You don't have to thank us. However, I am curious about your situation. Why were you aiding Crimean soldiers?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Do you question my story?

speaker: Ike
text: You're a monk on pilgrimage as well as an ally of Crimean resistance fighters? Under the circumstances, do you blame me?

speaker: Sephiran
text: Tell me something, Ike. If you came across a wounded person, could you ignore his plight?

speaker: Ike
text: Normally...No, I could not. But in times like these, where it means risking my own life... I don't know. It's tough to say.

speaker: Sephiran
text: Ha ha...You're quite honest. However, if actually faced with such a choice, a man such as yourself would not hesitate. If faced with an individual in pain, you would act instinctively. Your body would not wait for the command.

speaker: Ike
text: Who...Who are you? Really. You're so calm, so full of peace. I can't believe you're a simple monk.

speaker: Sephiran
text: If you'll forgive me, I must be going. Fare thee well, young warrior. I am certain that we will meet again.

speaker: Volke
text: ...Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, hello, Volke. What do you want?

speaker: Volke
text: I was thinking about traveling with you for a bit. I'll be in the general area, so if you need anything, you can call me. I'll help you out...for a fee, of course.

speaker: Titania
text: What did you say?

speaker: Ike
text: Why would you do such a thing? In times such as these, there must be many parties that need...intelligence.

speaker: Volke
text: Well, you've sparked my curiosity. And besides...No, we'll just have to leave it at that.

speaker: Titania
text: That's not acceptable.

speaker: Volke
text: Don't be so inflexible. It's not as if I'll be joining your merry band or anything. This is strictly business.

speaker: Titania
text: And yet you--

speaker: Ike
text: Titania.

speaker: Soren
text: I believe this is a good opportunity. We will almost certainly have need of this man's talents. He is a dubious character at best, but at least we know his motives. Everything begins and ends with gold. He'll be easy to control.

speaker: Ike
text: Soren, he's standing right there.

speaker: Soren
text: I don't think he minds.

speaker: Titania
text: What will it be, Ike? The decision's yours.

speaker: Ike
text: Very well. You may do as you like.

speaker: Volke
text: Excellent. Call me if you need anything.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm sorry, but I cannot accept your proposition. However, as we discussed earlier, I will summon you when we have the fee for my father's information. Is that acceptable?

speaker: Volke
text: Agreed. Be seeing you.

speaker: Ranulf
text: First the thief and then that monk...What an odd band of characters you've attracted!

speaker: Ike
text: Ranulf! Have you finished your errands?

speaker: Ranulf
text: All done! But about those two--

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, they're both rather mysterious.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Well, the monk seems like a decent enough fellow.

speaker: Ike
text: Determining who is a friend and who is a foe is something I must be able to do. But it's just so hard.

speaker: Ranulf
text: That's only because you don't have enough information to base your judgment on. All we can do now is press on.

speaker: Ike
text: You're right...

speaker: Tiger Laguz
text: You there! Beorc! What do you think you're doing?

speaker: Ike
text: I was trying to get back to my room, but I've lost my way. Can you tell me which way I need to go?

speaker: Tiger Laguz
text: It's this way. Follow me. Hey! Not so close! Walk behind me.

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Tiger Laguz
text: Er... Pardon me. The king has ordered us to treat beorc with kindness, but... It will...take some time. It is difficult to fight that instinct. Perhaps some memory of the slavery our forefathers suffered at beorc hands flows in our blood.

speaker: Ike
text: I understand. I'll keep my distance.

speaker: Tiger Laguz
text: Very well...Let's go.

speaker: Ike
text: All right.

speaker: Marcia
text: And so we put this guy right here, and this dealy-bobber goes there...and we're finished!

speaker: Ike
text: Packing, huh? Want some help?

speaker: Marcia
text: Do I want some...? Pfff! You're a hoot, handsome! I'm already done!

speaker: Ike
text: You're more skillful at this than I would've imagined. Or is it that Mist is woefully inept?

speaker: Marcia
text: Aw, the Begnion pegasus knights were always moving around, so I learned to pack quickly. They used to train us on it all the time...Go here... Pack this...Fun stuff!

speaker: Ike
text: Is that so? I can see that you have a strong sense of duty. Quitting the Begnion pegasus knights to join us must seem...

speaker: Marcia
text: What are you saying? I'm a burden now?

speaker: Ike
text: Um...no. I'm very grateful you're here. As I told you before, we're short on personnel.

speaker: Marcia
text: Oh. Good then! And I'm happy to be here! Um...say, Ike? You don't need to worry about me quitting the Begnion service. My decision wasn't based solely on my desire to repay you...

speaker: Ike
text: You had other reasons?

speaker: Marcia
text: Yes. I...I'm also searching for my missing brother. He may be a dolt and a scoundrel, but he's all the family I have in this world. Remember when you found me? When we were fighting the pirates? Well, I was trying to track him down. But every time I go looking for him, I end up in some dangerous situation with ugly boat monkeys trying to kill me.

speaker: Ike
text: Heh. So that's why you decided to join us, is it? I can understand that.

speaker: Marcia
text: So, are you sorry you asked?

speaker: Ike
text: Not at all. The important thing is finding your brother as quickly as possible, right?

speaker: Marcia
text: That's the plan!

speaker: Ike
text: You seem...depressed.

speaker: Lethe
text: Look at who I'm trapped with! Of course I am depressed... And keep your worthless observations to yourself. All of you are so slow...I can't believe you're still not ready.

speaker: Ike
text: Sorry about that. If we were like you and didn't need to carry anything, it would be easier, but...We have weapons and things to get ready.

speaker: Lethe
text: Weapons of steel are a human weakness. Without them, you cannot fight properly.

speaker: Ike
text: But...Lethe, you're carrying a dagger, aren't you? In the scabbard on your leg?

speaker: Lethe
text: This...is not for fighting.

speaker: Ike
text: Then what's it for?

speaker: Lethe
text: I use it to remove small bones from meat. It can also cut fruit into bite-sized pieces. It has proven quite useful.

speaker: Ike
text: Hmm...

speaker: Lethe
text: What? If you've got something to say, spit it out!

speaker: Ike
text: You despise beorc, but you don't mind beorc-crafted tools?

speaker: Lethe
text: If something's good, it's good. Denying something's obvious worth out of petty spite is foolish. It's not that I...I do not despise everything beorc. If every beorc could get along with us as well as you do, I'm certain...

speaker: Ike
text: Lethe?

speaker: Lethe
text: This is a ridiculous conversation! I'm leaving now.

speaker: Ike
text: Here are two Crimean soldiers who were being held as prisoners.

speaker: Elincia
text: Ahem...This may come as a surprise, but...My name is Elincia. I am the daughter of Ramon, king of Crimea, who was so recently killed by Daein's heartless attack. I'm on a mission to liberate and restore our homeland...And I need all the support I can garner.

speaker: Ike
text: We need to know where you stand. Will you recognize Princess Elincia as the Crimean heir? Will you fight for her?

speaker: Brom
text: Look here. My name's Brom, and this lass is Nephenee. We're just simple country militiamen from the same territory. Now, we don't know much about nobles and stuff. Kings and queens don't matter much when you're workin' the fields. 'Course, we know we'll be in trouble if someone takes our fields away from us, so that's why we joined the militia! This king of Daein's no friend of ours. And I hear he's doing terrible things, too... Vile tortures with rusty nails and...and more! What's going to happen to my family? I left them all back home, and I'm so worried I can hardly see straight.

speaker: Nephenee
text: If you can defeat the king of Daein, will this country return to the way it used to be? Is that what you're after?

speaker: Elincia
text: It is my hope. I may not be as powerful as my father, but I will never abandon Crimea.

speaker: Brom
text: You sound like a lady who stands by her word. Looks like my choice is easy!

speaker: Nephenee
text: Yes?

speaker: Brom
text: I'll fight in your name. I'll help you and yours, and we'll send those Daein egg suckers packing!

speaker: Elincia
text: Thank you.

speaker: Unknown
text: I beg your pardon...

speaker: Ike
text: You're...

speaker: Nephenee
text: O blessed saint...

speaker: Brom
text: Master Sephiran! You live!

speaker: Sephiran
text: Brom, Nephenee...Are either of you wounded?

speaker: Brom
text: We're fine, but what about you? You were jailed for helping us...I'm so sorry! Oh, I hope they didn't hurt you!

speaker: Sephiran
text: It is nothing to fret about. Everyone is safe, and that is what matters.

speaker: Nephenee
text: O blessed one...

speaker: Ike
text: Pardon me, may I have a moment?

speaker: Sephiran
text: And you are?

speaker: Ike
text: I'm Ike. I'm the commander of this mercenary company.

speaker: Sephiran
text: That must mean you're the one responsible for giving me back my freedom. I am Sephiran, a monk on pilgrimage. Please allow me to express my gratitude. Thank you.

speaker: Unknown
text: Leanne! I'm coming in.

speaker: Leanne
text: (King Tibarn!)

speaker: Tibarn
text: How are you feeling?

speaker: Leanne
text: (Today I am feeling most splendid.)

speaker: Tibarn
text: Ah, it is good to hear that you are well. Not surprising--it is a beautiful day!

speaker: Leanne
text: (I am growing used to the smell of the sea.)

speaker: Tibarn
text: Yes, we hawks enjoy the smell of the sea as well. Then you are starting to feel more at home here? Good, good. And how is Lord Lorazieh?

speaker: Leanne
text: (...Unchanged......)

speaker: Tibarn
text: Hm... I had thought his condition might have improved. Well, let's hope for a brighter tomorrow.

speaker: Lotz
text: You can understand what the heron princess is saying, can't you, Your Majesty?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Hm? Yes. Well, some of it, at least. Oh, you weren't around when Reyson first got here, were you, Lotz? When he arrived, he was just like this. You'd never know it by how fluently he speaks our modern tongue, would you?

speaker: Lotz
text: Now that you mention it, he does use some funny words when he gets angry. But, the letter that just arrived is written in standard script, isn't it?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Over these twenty years, he's gained total mastery of...You...you read the letter, didn't you?!

speaker: Lotz
text: N-no, I just caught a glimpse of it in your hand. That's all. I'm sorry! Er...Your Majesty...

speaker: Tibarn
text: You little scamp...

speaker: Leanne
text: (A letter?)

speaker: Tibarn
text: Hm? Yes, that's right. It's a letter from Reyson. It appears the Crimean army has passed safely through Daein and is on its way to the homeland.

speaker: Leanne
text: (What good news! So he's doing well, isn't he?)

speaker: Tibarn
text: Yes, Reyson is fine, but... I wonder what happened. He doesn't give details, but he asks Phoenicis to send reinforcements.

speaker: Lotz
text: If Prince Reyson is asking for help, things must be fairly serious.

speaker: Tibarn
text: I'd like nothing better than to take wing immediately, but I can't leave Lord Lorazieh and Leanne here alone...

speaker: Leanne
text: (I'll go with you!)

speaker: Tibarn
text: No, that won't work.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Don't try that look on me. There's no way I'm taking you with me.

speaker: Lotz
text: Yeah, that's crazy talk!

speaker: Leanne
text: (...Big meanie!!)

speaker: Tibarn
text: I suppose it's time to put my plan into action.

speaker: Lotz
text: What is it?

speaker: Leanne
text: (Plan?)

speaker: Tibarn
text: All right, I'm off to Gallia to get things settled. Lotz, I want you to watch over Leanne and help her pack.

speaker: Lotz
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Leanne
text: (Please put that cloth in here.)

speaker: Lotz
text: Um, I... I don't have any idea what you're trying to say. Maybe I should talk louder...

speaker: Leanne
text: (Tee hee! You're not very smart! I wasnt you to take this. and put it in here.)

speaker: Lotz
text: Um, DO YOU WANT ME... TO PUT THIS...IN THAT BAG??

speaker: Leanne
text: (Yes, yes.)

speaker: Lotz
text: Got it! In it goes! I'm getting the hang of this. I'M PUTTING IT IN THE BAG!

speaker: Leanne
text: (Ah! Aaaaahhhh!!!)

speaker: Lotz
text: What? Is something wrong?

speaker: Leanne
text: (Who's there!?)

speaker: Lotz
text: What are you...? Over there? Behind me? WHAT? SOMEONE IS BEHIND ME?? Gwaaaa!!!

speaker: Leanne
text: (Lotz! No! Let him go!)

speaker: Black Knight
text: If you want your father to be killed, then by all means keep screaming.

speaker: Leanne
text: (...Brother...)

speaker: Ashnard
text: Ah! The prodigal son returns!

speaker: Black Knight
text: I have gained that which you requested.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Show me.

speaker: Black Knight
text: This way.

speaker: Ashnard
text: These heron royals all look alike, don't they? Perhaps it proves their bloodline, but it's unsettling how similar they are.

speaker: Black Knight
text: I believe you had one in your possession previously.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Yes, I tried to get her to free the dark god from the medallion, but all she did was get sick and die. Pah! They're ridiculously frail creatures. I should have just killed her in the first place and saved some time.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Might I suggest this one be treated with more care? Capturing her was not an easy task.

speaker: Ashnard
text: For you, it did take quite a long time...Didn't it?

speaker: Black Knight
text: Diverting the sharp eyes of the hawk king proved to be quite difficult. It required much planning and care.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Ha! Don't tell me it was difficult! I know you! I know you use that arcane powder to travel about at will.

speaker: Black Knight
text: The powder drains my strength. For that reason, I would rather not use it unless absolutely necessary.

speaker: Ashnard
text: You are an enigma, dark one. Everything you possess is fey and of unknown origin.

speaker: Black Knight
text: The armor I presented to you...Do you find it dissatisfactory?

speaker: Ashnard
text: No, it has my approval. My wyvern Rajaion, and this armor which renders any enemy attack impotent... Both are well suited to me. They both shine because they are mine! And now the medallion, and that galdr as well, both belong in my hands!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Will the revival of the dark god take place soon?

speaker: Ashnard
text: Let me see... The conditions aren't bad. But, how long will they continue...Har! It is no matter. As long as all my chess pieces are on the board, things will work out. Soon every knee will bow to Ashnard!

speaker: Tibarn
text: ...What is going on? What's happened here?

speaker: Lotz
text: M-my...king...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Lotz! Hold on!

speaker: Lotz
text: I'm...so...sorry......the...princess......

speaker: Tibarn
text: Who did this? Who was the craven dastard that did this to you?

speaker: Lotz
text: ...Knight...in...black armor...Gwaa...urrk!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Lotz! No! Curse you, Daein! This was evilly done! Well, if you think to play such a game, you'll not find me an easy mark!

speaker: Ike
text: Ranulf! Whereabouts is the Gallian army encamped?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Just over those mountains.

speaker: Ike
text: So we're finally going to join forces...

speaker: Ranulf
text: Reports say that King Ashnard is gathering his forces in the capital. The time to work together is certainly upon us.

speaker: Soren
text: Ike! There's an enemy ambush waiting for us on that mountain.

speaker: Ike
text: Mmm... If we go around that mountain and avoid it, how much time will we lose?

speaker: Soren
text: A couple of days, at least.

speaker: Ike
text: In that case, we've no choice but to go through them, right?

speaker: Soren
text: Agreed.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Um, wait a second... Isn't this where there's usually some sort of discussion? Hello?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: The enemy approaches, sir.

speaker: Gromell
text: Listen up, men! Let them get as close as possible before pushing the rocks over the cliff. We must not let Crimea join forces with those sub-humans!

speaker: Titania
text: Commander, the foes are encamped on top of the rise. I wonder what sort of trap they have this time.

speaker: Ike
text: Those boulders didn't get up there all by themselves... Are they seriously going to roll them down on us?

speaker: Soren
text: At first glance, it seems a simplistic trap, but these narrow paths make avoiding the rocks impossible. I think they may be surprisingly effective.

speaker: Ike
text: So...

speaker: Ranulf
text: We run up the mountain as quickly as possible and smash the enemy commander! Right?

speaker: Ike
text: Right... How did you--

speaker: Ranulf
text: I know...genius.

speaker: Soren
text: Actually, that is the best plan. Try to avoid the boulders and reach the top as quickly as possible. Once there, defeat the general.

speaker: Ike
text: Right. Move out!

speaker: Gromell
text: Grr! So you've made it this far, have you? Then prepare to be sent down screaming!

speaker: Gromell
text: Heh heh...ha ha ha...Gather as many fools as you like...your weakness cannot survive...No one on this earth can withstand the might...of our king...

speaker: Ike
text: Is this the lot of them?

speaker: Ranulf
text: It looked like there were more of them from down there.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Now we've got you! Eat rock! Heh...eat rock... I'm pretty clever...

speaker: Elincia
text: Above us! Look out!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Need a hand?

speaker: Reyson
text: Tibarn! You came!

speaker: Tibarn
text: Well met, Reyson. And well met to the rest of you as well, warriors of Crimea.

speaker: Ike
text: How did you come to be here?

speaker: Tibarn
text: I thought I'd help you wipe out Daein.

speaker: Ike
text: That's good news for us, but has something happened? Why did you suddenly decide to help?

speaker: Reyson
text: I asked for his aid. We must defeat King Daein. To that end, the more powerful we are, the better. Yes?

speaker: Ike
text: So that's the story, is it?

speaker: Tibarn
text: It's true that Reyson requested my aid. However, that's not the only reason that I'm here.

speaker: Reyson
text: Hm? What is it?

speaker: Tibarn
text: In a moment. First, let us meet with the king of lions. He waits for us at the foot of the mountain.

speaker: Ike
text: Understood. Come on, everyone! Let's get off this peak and take a rest at the bottom.

speaker: Elincia
text: King Caineghis! It's an honor to see you again.

speaker: Caineghis
text: First, let me offer you my congratulations. You've made quite the triumphant return, Princess Elincia.

speaker: Elincia
text: Thank you. And allow me to express my gratitude for having the kingdom of Gallia fighting at our side. Your presence fills me with strength.

speaker: Caineghis
text: During this short interim, you've managed to turn the tide of the war. To be honest, I'm quite surprised.

speaker: Elincia
text: I didn't...I didn't come this far on my own. My lord Ike and his brave companions were with me. It was only with the support of many that I was able to return home.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Yes, my reports cover most of that. Everything that happened in Begnion, and in Daein as well.

speaker: Elincia
text: As to that... About Nasi--

speaker: Tibarn
text: King Gallia! Princess Crimea! I apologize for interrupting the festivities, but there's something I must discuss with you. Would you gather over there?

speaker: Caineghis
text: This group contains the people who were at the heart of that last battle, correct?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes, it is.

speaker: Tibarn
text: What about those two children? Surely they weren't involved.

speaker: Soren
text: ...Children?

speaker: Mist
text: Um...

speaker: Ike
text: This is Soren. He's my tactician.

speaker: Ike
text: And this is my sister, Mist. Before we begin this war council, there's something I need to share with all of you...It's a story that involves my parents as well. I've kept most of it from my sister, but I felt this would be a good chance for her to hear it, so I asked her to join us.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Understood. Go on.

speaker: Ike
text: It all begins when we meet Princess Elincia and escorted her into the forests of Gallia...

speaker: Ike
text: And that is everything I know.

speaker: Mist
text: F-Father...he... Is that how...Mom? That's...not true, is it?

speaker: Titania
text: Mist... Do you want to leave?

speaker: Mist
text: Um... No...I'm all right. I'm all right...I'm just a little confused.

speaker: Titania
text: Mist...

speaker: Caineghis
text: That's the whole of it, eh?

speaker: Tibarn
text: So this wasn't ever just a dispute between Crimea and Daein... There was something else at play the entire time.

speaker: Elincia
text: What could King Ashnard's ultimate goal possibly be? He has risked everything, even surrendering his own country...

speaker: Caineghis
text: Twenty years ago, even before he became king, he tried to release the dark god from within the medallion. However, he was thwarted by the actions of Greil and Elena.

speaker: Ike
text: What manner of being is this dark god? What would happen if it were freed from its prison?

speaker: Caineghis
text: I fear the world would once again be beset by natural calamity--much like it was 800 years ago. At that time, all the world, save Tellius, was drowned beneath the seas.

speaker: Elincia
text: That is a true story? I thought it nothing more than a fable...

speaker: Caineghis
text: We have living proof: Goldoa's King Deghinsea. He and two other heroes fought alongside the goddess herself to defeat the dark one.

speaker: Elincia
text: King Goldoa was one of the legendary heroes? But he's...still alive...

speaker: Tibarn
text: The Black Dragon King is a living fossil, and as stubborn as anything alive. He's been trying to control the rest of us for years, and he always says the same thing. Do not fan the flames of strife. As long as Lehran's medallion exists, you must never begin a war that engulfs the entire continent.

speaker: Soren
text: ...Never begin a war? It's possible...Perhaps there is more than one way for the dark god to gain its freedom.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Oh ho! Aren't you the clever one? That's just what the Black Dragon King says. Yet, the truth of that is unknown. There's a war going on right now, but the dark god's nowhere in sight, is it?

speaker: Soren
text: ...Could it be...? I think I may finally know Ashnard's intentions.

speaker: Ike
text: Really?

speaker: Soren
text: King Goldoa said that a conflict which engulfs the entire continent would free the dark god from the medallion. Let us assume that the war would have such an effect on the medallion no matter where it was...or who possessed it. And let's also assume that the king of Daein thinks this as well. I can hear him now...Where is the tinder for the blaze I need? The answer to this question proved to be an easy one. Yet he had to find a way to test his theory...So, he attacked neighboring Crimea. It had to be Crimea. Begnion was too big, too powerful. Daein would have lost. Crimea, however, is a country known more for its scholarship than its military strength. Daein probably felt that a surprise invasion would let them win while taking minimal casualties themselves. And they were right. Crimea was easy prey.

speaker: Soren
text: King Ramon was also friendly toward laguz...I imagine that this, too, influenced Daein's decision. If things went well, the conflict would be enough to engulf Crimea's ally, Gallia, and the fires would spread. First Crimea, then Gallia...And eventually Begnion as well. Daein's power would increase, and strife and discord would spread across the land, eventually reaching the lost medallion.

speaker: Ike
text: So you believe King Daein's goal is to awaken the dark god after all?

speaker: Soren
text: At the very least, it is one of his ambitions. There can be no mistaking that.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Which means that our plan to attack him at the capital fits right into his strategy, doesn't it? It's the trigger he needs to break the dark god's bonds.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Even if that's true, we can't stop now. This war's gone too far for that.

speaker: Ike
text: We have to smash Daein to end its menace once and for all. We bury every one of them and finish it.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Mmm... Agreed. That's the only plan that makes any sense.

speaker: Reyson
text: If only we had the medallion with us...

speaker: Titania
text: What is it, Reyson? Is there a way to avoid all of this?

speaker: Reyson
text: We, that is, the descendants of Lehran, we have a gift...Through the power of the slumber galdr, we have the ability to suppress the chaotic energies of the dark god in the medallion. So even if a massive battle occurred, if it were in my possession, I might be able to...

speaker: Mist
text: I'm so sorry! It's because of my carelessness that the medallion was lost in the first place!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist! I told you that it wasn't your fault, didn't I?

speaker: Mist
text: But--

speaker: Elincia
text: You were never careless, Mist. I know. You kept the medallion next to you at all times. You told me it was a keepsake of your mother's, and you always, always took good care of it. Didn't you?

speaker: Elincia
text: That's why it's not your fault. So please don't punish yourself anymore. All right?

speaker: Mist
text: Princess Elincia...

speaker: Ranulf
text: She's right. And besides, the dark god could be released no matter where the medallion is. So it's nothing to worry about.

speaker: Mist
text: Thank you, Ranulf.

speaker: Tibarn
text: All right... It's about time for you to hear what I have to say. Reyson!

speaker: Reyson
text: Yes?

speaker: Tibarn
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Reyson
text: Huh? F-for what?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Leanne's been kidnapped. It may have been by Daein's hand.

speaker: Reyson
text: That...can't be...

speaker: Ike
text: Why would Leanne be taken? The release galdr can only be sung by the girl Altina. Right?

speaker: Reyson
text: But Ashnard doesn't know that.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh no...

speaker: Ranulf
text: What a mess... Nothing can ever be clear and simple, can it?

speaker: Boy
text: Mister! 'Scuse me, mister! Are you guys gonna go into these mountains? There are lots of soldiers wearing black up there. Those guys...they killed my poppa and burned our village. That's why we went to the mountains in the first place. You're gonna go up there and take care of 'em, aren't you? Gonna make 'em pay? Please, mister, say that you are! My momma and my sister and me don't have anywhere else to go, and I wanna go back to the cabin my poppa built.

speaker: Ike
text: I understand. We're going to take care of those guys. You just stay here a bit longer. All right?

speaker: Boy
text: Yay! Go give 'em heck, mister! Oh, wait! Wait! I heard those guys talking about something, too! They said if anyone comes up the mountain single file, they'd get 'em all at once. It was something like that anyway.

speaker: Ike
text: Really? That's a lot of help. Thanks.

speaker: Boy
text: Good luck, mister!! Kill 'em all! Do it for my poppa!

speaker: Ike
text: Excuse me, do you have a moment?

speaker: Bastian
text: Forsooth! What ho! My eyes behold Sir Ike! Pray tell, what would you ask of me, good sir?

speaker: Ike
text: Um...well... I just wanted to chat. I try to speak with all the members of the army when I have a minute.

speaker: Bastian
text: I see! A fine idea that is, good sir. Some generals hope their soldiers all to be aloof, and ready always for the fight. If all goes well, sweet happiness abounds. But if the tides do turn, then anger grows. One wonders if he can lead men at all...I, too, am often plagued by such grim thoughts.

speaker: Ike
text: Uh...yeah. Listen, I--

speaker: Bastian
text: Yet you walk out among your men-at-arms; spin tales, tell jokes, and lend a willing ear. Huzzah, dear sir! Huzzah until the end! In truth, I did much fear your name at first. I swore to find the mettle of the man, and studied you with cautious, steady eye. I thought to find yourself a brutish rogue. A villain crafty in his fiendish plans! With status and great wealth his only goals. Had such been your own ethic and deceit, I would have taken measures sure and swift to see your person vanished in the night. Yet lo! What do I find before mine eyes? A man so noble, true, and without peer, as would beset the moon herself with lust!

speaker: Bastian
text: General?

speaker: Ike
text: Zzz...Wha--? Huh? ...Er... Sorry about that. Must have dozed off. What were you saying? Something about the moon or...something?

speaker: Bastian
text: Commander, you are tired and unaware of how your body doth cry out for rest. If it would please you, I was of a mind to partake in a sweet and soothing draught. A beverage warm, and pleasant to the lips.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Um, if you're offering me a cup of tea in your tent, I'll accept. ...That IS what you're offering... Right? Oh, and I apologize in advance if I fall asleep again. I'm really tired.

speaker: Bastian
text: Your words do make my ears alive with joy! I shall regale you with a tale or two, and poems to ease the savage toll of war.

speaker: Largo
text: Hey there, little man! I've got serious business with the general of this army. Take a message, will ya?

speaker: Ike
text: And you would be...?

speaker: Largo
text: The name's Largo, and I'm a world-class berserker!

speaker: Ike
text: World-class berserker... That's a rather dubious title.

speaker: Largo
text: What's this? You doubting my strength? I can pin a tiger with my bare hands! That's not just hot air either!

speaker: Ike
text: Dubious.

speaker: Largo
text: You think I'm fooling with you? Have your general hire me and then see for yourself! You can decide how much I'm worth after you see me in action. But let me tell you, if the gold's not good enough, pffft! I'm gone!

speaker: Ike
text: Huh? All of this sounds vaguely familiar...But at least you're confident.

speaker: Largo
text: Like I said. World-class berserker. Here, watch me bend this lance. Rrrrrrrrrr!!!

speaker: Ike
text: All right. You're in.

speaker: Largo
text: Yes! So, uh, how about taking me to meet the general?

speaker: Ike
text: I'm the general.

speaker: Largo
text: Wah? Bwaa ha ha ha ha ha haaaaa! That's good! You're a funny little guy! Bwaa ha ha ha haaaa!! So, seriously. Where's the general's tent? Must be that big one there.

speaker: Unknown
text: Largo?

speaker: Largo
text: Hey! I thought I'd find you here, Calill! You're looking hot! Almost as hot as me! Bwaaa ha ha ha haaaaaa!

speaker: Calill
text: Did you come looking for little old me? Oh, how sad for you. My contract with this army isn't up for quite some time.

speaker: Largo
text: Yeah, I thought you'd say that. That's why I'm joining up, too!

speaker: Calill
text: What? Are you really going to hire Largo, General Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: That's the plan.

speaker: Largo
text: Huh? This little guy really is the general? Bwa ha ha ha! Don't I look like the biggest fool around? And I mean big! Rrrrrrr! Sorry if I offended you, little guy!

speaker: Calill
text: Oh... He's such a clown. But you made a good hire. After all, he's a world-class--

speaker: Ike
text: Berserker. Yeah, I heard.

speaker: Calill
text: He pinned a tiger with his bare hands! Two of them, actually. At the same time.

speaker: Largo
text: Bwa ha ha ha haaaaa! Yeah, that was awesome!

speaker: Ike
text: ...Definitely dubious...

speaker: Rhys
text: Oh, Titania. So this is where you’ve been, is it?

speaker: Titania
text: Rhys! Are you sure you’re well enough to be up?

speaker: Rhys
text: Yes. My fever’s completely gone.

speaker: Titania
text: Are you sure? You still look a bit unsteady on your feet if you ask me.

speaker: Rhys
text: Well, I’ve been in bed for almost a week. I doubt anyone would be in top form–even you, my friend!

speaker: Titania
text: I certainly hope that’s all it is. In any case, until you’re back at full speed, you won’t be doing any work. We’re mercenaries, after all, and...

speaker: Rhys
text: Even the smallest lapse invites death. Right? I know, I know. My apologies to the rest of the team, then. It looks like I’ll be recuperating for a while longer.

speaker: Titania
text: Mm, it’s for the best. Take your time and get fully rested and restored. You are our sole staff wielder, Rhys...The harder our work, the more we depend on you to be at our sides.

speaker: Rhys
text: Thank you for your kind words.

speaker: Titania
text: Oh, by the way...That paper you’ve been carrying around...Is it a letter? I’d intended to go into town this afternoon. I can deliver it for you if you like.

speaker: Rhys
text: Oh, no. This letter is for you, Titania.

speaker: Titania
text: For me?

speaker: Rhys
text: Not more than a little while ago, I went out for a walk around the yard and...A man I’ve never seen before came up to me and said...Give this to the red-tressed knight.

speaker: Titania
text: How curious... I wonder what it is.

speaker: Rhys
text: I imagine it’s a thank-you letter from the people of Caldea or something to that effect.

speaker: Titania
text: Oh, no! How dare they!?

speaker: Rhys
text: Titania? What’s the matter? What did the letter say?

speaker: Titania
text: ...Rhys! Take this letter to Oscar, and tell him to prepare for combat and wait for me! I have to go out for a moment.

speaker: Rhys
text: Uh, but, Titania?

speaker: Titania
text: I’ll be right back! I’m counting on you!

speaker: Rhys
text: What on earth could that letter have said?

speaker: Rhys
text: Everyone! Come quickly!

speaker: Boyd
text: Hey, Rhys. So, how are you feeling?

speaker: Oscar
text: What is it? Why are you so agitated?

speaker: Ike
text: Has something happened?

speaker: Rhys
text: It’s Mist and Rolf...They...They’ve been taken by bandits!

speaker: Boyd
text: What?!?

speaker: Ike
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Oscar
text: The two of them went out early this morning to gather wildflowers...Sure,they’re not back yet, but...

speaker: Rhys
text: Earlier, by the gate...a man asked me to deliver a letter to Titania. It was from a group of bandits–kidnappers. What are we going to do?

speaker: Oscar
text: Let me see it.

speaker: Rhys
text: Oh, if only I’d known...He didn’t seem like a bad person...

speaker: Oscar
text: Hm. I get it. They’re after revenge. They want retribution for the other day at that village... Caldea, was it? Hm. Taking children as hostages? What cowards!

speaker: Ike
text: Blast!

speaker: Boyd
text: Wait, Ike! Where...Where do you think you’re going?

speaker: Ike
text: I’m going to get Mist!

speaker: Rhys
text: But...No! Titania...She said she’d be right back. You’re supposed to get ready and wait for her...

speaker: Ike
text: And do you honestly think we’ve got time to wait? I’m going!

speaker: Boyd
text: What do you think you’re going to do on your own, rookie? Hold it! I’m going, too!

speaker: Rhys
text: Stop! Both of you! I...I’m going with you.

speaker: Oscar
text: Oh, c’mon! Wait! This is crazy! Do you think you can just ignore the deputy commander’s orders?

speaker: Boyd
text: The road forks here...Well, which way do we go?

speaker: Ike
text: How am I supposed to know that?

speaker: Boyd
text: Hold it! Are you saying you don’t know where we’re going? Unbelievable! You’d better learn to think before you act,you moron!

speaker: Ike
text: Shut your mouth, Boyd!

speaker: Boyd
text: You think you can make me? Come on!

speaker: Rhys
text: B-both of you, this is no time to be fighting.

speaker: Oscar
text: I figured we’d find you like this.

speaker: Boyd
text: What are you two doing? So you’re coming after all? It’s not like you two chambermaids to be disobeying orders. What’s the world coming to?

speaker: Ike
text: Oscar, you know this road, don’t you? Which way do we go?

speaker: Oscar
text: You’re going to the bandit stronghold, right? It’s the left fork.

speaker: Ike
text: Got it!

speaker: Boyd
text: I’m still talking here! Let me finish what I–

speaker: Rhys
text: Come on, Oscar. Let’s go, too!

speaker: Oscar
text: I guess we’ve no choice.

speaker: Boyd
text: Uh...HEY! You’re not leaving me behind!

speaker: Ikanau
text: So you came, did you, boys? Is it just you, then? You came alone? You seriously underestimate what we’re capable of doing to you. Now, where’s that snobby, red-haired wench you ride with?

speaker: Ike
text: Titania’s not here. It’s just us. All I want to know right now is whether Mist and Rolf are safe.

speaker: Ikanau
text: Yeah, of course. We’ve got ’em locked up safe and sound in that little shack back there. We got no problem with those brats. What we’re after is a little revenge. We want the redhead and her pups. And that’d be you boys.

speaker: Boyd
text: Then hurry up and let those two go! We’re here, aren’t we? You’ve got no more reason to hold them.

speaker: Ikanau
text: You’re here, but Red ain’t. We’ll just keep the brats until she arrives.

speaker: Ike
text: Dang it!

speaker: Ikanau
text: If you’re so impatient, I guess we can start by killing you whelps. You all ready to die? Hey! Come on out! It’s time to play, lads!

speaker: Rhys
text: There...There are so many...But...we must not lose!

speaker: Oscar
text: Rhys, move to the rear! If anyone gets injured, we’ll need you on hand with your staff.

speaker: Rhys
text: Understood!

speaker: Ikanau
text: Take ’em, lads! Without the red-haired knight, they’re no match for us!

speaker: Boyd
text: What’d you say, dirtbag?

speaker: Ike
text: We’ll make you regret those words!

speaker: Ike
text: Titania! I, uh... I’m sorry. I ran off on my own without...

speaker: Titania
text: We’ll talk about it later. For the time being, keep your mind on the battle, Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: Right!

speaker: Rolf
text: Oh...sniff...

speaker: Mist
text: Keep your chin up,Rolf! Boys aren’t supposed to cry!

speaker: Rolf
text: But...I’m so scared...Aren’t you even a bit scared, Mist?

speaker: Mist
text: Of course I am, but...Listen, we’ll be fine! My brother will definitely come rescue us.

speaker: Rolf
text: Mm...yeah. You’re right! And I’m sure that my brothers will be right there with him.

speaker: Mist
text: I’m sure they will, too! So no more crying! Got it?

speaker: Titania
text: I’m sure I told them to wait for me...I should have known they’d disobey orders. They have no discipline...As deputy commander of the Greil Mercenaries, I cannot allow any more of our people to be harmed.

speaker: Ikanau
text: Graaw! We won’t lose, not to the likes of you!

speaker: Ikanau
text: This...This can’t be...I don’t deserve to lose to sellswords like you...

speaker: Ike
text: Will you let the two of them go now?

speaker: Ikanau
text: Sure, you can have ’em both. If you can beat me, that is!

speaker: Ikanau
text: Heh heh heh. I’ve been waiting for you,you red-haired demoness. You are going to hurt–and hurt bad. This is for my mates who fell before you in Caldea!

speaker: Titania
text: No matter your motives, you’ve taken helpless innocents as hostages. You’re not fit to be called human. May the blessings of the goddess be kept from you for all eternity!

speaker: Ike
text: All right! Somehow we did it.

speaker: Boyd
text: Somehow? What do you mean, somehow? We did it because we’re better than them!

speaker: Titania
text: What you DID...was in direct defiance of the orders I explicitly gave you. How it all turned out is another issue altogether.

speaker: Oscar
text: Deputy Commander, I take full responsibility. The failure is mine...

speaker: Rhys
text: Accept our apologies.

speaker: Titania
text: Oscar, Rhys... What am I supposed to do with you two? Sigh...I think I’ll leave you two to the commander. He’ll know how to handle you, I’m sure. Now, let’s find Mist and Rolf.

speaker: Ike
text: According to the bandit chief, they’re in that shack back–

speaker: Mist
text: Eeek!

speaker: Ike
text: What? Mist!

speaker: Mist
text: Brother! Everyone! You came!

speaker: Rolf
text: Oh...I’m scared.

speaker: Oscar
text: Rolf!

speaker: Rolf
text: Oscar? Help me!

speaker: Boyd
text: Rolf! I’m here, too!

speaker: Rolf
text: Boyd? Wa...waah!

speaker: Boyd
text: Stop crying! You don’t need to worry! We’ll get you outta there!

speaker: Mist
text: That’s right! Buck up, buddy!

speaker: Rolf
text: Uh... I’ll try!

speaker: Ike
text: You! Harm either of them, and I’ll see you dead!

speaker: Bandit
text: Shut up! Shut your stinking trap! If you want these two alive, you’ll throw your weapons down. If you don’t, I’ll start with the girl...

speaker: Mist
text: Eek! No!!!

speaker: Ike
text: Stop!

speaker: Titania
text: Wait!

speaker: Ike
text: Huh?

speaker: Bandit
text: Yeah?

speaker: Titania
text: I’m putting down my weapons. See?

speaker: Bandit
text: Heh...heh heh. Smart move, wench!

speaker: Oscar
text: Deputy Commander...

speaker: Titania
text: We’re here to save them. Now all of you back off.

speaker: Oscar
text: OK...

speaker: Ike
text: Dang!

speaker: Boyd
text: This stinks!

speaker: Bandit
text: Heh heh heh...All right, so now you’re all unarmed. Which means...all you can do is watch while I gut this whiny brat like a fatling pig!

speaker: Ike
text: Ah!

speaker: Bandit
text: Beh heh heh! DIE!!!

speaker: Rolf
text: Wah!

speaker: Bandit
text: Arrr...Uhh......

speaker: Rolf
text: Ohh... Uhnnng...

speaker: Mist
text: Rolf! Can you hear me?

speaker: Boyd
text: Mist! Is Rolf– Is he...

speaker: Mist
text: He’s fine. He just fainted is all. There’s not a scratch on him.

speaker: Boyd
text: Whew...Don’t do that to me.

speaker: Oscar
text: I’m just glad to see you both alive and well...You’re both so brave.

speaker: Mist
text: Yep! Thanks.

speaker: Ike
text: This guy’s dead. This arrow–who shot it?

speaker: Shinon
text: A single arrow, right between the eyes? Who else could make a shot like that? No one, that’s who!

speaker: Ike
text: That voice!

speaker: Shinon
text: Don’t you children owe me a little gratitude? I did just save your lives.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Deputy Commander...Shinon...hah...hah...You’re both so cruel. With this armor on, you know I can’t run that fast...

speaker: Ike
text: Shinon! Gatrie!

speaker: Rhys
text: So, that’s where you went, Titania?

speaker: Titania
text: Of course. I knew we’d need reinforcements. I’m glad it wasn’t a waste of time.

speaker: Titania
text: Well done, both of you.

speaker: Shinon
text: In the end, I got to feather someone. So it was worth the rush.

speaker: Gatrie
text: All I...did...was sweat...That...]was h-hard...work...

speaker: Mist
text: Brother!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist...You did well, Sis. You must have been frightened.

speaker: Mist
text: Uh-huh...Uh-unh! I never stopped believing. I knew that you and the others would come and rescue us. I knew you’d come! So, I was fine!

speaker: Ike
text: Really? That’s an improvement on your usual sobbing and nose-running.

speaker: Mist
text: You jerk! I...My nose does not run!

speaker: Titania
text: All right, come on! Let’s head for home. My goodness...What a day this has been.

speaker: Ike
text: They’re not here either...

speaker: Soren
text: Ike, pursuing them any farther may be dangerous. I think it would be best if we returned to Gallia for now. It’s possible the commander may have followed another road into Gallia. It’s something we should consider.

speaker: Ike
text: ...You’re right. Getting killed looking for them would waste everything they accomplished by breaking away. I guess all we can do is trust that they’re well and withdraw.

speaker: Titania
text: Ike, there’s a fort over there. Just now, for a moment only..I thought I saw someone. Shall we investigate?

speaker: Ike
text: What? Really? Yes, let’s go take a look.

speaker: Soren
text: It seems as though this place has been abandoned for a long time.

speaker: Titania
text: There’s no one here...Hm. I could’ve sworn I saw a silhouette, but...I guess it was a trick of the light.

speaker: Ike
text: Let’s take a quick look around. If we don’t find anything here, we’ll head back to Gallia.

speaker: Titania
text: Very well...

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Here they are! I’ve found the Crimean mercenaries! Surround them!

speaker: Ike
text: Curses! Daein troops...

speaker: Mia
text: Uh-oh. Daein soldiers here, too. Now, where’s that exit...Hm? What’s that sound? Someone...fighting?

speaker: Mia
text: Your name wouldn’t happen to be Ike, would it?

speaker: Ike
text: It is, but...who are you?

speaker: Mia
text: I’m Mia. I’m a mercenary, hired by Crimea to bolster the army’s numbers.

speaker: Ike
text: An army mercenary, huh? So, uh, what are you doing here?

speaker: Mia
text: I got careless and was captured. They were about to send me to a prison camp when Greil saved me.

speaker: Ike
text: You’ve seen my father? Where?

speaker: Mia
text: Just a little bit north of here. Not too far away, though.

speaker: Ike
text: Really? So he’s safe...

speaker: Mia
text: Tell me, who exactly are you guys?

speaker: Ike
text: We’re the Greil Mercenaries. As you can see, we’re fighting against Daein.

speaker: Mia
text: Huh...You’re taking on a whole Daein battalion with these numbers? Nice. That settles it then!

speaker: Ike
text: Settles what?

speaker: Mia
text: This battle. I’m coming in on your side. You don’t mind, do you?

speaker: Ike
text: It’s fine with me, but...I don’t know if you’ll get paid just because I let you fight.

speaker: Mia
text: We’ll worry about the details later! Great, so that’s all taken care of. What next, boss man?

speaker: Petrine
text: Ha ha ha...Found you at last. You provided more entertainment than I thought you would.

speaker: Ike
text: Who are you?

speaker: Petrine
text: Me? I am General Petrine, and my arrival marks your doom. Lament your fortune,dear children, for all hope is lost. You will not leave this place alive.

speaker: Soren
text: Petrine...of the Four Riders of Daein?

speaker: Ike
text: Do you know her, Soren?

speaker: Soren
text: If she’s who I think, then she’s one of the four generals who are King Daein’s most trusted confidants. She is said to wield a flame lance of terrible arcane might.

speaker: Petrine
