text: Ha ha ha...You’ve heard of me? Why, I’m flattered. I’ll try to make this easy on all of you. Give me the princess, and do it now. If I roast the girl along with you curs, I won’t be able to present her head to His Majesty.

speaker: Ike
text: Sorry to tell you this, but the princess isn’t here. She’s been in Gallia for quite some time now.

speaker: Petrine
text: What...nonsense is that? Do you expect me to believe you? There’s no way mercenary scum like you could get past my troops!

speaker: Greil
text: They say that blind arrogance sows the field of its own destruction. Something tells me they were talking about you.

speaker: Petrine
text: Who–

speaker: Ike
text: Father!

speaker: Greil
text: What’re you doing back here, you dumb pup?

speaker: Ike
text: We got the princess safely into Gallia. When you didn’t rejoin us, we decided to look for you. The mission wouldn’t be complete until you returned.

speaker: Greil
text: ...What am I to do with you? Still, you did well. Good work, Ike.

speaker: Petrine
text: Ha! Ignoring me proves you’ve got more guts than common sense. So you’re the commander, eh? Hmph! And I was waiting for some great hero. You’re just another sellsword.

speaker: Greil
text: Am I?

speaker: Petrine
text: Ha ha. You know, I think I’ll keep you! His Majesty, well...Let’s just say he enjoys strong men. Yes, I do think you’ll make a grand souvenir. You don’t have to come along quietly, but I must have you alive. Dead men have no value, after all.

speaker: Greil
text: ...So the rumors of mad King Ashnard’s twisted games are true, are they?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Shinon... What are these twisted games the boss is talking about?

speaker: Shinon
text: There’s rumor that King Daein gathers strong men from around the continent and sets them to fight one another. Those who live, regardless of their birth, are given influential positions. Don’t know if it’s true, though.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Oh...So that weird dame’s got her eye on the boss now, does she?

speaker: Greil
text: Shinon! Gatrie! I’ll distract the woman. You two grab Ike and the others and get out of here now!

speaker: Shinon
text: Got it!

speaker: Gatrie
text: But, Commander! We can’t leave you here on your own!

speaker: Shinon
text: Idiot! That woman’s no threat to the commander. All right Come on! Let’s go!

speaker: Greil
text: Move it! We’ll regroup in Gallia!

speaker: Petrine
text: You’ll not escape me. Not you or your little friends. You’re far too tasty a treat to pass up.

speaker: Greil
text: You said your name was Petrine, is that right? Listen up. This place is nowhere near big enough. There’s not enough room for a true contest between the two of us. I’m going elsewhere. You coming?

speaker: Petrine
text: Do you actually think I’m going to fall for such a simple ruse?

speaker: Greil
text: You and I, we’ve got more power than the average person. We don’t come across a chance like this too often. I’d like to flex my muscles without any distractions getting in the way. You?

speaker: Petrine
text: Ha ha...You really do know how to sweet talk a girl, don’t you? All right, I’m coming.

speaker: Greil
text: Over here.

speaker: Petrine
text: All right, men. I’m leaving you in charge here. Don’t let even one of these Crimean vermin escape! Understood? I want them exterminated by the time I return.

speaker: Ike
text: We join up with Shinon, and we get out of here! Come on, don’t fall behind!

speaker: Ike
text: Well met, Shinon. Are you unharmed?

speaker: Shinon
text: Do I look injured? I’m as fit as ever. You must be disappointed Daein hasn’t stuck me full of holes yet.

speaker: Shinon
text: Guess it’s time to tighten our belts and move on. Now that I’m gonna be dragging your worthless carcass around again, ‘ll have to work twice as hard.

speaker: Ike
text: Gatrie!

speaker: Gatrie
text: Hey, is that you, Ike? I heard you got the princess to Gallia. Nice work! You’re quite the hero. ...But wait! So what in blazes are you doing back here?

speaker: Ike
text: You’ll think it foolish, but I was worried about all of you.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Aww...You’re going to make me cry, you silly pup! All right...sniff... Get it together, Gatrie. Tonight, you and I will share a meal sing a song or two!

speaker: Balmer
text: How goes the battle?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: There aren’t very many of those mercenaries, but they’re fierce.

speaker: Balmer
text: And you’re having a rough time, eh? Bah! What an embarrassment.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: I apologize...

speaker: Balmer
text: It will work out. Reinforcements will be arriving soon. Once they’re here, I want you to end this farce at once!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Ike
text: More enemy troops...

speaker: Balmer
text: Hmph. You wretches...You’re not worthy of General Petrine’s attention. I will roast your bones and present them to her as a trophy!

speaker: Balmer
text: Urgg...Ahh...

speaker: Ike
text: Titania! Are you all right?

speaker: Titania
text: Ooh...I think I can move, but...there’s no way I can fight...

speaker: Ike
text: Get yourself to safety, then, and wait until this is all over.

speaker: Titania
text: I understand. Watch your back, Ike...

speaker: Soren
text: I’m sorry, Ike. I don’t think I can fight anymore.

speaker: Ike
text: That doesn’t matter, not as long as you’re still alive. Find someplace out of harm’s way, understood?

speaker: Soren
text: I’ll do that. And, Ike...watch yourself...

speaker: Ike
text: I have to find my father. Where did he go?

speaker: Ike
text: Titania! Is my father...

speaker: Titania
text: Don’t worry. Commander Greil’s the better fighter. He’ll be fine.

speaker: Petrine
text: Dog’s breath! Who are you, man? You look like a common sellsword, but you fight like a demon!

speaker: Greil
text: What’s wrong? Ready to surrender?

speaker: Petrine
text: And admit defeat? Me? Dont’t be absurd...

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Here they are! Over here!

speaker: Ike
text: Blast. Enemy reinforcements! Father! Let’s get out of here! There are too many–

speaker: Greil
text: ...Looks like I’ve got no choice.

speaker: Petrine
text: Ha ha ha ha...So now, the tide has turned, hasn’t it?

speaker: Petrine
text: All troops, attack! Kill them! Kill them all!

speaker: Greil
text: Hm...Looks like our luck’s run out.

speaker: Ike
text: Father!

speaker: Greil
text: You have to survive this, Ike. I’m not going to lose you, not in this place. Are you ready?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, Commander!

speaker: Petrine
text: You’ve nowhere to run. Curse whatever gods you hold, for they have abandoned you!

speaker: Ike
text: What was that?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: B-b-beasts! Gallian beast soldiers!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: R-r-run! We’re going to be torn to shreds!

speaker: Petrine
text: Stand your ground, all of you! Don’t panic! I will personally slaughter the first man to turn his back on the enemy!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Noooo!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: B-b-beasts!

speaker: Petrine
text: Pfeh. Worthless cowards, one and all.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Attention, Daein soldiers! Leave this place at once! If you do not comply immediately, you will face Gallia’s full strength!

speaker: Petrine
text: Threaten me all you like. It’s not going to frighten me off. If I leave, His Majesty will have me executed. I’d rather die here in battle, with my honor intact.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Withdraw, General Petrine.

speaker: Petrine
text: The Black Knight...

speaker: Black Knight
text: As for your king, you have nothing to fear. I’ll explain things to him. Take your men and go.

speaker: Petrine
text: Tsk! All troops, fall back!

speaker: Greil
text: Hm?

speaker: Ike
text: He’s staring at you, isn’t he, Father?

speaker: Greil
text: Yeah. He is.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hey! Are you planning on taking us all on by yourself?

speaker: Ike
text: Father?

speaker: Mist
text: Father! Brother!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist!

speaker: Elincia
text: Master Greil, my lord Ike...I am pleased you are well.

speaker: Ike
text: Princess Elincia...Why did you return here?=

speaker: Ranulf
text: The princess came and requested Gallian aid for your mercenary company. That is what brings us here.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you one of Gallia’s sub-humans?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Sub-human? Ha! What arrogance it takes to coin such a name! You think yourselves the only onesworthy of the name human, and so we laguz must be beneath you? And thus you call us sub-human. We are less than human to you, is that it?

speaker: Ike
text: I’m sorry...I don’t know any other name for you. If I have offended you, I apologize. What should I call you? Laguz? Would that be more appropriate?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Huh? You show manners? How odd.I like that. Now, you are...Who, exactly?

speaker: Ike
text: My name is Ike. Ike of the Greil Mercenaries.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I’m Ranulf, a warrior of Gallia. We did not know what to think when this group of beorc came tramping through Gallian fields...Imagine our surprise to learn that one of them is Princess Elincia. Now, that was a shock. Two days ago, Daein proclaimed their conquest. We thought Crimea’s royals had all been killed.

speaker: Ike
text: Conquest? They’ve laid claim to Crimea? So that means Crimea must be...

speaker: Elincia
text: I...also heard this news from my lord Ranulf...After...after I fled the capital...My lord uncle Renning...He...I...I am...all alone.

speaker: Ike
text: Princess Elincia...

speaker: Ranulf
text: This is why our king ordered extra patrols along the nation’s border. It wasn’t mere chance that brought my warriors here to offer you support.

speaker: Ike
text: I see...

speaker: Ranulf
text: First of all, I must present Princess Elincia to the king. As for the rest of your men, Ike, I must get orders from my superiors. Until then you may rest at an old castle inside Gallia. Sorry, but I cannot bring so large a group of foreigners to the palace without warning.

speaker: Ike
text: I understand. Commander, that’s not going to be a problem, is it?

speaker: Ike
text: Commander?

speaker: Greil
text: Hm? What was that?

speaker: Ike
text: What’s wrong? You’re not paying attention. It’s not like you.

speaker: Greil
text: I was thinking about something. So, what’s been decided?

speaker: Ike
text: Princess Elincia is going on to the palace with Ranulf. We’re going into Galliaand setting up camp at an old castle. Which way to this castle, Ranulf?

speaker: Ranulf
text: I shall prepare a guide to take you. One of you! Quickly!

speaker: Greil
text: No, don’t go to the trouble. If it’s nearby, we cross the river on the border and head west. It’s Gebal Castle, right? You go ahead. Get the princess to King Caineghis as fast as you can.

speaker: Ranulf
text: ...Understood. What thoughtful guests you are. If you’ll excuse me. Oh, and if it’s not overly presumptuous, I’ll have food delivered to you later.

speaker: Greil
text: We’d appreciate it. The road has been hard, and we had little time to pack more than salted meat and hard biscuits.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Then we shall provide! Princess Elincia, shall we leave?

speaker: Elincia
text: Farewell, everyone...Until later. I will see you soon, won’t I?

speaker: Greil
text: Mm.

speaker: Ike
text: Take care.

speaker: Ike
text: Father!

speaker: Greil
text: Ike? What are you doing still awake?

speaker: Ike
text: I couldn’t sleep, so I was lying there staring outside, and I saw you leave the castle. Where are you going at this hour?

speaker: Greil
text: It’s nothing to do with you, boy. Go back inside and get to sleep.

speaker: Ike
text: Will you stop treating me like a child? I’ll do as I please, got it?

speaker: Greil
text: Hmph. You always were a stubborn pup. What say we take a walk and chat a bit?

speaker: Ike
text: ...Yeah.

speaker: Greil
text: Tell me, Ike, are you getting used to the ins and outs of the mercenary life? The way we approach combat?

speaker: Ike
text: I’m definitely a better fighter. But I don’t understand...Why would you put a recruit like me in charge?

speaker: Greil
text: What is it with all the complaining? You have a problem with authority?

speaker: Ike
text: Just give me a straight answer. I’ve only just started. I’m barely able to handle my own duties around here. I shouldn’t be in charge of anyone.

speaker: Greil
text: You can learn it all at once. It’ll all fall into place as soon as you start to get some experience.

speaker: Greil
text: It’s just strange is all... A while ago, you never would have said or done anything like this.

speaker: Ike
text: Is something wrong, Father? Why are you in such a rush?

speaker: Greil
text: ......Do you remember anything at all about your mother?

speaker: Ike
text: What? Where did that come from?

speaker: Greil
text: Just answer the question.

speaker: Ike
text: Let’s see...She was kind, I...think...I don’t really remember. And you’ve never said much about her either.

speaker: Greil
text: Hm. Is that so...

speaker: Ike
text: Father? What is it?

speaker: Greil
text: We’re done. Leave me and go back to the castle.

speaker: Ike
text: What? Just like that?

speaker: Greil
text: You heard me. That’s a direct order! Return to the castle immediately!

speaker: Ike
text: I... Fine...

speaker: Ike
text: Father… What’s going on? Where are you?

speaker: Greil
text: Ike? Stay back!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Here. Use this blade.

speaker: Greil
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Black Knight
text: I’ve been waiting for this for a long time.

speaker: Black Knight
text: I would prefer it if you used your proper weapon, so that I might see you at your full strength…

speaker: Black Knight
text: General Gawain, Rider of Daein.

speaker: Greil
text: That was my name once, but I threw it away. The only weapon I need is right here.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Do you want to die?

speaker: Greil
text: Your voice… I remember you.

speaker: Greil
text: You think you can defeat me? The man who taught you how to fight? What a fool.

speaker: Greil
text: Come on, boy! Come try me!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Is that all there is? No challenge? No resistance?

speaker: Ike
text: Father!!!

speaker: Ike
text: Don’t… Don’t leave…

speaker: Ike
text: Don’t leave me! Father!

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...Unbelievable. Is this truly what has become of my teacher?

speaker: Ike
text: Father! Father!!

speaker: Greil
text: I...Ike...

speaker: Ike
text: Hold on!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Now then, will you give me what I came for?

speaker: Greil
text: I...don’t...have it.........I threw...it away...

speaker: Black Knight
text: Ha. You, who knows better than any what it truly is, threw it away? Surely you can craft a more plausible lie. You’re not even trying anymore.

speaker: Greil
text: I’m done talking to you.

speaker: Black Knight
text: So there’s no way for me to get my answers, is that it? The dead keep their secrets, or so it is said. But you, however...You are not dead yet. I wonder...Will watching your son’s face grow pale, his eyes grow dim as his life bleeds away...And then your daughter... Oh, the horrors I will visit upon her. Will that loosen your tongue, perhaps? I suppose we will simply have to see.

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Greil
text: No! Ike!!!

speaker: Greil
text: Ike!!!

speaker: Black Knight
text: I won’t check my hand again. Give me what I am after. If you offer no more resistance, I will leave your child alive.

speaker: Greil
text: S-stop...You will not touch my son!

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...What is this? The king of beasts? How bothersome. Do I retreat? Eh?

speaker: Ike
text: You’re not going anywhere.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Tell me, is the son as stupid as the father?

speaker: Greil
text: ...Nng...Ahh...

speaker: Ike
text: Father!

speaker: Greil
text: Ike, stop. There’s no way you can win.

speaker: Ike
text: But...

speaker: Greil
text: Ike!

speaker: Black Knight
text: You will not continue? Then I will finish...

speaker: Black Knight
text: ...So close.Now is not the time for me to deal with him. Hmph. You get to keep your head today, boy.

speaker: Greil
text: Blast.

speaker: Greil
text: So willful. So arrogant...Of course... The one who...made him that way...was...m-me...

speaker: Ike
text: ...Father? Father! Hold on! I can’t do anything here..I’ve...I’ve got to get you back to the castle!

speaker: Ike
text: ...Nngh

speaker: Greil
text: I-Ike...

speaker: Ike
text: Father? You’re awake!

speaker: Greil
text: I...There’s something I need to tell you.

speaker: Ike
text: Tell me later. Right now, I’m getting you back to the castle.

speaker: Greil
text: Forget about revenge...Leave that knight alone...Stay away...

speaker: Ike
text: What? Father?

speaker: Greil
text: Stay with the king of Gallia...Live here. Live in peace...

speaker: Ike
text: Father, stop talking. You’re wasting your strength. Please...

speaker: Greil
text: I need you to take care of everything...The company...Mist...

speaker: Ike
text: Wait...You mustn’t say such things! It’ll be light soon. You’ll be fine...

speaker: Ike
text: A little longer...Stay a little longer...

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Oh my! If it isn't young Prince Serenes! Welcome, welcome, welcome.

speaker: Reyson
text: Nealuchi, you're looking well.

speaker: Nealuchi
text: And feeling well, too, thank you very much. This old crow's as spry as ever. Hee hee!...Tell me though. How fares your father, King Lorazieh?

speaker: Reyson
text: The same as ever. Since that terrible day, he remains abed... He seldom rises anymore.

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Mmm... I'm not surprised. In the span of a few days, he lost his family, his friends, and almost all of his countrymen.

speaker: Reyson
text: Yes...

speaker: Nealuchi
text: And yet, we're blessed that you are still with us! Prince Reyson, if there's anything this doddering old bird can do for you, please do not hesitate to ask.

speaker: Reyson
text: Thank you. I appreciate your kind sentiment.

speaker: Naesala
text: Sorry to have kept you waiting, Reyson. Nealuchi! You can talk ancient history later. Leave us at once.

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Yes, yes, of course. I'm sure you've much to talk about, much to say. I'll just take my leave of you...Please, Prince Reyson. Make yourself at home.

speaker: Naesala
text: Hmph! Old Nealuchi's always been fond of House Serenes. When he heard the White Prince himself was gracing us with a visit, he could barely contain his joy. So, Prince. What's this all about? We haven't seen your face around here in a long time, and I'm naturally quite curious as to your intentions.

speaker: Reyson
text: Your attitude during the Goldoa meeting piqued my interest. What is it you're after, Naesala? Why do you provoke Tibarn?

speaker: Naesala
text: You came all this way for that? Are you serious?

speaker: Reyson
text: Do not mock me, crow king! Tibarn is my father's guardian. If not for him, we might have suffered the end of House Serenes itself. I will not brook any insults to him.

speaker: Naesala
text: Oh, I see. So rather than ally yourself with me, your trusted companion of old, you would side with this new protector? That's an unfortunate shift in attitude. I trust you remember that when you and your sister were young, it was I, and not Tibarn, who watched over you?

speaker: Reyson
text: Any change in my bearing can be laid at your roost, Naesala. After all...you, my old friend, are the one who continues to engage in commerce with my enemy. With humans. If you were to change your ways, I'm sure we could rebuild the relationship the two of us once shared.

speaker: Naesala
text: Oh no, that I could never do. You see, humans are essential to the fulfillment of my ambitions.

speaker: Reyson
text: ...You've changed, Naesala. If this is the path you've chosen, I've nothing left to say.

speaker: Naesala
text: ...I doubt you could ever understand what it means to guard Kilvas, Prince. To protect an entire country.

speaker: Raven Laguz
text: King Naesala! Duke Tanas of the Begnion Imperial Senate has arrived.

speaker: Naesala
text: Bring him in.

speaker: Oliver
text: Your Majesty! J-just now, I brushed against the most splendid specimen! W-was that a Serenes noble? They're supposed to be extinct!

speaker: Naesala
text: And what if it were?

speaker: Oliver
text: Oh, I was right! Wonderful! My eyes did not deceive me. Those dazzling white wings. And that shimmering hair, sparkling like falling gold dust...That is the crystallization of beauty in its purest form--

speaker: Naesala
text: Duke Oliver, can we please discuss the business at hand? Per your request, we have appropriated several pieces of art from the ships of Duke Gaddos.

speaker: Oliver
text: Yes, yes, and you will be compensated as promised. But right now there is...something else that I simply must have.

speaker: Naesala
text: Really? Another request? What can we purloin for you today? More art, perhaps?

speaker: Oliver
text: Oh ho! Something much more stunning. And if you agree to my proposition, I will double your normal fee!

speaker: Naesala
text: That is a most generous offer. Tell me, what is it you desire?

speaker: Oliver
text: Desire? But surely you've already guessed...

speaker: Ike
text: Meeting with the apostle was fine, but all she did was pay us and give us another job. She answered no questions.

speaker: Titania
text: I wonder what she's planning. That cargo... I can't help but believe that there were living creatures inside, but...What do you suppose the apostle intends to do with them?

speaker: Ike
text: I don't know. Titania, are all nobles and royals like this? They have plans and paperwork for every little thing, and their speech is as confusing as it is tedious.

speaker: Mist
text: But, Ike, the other nobles we know are different! There's Princess Elincia, and King Gallia, and the dragon prince, too! All of them have been so nice and friendly and easy to talk to.

speaker: Titania
text: Perhaps the rudeness of the upper echelon is unique to the beorc class system. Princess Elincia was raised in special circumstances. Maybe that's why she's so different.

speaker: Ike
text: Bah! I could never get accustomed to the culture of beorc nobles.

speaker: Ike
text: Tell me, Soren, are you all right?

speaker: Soren
text: Hm?

speaker: Ike
text: Recently--ever since we reached Begnion, in fact--you've seemed depressed.

speaker: Soren
text: Is...is that so? How odd. Well, I can think of nothing specific that's bothering me.

speaker: Ike
text: Well, if you say so.

speaker: Ike
text: So, it's time for the desert! Which is the best direction to enter from?

speaker: Ike
text: Soren?

speaker: Soren
text: ...Eh? Yes, what is it?

speaker: Ike
text: All right, I know there's something going on!

speaker: Soren
text: I'm... I'm sorry... I was...thinking. What is it you wanted?

speaker: Ike
text: Well, I was going to ask you for directions, but it's no longer necessary. It looks like we're being met.

speaker: Soren
text: Ah!

speaker: Tormod
text: Who are you? Answer me!

speaker: Ike
text: We're mercenaries. We were hired to take care of a group of bandits operating in this area.

speaker: Tormod
text: More of the senators' dogs! You cast us as thieves so you can murder us and hide your guilt! But we will not be defeated! Mark my words! The day will come when all slaves are free, and then you will pay for your crimes!

speaker: Ike
text: What on earth are you talking about?

speaker: Tormod
text: No more useless words! Come, my brothers! Take them!

speaker: Ike
text: What? We're facing laguz? I don't like the look of this!

speaker: Soren
text: Laguz or no, it doesn't change the fact that they are brigands. Do not lower your guard!

speaker: Ike
text: I know what I'm doing. Everyone! Watch your footing in this sand. Take care and fight well!

speaker: Lethe
text: Sniff... Hm?

speaker: Lethe
text: I...sense...something...

speaker: Lethe
text: ...Grrrr...Must be my imagination...

speaker: Stefan
text: A female cat! Splendid! I've not seen your face in these parts before.

speaker: Lethe
text: Aaaah! Wh-where...Where did you come from?

speaker: Stefan
text: Oh, I see that I've startled you. My apologies.

speaker: Lethe
text: Who are you?

speaker: Stefan
text: If you wish to learn someone's name, isn't it polite to introduce yourself first?

speaker: Lethe
text: Grrr... I am...Lethe. From Gallia.

speaker: Stefan
text: And I...am Stefan! I live here in this desolate wasteland, playing at being a hermit.

speaker: Lethe
text: Is that so? Well, don't let me interrupt your...life.

speaker: Stefan
text: Oh no! Please don't worry about it.

speaker: Lethe
text: Oh, I won't.

speaker: Lethe
text: ...And?

speaker: Stefan
text: What?

speaker: Stefan
text: Why are you standing there staring at me? I'm interested in Gallia's beast tribes. Fascinating, really. I have an idea! Can we go somewhere and talk?

speaker: Lethe
text: ...I don't think so.

speaker: Stefan
text: Why not?

speaker: Lethe
text: My companions and I are in the middle of a battle! I've no time to chitchat with you!

speaker: Stefan
text: Very well... Then I will help you! And once this battle is finished, you'll have time to converse, yes?

speaker: Lethe
text: I suppose...perhaps...

speaker: Stefan
text: Right! Off we go then!

speaker: Lethe
text: ...What sort of lunatic have I found now?

speaker: Mordecai
text: Sniff...

speaker: Mordecai
text: Urrrr?

speaker: Mordecai
text: Something's...here...Beneath...the sand... Mmmrrr??

speaker: Stefan
text: Nope! I'm over here.

speaker: Mordecai
text: So there you are.You are...good at hiding.

speaker: Stefan
text: To be praised by one of the beast tribes is an honor! I am Stefan! I live here in this desolate wasteland, playing at being a hermit. Who are you? I haven't seen you in these parts before.

speaker: Mordecai
text: I am Mordecai, a warrior of Gallia. This is the first time I have walked beyond the borders of my country.

speaker: Stefan
text: I thought that might be the case...And I was right. Hoooo! I'm ever so clever!

speaker: Stefan
text: Mordecai, listen here. I'm interested in the beast tribes of Gallia. Would you mind talking with me? I'll buy dinner!

speaker: Mordecai
text: Um... My friends and I are fighting, so I...cannot. Sorry.

speaker: Stefan
text: Very well, then! I will help you. Once this battle is finished, you'll have time to converse, yes?

speaker: Mordecai
text: All right. If you will fight with us,then I will call Stefan a friend. Later, we will talk about Gallia.

speaker: Stefan
text: I'm looking forward to it. Right then, off we go!

speaker: Mordecai
text: Yes! Off we go!...Right...then...

speaker: Ike
text: Huh?

speaker: Stefan
text: Oh, look at you! Lost in a place like this... What an odd duck you must be. Hmm...It would be a shame to see you go home empty-handed, though. I will give you this as a memento! Now, in exchange... I ask you to treat our meeting as a dream and let it fade from your memory. And now, I bid thee...farewell!

speaker: Soren
text: Woah!

speaker: Stefan
text: Are you lost, young one? What are you doing in this place?

speaker: Soren
text: What are YOU doing here? Are you with the sub-humans? ...Wait, did you just pop out of the sand?

speaker: Stefan
text: Mmm...

speaker: Soren
text: What?

speaker: Stefan
text: ...Hmm. It seems I made an error.

speaker: Soren
text: What are you talking about? You're not--

speaker: Stefan
text: I was wrong. It's nothing. I've no use for you.

speaker: Soren
text: Oh. All right, then.

speaker: Stefan
text: Hold!

speaker: Soren
text: What now?

speaker: Stefan
text: It would be a shame to see you go home empty-handed, though. I will give you this as a memento! Now, in exchange... I ask you to treat our meeting as a dream and let it fade from your memory. And now, I bid thee...farewell!

speaker: Muarim
text: Haah...haa...haa... We lose...

speaker: Ike
text: You! You're the leader of this band, aren't you?

speaker: Muarim
text: Yes...I am. I'll resist you no further. Take me with you or execute me here... I care not. But my companions... Would you let them go? ...Please?

speaker: Unknown
text: No! I won't allow it!

speaker: Ike
text: Huh?

speaker: Tormod
text: I won't let you take Muarim!

speaker: Muarim
text: Grrr... Stay back, little one! You were not supposed to expose--

speaker: Tormod
text: If you want Muarim, you'll have to kill me first!

speaker: Ike
text: You're--

speaker: Muarim
text: Yes, he is a beorc child. I claimed him when he was little more than an infant. He has nothing to do with us...sub-humans...

speaker: Tormod
text: Stop lying! I'm here because I want to be! Who's the leader of the laguz emancipation army? I am! You're a big jerk, Muarim! Trying to cover for everyone and get yourself killed? I won't allow it!

speaker: Muarim
text: Little one...

speaker: Ike
text: Hey! I don't care who the real leader is.

speaker: Ike
text: A laguz who calls himself a sub-human is protecting a kidnapped beorc who claims to lead a laguz emancipation army? Do I have that right? Because if I do, I have absolutely no idea what any of you are talking about. Would someone please tell me what is going on here?

speaker: Ike
text: All right... Please go over that again. It's been customary throughout Begnion's history to keep laguz as slaves?

speaker: Tormod
text: That's right.

speaker: Titania
text: But that's in the past now! Twenty years ago, all slavery was outlawed, and all laguz were freed!

speaker: Nasir
text: And as far as the general public is concerned, that is exactly what happened.

speaker: Ike
text: So there's a portion of society that willingly breaks the law?

speaker: Tormod
text: The commoners obey, but there are still many laguz slaves in the homes of nobles. Muarim and I brought this to the attention of the senators, but they would not listen. That's why we gathered other fighters. We break into the homes where slaves are kept and help them escape. Of course, the nobles can't let this be known publicly, so they brand us thieves and turn us into wanted outlaws.

speaker: Ike
text: All right. I think I understand your motives,but you're not going to solve the basic problem this way.

speaker: Tormod
text: We know that. But we can't give up and leave them in chains. We can't and won't!

speaker: Ike
text: Do you mind if I try to help?

speaker: Tormod
text: Huh?

speaker: Ike
text: This sort of beorc behavior is something that's been bothering me. I think there may be something that I can do...

speaker: Reyson
text: Naesala! Stop this foolishness! Where are you taking me? Tell me!

speaker: Naesala
text: It's only a little farther! I'll tell you once we've arrived, just as I promised.

speaker: Reyson
text: I left no word with Tibarn. If I had known we were coming this far, I would have left a message...

speaker: Naesala
text: Here we are. This is what I wanted to show you. Look below you, Reyson. What do you see?

speaker: Reyson
text: What...what is this? How is this possible? What happened here?!

speaker: Reyson
text: This...is Serenes? Is this what you're trying to tell me?! This colorless vista, these cracked and withered branches, these lifeless trees... This is my forest?

speaker: Reyson
text: [Sacred trees! Seed, root, and trunk! Awake from your slumber and heed my cry! Answer the call of the green, mighty ones!]

speaker: Naesala
text: ...The ancient tongue. It's been many years since I heard it last. You can still speak it.

speaker: Reyson
text: The voice of the forest is still. Why... How did this...

speaker: Naesala
text: It's been like this since your clan's been gone. The area near the entrance is especially bad. They used fire...Most of the trees are dead.

speaker: Reyson
text: ...Unforgivable. How...how can they do things like this. Cursed humans... What did this forest do? What did my clan do...

speaker: Naesala
text: Humans hold all laguz in contempt. And in the same way, they hold all of nature in contempt as well. They think everything exists for their pleasure and betterment...They are beneath contempt.

speaker: Reyson
text: Naesala... It appears that I have misjudged you. I called you a groveling toady to humans and labeled you traitor. I was overly harsh. I apologize.

speaker: Naesala
text: Not to worry. I engage in occasional commerce with humans...That much is true. A more pressing issue is the growing darkness. You can return to Phoenicis tomorrow, can you not? I'm certain that some noble has a villa in this area. At this time of year, it is almost certain to be empty. I suggest we borrow it for the evening.

speaker: Reyson
text: You would sleep in a human building?

speaker: Naesala
text: Think about it... Bird folk like you and I have no night vision whatsoever. If we were discovered by humans, they would surely overwhelm and capture us, right?

speaker: Reyson
text: Mmm... I see your point.

speaker: Naesala
text: Very good. I'll go stumble around until I find something to eat. Please...make yourself comfortable.

speaker: Reyson
text: Naesala!

speaker: Naesala
text: Yes?

speaker: Reyson
text: Thank you. For everything you've done. I...I appreciate it.

speaker: Naesala
text: Don't be ridiculous. We're old friends,are we not?

speaker: Reyson
text: Right you are! Old friend.

speaker: Naesala
text: Is everything in place?

speaker: Raven Laguz
text: Yes. That Duke Tanas cannot sit still. He is literally...quivering with anticipation. It's not pretty.

speaker: Naesala
text: I bet it isn't. Just make sure that mountain of suet stays hidden. If Reyson catches so much as a glimpse of his bulk, he will take wing.

speaker: Raven Laguz
text: Understood.

speaker: Naesala
text: Now, time to put on the finishing touches. This, too, I do to raise up Kilvas. Reyson, please don't judge me too harshly. That being said, I'm sure you will. Ah, well. Such is life. Enjoy your new one... Old friend...

speaker: Servant
text: Ahem. You are from the northwest nation of Crimea, are you not? You have my condolences for the terrible misfortune that has befallen your country and people. Yet you remain blessed! Fate has brought you here to the Grand Temple Mainal! To the splendor of Begnion, grandest of all the nations of Tellius. By the way, I hear you are traveling north to the Grann Desert. There are ancient ruins there, you know? They are the remnants of a race known as the Zunanma, who come from a civilization that predates our own. I'm sure you will enjoy the sensation of being immersed in such primordial surroundings!

speaker: Ike
text: Um...yeah. It'll be a real picnic.

speaker: Servant
text: Oh, yes, picnics are indeed nice. Oh, but a word of caution. Studying the ruins from afar is one thing, but you would be well advised to keep your distance... For safety's sake! It's said that there's a bandit stronghold near the northwest ruins. And we hear occasional reports of strange figures wandering the dunes in the northeast. Be careful!

speaker: Sigrun
text: How are your preparations progressing?

speaker: Ike
text: They're underway. We leave within the hour.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Your next mission takes you to the Grann Desert. You must choose your companions with care.

speaker: Ike
text: A desert is just a large patch of sandy soil, is it not?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Ha ha! With one major difference! Unlike sandy soil, you'll not find solid earth near the surface. You could dig and dig and find only more sand. Those on foot and horseback may find it difficult to move around.

speaker: Ike
text: I see. I'm sure that Soren knows much about these things, but...

speaker: Sigrun
text: Hmm? Has something befallen master Soren?

speaker: Ike
text: I don't know if he's feeling ill or just moping about. It all started when we arrived in Begnion.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Oh...

speaker: Ike
text: Be that as it may, it won't hurt for me to have this information. Can you tell me more?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Of course. There's little water in the desert, and the soil is very dry. Few trees or grasses grow there. Which means there are no groves or anything else which would provide cover. And, as I mentioned before, those on foot or horseback will find the sand slows their pace considerably. The exceptions are magic users, staff wielders, and thieves. Such people will not be affected to so large a degree.

speaker: Ike
text: Thieves are agile, so I understand why they would be unaffected. But those skilled in the magical arts? That doesn't make sense.

speaker: Sigrun
text: I once heard an explanation from a magic user that I know...He claimed that the spirits he employed flew before him and cleared the sand from his path. However, considering the source, I'm not sure how much of that is truth.

speaker: Ike
text: Who was the source?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Prime Minister Sephiran.

speaker: Ike
text: Would he play a joke like that?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Ha ha! Well, the prime minister is a very amusing man. But, please, allow me to continue my explanation. What else...? Others who are unaffected by sand are pegasus knights, wyvern riders, and other flying units. Oh, and laguz, too. Terrain features don't seem to affect them much in either form, although they will be slowed some.

speaker: Ike
text: You said laguz, didn't you? Almost everyone here says sub-human.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Well, of course. Beorc and laguz are both living things. Every precious life was created to be equal by the blessed goddess. The fact that there are still those who persecute laguz in the land of the goddess... It is deplorable.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Are you of a noble house?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Yes, I am. One must be of noble birth to serve the goddess.

speaker: Ike
text: But I thought...that all nobles were half-crazed fools who can't speak the truth. You seem quite honest.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Ha ha, I'll take that as a compliment...Oh, and one last thing.

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Sigrun
text: The desert contains the remnants of more than one lost civilization. Rumor has it that treasures from those times still lie undiscovered beneath the shifting sands. Those with good luck may come across such treasures during battle.

speaker: Makalov
text: Hoooweee! The Grand Temple! Luxury and...gorgeousness as far as the eye can see. If a scoundrel like myself can find employment in a place like this, I guess my luck hasn't abandoned me after all.

speaker: Makalov
text: But...for all the glitter and gold, there's an equal amount of dangerous work. Hmm...That I could do without. Maybe I can use my prone-to-illness ploy...Cough! Yes, I think I can arrange to work about one out of every...five jobs or so! And now that I've a fixed income, it's time to visit the local inns and see what games of chance are about!

speaker: Ike
text: Evening.

speaker: Makalov
text: WHAAAA! You... Did you happen to hear any of that?

speaker: Ike
text: You were talking out loud. Loudly.

speaker: Makalov
text: Um...I, uh... I wasn't being serious...I am an extremely diligent man! Yes, I am!

speaker: Ike
text: Those peddlers you were with...You were in debt to them, right?

speaker: Makalov
text: Huh? How do you know that?

speaker: Ike
text: When we took out that group, your debt vanished...

speaker: Makalov
text: Yes! You're right! That was a tremendous help. Thanks much!

speaker: Ike
text: Come now, you can't believe that the world is as forgiving as that. Or that we are so foolish.

speaker: Makalov
text: What?

speaker: Ike
text: Debts are debts, and you have many. Those peddlers weren't the only people who were owed coin by you... Right? We can't have debt collectors hounding the company day in and day out. My staff officer repaid the rest of the money you owe.

speaker: Makalov
text: Tha-that's...very kind of you.

speaker: Ike
text: It was from the company coffers. You, my friend, are now in OUR debt. You fight to repay the Greil Mercenaries.

speaker: Makalov
text: Ah! But! Aaah!

speaker: Ike
text: Payment will be deducted from your wages. For...quite some time. It seems you're working for free, friend.

speaker: Makalov
text: Oh! I--! Oooh!

speaker: Ike
text: Until your debts are completely repaid, don't even think about leaving the company. Or getting sick. Right then! I trust you'll do your best.

speaker: Makalov
text: ...What a mess...Awww... Nuts!

speaker: Reyson
text: What is this? Who are you? What have you done with Naesala?

speaker: Oliver
text: Oh... Ooooo...This is something everyone should see. There can be no doubt--I gaze upon the last living wonder of the Serenes royalty. Those golden locks! Witness how they gather in the morning sun and multiply its brilliance. The gentle lustre of those argent wings! Manifest proof of royalty, as sure as I am alive. Magnificent... Absolutely magnificent. A true work of art wrought in flesh and feather. All this beauty... Mine... The fortune I paid the raven king seems like a pittance compared to this treasure!

speaker: Reyson
text: What? Naesala...sold me? To YOU?!

speaker: Oliver
text: Oh ho ho ho! You are exquisite, even in rage! Now, if you behave yourself, I'll grant you a life of luxury...

speaker: Oliver
text: Oww!!! My nose! My beautiful nose!

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Bishop Oliver?! You winged freak! You'll pay for that!

speaker: Oliver
text: Noooo! You mustn't harm him! You mustn't ruffle a single feather of those gorgeous wings!

speaker: Oliver
text: My beauty, you mustn't be frightened. In time, you will come to see how kind and charitable a master I can be.

speaker: Reyson
text: This is madness!

speaker: Oliver
text: Oooh! S-so frightening! How delicious! But I fear that we must now be separated for a short while. Loyal servants! Attend my words! You must not raise a hand to this one. Prepare his meals with care, and do not disturb his rest. I would not see his countenance marred by displeasure. Herons, you see, are such delicate things. And then, at the proper time... Yes, the proper time. When will it be? I say to you, those haughty senators and their ilk have looked down their noses at me for the last time! I shall show them all! Ooooh, but I must have a grand stage. One where none can fail to see me. The Serenes royals are creatures of legend, and when I arrive with one at my side... I can hardly wait to see Duke Gados's face. Oh ho ho ho! Aho ho ho ho ho ho ho!

speaker: Reyson
text: Naesala, you wretch... Curse your eyes! How dare you do this to me...

speaker: Ike
text: I've brought him.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Well done, Ike. I shall see that you are well rewarded.

speaker: Ike
text: Where's your usual entourage? I see only two of your holy guard...

speaker: Sanaki
text: Oh, there was some sort of disturbance. I think they're clearing away the rabble. But on to business... Is that one there the ringleader of the thieves? Why, he's nothing but a child! Has he offered up any kind of defense for his deplorable actions?

speaker: Tormod
text: We are no thieves! We are trying to free the laguz that these filthy aristocrats hold in captivity!

speaker: Sanaki
text: What manner of absurd fairy tale is this? In the year Begnion 624, Apostle Misaha, my honored grandmother, emancipated every last laguz slave. In accordance with her law, today there is not a single slave to be found in all of the Begnion Empire.

speaker: Tormod
text: You lie! Countless noble houses even now keep laguz as servants or entertainment...or worse! And the senate! Those vast windbags grant tacit approval by doing nothing!

speaker: Ike
text: That's enough! I told you to keep a cool head.

speaker: Tormod
text: Bu-but--!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Ike... Whyever would you bring such an ill-mannered rogue to meet me? What is it you're planning?

speaker: Ike
text: If anyone's planning something, it's you.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Really? And what could you possibly mean by that?

speaker: Ike
text: Your last mission showed us the slave trade, and now you've put us in contact with an underground emancipation group. From the very beginning, I found this whole arrangement a little odd. You have more vassals than you can use, yet you hire us for these missions? Your motivations have me puzzled.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Oh, I see. And have you solved this puzzle of yours?

speaker: Ike
text: You want to expose the depravity of the inner circles of power. But you don't want the general public to know that the majority of the senate is involved in slavery.

speaker: Sanaki
text: And to think I thought you were as untutored as a wild monkey. You're actually quite bright.

speaker: Ike
text: I didn't figure it all out by myself. I have companions whom I trust with my life. They helped.

speaker: Tormod
text: Hey! Hold it! What in the world are you talking about? Would someone like to explain this to me?

speaker: Ike
text: The apostle is aware of the laguz slavery. On top of that, it appears she intends to do something about this problem.

speaker: Tormod
text: Are you serious?

speaker: Sanaki
text: I am. However, whether I succeed or fail depends largely on what you do next.

speaker: Ike
text: So be it. I think it's time you told us about the next job you have lined up for us.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I've received reports that Bishop Oliver, the duke of Tanas, is up to something suspicious. Duke Tanas has a villa near the woods of Serenes. Go there, and return with irrevocable proof of...whatever he's doing. If you succeed in this, I promise to support your Princess Elincia with all the power at my command.

speaker: Ike
text: We'll bring back whatever information it is you're looking for. Be ready for us!

speaker: Ike
text: Is this the place?

speaker: Soren
text: Yes, it is. It's rather heavily guarded. Even so, I think a direct attack would be our best chance of gaining entrance.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Halt! Who goes there? What are you doing? This villa is the property of Duke Tanas, senator of the empire! No trespassing!

speaker: Ike
text: I am Ike, of the Greil Mercenaries. Under orders from the apostle, we've been charged with investigating the duke.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: What? The apostle sent you? Wa-wait here a moment!

speaker: Mist
text: All right, Brother, we'll sneak around out here and see what we can see.

speaker: Ike
text: Good idea.

speaker: Titania
text: Leave it to us. If we get stopped, we can talk our way out of it. All right, Mist, let's get going.

speaker: Mist
text: Yeah!

speaker: Oliver
text: What is it I hear? That you lads claim to be here on the apostle's business?

speaker: Ike
text: We have a letter here that bears her seal.

speaker: Oliver
text: Hmm... Well... I see. It appears genuine. Very well. Am I in a position to ask what, exactly, I am suspected of doing?

speaker: Soren
text: We are here by the apostle's leave. Do you honestly intend to make us discuss this private matter outside?

speaker: Oliver
text: Oh! No, no, of course not. Never! I would never insult...Please, c-come inside...

speaker: Oliver
text: Oh? Slavery? Me? The apostle would honestly accuse me of such an unfashionable thing as slaveholding? Oh ho ho ho!

speaker: Ike
text: Do you claim no knowledge of such a thing?

speaker: Oliver
text: I've shown you every nook of my mansion, every cranny. I've been most thorough, have I not? And you saw no trace, not a single sign, of any laguz here, did you?

speaker: Ike
text: That is true.

speaker: Oliver
text: This accusation is absolutely ridiculous! To think that I, a bishop who serves only the apostle's will, would do anything to violate our country's emancipation act! Be certain that you tell the apostle everything! Tell her that Duke Tanas is upright and cleanhanded! There is not even a shadow of falsehood in my noble eyes! Look into them deeply, my boy, and tell me what you see...

speaker: Oliver
text: Well? Hmmmmm?

speaker: Ike
text: Ugh! Hey, stop that! Back off!

speaker: Soren
text: We have little choice, do we...I think it would be best if we left for the time being.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Hey! Halt! You can't go in there!

speaker: Ike
text: Ah!

speaker: Mist
text: Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist, what is it?

speaker: Mist
text: Ike, I saw him! In a room on the top floor of this building, I saw someone--I think he was one of the bird tribe! He looked like he was trying to jump out a window, but he was forced away from it and back into the room.

speaker: Oliver
text: Wha-what? What is this...this child babbling about?

speaker: Soren
text: Someone from the bird tribe? Can you describe him?

speaker: Mist
text: Um, he had long hair! It was...sparkling, like gold. And his skin...it was so pale--almost translucent. Oh! And his wings! They were pure white!

speaker: Ike
text: Is that accurate, Titania?

speaker: Titania
text: It is. I saw him as well.

speaker: Soren
text: That can only mean there is a member of the heron clan in this place. According to books, only members of the royal heron family possess white wings.

speaker: Ike
text: It appears that there is at least one room we have yet to see. What is it going to be, Duke Tanas? You can cooperate and show us this room that you somehow forgot, or...

speaker: Oliver
text: Guards! Kill them all! Don't let a single one escape!

speaker: Ike
text: So this is how you want to play it, eh? I thought it might come to this.

speaker: Devdan
text: Devdan hears the sounds of battle...

speaker: Kimarsi
text: You dare to bring conflict into Bishop Oliver's home? My lance will make you pay for your impudence!

speaker: Kimarsi
text: What... What fate is this? Is it just punishment...for my complicity...in this evil...

speaker: Reyson
text: Ah!

speaker: Oliver
text: Oh, my sweet, beautiful little bird! Don't be frightened! Come, let us fly away together...

speaker: Reyson
text: Stay away from me, you filthy fat man!

speaker: Reyson
text: ...Urgh!

speaker: Oliver
text: Come quietly! You belong to me! I will not give you up. No one shall take you from me...

speaker: Reyson
text: Though the price may be my life, I will never cooperate with you!

speaker: Unknown
text: Hey! Where are you, Duke Tanas? ...Are you in here?

speaker: Oliver
text: ...Ah... N-n-nooo...

speaker: Ike
text: Duke Tanas...

speaker: Reyson
text: Who are you?

speaker: Ike
text: Ah! You... You're the Serenes--Are you unharmed? We have come to help you. Your injury... Did that man do that to you?

speaker: Ike
text: This wound must be tended to...

speaker: Reyson
text: Stay back!

speaker: Ike
text: But...

speaker: Reyson
text: Do not approach me! Cursed human!

speaker: Ike
text: The Greil Mercenaries have returned.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Ah, Master Ike. It is good to see you well. How went the mission? Did you unearth any meaningful proof?

speaker: Ike
text: Where is the apostle?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Master Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: I must speak with the apostle. Where is she?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Apostle Sanaki is in the garden, having a pleasant conversation with Princess Elincia. I will go directly and see if she will meet with you. Please wait here.

speaker: Ike
text: In the garden? Great.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Ah, Master Ike! No! You mustn't behave so! You will cause such problems!

speaker: Ike
text: Apostle...

speaker: Sanaki
text: What? You! What are you doing? How dare you approach me unannounced! This is most inappropriate, and I will not--

speaker: Elincia
text: What has happened, my lord Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: All of it. I want to hear all of it...Now!

speaker: Sanaki
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Master Ike! One must not speak to the apostle in such a discourteous fashion!

speaker: Ike
text: Twenty years ago, something happened in Serenes Forest. Something terrible. I want to know.

speaker: Sanaki
text: What?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Master Ike?

speaker: Elincia
text: W-what happened twenty years ago?

speaker: Sanaki
text: You found one of the heron clan? And a Serenes noble no less...One of them still lives? But that...such a thing...

speaker: Sigrun
text: Apostle Sanaki...

speaker: Ike
text: Tell me.

speaker: Sanaki
text: That is a very...difficult problem...Hmm... How to impart this tale...

speaker: Nasir
text: It would appear that no one is willing to begin this story. That being so, I would open with what is commonly known of the matter. Do you find this acceptable?

speaker: Sanaki
text: And you are?

speaker: Ike
text: He is a friend of mine. Nasir, if you know something, I would hear it. When you are done, the apostle can clarify. Agreed?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Hmmm...

speaker: Nasir
text: It begins with the assasination of the previous Begnion apostle. It was twenty years ago... One year after the declaration of emancipation was made. The leader at the time was the Apostle Misaha, who was more adored by the public than any apostle before...or since. When she was assassinated, the citizenry was wracked with grief. All of Begnion despaired. And then, a rumor began to circulate that the assassination was the work of the Serenes herons. In the twinkling of an eye, the rumor spread throughout the Begnion capital. One night shortly thereafter, it happened. The citizens grew violent. They massed at the edge of Serenes Forest, home of their supposed enemy, and set it to burn. The crowd raged on for three nights, and in the end, the heron clan was lost.

speaker: Elincia
text: But their involvement was just a rumor...Wasn't it? Why, why did they...

speaker: Sanaki
text: Oh, the shame of it...

speaker: Nasir
text: Apostle? The remainder of the tale is yours. You stand as the empress of Begnion. You are responsible for the acts of your citizens, are you not?

speaker: Sanaki
text: ...False. The accusation was completely false.

speaker: Ike
text: The assassination of the apostle was not the work of the Serenes clan?

speaker: Sanaki
text: That is correct.

speaker: Nasir
text: The heron clan possess no fighting skills. Their tribe survived by living a life of peace and piety within their forest. Unlike other laguz, they never focused on developing their strength for the purposes of combat. Anyone with any knowledge of laguz would have known such a thing. At the very least, the citizens of Begnion would have known this. However, they had lost their leader, and in their grief, they cared little for the truth. They were merely looking for some way to vent their rage and despair. Isn't that true...Apostle?

speaker: Elincia
text: Please, Lord Nasir! Your tone of voice...

speaker: Sanaki
text: It's all right, Princess Elincia. He speaks the truth, be it with a sharpened tongue or no.

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike, the bird tribes of Phoenicis target only Begnion ships with their piracy. The ravens of Kilvas are after cargo, and so they attack everyone with equal vigor. The hawk clans, however, hold the heron clan as brethren...and still remember the false accusations. And their brutal murder.

speaker: Ike
text: The heron at Oliver's mansion...He slapped my hand away when I tried to help him. He had such hatred in his eyes. When he leapt from the window, he spoke to me. Remember the genocide, he said. Twenty years have passed, but I will never forgive what you did!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Such needless pain...It may sound like utter hypocrisy, but my people regret deeply the actions of that horrific night. We stole the heron clan from this world... Every time we see the blackened forest, our grave sin comes back to haunt us.

speaker: Nasir
text: Apostle... You are honorable. The majority of the senators have done their best to banish all memory of the Serenes and that night. Yet you have resisted. That is your intent, is it not? You are not like them... You are attempting to take responsibility for the actions of the people. To undo the wrongs of the past, you launched your own investigation into the laguz emancipation issue. You've even gone so far as to hire outsiders like Ike and his mercenaries to expose the problem, haven't you?

speaker: Sanaki
text: ...Princess Elincia?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes?

speaker: Sanaki
text: I would like once more to make use of your escorts. Would you grant me this boon?

speaker: Elincia
text: Of course! Er, that is...If Ike and his group agree, I have no objection to your proposal.

speaker: Ike
text: Depends on what you want.

speaker: Sanaki
text: The member of the heron clan you met...I want you to find him. I want to meet with him. I want to speak with him.

speaker: Ike
text: If that is your wish, we will do it. In any case, we let that monster Oliver slip through our grasp. We'll handle both tasks at the same time.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I'm counting on you.

speaker: Muarim
text: Ahem...

speaker: Tormod
text: Muarim!

speaker: Muarim
text: Little one! How... How was it? Were you treated roughly? Did they attempt to punish you?

speaker: Tormod
text: No, it was nothing. And the apostle? I thought she'd be some mean old hag, but she's just a kid. Really, she's even shorter than I am.

speaker: Muarim
text: Li-little one! You must lower your voice. And watch your tongue!

speaker: Tormod
text: What? Why?

speaker: Ike
text: Rest easy, Muarim. Everyone in this room is with me. The apostle has no ears here.

speaker: Muarim
text: That is good.

speaker: Tormod
text: Muarim?

speaker: Muarim
text: Speaking ill of the apostle here is considered treasonous. Keep it up, and they'll kill you--or threaten to.

speaker: Tormod
text: What?

speaker: Muarim
text: Little one... While we are here, please choose your words with more care than you have shown. I beg of you.

speaker: Tormod
text: Oh, right. Right. I understand.

speaker: Ike
text: For a laguz, you seem to know more about the court etiquette here than my fellow beorc, Tormod.

speaker: Muarim
text: Bah...

speaker: Tormod
text: That's 'cause...'cause I don't know much about any of this stuff. That's all!

speaker: Muarim
text: It is no matter, little one. Ike, the reason I am familiar with the customs of the Begnion nobles is...I myself was once a slave.

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Tormod
text: Oh, no...

speaker: Muarim
text: For generations, my family...served as slaves to one house. They were wealthy and powerful, senators all. As a child, I was raised never to question my station as a slave. From the day that I was born, the most grueling physical labor was as natural as breathing. I knew nothing else. To ensure we were liked by our masters, we were drilled in the etiquette of polite society until it became second nature. We were slaves... We did what we could to live as long as we could. The most important thing was not to incur the wrath of our masters. If we displeased them, we were punished. If we were lucky, we were beaten. If we were unlucky...

speaker: Tormod
text: Muarim! That's enough!

speaker: Muarim
text: I am sorry. Lord Ike...If a former slave like myself is present, all of you will be judged, scorned, and looked down upon. I came here...to ask if you would... take care of something for me. I would have you take care of the little one.

speaker: Tormod
text: Why would you say such a thing? You were born a laguz slave...And you're not allowed to be free...That's not right! That's why we promised each other we'd change all of that. We made a promise! Laguz, like beorc, would build homes and plant fields! Families would live together in peace and freedom! That's the world we dreamed of...

speaker: Muarim
text: That's a dream that belongs to us as former laguz slaves. We don't need the help of another beorc like you.

speaker: Tormod
text: What?...sniff!

speaker: Muarim
text: Little one!...

speaker: Ike
text: ...Does it really warrant that much concern?

speaker: Muarim
text: Huh?

speaker: Ike
text: Since I first arrived here in Begnion, it's something that's been bothering me. If you're born into a noble house, you're a noble. If your parents are slaves, you're a slave. Do you think a person's worth is decided at the moment of their birth? That's... I can't understand a country where that passes for normal, I just can't.

speaker: Muarim
text: Those don't sound like the words of someone working for Princess Crimea. Princesses are princesses because they're born into royal families, right? Are you going to deny that?

speaker: Ike
text: No, you're right. Elincia... She is a princess. I don't think we've treated her with more respect than any other employer we've had, but...Heh. Funny. We've addressed her as Princess the entire time, but I've never really considered what it meant.

speaker: Muarim
text: From where I stand, I think you've been blessed. You were born a beorc and raised in a country with a lenient social structure. That's an enviable life.

speaker: Ike
text: It's so hard... I... No matter how I try, I'll never fully understand your pain. But listen, I didn't treat Elincia any differently after I learned of her heritage. I'm not going to think of you or treat you differently just because you used to be a slave. It's not going to happen. You're...you. And I'm free to think of it that way if I want, right?

speaker: Ike
text: Muarim, there's nothing anyone can do about your past.About the burdens you carry. And I know I don't know everything that'sgoing on, but you shouldn't be trying to push Tormod away. He's dedicated to you, and being with you is his choice. It's part of his freedom.

speaker: Muarim
text: ...I see now. I will go...and find him.

speaker: Ike
text: If meeting those in the temple is uncomfortable, I can go and bring him back. What do you think?

speaker: Muarim
text: No, I can do it. I have a good nose. Tracking the young one's scent while avoiding other beorc is an easy task.

speaker: Muarim
text: Ike... I want... I mean...Never mind. May our friendship be true and enduring.

speaker: Ike
text: I share your sentiment. Our troop will have you for as long as you wish.

speaker: Ike
text: What the...? Um...who are you? How long have you been a member of my troop?

speaker: Stefan
text: I joined after the battle in the sands. My name is Stefan. I apologize for not introducing myself earlier.

speaker: Ike
text: Why are you here?

speaker: Stefan
text: In part it's because I'm curious. But mostly, it's the guiding hand of fate that has led me to you.

speaker: Ike
text: Huh?

speaker: Stefan
text: In the desert, I watched the dance of your sword. You have a unique style, but it is incomplete, filled with hesitation. You have recently lost your teacher, no?

speaker: Ike
text: Ah...

speaker: Stefan
text: Luckily, your foundation is quite strong. Which is why I can be of service. Your technique... How powerful will it be when perfected? I would like to know.

speaker: Ike
text: Wh-who are you?

speaker: Stefan
text: You can learn the dance of blades from me without knowing my history, can you not? What say you? Let your heart decide.

speaker: Ike
text: I understand. If you can help me perfect my technique, I will gladly accept an invitation to learn from you.

speaker: Stefan
text: Then prepare yourself. Come! Attack me with all your strength.

speaker: Greil
text: Good morning, Ike. Today’s your first day as a professional soldier, isn’t it?

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, and I’m ready to go.

speaker: Greil
text: What you are is late. The others were suited up and ready at the break of dawn.

speaker: Ike
text: Sorry. I’ll get up earlier from now on. So, what’s my first job?

speaker: Greil
text: I’m talking with Titania right now. Wait outside until we’re done.

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Titania
text: Very well, Commander Greil, shall we continue?

speaker: Greil
text: You were telling me about some bandits that needed taking care of, weren’t you?

speaker: Titania
text: Correct. The request comes from a nearby village. According to our reports, the bandits are not all that strong. I think it best if I ride out and take a look. I plan on taking Oscar and Boyd along with me.

speaker: Greil
text: Just the brothers? Hm. Go ahead and add Ike to your team. Shinon, Gatrie, and I can handle the other two jobs easily enough. Titania, I’m leaving Ike in your care. I’m trusting you to show him the ropes.

speaker: Titania
text: Understood, Commander.

speaker: Titania
text: Come on, Ike. Let’s get you set up.

speaker: Ike
text: All right...My first job.

speaker: Oscar
text: Captain Titania. Preparations are complete, and I’m ready to go.

speaker: Titania
text: Impeccable timing. It’s nice to know we can always count on you to be at the ready, Oscar.

speaker: Boyd
text: Don’t forget about me! I’m ready for action!

speaker: Titania
text: Is that so, Boyd? That’s a surprise.

speaker: Boyd
text: Ha! Not today it isn’t.

speaker: Boyd
text: As of today, I am going to be the absolute model of perfection. I need to set a good example for Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: I’ll take your word for it.

speaker: Oscar
text: Your first campaign at last. I know you’ve wanted this for a while. Are you nervous,Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: I think I was more nervous last night. I could hardly sleep. This morning, I’m feeling pretty good. It’s the calm before the storm.

speaker: Oscar
text: You should try to relax. You’re not going to be out there alone.

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, you’re right.

speaker: Titania
text: Right. Everyone ready? Let’s go.

speaker: Titania
text: This is the village of Caldea. The bandits are few, but we mustn’t get careless. Our goal is to take out the bandit leader in front of the large building, and then secure that building.

speaker: Titania
text: All right, let me explain what’s going on.

speaker: Titania
text: This is a map of Caldea. They’ve hired us to drive off some bandits. We’re the blue marks here. The red marks are the bandits.

speaker: Titania
text: There aren’t many of them, but we can’t get careless. The one in front of the building up north is their leader.

speaker: Titania
text: Our mission is to take him out and recapture that building.

speaker: Boyd
text: Ike! Listen up! All this stuff is old news to me, but I can give a rookie like you a few tips. First off, don’t let yourself get worked up and jump out in front of everyone. You’ll just end up getting hurt.

speaker: Oscar
text: Don’t try to do too much, Ike. When things get dangerous, you can–and should–rely on us. As long as you watch how the enemy moves carefully, you’ll be fine. Think of this as a training mission.

speaker: Ike
text: I’ll do that. Oscar, Boyd, thanks for your help.

speaker: Oscar
text: Don’t mention it.

speaker: Boyd
text: Just sit back and watch how a professional handles things!

speaker: Titania
text: Enough chitchat, you three! We’ve got work to do!

speaker: Titania
text: Ike, before you engage an enemy, take a good look at his weapon. The weapon you use often determines who has the upper hand in a fight. For example, the axe I’m wielding serves me well against lances, but it fares less well against swords.

speaker: Oscar
text: And my lance is great against swords but not against axes. And to complete the triangle...

speaker: Ike
text: Ah! My sword. It’s strong against axes, but weak against lances. Right?

speaker: Titania
text: Yes, exactly. If you can remember that, you’ll be more effective in combat.

speaker: Boyd
text: That’s just the basics, though. This’ll come in handy soon enough, so don’t forget it.

speaker: Ike
text: Swords over axes...I won’t forget. Not if I remember that I’ll always have the advantage over you, Boyd.

speaker: Boyd
text: Do you think you could maybe find a different way of remembering? Yeah, thanks.

speaker: Titania
text: And one more thing...Don’t forget to visit the locals. We’re here to help, after all. The villagers should welcome our presence.

speaker: Zawanar
text: What’s going on out there? Is that some sort of army? Pah. A bunch of mercenaries looking for their next meal. The villagers must’ve hired ’em. Listen up, lads! Hurt ’em, and hurt ’em bad! We let this bunch live, and we’ll have hordes of hired swords hounding us the rest of our days!

speaker: Bandit
text: It’s those fool villagers...They think they can buy a bunch of sellswords to chase us away. It ain’t gonna work out how they wanted. All they get for their trouble is a bunch of ruined houses. Tear’em down, boys! That’ll teach ’em!

speaker: Bandit
text: My work here is done. This house is totalled! Time to move on to bigger things. Now, I smash me some mercenaries.

speaker: Zawanar
text: You looking for something, fool? You looking for a fight? Heh heh... You came to the right place. I’ll give you a tussle!

speaker: Zawanar
text: I...I’m meant for better than this...I don’t want to die here...

speaker: Zawanar
text: Hey, you’re nothing but a boy. Well, every brat needs a beating now and then. Are you ready for it?

speaker: Ike
text: Not today.If you want to run away, now’s your chance.

speaker: Zawanar
text: Heh heh heh. Imagine that, you sassing me. Don’t that beat all?

speaker: Titania
text: Despite my own warnings, I let my guard down, and I got beaten. Ha ha...urgh...

speaker: Ike
text: Titania, you shouldn’t move.

speaker: Titania
text: That’s the end of it. Ike, are you all right?

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, I’ll be fine.

speaker: Titania
text: You know, you surprised me. To think that you’ve come so far.

speaker: Ike
text: Look at my father, though. I’ve still got such a long way to go.

speaker: Titania
text: There’s nothing you can do about that. After all, Commander Greil is–

speaker: Ike
text: Huh? What about my father?

speaker: Titania
text: Oh, nothing.

speaker: Ike
text: Nothing? Now I’m really curious.

speaker: Titania
text: Don’t worry. You’ll learn all about it someday.

speaker: Boyd
text: Hey, Ike! that wasn’t bad for your first battle. Not as flashy as my first time, though!

speaker: Oscar
text: Yeah, you were a real standout. I’ll never forget the sight of you so keyed up you broke your own axe.

speaker: Boyd
text: Oscar! Dang it! You didn’t have to bring that up!

speaker: Oscar
text: Anyway, Ike. Congrats on finishing your first mission.Welcome to the group.

speaker: Titania
text: Everyone’s all right? Then let’s get going. I’m sure Mist has a nice, hot meal waiting for us.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Ahem...Now then, you have proclaimed yourself to be the orphan of Crimea's King Ramon. Princess Elincia Ridell Crimea, correct?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I have heard stories that King Crimea had a daughter in secret. My men have reported as much to me in the past. However, whether you are that princess or not is another tale. Do you have nothing that would lend credence to your claims?

speaker: Elincia
text: Nothing at all. It took all my energy simply to avoid capture by Daein. I had no time to secure any proof of my claim.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Hmph. And with Crown Prince Renning also dead, there is no one who even knows your face. What am I to do?

speaker: Ike
text: I will vouch for her.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: I have no doubt that Princess Elincia is the true heir to the throne of Crimea.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Oh, really? And tell me, what gives you this strength of conviction? If we believe her story, this woman has not engaged with the outside world since the day she was born. So how is it that you, a lowly mercenary, dare to assert her authenticity?

speaker: Ike
text: The Daein army pursues her with bloody-minded determination. At every turn, they demand that we turn Princess Elincia over to them. What further proof do you need?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Hmm... If someone of...proper standing made that pronouncement, I would accept it as irrefutable proof. But you... You're a commoner. You have no surname, no documented lineage...You have nothing. I know commoners. They are poor. For a price, they will support any lie, no matter how outlandish.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Oh! Now, I suppose you will tell me you are the son of some noble house? No, of course not. But wait, perhaps you're a royal knight of Crimea?

speaker: Ike
text: I am neither a noble nor a knight. I have no connection with the palace whatsoever. And no matter how much gold I stood to gain, I would not betray my convictions. Elincia has paid us, yes, but nothing more than the standard fee to purchase our services as her escort. Nothing more. We have come this far only because we believe Elincia to be a woman of integrity. We would not sell our swords to a liar. I don't care how high and mighty you might be. I will not stand here and let you mock the bond of trust that ties us to Elincia.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike!

speaker: Lekain
text: How dare you! Who are you to address the apostle so crudely! Guards! Guards! Seize this man! For his abuse of the apostle, the penalty can be only death!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Halt!...Ha ha! Ha ha ha! Sephiran was right about you. You are very interesting.

speaker: Lekain
text: A-Apostle?

speaker: Ike
text: Sephiran? That monk we rescued from the prisons?

speaker: Sanaki
text: A monk, was it? His disguises are always so clever. It never ceases to amaze me. As always, he remains an enigma. Heed my words! Sephiran is in truth Duke Belsys, prime minister of Begnion and my most trusted advisor. He has been traveling the neighboring lands for months, trying to ascertain the condition of the people there.

speaker: Sigrun
text: We have received detailed reports on Princess Elincia and the mercenary company serving as her escort.

speaker: Ike
text: So...you knew we were coming. You knew who we were all along.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Yes. I apologize for testing you. You see, life here in the palace is dreadfully dull. I am always so very bored. Thanks to the princess and her brazen little escort, this interrogation proved to be an amusing diversion.

speaker: Oliver
text: Oh ho ho! So that's what this was! How very like you, Apostle. A cunning game of wits and words. Simply smashing! Even your most loyal servant, Duke Oliver of Tanas, was on the verge of being completely fooled. I am humbled! Oh ho ho! Come, Duke Lekain!

speaker: Lekain
text: Ah-ahem. It was all a ruse, was it?...Oh, Apostle, you do tease us so mercilessly! Still, it was not such a bad way to amuse ourselves, was it, Duke Hetzel?

speaker: Hetzel
text: Hoo! Too true, my good duke! Princess Crimea, it appears that you have put quite a smile on the face of our beloved apostle. What an honor that must be! Hoo hoo hoo!

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Ah... Um...Yes... I suppose...

speaker: Ike
text: Madness!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Oh, yes, I almost forgot in all the fun...Sephiran has already vouched for your identity as the true princess of Crimea. I require no further proof. You may rest easy.

speaker: Elincia
text: I am...most grateful.

speaker: Ike
text: Wait a minute!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Yes?

speaker: Ike
text: What is the meaning of this? You knew Elincia was Princess Crimea? And you continued to humiliate her for your own entertainment? For some stupid game of wits and words? This is no joke!

speaker: Ike
text: Elincia's homeland is lost to her! Her family has been hunted down and killed by the monsters of Daein! And with nowhere else to turn, she endures mortal danger and terrible heartbreak to reach your door. And then you...you laugh at her?! Where is the humor in that? Where is your decency? You're horrible! You are all horrid people! You disgust me beyond words! And you owe Elincia a proper apology.

speaker: Elincia
text: My... My lord Ike, please--

speaker: Lekain
text: Wretched peasant! You loose that treasonous tongue once more, and--

speaker: Sanaki
text: Duke Lekain, restrain yourself!

speaker: Lekain
text: But... But...

speaker: Sanaki
text: I am speaking. Be still.

speaker: Lekain
text: Grrr...

speaker: Sanaki
text: Now then, Ike. I fully understand your feelings. Your passion for your employer is truly a beautiful thing. Would that my own fawning vassals shared your commitment. However, truth be told, your behavior does test my patience. Raise your voice once more to me, and you will seriously damage the princess's already precarious position. Do you understand?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Not really. Why don't you fill me in Even if Elincia is truly Crimean royalty, she is at best heir to a dead country. Nothing more. Without Begnion's support, Elincia's claim holds no meaning. Am I mistaken?

speaker: Ike
text: Pah!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Even if we harm her fragile feelings, for the sake of her country's future, she must stand by and say nothing. In fact, she is in no position to do anything but beg for Begnion's favor. Or...hadn't you noticed?

speaker: Sanaki
text: I have much to consider. For now, I shall take my leave of you. I will meet with my senators soon and discuss this state of affairs. Crimea's future will not be uncertain for long. Until that time, I suggest you rest and relax. Perhaps you could try your hand at our courtly games of...wit and words?

speaker: Ike
text: What incredible nerve! To take advantage of our situation and speak down to us like that...I don't care if she's the empress or the apostle or whatever! I can't stand her!

speaker: Titania
text: Listen, Ike, isn't it possible that the apostle saved you?

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Nasir
text: Titania is correct. Begnion is a nation ruled by time-honored custom and ancient conventions. You insulted the apostle--the very symbol of their way of life. The fact that you are still breathing is a miracle.

speaker: Ike
text: I...hadn't realized.

speaker: Nasir
text: And as her escort, your criminal behavior would fall directly on your employer, Princess Elincia. If you had truly angered the apostle, any hope of restoring Crimea would have vanished like a puff of smoke.

speaker: Ike
text: That's madness! They would sacrifice a whole country to satisfy their own egos?

speaker: Soren
text: Ike... This may not be much of an answer, but letting madness rule the day is the prerogative of nobility. The beorc divide themselves into classes. And with classes come prejudice. From the moment of our birth to our final dying gasp, we commoners know we are not allowed to defy the upper classes.

speaker: Ike
text: Princess Elincia...I... I'm sorry. My ignorance does not excuse my stupidity. ...I truly am sorry.

speaker: Elincia
text: No. I...What you said, you said in my defense and in my honor. It made me very pleased.

speaker: Ike
text: Huh?

speaker: Elincia
text: To see you so angry on my behalf...Your words filled my heart.

speaker: Ike
text: It wasn't as noble as you make it sound.

speaker: Elincia
text: However, there is one point that I would contest. It is true that I've lost my family...and my home. But I did have people to turn to...People to rely on. My lord Ike, you and your company were at my side. For me, this has been a great source of inspiration and of happiness.

speaker: Ike
text: Princess Elincia...

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike... Please call me Elincia.

speaker: Ike
text: Huh? That would be improper, wouldn't it? I mean, you're our employer, and...

speaker: Elincia
text: You called me so earlier.

speaker: Ike
text: I did? Really?

speaker: Elincia
text: You didn't notice?

speaker: Ike
text: No, I... Oh. My aplogies. I'll be more careful. Well, I suppose we should go. They've prepared rooms for us.

speaker: Elincia
text: Ah, my lord Ike......

speaker: Mist
text: I am so booooored! We've been here for five days already...And there's absolutely nothing to do! They gave me free reign to wander the temple, but I've seen everything! I'm tired of it!

speaker: Titania
text: I take it Princess Elincia has been invited to yet another social gathering? A little time off is one thing, but this...

speaker: Ike
