text: I guess I'll get in some fencing practice...

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike, the captain of the apostle's holy guard is headed this way.

speaker: Sigrun
text: I beg your pardon. Are you and your mercenary company enjoying your stay here in Begnion? Is there anything you find wanting?

speaker: Ike
text: There's nothing to do, and Mist is bored.

speaker: Mist
text: Ah, Ike! Why'd you say that!?

speaker: Ike
text: Weren't you just complaining about that exact same thing to me? You said you were bored and tired of everything.

speaker: Mist
text: That doesn't mean you should go spouting it to everyone! Oh, you're such an idiot, Ike!

speaker: Titania
text: My apologies... Neither of them meant any offense. They're just frustrated.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Yes, I understand that. I will pay it no mind.

speaker: Ike
text: Did you have some reason for coming to speak with us?

speaker: Sigrun
text: I bring word from the apostle...She wishes to charge you with a task.

speaker: Ike
text: The apostle wants to employ us!?

speaker: Titania
text: I didn't expect this.

speaker: Ike
text: Expect what?

speaker: Titania
text: Your reaction. I'd have thought that you would be spouting and fuming at the thought of working for the apostle.

speaker: Ike
text: If Princess Elincia can tolerate endless social gatherings to judge Begnion's mood and garner her favor, the least I can do is help her earn points by running an errand or two.

speaker: Titania
text: Hmm...

speaker: Soren
text: Ike, they're coming.

speaker: Ike
text: So we lay in wait for them here, right?

speaker: Soren
text: Yes. The apostle's orders were clear. Stop the band of merchants traveling on the old highway, and seize their cargo. This does look to be the best spot for an ambush.

speaker: Ike
text: All right. I don't know who we're facing,but we're on the job. Let's do this right!

speaker: Gashilama
text: A poor crop this time around. Cats, tigers, and a few crows...All we've got are laborers. We're not going to get rich with this.

speaker: Bandit
text: Aw, and we worked hard to catch'em! Is it as bad as all that?

speaker: Gashilama
text: I've been selling half-breeds for twenty- five years. The ones that fetch the highest price are the trophy herons. And if they're white-winged royals, the fanatics will empty their purses of every last coin.

speaker: Bandit
text: Well, if that's the case, why don't we hit Serenes Forest next time? There might be a few of 'em left.

speaker: Gashilama
text: You've the brains of a dead wyvern! Why do you think herons are so expensive? It's because they're rare! It's been twenty years since that mob burned Serenes. The herons were all roasted like chickens! No matter how you look at it, that was utter lunacy. All that gold, up in smoke.

speaker: Bandit
text: Oh... If they're so valuable, I'd like to see one with my own eyes. I'd catch it and put it in a cage...

speaker: Gashilama
text: ...Idiot...

speaker: Bandit
text: Think what you could buy with all that gold. A new axe...Oh, and some furry boots, too!

speaker: Gashilama
text: Shut up, fool! Stop your daydreaming, and look over there!

speaker: Bandit
text: Wh-what? Who are they?

speaker: Gashilama
text: Bah! Look alive, lads! They're not common travelers!

speaker: Ike
text: Here they come. Titania, are we sure this is the right bunch?

speaker: Titania
text: This fog makes it hard to see, but their numbers and appearance match our intelligence... It must be them.

speaker: Soren
text: Well, they've certainly seen us. They're readying their weapons.

speaker: Ike
text: Very well... Get ready to fight,everyone!

speaker: Makalov
text: Ah... What terrible luck. My sixth sense told me that the weather would be nice today.

speaker: Bandit
text: Hey! Grumbling and whining won't pay off your debt! Come on, beautiful, cough up my gold!

speaker: Makalov
text: I'd dearly love to pay you, but unfortunately...I'm broke.

speaker: Bandit
text: Not again! You're employed as a bodyguard! Why don't you have enough gold to pay me back?! Grr! When we get back to the base, I'll get what's mine. Try to run, and you'll pay in pain!

speaker: Makalov
text: ...Threaten all you like! I can't give you what I don't have! Ooo, I hope that sounded brave...Oh, dear... What am I going to do? It seems I must go crawling back to my dear sister once again. Oh, she's going to be so mad... But in the end, I'm sure she'll help! After all, it's for the life of her brother! Right! Tonight, I pay a little visit to the barracks of the sacred pegasus knights!

speaker: Marcia
text: B-B--Brother?!

speaker: Makalov
text: Hey, Marcia! Heh... Hey, long time, huh? Good timing, though! I was just thinking about paying you a visit, Sis.

speaker: Marcia
text: Long time? Long time?! You dungheel! Where in the name of heaven have you been? You racked up all that debt and then ran away? You're such an irresponsible skunk! Thanks to your worthless hide, I had to leave the sacred pegasus knights!

speaker: Makalov
text: Huh? But why?

speaker: Marcia
text: Because there were a bunch of debt collectors hanging around the barracks! That's why!

speaker: Makalov
text: Oh, that's... That's a shame. Listen, I was trying to increase the money I borrowed and pay off the original, but it, um...vanished. And I swear that just kept happening! I'd almost get enough and then...poof! Gone! Ha ha! Ha? Hmm...

speaker: Marcia
text: You rat. You cheese-eating rat! You haven't changed at all...Let's go. You're coming with me.

speaker: Makalov
text: With you... Where are we going? What am I going to do?

speaker: Marcia
text: You're joining my company. I'm going to let Ike beat some sense into you. We'll see how that works.

speaker: Makalov
text: No, wait... I'm working for these guys at the moment, and...Well, if I just up and joined with the other side, it might cause problems--

speaker: Marcia
text: STUFF IT, SPONGE-BRAIN!!! NO MORE LAME EXCUSES!!! FOLLOW ME!!! NOW!!

speaker: Makalov
text: Sorry, Sis! Sorry! I'm coming...

speaker: Calill
text: Oh...bother. Buying all these things is well and good, but I simply can't carry it all. And where's Largo?! He leaves me in this backwater burg and wanders off to goddess only knows where...

speaker: Ike
text: Hello?

speaker: Calill
text: Oh, you there! Today's your lucky day. You've arrived at just the right time. I have something nice to give you. I just got back from a shopping spree, and I got this as a free bonus of sorts. Oh, please, no need to thank me. When you're a sophisticate like me, you never want for trinkets. Or men, for that matter. Well, toodle-doo, then! Be sure to treasure that for the rest of your days! Now...which way to the nearest city?

speaker: Girl
text: I found this in the river. But...my mom said it was dirty, and I had to throw it away. Do you... Do you want it? Really? All right, you can have it. Take care of it, please.

speaker: Grandma
text: EH? DID YOU SAY CATTLE? ...A BATTLE? STRANGER? WHAT? ...OH, DANGER! GOODNESS! WHAT AM I TO DO? Oh, maybe this will help, dearie. It's just lying here collecting dust...Just like me...Never a visitor...Anyway, I don't know what it does, but...it's pretty. If I gave it to my grandkids, they might write once in a while...HERE! TAKE IT! NOW DO ME A FAVOR AND PROTECT MY HOUSE, ALL RIGHT?...NO, MY HOUSE! ...A MOUSE?! WHERE?!

speaker: Gashilama
text: They...They're crushing us...They're nothing but a pack of rats, but they fight like demons! Har har! But no matter how tough they are, there's no way they can stand up to a real monster! Hey! You there! Release the feral! Har har har! Now, all we have to do is sit back and watch 'em chew their heads clean off!

speaker: Gashilama
text: You... You're just like us! You eat meat, you ride horses... I mean, come on! We're not hurting any humans here! What's wrong with buying and selling a few half-breeds?

speaker: Gashilama
text: How did this happen? I've lost everything...

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, you! Why don't you lay down your weapons and walk out of here with your lives? You can posture as much as you want, but there's no way you can beat us!

speaker: Gashilma
text: Shut it! I don't know why you're here, but if we lose our cargo, we lose everything! It ain't happening!

speaker: Ike
text: In that case, we've no choice. You'll receive no mercy from us!

speaker: Makalov
text: Are you a mercenary too? It's a tough life being a warrior for hire, isn't it? I don't like having to do this, but...I must pay off my debts, or my sister will have my head.

speaker: Makalov
text: Ah, forgive me, Marcia...

speaker: Marcia
text: Brother...Wh-why...

speaker: Makalov
text: Marcia! Hold on! Please... Don't die on me...MARCIA!!!

speaker: Ike
text: Our duty is done. Let's grab the cargo and get out of here!

speaker: Sigrun
text: Well done. The news of your victory is welcome, as is the cargo you seized. Now, about your payment...

speaker: Ike
text: Wait. This mysterious cargo was a bunch of really heavy crates...Would you tell me what they contained?

speaker: Sigrun
text: That--

speaker: Tanith
text: Your job was to deliver the cargo. You've no need to investigate further.

speaker: Ike
text: But--

speaker: Tanith
text: Princess Elincia has returned to her quarters. You would do well to inform her of your safe return.

speaker: Sigrun
text: It appears that the apostle will handle your payment on the morrow. Perhaps you can speak with her then.I beg your leave. I must be going.

speaker: Ike
text: Very well.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Thank all of you for coming,my fellow laguz kings. It's been decades since all of us were gathered in one place. I would extend my gratitude to King Deghinsea of Goldoa, who arranged this meeting place at short notice.

speaker: Deghinsea
text: It was nothing, King Caineghis.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Fellow kings and countrymen, attend to my words! As you no doubt have heard, Daein has invaded Crimea and overrun her. Of course, Crimea is a beorc nation...However, since the time of her founding, she has made every effort to engage the laguz with honor and dignity. Never has this been more true than during the thirty-year reign of good King Ramon. During this era, Gallia and Crimea initiated many ambitious cultural projects in an attempt to bring our divided people closer.Yet one man has always reviled our work...The Daein king, Ashnard. Why he took this recent course, however...I know not. Ashnard's actions are monstrous. His army has put much of Crimea to the sword. Her people live in terror. Her king lies dead. And now, the Daein forces continue their ruinous march and cross the border into laguz territory... Into Gallia.

speaker: Tibarn
text: That trespass, O king of lions, is because your country chooses to harbor King Crimea's orphan. Is it not?

speaker: Caineghis
text: Yes, that is the justification they would present.

speaker: Tibarn
text: But the princess of Crimea is no longer in Gallia, is she?

speaker: Caineghis
text: Your spies are as efficient as ever, King Tibarn of Phoenicis. As you say, the princess has already departed for Begnion.

speaker: Tibarn
text: I know this only because she came to the aid of a ship carrying Begnion's apostle.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Ah! So Princess Elincia is safe and in contact with the Begnion Empire? That news gladdens my heavy heart.

speaker: Tibarn
text: I do not believe that Daein yet has this information. If word got out that the princess of Crimea has been granted sanctuary in Begnion, Daein might halt its invasion of Gallia.

speaker: Naesala
text: Your information is dated, hawk king! Have your legendary eyes and ears abandoned you after all these years?

speaker: Tibarn
text: You have something you wish to say?

speaker: Caineghis
text: Would you be so kind as to explain yourself, King Kilvas?

speaker: Naesala
text: Princess Elincia barely escaped Crimea with her life and then fled to Gallia. And yet a certain king of beasts there, one on whom she had pinned all hope, chose not to support her.

speaker: Naesala
text: With nowhere else to turn, the princess and her retinue spent two long months at sea, arriving in Begnion mere days ago.Daein knows of these events as well,and the king has dispatched a team of hunters to make a corpse of the girl. And that, dear kings, is the latest news...At least, to the best of my poor knowledge.

speaker: Caineghis
text: Daein knows the princess is in Begnion?! King Kilvas, how did you come to possess this information?

speaker: Naesala
text: Why, there's no trick to it. I just perk up my ears and...point them in the right direction.

speaker: Tibarn
text: You expect us to believe that a stray wind carried it to your ears? This is an odd tale, Naesala.

speaker: Naesala
text: Hmm? Do you think so? Well, there is one trick to information gathering that I know. Shall I share it with you?

speaker: Tibarn
text: If it involves dealing with human scum, I'll pass. Forgoing my laguz pride is not something I'm willing to do.

speaker: Naesala
text: Ha! Is that not always the way of Phoenicis, to cling to those last tattered remnants of pride? Instead of proclaiming that you will attack none but Begnion ships, just admit that you don't have the power to do more!

speaker: Tibarn
text: What did you say?

speaker: Deghinsea
text: Both of you will desist at once! King Naesala of Kilvas, your actions of late can indeed be judged as too extreme.

speaker: Naesala
text: Black Dragon King of Goldoa, what do you pretend to know of my actions? Please, enlighten me.

speaker: Deghinsea
text: I would remind you of the beorc ship you attacked in Phoenicisian waters...and left stranded in Goldoan territory.

speaker: Naesala
text: Oh...that.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Naesala, you lying crow! You've been sneaking about in my territory again, have you?

speaker: Deghinsea
text: I heard from my own son, Kurthnaga, that a beorc resembling Princess Crimea was on board that ship.

speaker: Kurthnaga
text: It is true.

speaker: Caineghis
text: What? King Kilvas, you...

speaker: Naesala
text: Don't act surprised! I have no intention of ruling some tiny island nation forever. I will make Kilvas a name to remember! To that end, no amount of gold is enough. Laguz or beorc, I care not. If the pay is right, there's nothing I won't do.

speaker: Deghinsea
text: I care not about the reach of your ambition, but you should choose your methods with more care. What good will it do you to expand your domain only to find enemies at your every border?

speaker: Naesala
text: I will take your words to heart for the time being.

speaker: Deghinsea
text: And you, too, King Phoenicis. What good will your piracy do you if it earns the wrath of Begnion? Continue at this pace, and there's no telling when the hostilities will end.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Until the people of Begnion apologize for the slaughter of our brother herons, I will do no such thing.

speaker: Deghinsea
text: Prince Reyson of Serenes? Are you of the same mind?

speaker: Reyson
text: Those humans burned Serenes Forest and killed my people. No amount of human blood can slake my thirst for vengeance. For my siblings, for my countrymen, I demand justice. I cannot even return mybedridden father to our forest home!  I am no soldier. I know nothing of war, so King Phoenicis acts in my stead. I am most grateful to him, and I would not see him stop until Begnion has paid.

speaker: Deghinsea
text: Blood leads only to blood, and violence begets violence. Nothing more. Revenge is simply another name for murder.

speaker: Deghinsea
text: And you, king of lions? What will you do about your home of Gallia? Now that you know Daein's feint toward Gallia is merely another move in his game of war, how will you act?

speaker: Caineghis
text: They've made no formal declaration of war.Until they do, we watch and wait.

speaker: Tibarn
text: If it's the first step towards eradicating all human scum, Phoenicis will help you destroy Daein.

speaker: Caineghis
text: No. Unless this becomes a true war among all nations, I want you to stay your hand. As long as Gallia is protected by the sea of trees, we can stave off Daein's attacks.

speaker: Naesala
text: Ah, the luxury of a large nation! You would waste a chance to expand your territory just to maintain the status quo? Sad.

speaker: Deghinsea
text: I agree with King Gallia. If we were to form a laguz alliance against Daein, we would drive Begnion to Daein's side and lose a valuable ally. The flames of war cannot be fanned haphazardly. Above all, we must think of Lehran's Medallion. Its location is unknown...But it still exists. We know this. And as long as it does, we cannot allow any war that could stand to engulf all our nations! Do you understand, laguz kings? I beg of you, do not forget it.

speaker: Maid
text: Psst! You wanna hear somethin'? There's a rumor going 'round that a tiger sub-human has been seen on the foggy banks of this very river!

speaker: Maid
text: Eh, wot? You don't seem surprised! All right then, how about this? That sub-human? They say it's ALWAYS in beast form! It can't change back! Right frightening, ain't it? The only way for us humans to fight them savages is to wait for 'em to change out of beast form. I mean, how can we kill 'em if they won't change?

speaker: Maid
text: Still no reaction, eh? What a bore! 'Owzabout this juicy morsel, then? Was saving it, I was, but... I 'eard from my darling in the army, that tigers, cats, and other four-legged sub-humans HATE fire magic. That's a useful tidbit, ain't it? Oh, I knows things!

speaker: Lady
text: You there! Serving wench...There's work to be done. Why are you wasting time chatterin' on?

speaker: Maid
text: Wha-what's wrong? Just saying 'allo to one of the new servants is all!

speaker: Lady
text: You fool! This is no servant!

speaker: Maid
text: ...Aye? ...Oy? ...Eh wot? Oh, crickey! Princess Crimea's escort...? A guest of the apostle...?!? Oh, ohnoohmygosh! Please...Please forgive me!

speaker: Maid
text: Wha-what should I do? Ooo, he looked right angry, he did! I might get sacked!

speaker: Gatrie
text: Well, if it isn't Ike! Out for a walk, Commander?

speaker: Ike
text: Hello, Gatrie. Yeah, if I stay in that horrible, gaudy room for too long, I start to feel depressed. Is that why you're out here, too?

speaker: Gatrie
text: No, I'm here for different reasons. I'm just...admiring the flowers.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, right. Yes, they all seem to be in bloom this time of year. The large yellow ones are especially pretty.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Not those flowers...THOSE flowers!

speaker: Ike
text: ...Gatrie, we're inside. There's nothing here but the temple handmaidens.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Exactly! It's like a whole new species of girl lives in Begnion! Everyone in this palace is drop-dead gorgeous!

speaker: Gatrie
text: You know what I mean, Ike? Tee hee! Say, which one strikes your fancy? That buxom lass with the chestnut hair is... Hey, Ike? Ike? Bah! He's still just a boy!

speaker: Astrid
text: Um, Commander Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: Hm? Oh, it's you.

speaker: Astrid
text: Are you trying to clear your head as well?

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, I guess so. I'm just walking and thinking about things. Begnion is so...odd. I don't understand this country at all.

speaker: Astrid
text: Mm...I can see that. Everything's so wrapped up in form and tradition, it feels like Begnion has lost track of more important things.

speaker: Ike
text: You're some noble house's daughter, are you not? What made you decide to become a knight?

speaker: Astrid
text: To escape my royal family... No, not to escape...but to confront it. I want my life to be my own.

speaker: Ike
text: How do you like being a knight?

speaker: Astrid
text: I am still not satisfied. I may now be a knight, but my hands still shake when I draw my bowstring. So perhaps my goal was not simply to become a knight. Perhaps my true goal was to become stronger. Commander Ike, the others say that you never give up, no matter how bleak the fight. That seems like true strength to me.

speaker: Astrid
text: Please, allow me to continue fighting by your side. If I remain with you, I will grow stronger from your example.

speaker: Ike
text: Your skill with the bow is spectacular. How could I possibly refuse your request? We're pleased to have you.

speaker: Astrid
text: Oh...thank you! Thank you very much!

speaker: Marcia
text: Aaaaahhhh...

speaker: Ike
text: That was quite a sigh.

speaker: Marcia
text: Huh? Aw, nuts! You heard that, handsome? Sorry about that.

speaker: Ike
text: You've been behaving oddly lately.Something happen?

speaker: Marcia
text: Pfff! I'm fine! It's just...Well, being here in Begnion is...difficult, you know?

speaker: Ike
text: Difficult? You were a member of the pegasus knights here, weren't you? Aren't you happy to see some of your old friends?

speaker: Marcia
text: No, I'm not happy!! It's... It's so blasted embarrassing! I can't bear to face them!

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Marcia
text: I've told you why I resigned my knighthood, haven't I?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, you're searching for your brother.

speaker: Marcia
text: It's my brother's fault... I... I...Aaargh! That no-good chum bucket!

speaker: Ike
text: Um...maybe we should just drop it.

speaker: Marcia
text: ...Huh? Oh, no it's--Don't worry. I'm fine.

speaker: Ike
text: Don't let it get to you too much. I don't want you distracted in a fight, all right?

speaker: Marcia
text: Got it. Thanks.

speaker: Marcia
text: Ike's a brother, too... So why is he so different from my brother? Grrr! Lazy do-nothing!

speaker: Narration
text: The Crimean royal palac, located in the center of Melior, is famed for its beautiful  gardens where the world seems at peace. But times have changed. Countless battles have raged in these idyllic confines, and a new dark lord now sits upon the throne. The palace itself has not suffered--it remains a study in dignity and elegance. Yet there is no peace on this day. A grim tension fills the air, engulfing all it touches in deafening silence. Within the heart of the palace sits the author of this war: Ashnard, king of Daein.

speaker: Narration
text: Ike, supreme commander of the Crimean army, and Elincia, princess of Crimea, have completed their battle preparations. Now, they spend a tense morning waiting for the decisive battle that will conclude their yearlong odyssey. They wait for the beginning of the end.

speaker: Bastian
text: Princess? It's time.

speaker: Elincia
text: It's right there... I can see the capital...Father, Mother, my lord Uncle...Your Elincia has returned...

speaker: Lucia
text: Our soldiers are in formation and awaiting your word, Princess. For good or ill, this will be our final battle. Before they march, would you...speak to them?

speaker: Elincia
text: What? Y-y-you want me to...address the troops?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: This fight will determine if Ashnard falls and if we can all return to our beloved homeland. Today, Princess, we risk all. Giving men the courage to fight is the duty of a leader.

speaker: Elincia
text: I...I don't know how well I'll do, but...I will try.

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Ahem!...Hear me! Brave fighting men of Crimea! Much have you lost in service to your land.

speaker: Elincia
text: Hear me! Beloved friends of the laguz! You, too, have given all for our fair cause. Hear me! My trusted company of old! You men of Greil did see me to this day.

speaker: Elincia
text: I stand before you made of flesh and bone, alive because you risked your lives for me. A word cannot my thanks express in kind...

speaker: Elincia
text: We march today into the jaws of fate; our enemy lies in wait o'er this hill. If on the 'morrow, Ashnard lives no more, my fondest dream is to among you walk and give you each my heartfelt thanks anew.

speaker: Elincia
text: Let not this dream dissolve into dispair! We will defeat the dreaded king of Daein! We will reclaim this land we hold so dear. Lend me your strength! Lend me your weary hearts! Today we make our fate for good and all. One life can make a mark upon this world. One life can move the wheel of history. Be that one life! Fight well! Fight brave! Fight true.

speaker: Ranulf
text: ...Where did that come from?! That was magnificent! It seems the princess, too, has grown stronger.

speaker: Ike
text: It's said we grow into the roles we're given, isn't it? Elincia will make a splendid queen.

speaker: Ike
text: That's... That's just what Nasir said! What? It's true! Stop it! Don't give me that I-can't-believe-what-I-just-heard look.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Nasir said it, right? Whew! That's a relief! I thought the world had gone mad.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Stupid cat.

speaker: Ike
text: All right, let's go! This ends today!

speaker: Titania
text: I'm ready.

speaker: Soren
text: I have everything I need.

speaker: Ike
text: Very well, we're ready--

speaker: Titania
text: Say, Ike! This is the end of the end, you know? So...rather than just giving orders... Why don't you say a word, too?

speaker: Ike
text: I think Princess Elincia said enough!

speaker: Mist
text: I want to hear what you have to say, Brother! Father always did it, didn't he?

speaker: Ike
text: You want me to say something...like Father would have done?

speaker: Mist
text: Uh-huh!

speaker: Ike
text: Um...hey there...Before this final battle, there's only one thing I want to tell all of you...

speaker: Ike
text: I don't want any of you dying on me! Remember--you only have one life! At a time like this, it doesn't matter what our blood ties are. We are family. That's what my father always used to say. And today...for the first time... I understand why he said it... Because we are a family.

speaker: Ike
text: So if you don't want to cause your family any grief, then live! Don't drop your guard! Don't turn your back! Use every drop of your strength! Our road has been long, but it ends today! Let's liberate Crimea and free our friends...and our families...from Daein's tyranny! Men of Crimea...Laguz of Tellius...Greil Mercenaries...MOVE OUT!!

speaker: Unknown
text: Attack! We're being attacked!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: The castle gate has fallen! The Crimean army cannot be stopped!

speaker: Bryce
text: ...It appears the end is near. Your Majesty, please use the rear gate and withdraw. We will cover your retreat.

speaker: Ashnard
text: I am not leaving.

speaker: Bryce
text: But if... If we lose Your Majesty, the Daein royal bloodline itself will be lost!

speaker: Ashnard
text: Are you saying I will lose? Hm? Is that what you wish to say?

speaker: Bryce
text: ...Of course not! However, our army is in dire straits. It is merely an act of prudence, Your Majesty. I humbly ask that you consider the continuance of the bloodline above all else. Of course, your judgment--

speaker: Ashnard
text: The value of the thirteenth generation of Daein's royal family is not so high as to warrant your pathetic display. I AM Daein. If I am to be destroyed, then let Daein be destroyed with me.

speaker: Bryce
text: Your... Your Majesty... That is--

speaker: Ashnard
text: I have no need of inconstant retainers. You are an obstacle. Away with you.

speaker: Bryce
text: ...B-but, Your Majesty...

speaker: Ashnard
text: My sole desire is to rule through strength. The weak perish, and the strong live on... This is the law of nature. It is the law the goddess herself created when she forged this world.

speaker: Bryce
text: ...It appears that further conversation would only be a waste of time. Though even if His Majesty desires it not, I will remain and protect him. I cannot allow the legacy of Daein to end here!

speaker: Ashnard
text: Tell me, Bryce... You were my father's retainer, were you not?

speaker: Bryce
text: ...From the fifteenth year of my life...and for twenty more years until his death... I did serve him faithfully.

speaker: Ashnard
text: The thing that killed my father was not plague, nor was it another illness.  It was me.

speaker: Bryce
text: Wh-what?

speaker: Ashnard
text: Oh, but it doesn't end there. There was my stepmother, too. And every brother who stood to be a legitimate heir...All of them died by my hand.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Are you still determined to protect me? Knowing this truth?

speaker: Bryce
text: ...I am...Even knowing now as I do...you are still your father's son. The blood of Daein's kings flows in you. You are all that remains....By your leave.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Such loyalty to a corpse...In truth, there is nothing in this world more humorous than a knight.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey! Look out!

speaker: Elincia
text: Is... Is that...

speaker: Ike
text: Elincia, what are you doing?! Get back!

speaker: Elincia
text: ...Ashnard...

speaker: Ike
text: Wh-what did you say? THAT is the king of Daein?!

speaker: Ashnard
text: Heh heh heh heh...It's been a long time, Princess Crimea.

speaker: Ashnard
text: You look quite different than you did the day that I cut your father and mother down like cattle... I can hardly believe you're the same little girl who did nothing but tremble and stare at me.

speaker: Elincia
text: You... You craven-- I've returned to see you defeated! I will no longer allow you to treat Crimea any way you please!

speaker: Ashnard
text: Haaa haa haa! How brave and noble of you. However, you are not the one I seek.

speaker: Elincia
text: Aaah!

speaker: Ike
text: Elincia!

speaker: Ashnard
text: Are you the one they claim is the son of Gawain?

speaker: Ike
text: King Ashnard of Daein! Your treachery dies on my blade!

speaker: Ashnard
text: Oh ho? Ah ha ha ha haaaa! I see that blade in your hand... It is a sacred blade, is it not? The only type of blade that can pierce my armor. Hm. It matters not how famous the blade. If the wielder lacks skill, the greatest sword is nothing but blunted steel.

speaker: Ike
text: Don't worry. You will see for yourself how blunt it is.

speaker: Ashnard
text: I expect good things from you, son of Gawain. What you see before you are my elite, handpicked soldiers. How will you deal with them? I'm looking forward to watching you. Don't disappoint me!

speaker: Ike
text: Hold!

speaker: Ike
text: Any of you whose arms remember what it is like to battle, step forth! I would take of your strength now!

speaker: Ike
text: Are you nervous?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes. And you, my lord Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: No. I'm actually pretty calm, in a strange way...Now that we're finally here, I can focus on defeating King Daein. Nothing else seems to matter.

speaker: Elincia
text: I wonder if we shall win...

speaker: Ike
text: We will win. I didn't come this far to lose. You've come all this way as well, so believe in yourself!

speaker: Elincia
text: ...You're right!

speaker: Nasir
text: ...Ike! I don't like these odds! I think it likely that we may take a lot of casualties. What do you think of pulling in one of the other commanders to lend us a hand?

speaker: Giffca
text: I have answered your call. So, Daein's elite soldiers are giving you some trouble, are they?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Sorry to have kept you waiting. But now that I'm here, you can breath easier. I promise you that King Daein will fall at my hands.

speaker: Naesala
text: I'm here, but heed my words! I'm only here to aid you! Don't try to put the burden of this battle on my shoulders.

speaker: Ashnard
text: One blow. For nameless wretches like you, one blow is more than enough.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Heh heh heh heh. You've done well to have grown so strong. At last, I have gained a foe worthy enough to test my sword. Excellent! Enjoy my might to your heart's content!

speaker: Ashnard
text: ...Do you think you can defeat me? Ggrrraaahh haarr haaarr haaaarrrhhh... GGGRRAAAAAGGGGHHHH!!! It's not over yet. I haven't seen all you are capable of.

speaker: Ike
text: What...are you doing?

speaker: Ashnard
text: Now is the time to use this!

speaker: Ike
text: NO! You blind, stupid fool!

speaker: Ike
text: Flee! Get away, everyone!

speaker: Ashnard
text: GGGRRAAAAAGGGGHHHH!!! GGRRAAAHH HAAA HAAA HAAA!!!...It...feels...so...GOOOOOOD...

speaker: Ike
text: He's touching the medallion! But he's still sane...

speaker: Ashnard
text: YAAARRRRGGGHHHH!! GGGWWAAARRRHHHHHH!!!

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike! We can't win like this! Call one of the battalion commanders! Do it now!

speaker: Giffca
text: I have arrived. What is that thing? So...Ashnard tried to use the medallion, did he?...Fool...

speaker: Tibarn
text: Sorry to have kept you waiting...Is that King Daein?! He's become a monster! The medallion's chaotic energy is overflowing from his body....No matter. Leave him to me. I promise you this! Ashnard will fall at my hands.

speaker: Naesala
text: ...Yeah, yeah, I'm here... What's everyone so worked up abou--Holy goddess above!!! Is that thing...King Daein? H-he's a monster! Wait... You want me to fight THAT? Are you insane?!

speaker: Bryce
text: I am Bryce, general of Daein!

speaker: Ashnard
text: Heh heh...excellent...Excellent! So good! More...more, I say! At this time of ascension, it's not enough...not enough...

speaker: Ike
text: Now...it is truly over.

speaker: Ike
text: Ena, stay back! The king's mount is still alive!

speaker: Ike
text: Stay back!

speaker: Ike
text: Ena!

speaker: Elincia
text: No!

speaker: Ike
text: What's going on? His mount is so calm...

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike... Let them be.

speaker: Ike
text: Nasir, what's this all about?

speaker: Nasir
text: That...is her mate. As death nears, he has regained his sanity.

speaker: Ike
text: King Daein's mount is Ena's...mate?

speaker: Ena
text: ...Rajaion...

speaker: Leanne
text: ( Say, Brother...)

speaker: Reyson
text: Leanne? What is it?

speaker: Leanne
text: (That dragon with the big wings...)

speaker: Reyson
text: A laguz... No, it can't be. Ashnard's mount was a wyvern...Wasn't it?

speaker: Leanne
text: (I can't tell for sure.)

speaker: Reyson
text: (If he is a laguz,)

speaker: Leanne
text: (Then let us sing,)

speaker: Ike
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Reyson
text: Be patient, please. There's something we want to try.

speaker: Ike
text: Huh?

speaker: Ike
text: Reyson...that's...

speaker: Reyson
text: Leanne told me that dragon's true form had been warped. So we sang the galdr of rebirth...

speaker: Ena
text: Ra...Rajai...on...

speaker: Rajaion
text: Err...aah...

speaker: Ena
text: ...Rajaion? D-do you know who I am?

speaker: Ena
text: Yes... Yes! You recognize me!

speaker: Rajaion
text: You were made...to suffer...because of me... I'm sorry.

speaker: Ena
text: ...Sniff... Rajaion! Rajaion! Oh, Rajaion...

speaker: Rajaion
text: ...Ena... Let's return to Goldoa. The two of us...together.

speaker: Ena
text: I will go anywhere, my love, as long as it is with you.

speaker: Rajaion
text: Ena...from this day forward...Forever......

speaker: Ena
text: ...Sniff......sniff...Ah, Rajaion...

speaker: Ike
text: He was one of the dragon tribe?

speaker: Nasir
text: That's right. He and Ena were engaged to be married...And then, he was driven mad by King Daein, and his form warped.

speaker: Ike
text: ...I see.

speaker: Mist
text: Aha! Is that...Nope! Dang...

speaker: Mist
text: Hmm...Ah! Here it is!

speaker: Ike
text: What is it, Mist? Did you find something?

speaker: Mist
text: The medallion, Ike! The medallion! I finally...have it back...

speaker: Ike
text: Mist, that medallion is--

speaker: Mist
text: Yeah... I know.

speaker: Mist
text: Reyson! Leanne!

speaker: Leanne
text: (Hm? What is it, Mist?)

speaker: Reyson
text: What?

speaker: Mist
text: Here.

speaker: Leanne
text: (The medallion.)

speaker: Mist
text: The medallion belongs in Serenes Forest. My mother...was only holding it for Lillia.

speaker: Reyson
text: ...Leanne, you take it.

speaker: Leanne
text: (Thank you, little Mist.)

speaker: Reyson
text: Thank you, daughter of Elena. In the memory of my departed sister...I accept the medallion from you.

speaker: Ike
text: I've brought her, Nasir.

speaker: Nasir
text: ...I'm sorry, Mist.

speaker: Nasir
text: I knew how much the medallion meant to you, and I stole it nevertheless. No matter the words I use to apologize, I did something unforgivable. I gained your trust--and Ike's--and betrayed it. Then I compounded my dishonor by fleeing. ...I am so very sorry...

speaker: Mist
text: ... Thanks for coming back, Nasir. I... I wanted to see you again. And I'm glad I did. Welcome back.

speaker: Nasir
text: ...Ah, Mist. I do not deserve your kindness...

speaker: Ena
text: ...Mist, please allow me to apologize as well. I am the one who is truly at fault here. What Nasir did, he did for me.

speaker: Mist
text: I'm sure there's some very important reason for all of this. And it's probably still unresolved. I'm honestly quite curious. Plus, I want to help! But... But I doubt that I can. So, I'm going to wait. I've decided to wait until the two of you can tell me about whatever it is. So...you don't need to worry about it anymore. All right?

speaker: Nasir
text: ...Thank you, Mist.

speaker: Ena
text: Thank you.

speaker: Janaff
text: Har! So tomorrow's the day we take on the capital. I'm ready! Whooooo! It doesn't matter how hard the fight you're facing might be, I always feel excited the night before!

speaker: Ulki
text: I'd like to tell you how wrong that is, but I can't. I...can't seem to calm my nerves, either.

speaker: Janaff
text: We're going to win, you know? King Daein won't survive the day.

speaker: Ulki
text: Mmm...I wonder.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you two on guard duty?

speaker: Janaff
text: Oh, it's you. Heya, Ike.

speaker: Ulki
text: Do you have some need of the king?

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah, will you tell him I'm here?

speaker: Ulki
text: We will. Wait here.

speaker: Tibarn
text: So, tomorrow it is. Did you come by to check on our preparations?

speaker: Ike
text: You know me too well. You're going to circle the capital and ensure that no airborne enemies escape. That's clear, isn't it?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Yes. I think encircling the capital's a good idea. We'll guard the west and take care of airborne combat as well. The Phoenicis and Kilvas armies are unbeatable in that regard.

speaker: Ike
text: Kilvas is going to help out?

speaker: Reyson
text: Of course.

speaker: Tibarn
text: After what we saw in the dungeons of Gritnea Tower, we all agreed that King Ashnard must pay. Reyson and Leanne helped to sway certain opinions. It was tough, but in the end, we understood what needs to happen. That having been said, the crows are traitorous by nature. If worse comes to worst, it may be just us hawks out there.

speaker: Ike
text: That will be enough. At least I know I can rely on you.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Well, to be perfectly honest...I wouldn't mind a chance to remove Ashnard's head from his shoulders.

speaker: Ike
text: It's just like the time I fought the Black Knight...You're being kept away from the main fight. My apologies, hawk king.

speaker: Tibarn
text: That's all right. But if you find yourself overwhelmed, give me a call.

speaker: Ike
text: Understood.

speaker: Tibarn
text: And as for you, Reyson. I'm sure you're tired of hearing this, but--

speaker: Reyson
text: I know, I know. Be careful. Don't die. Don't worry, I won't die. I'm not going to leave Leanne and my father all alone.

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Nestling. It appears they're discussing tomorrow's battle. Shouldn't you join them?

speaker: Naesala
text: ...No, I think not. It's just Tibarn after all. He doesn't really want help from Kilvas anyway.

speaker: Nealuchi
text: The hawk king may not care, but...Prince Reyson would surely feel that you had betrayed him yet again, Nestling.

speaker: Naesala
text: What?

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Oh, and dear lady Leanne as well. If you were to flee in the face of the enemy, it would break her heart. Hah...... It would be so sad...HAAAH... Heeee!

speaker: Naesala
text: Senile old crow. You think if you bring those two into it, I'll do as I've been told and fight... Curse you!

speaker: Ranulf
text: This war has been waged for over a year...But it could all be over by midday tomorrow. How do you feel, Ike? Think we'll win?

speaker: Ike
text: We'll win.

speaker: Ranulf
text: I knew you'd say that! Ha! You don't fool me anymore. But even so...I appreciate your bravado tonight.

speaker: Giffca
text: Without such courage, it would be impossible to face King Daein.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Master Giffca! What are you doing here?

speaker: Giffca
text: The king felt uneasy knowing you were here on your own. I come in his name.

speaker: Ranulf
text: So, are you going to fight with us?

speaker: Giffca
text: That is my purpose. That is, if Lord Ike grants his permission.

speaker: Ike
text: Of course. The Daein army is large, so we're going to be attacking them from the front and holding the two eastern gates. I'd be very appreciative if you would agree to take command of that front.

speaker: Giffca
text: If that is your wish, I can but agree.

speaker: Ranulf
text: What's this now? You weren't satisfied with the work I was doing? I mean, I know that I'm no Master Giffca, but please...

speaker: Ike
text: Ranulf, I want you to be with me. Is that all right?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Oh, now I see. Sure, that would be fine! Getting to be part of the main pack is the highest of honors.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Master Giffca!

speaker: Lethe
text: It's been a long time. How is the king?

speaker: Giffca
text: He's in good health. The king...has given me a message for you two.

speaker: Lethe
text: A message? Not orders?

speaker: Giffca
text: That's right. He said to be sure you make it home alive. And then he said that your work in the past year has been most satisfactory and that he's sincerely grateful to you both.

speaker: Lethe
text: ...That's...such an honor!

speaker: Mordecai
text: We have fought hard. But...it wasn't a bother. Ike and the others are good beorc... We are happy to fight with them.

speaker: Giffca
text: I see.

speaker: Zelgius
text: If that's the decision you've reached, we'll respectfully comply.

speaker: Ike
text: If we can march quickly and know that someone's protecting our backs, it would be a huge relief.

speaker: Zelgius
text: As you wish. May the fortunes of war be with the Crimean army. If you have need of soldiers, send word. We'll move out at top speed.

speaker: Ike
text: I'll be counting on it.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike, may I have a moment?

speaker: Ike
text: Of course. What is it?

speaker: Elincia
text: The soldiers say that tomorrow we'll be able to see the great bridge. Once we cross it, we'll be in Crimea.

speaker: Ike
text: That's what I've been told.

speaker: Elincia
text: It feels like I've been away for many years. Crimea is the land where I was born and raised. To feel so removed from it... I feel now, at this late juncture, that I know almost nothing of my own country. It is an unreal experience.

speaker: Ike
text: I know what you mean. I don't have the sense that we're on the brink of being back in Crimea, either. I don't even remember this area at all. Maybe it's because I was born in Gallia and raised in the countryside. But countries are joined together like this all over the continent. I'm really in awe of it all.

speaker: Elincia
text: So am I! For one who knew nothing of life outside the royal villa... Everything...is...So very big.

speaker: Ike
text: Big? Hmm... Yeah, I guess you're right. When we left Crimea, it was spring... The snows were melting, the days were getting longer, and the weather was mild.

speaker: Elincia
text: It's been almost a year since we departed. Only a year, but the distance we've traveled to get here has been long and hard...It feels like many years have passed us by. Yet this is the land where I was born and raised... Ah, my dear, sweet Crimea...How is it that you feel so far away?

speaker: Ike
text: For me, too, Crimea is my homeland. We're almost there... Let's go home.

speaker: Elincia
text: It is as you say, my lord Ike....Let's go home.

speaker: Unknown
text: Oooh, what a romantic setting. Makes it hard to make an appearance! I guess I could just leave you two...

speaker: Ike
text: Huh? I know that voice...

speaker: Ranulf
text: Hey there, Ike! Looks like we stayed alive long enough to be reunited! Aren't we the lucky ones?

speaker: Ike
text: Ranulf!

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ranulf! How nice to see you again!

speaker: Ranulf
text: My princess Elincia! Welcome home! I'd curtsy, but the tail makes it look silly.

speaker: Ike
text: What are you so darned chipper about?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Once I heard the news that the Crimean army had taken the Daein capital, I ran all this way to greet you.

speaker: Ike
text: How go things in Gallia? You're not engaged in open hostilities with Daein, are you?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Not yet.

speaker: Ike
text: What's that supposed to mean?

speaker: Ranulf
text: In light of your army's success, the elders have finally agreed on something. Gallia will lend its full support to Princess Crimea's efforts to liberate her homeland. It's a done deal!

speaker: Elincia
text: Really?

speaker: Ike
text: So, is the Gallian army going to--

speaker: Ranulf
text: We're going to establish communications with them and create a united front. That being said, Gallia is here to support you. The Crimean army will always be at the center of the effort. Don't forget that.

speaker: Ike
text: King Gallia is being most gracious. That posture will allow Crimea to lay claim to any victories we achieve.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Don't say things like that! I'm shocked that you would understand such subtleties. Who are you, and what have you done with Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: I don't believe you have the right to speak to me like that. Kidding. Actually, Soren just lectured me on the same situation when we received reinforcements from Begnion.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Of course. You were tutored by your nervous little staff officer. Now I get it... Has he snapped yet? He seems high-strung.

speaker: Elincia
text: King Caineghis is always thinking of Crimea, isn't he? How can I ever repay him?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Princess... Let's win your country back. When that's done, please rebuild the bonds of friendship between our nations. That would be the ultimate way to say thank you, wouldn't it?

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes! Yes, of course!

speaker: Petrine
text: So they're finally here, are they? Has the work on the bridge been finished? And your answer had better be yes!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Y-yes, General! Do you think it will work?

speaker: Petrine
text: Sometimes the simplest of traps offer up the best results. Lure the enemy in, and then finish them off one by one. Got it?

speaker: Petrine
text: Listen up, dogs! There will be no retreating today! We stop Crimea's advance here! We will not allow them to gain the comfort of their homeland! Any who do not fight to the death will face my lance!

speaker: Ike
text: There's the bridge... Wow, it's huge... I doubt if Daein's going to let us cross over without objection.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Yeah, I think that's highly unlikely.

speaker: Ike
text: Titania! It's time to march! Make sure the troops stay alert and move with caution!

speaker: Titania
text: Understood, Commander!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Say, Ike. There's one thing I've been meaning to ask you.

speaker: Ike
text: What is it?

speaker: Ranulf
text: I haven't seen Nasir around. What's happened to him?

speaker: Ike
text: He was declared an enemy combatant and locked up.

speaker: Ranulf
text: What? Hey, I understand you being irked that he didn't mention testing you and all, but treating him like a criminal is too--

speaker: Ike
text: Testing me? What are you talking about?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Huh? Oh, um... Nice weather, eh?

speaker: Ike
text: We're going to talk. Now.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Nasir is a Daein spy? No way! That's not possible! He was our spy!

speaker: Ike
text: You're telling me he was a Gallian spy? None of this makes sense to me...

speaker: Ranulf
text: He worked for us on behalf of the king. But...Daein? As a laguz, he would have absolutely no reason to work for them.

speaker: Ike
text: But there was a Goldoan named Ena who was working as a general for Daein.

speaker: Ranulf
text: ...Are you serious?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, we were forced to fight her in the Daein capital. When we attempted to capture her, Nasir intervened and allowed her to escape. He betrayed us.

speaker: Ranulf
text: What? Hold on a minute...

speaker: Ranulf
text: Maybe that was... If that's the case, then I can see why...No, even so, teaming up with Daein is just too much...hmm......

speaker: Ike
text: I hate to interrupt whatever it is you're doing, but we've arrived at the bridge.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Let me speak to Nasir. Please!

speaker: Ike
text: Once we've finished this battle, we can go together. All right?

speaker: Ranulf
text: Of course.

speaker: Petrine
text: All right, Haar! Time for you to go to work.

speaker: Haar
text: Zzzzz... No, Mom, five more minutes...Zzzzzzzzzz...

speaker: Petrine
text: Dozing off on the battlefield... You've got a lot of nerve, don't you? Hey! Wake up or I'll burn you to a crisp!

speaker: Haar
text: Zzzzz... Snort! Huh? Wha--? Uh... Right! Has the enemy arrived?

speaker: Petrine
text: Yes, they just got here. Now get out there and do your job.

speaker: Haar
text: Oh, I'm all over it. Yaaaawwwnnn...

speaker: Petrine
text: What an absolute fool.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Well, here we are! And there's the Daein army on the other side as expected! They're already in battle formation and waiting to give us a warm welcome. Aw, that's charming!

speaker: Ike
text: That's just what I want.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Oh ho! Well said. And by the way, I thought I'd join you today.

speaker: Ike
text: Not as a Gallian, but as part of our army, right?

speaker: Ranulf
text: If it's a problem, I can always sit this one out.

speaker: Ike
text: Of course not! Thanks for your continued support, Ranulf!

speaker: Ranulf
text: Ha! The pleasure's all mine! Let's go carve us some Daeins!

speaker: Haar
text: Attention... Let's...yaaawwnn...go. Hmm...maybe I can catch a nap while we fly...

speaker: Haar
text: ...Now then...Let's see how things look.

speaker: Haar
text: Greetings, Jill. So you're still alive, eh? Good to see.

speaker: Jill
text: That's what I was going to say to you! You survived! I'm very pleased.

speaker: Haar
text: General Shiharam left me in charge. I'm supposed to get our survivors and their families to Begnion. I can't die until that's done.

speaker: Jill
text: Oh, I see... But then... Captain, why are you still in Daein?

speaker: Haar
text: I... Believe it or not, I'm a vindictive man. Revenge for the general is something I couldn't let go.

speaker: Jill
text: Oh! But...that...

speaker: Haar
text: Don't get the wrong idea. You're not the enemy I'm seeking.

speaker: Jill
text: Huh? But...

speaker: Haar
text: The ones responsible for General Shiharam's death, are the Daeins. I pretended to return to the fold so I could get close to General Petrine...I'm just waiting for my chance. But I think they may be on to me. My unit's a bunch of tough guys who serve as Petrine's watchdogs. Plus, I've been ordered to charge the Crimeans head-on. It's Daein's way of killing two birds with one stone.

speaker: Jill
text: Don't do it! Come fight by our sides! If you're looking to kill Daeins, then we share the same goal!

speaker: Haar
text: Jill... I, um... I don't trust Crimea anymore than I do Daein. I'm sick to death of serving countries.

speaker: Jill
text: Captain...

speaker: Haar
text: Still... I can't abandon the daughter of the man to whom I owe so much... Guess I'm changing sides again.

speaker: Jill
text: Really? Oh, thank you, Captain!

speaker: Haar
text: No, you've got that backwards.

speaker: Jill
text: Pardon?

speaker: Haar
text: I'm a new recruit... So I'm under you. Thanks in advance, Captain.

speaker: Jill
text: What? Don't be silly! Wait...Ah, Captain!!!

speaker: Lucia
text: Is that the Crimean army?

speaker: Bastian
text: What ho! It is the army come again! I see the Crimean flag in the rear...But lo! Who do I spy in the distance? Green hair...orange dress...and eyes bewitching fair...Elincia comes! Let us to her aid ride!

speaker: Lucia
text: The princess has returned! Count Bastian, return to the castle and inform Geoffrey at once. I will move ahead and inform the princess that her retainers are here to meet her.

speaker: Bastian
text: Lady Lucia, keep your wits about you. That we are excited is fair to say... But show the enemy no weaknesses, lest he does cut us down like autumn's wheat.

speaker: Lucia
text: Good advice. And you watch that you aren't waylaid on the way back to the castle.

speaker: Bastian
text: Even if Daein unleashes on myself the full force of their army's wrath...They are no match for clever Bastian! I'll meet you at the castle gate anon.

speaker: Lucia
text: Right!

speaker: Lucia
text: Are you ready to fight?! Are you ready to die?! We must give our all to protect Princess Elincia!

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: My fellow Crimeans! Now is the time we stand and fight for the life of our homeland!

speaker: Petrine
text: Ha ha! Do you like your meat rare? Or do you like it charbroiled? Let me know, and I'll cook you up just as ordered! Wha ha ha ha ha!

speaker: Petrine
text: Y-Your... Your Majesty...Forgive me...please... Oh, I don't want to die... So...scared...

speaker: Haar
text: ...Combat. Tsk. It's one of those things you simply cannot control.

speaker: Haar
text: The Dark Angel... She's found me at last... At least I can sleep now...

speaker: Lucia
text: Princess Elincia! Welcome home! It's so good to see you safe!

speaker: Elincia
text: Lucia? Lucia! Is it really you?

speaker: Lucia
text: I am no spirit. See? Flesh and bone, through and through.

speaker: Elincia
text: Ah, Lucia! You have no idea how I've longed to see you.

speaker: Lucia
text: And I you, Princess Elincia. When my brother Geoffrey told me you had been lost, my world went dark. When I learned you were still alive...I was...so...

speaker: Elincia
text: Then Geoffrey is safe as well? Happy day! Are there others? How many Crimean retainers have survived?

speaker: Lucia
text: Well, there's Count Bastian. That silver-tongued rascal is as loquacious as ever. Also, General Tagio, Marquis Katol's orphan, Silok, and Marquis Mitnala are all with us. The soldiers we have contacted so far do not even number one hundred. But if they know you've returned, retainers hiding throughout the land will surely come pouring in.

speaker: Elincia
text: Yet, my existence... It is not known to the general populace...

speaker: Lucia
text: There's no need to worry about that! Tales of your exploits in Daein have reached every corner of Crimea. In every village, in every town, the people are talking. Our fair king had a hidden child, they say. The secret princess of Crimea is fighting to save us all! In addition, Daein soldiers have been frantically searching for a mysterious and elusive Princess Crimea. All they've succeeded in doing is convincing the people that you truly are their princess. All of Crimea has been anxiously awaiting your return.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh, Lucia, do you speak truly? They have...acknowledged my existence?...I never...expected this day...

speaker: Ranulf
text: News of your actions in Daein reached the ears of King Gallia through Nasir. I then told Lucia, who passed it to the citizenry....You know, the thought that Nasir is a traitor just doesn't feel right to me. I can't believe it.

speaker: Ike
text: You think I don't see that? Look at what we know about the medallion. We discovered it thanks to his hints. He's helped us throughout our entire journey. In that, at least, he was not false. Yet, if he will not speak, there is nothing I can do to save him.

speaker: Ranulf
text: Let's go see him. One way or another, I will loosen his tongue.

speaker: Ike
text: This way.

speaker: Ike
text: He's being kept in this supply tent. We wanted to keep him away from the other soldiers.

speaker: Ranulf
text: What is it?

speaker: Ike
text: He's... He's gone! I brought him breakfast this morning! He was here...

speaker: Soren
text: Hmm...

speaker: Unknown
text: Soren! Are you in here?

speaker: Soren
text: Yes.

speaker: Soren
text: Ike? It's late. What do you want?

speaker: Ike
text: Shhh!

speaker: Soren
text: Um...Ike?

speaker: Unknown
text: Oh, no... How strange. I was sure he'd come this way. Yooo-hooo?!

speaker: Soren
text: That voice... It's the woman from the item shop, isn't it?

speaker: Aimee
text: Commander! Ike? Where have you gone, handsome?

speaker: Ike
text: Crud.

speaker: Soren
text: ...Did you run in here to escape?

speaker: Ike
text: Look, whenever that woman corners me, it takes forever to get away. Let me hide in here until things simmer down.

speaker: Soren
text: We begin marching tomorrow morning...This is a waste of valuable time. I'll go and chase her away.

speaker: Ike
text: Wait! Soren!

speaker: Aimee
text: Iiike! Ikey-poo! Where aaaaare you?

speaker: Soren
text: Aimee?

speaker: Aimee
text: Oh. Soren. Ew. I mean, um...hi. Why are you out so late?

speaker: Soren
text: Do you have some business with Ike?

speaker: Aimee
text: Well, yes I do. I found a special something that I'd like to give to him. Do you know where he is?

speaker: Soren
text: Ike is...in a war meeting. If you have something for him, I can hold on to it for you.

speaker: Aimee
text: Hmm... What should I do? You see, I have this new staff... The staff is VERY valuable. I'm not sure if I feel comfortable simply handing it over to someone who doesn't...understand that.

speaker: Soren
text: That's a Hammerne, is it not? A rare staff that can take any item, no matter how battered and worn, and repair it completely.

speaker: Aimee
text: Why...that's right. You're quite knowledgeable, aren't you?

speaker: Soren
text: If I may continue, I believe that there is only one of these in all the world. It truly is priceless. And you want to give this to Ike?

speaker: Aimee
text: Well, I do want to be helpful.

speaker: Soren
text: ...If you truly wish to capture Ike's attention, bringing him staves and whatnot will avail you nothing.

speaker: Aimee
text: What? Really? Oh, dear... I was so hoping he would like it.

speaker: Soren
text: Food, however, would be much more effective than a staff. He's particularly fond of spicy meat dishes.

speaker: Aimee
text: Is that so? Cooking is not something that I'm skilled at, but... Oh, I've got it! I know the perfect dish!

speaker: Soren
text: Ah, good! He will be very pleased! Um...what about the staff?

speaker: Aimee
text: Hee hee! You can keep it as payment for the cooking tip! Take good care of it.

speaker: Soren
text: ... Well, she's unexpectedly generous. I received something quite nice from your admirer, Ikey-poo! Thank you so much!

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, wait a minute!

speaker: Ike
text: Understood. Proceed as ordered.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Sir, yes, sir!

speaker: Ike
text: What's next... Huh? Who's there?

speaker: Shinon
text: Sir, yes, sir... Hey, it's General Ike the Great! I heard all about it, you know? Those guys went and made you...a NOBLE!

speaker: Ike
text: Shinon?

speaker: Shinon
text: Good for you, huh? Har har! ...Hic! You're in love with a pwetty wittle princess, you're fighting side-by-side with yer sub-human pals. Yes! Yer moving up! Oooo, look at you! It's big mister Ike! Leading the good life!

speaker: Ike
text: They're not sub-humans. They're laguz.

speaker: Shinon
text: ...Yeah, whatever. Here's the deal... Now that yer a high- class noble, you can't be running around with a...buncha broke mercenaries. All the other nobles...are gonna LAUGH at you! So...give it up! I'll do you a favor and take over.

speaker: Ike
text: I don't think so. I'm going to continue as commander of the Greil Mercenaries.

speaker: Shinon
text: Screw you! You always get everything! Don't you ever want to give up anything? Nooooo! Not big important mister Ike! You've always been like this! You act like you're not interested in something, then you swoop in and...STEAL IT AWAY!

speaker: Ike
text: Hey! Shinon?

speaker: Shinon
text: ......Wh-what? WHAT?! And watch how you say my name, boy! Boy, boy, boy... Wittle boy Ike... Wittle Ikey...

speaker: Ike
text: ...Shinon, what's wrong with you? Are you feeling all right?

speaker: Shinon
text: What do you care, you snotty whelp?! It's none of yer business! AND another thing! About the command of the company. If you refuse to give it up...at least change the name! Yer NOT...Commander Greil! Just because you're his son...That doesn't...give you the right...to use his name...

speaker: Ike
text: Shinon, are you sure you're all right?

speaker: Shinon
text: ...YEAH! I'm fine! I'll be fine... Fine, fine... Ugh...I don't feel so good. Ooh...BLAARRRGGGHHHH!

speaker: Ike
text: It was never about the commandership...It was about my father....

speaker: Ashnard
text: I see. So Crimea and Gallia have finally joined forces, have they? Half-breeds and humans fighting side by side... How sweet!

speaker: Black Knight
text: In addition, it seems the incident with the heron princess has brought more Phoenicians to the struggle as well.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Oh, the hawk king is getting involved, eh?

speaker: Black Knight
text: Which means that the Crimean army's strength of arms is all but equal to our own...and growing daily. Of course, this pathetic, ragged band is still no match for our superior leadership and skill.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Heh heh heh... Heeee hee hee hee! Things are getting interesting, are they not? But I am still unsatisfied. Divide our army into two battalions, and send one to meet the Crimeans.

speaker: Black Knight
text: And who...will be in charge of that battalion?

speaker: Ashnard
text: Bertram.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Bertram?

speaker: Ashnard
text: Does that bother you? Well then... Perhaps I should leave it to you and see what happens! Heee heee heee!

speaker: Black Knight
text: Do you believe I would betray you?

speaker: Ashnard
text: I believe your heart has considered it.

speaker: Black Knight
text: Surely you jest...I will divide our forces and see that they march to meet Crimea under Bertram's command. Is this satisfactory?

speaker: Ashnard
text: I leave it to you, good sir knight.

speaker: Black Knight
text: One other thing, Your Majesty. In my absence, did you order the death of Ena?

speaker: Ashnard
text: Ena? Ena...? Oh, yes, her. I'd forgotten about that one. I lost all interest in her when she failed to hold Daein's capital, you know? I've no use for failures...Yes, yes, I remember it now. I ordered General Petrine to take care of her...Ha! Another failure under my command...I told Petrine that if the task was beyond her, capturing Ena would be enough.

speaker: Black Knight
text: I see.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Why do you ask?

speaker: Black Knight
text: According to one of General Petrine's men, they have indeed captured Ena. But, with the general's death, they're unsure what to do with her.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Heh heh. That was one of Petrine's better qualities. She always did follow orders. Well, what do you intend to do?

speaker: Black Knight
text: I wish to receive your instructions. Do you still wish to see her killed, or have you changed your mind?

speaker: Ashnard
text: Mmm. Do as you will. I care not. However! Do not bring her into my presence! When that one is near, Rajaion seems to grow restless.

speaker: Black Knight
text: As you wish.

speaker: Ike
text: Everyone seems to be here. Go ahead, Soren. You can begin now.

speaker: Soren
text: Very well.

speaker: Soren
text: Please look at this map. The current position of our army is here in the Marhaut Range. Between us and the capital there are two large outposts of enemy troops--Fort Pinell and Nados Castle.

speaker: Bastian
text: Both holds were built to guardian our fair land. But now Daein rules them both, and knows of us. With rations set, they could hold out a year. Say what you will of Daein and her foul plans. One must admire her skill in things of war.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Come now, Bastian! Why would you praise our foe?

speaker: Bastian
text: I do but speak the mean of it, good sir. The truth is harsh, but lies would be worse still.

speaker: Lucia
text: Will you two please shut up? Please? Sheesh!

speaker: Ike
text: Pinell and Nados are fairly close to one another. I doubt they would expect us to attack both at once, but...

speaker: Titania
text: That seems to be a waste of our strength. And we don't want to get ambushed from the rear while attacking.

speaker: Soren
text: We cannot divide our army, but we could send a small force to attack the base with weaker defenses and keep it occupied. At the same time, the main army can focus on the other one and conquer it.

speaker: Soren
text: These are both strongholds built for the defense of Crimea...Now that they're under enemy control, they pose a significant danger.

speaker: Ike
text: These are fairly close to one another. I doubt they would expect us to attack both at once, but...

speaker: Titania
text: That seems to be a waste of our strength. And we don't want to get ambushed from the rear while attacking.

speaker: Soren
text: We cannot divide our army, but we could send a small force to attack the base with weaker defenses and keep it occupied. At the same time, the main army can focus on the other one and conquer it.

speaker: Ike
text: I see... So which one has more soldiers?

speaker: Soren
text: That would be Fort Pinell.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Very well. Then the main army will lead an assault on Fort Pinell. Meanwhile, I'll take my army and a unit or so of Gallians and set out for Castle Nados. We'll launch an attack, and when they come out to meet us, we'll retreat. Then we'll attack again! It will keep them busy.

speaker: Ike
text: That should give us the time we need. We'll take care of our front by day's end...Let's go capture a fort!

speaker: Tibarn
text: It's settled then.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: Princess Elincia...Huh?

speaker: Ike
text: What's going on? Why are you dressed like that?

speaker: Elincia
text: I thought to join you on the battle lines--

speaker: Ike
text: Is that a pegasus?! Where did you get that?

speaker: Elincia
text: He belonged to my great-grandmother. I'm a bit nervous about riding him, but I'm going to try nevertheless.Ike

speaker: Ike
text: I appreciate your desire, but your retainers will never allow it. Will they?

speaker: Elincia
text: As for that...

speaker: Ike
text: Did you agree to this, Geoffrey?

speaker: Geoffrey
text: No, personally, I'm against it, but...She is the princess, and it is her wish. I can do nothing.

speaker: Lucia
text: The princess's great-grandmother was a Begnion pegasus knight of some renown before marrying into House Crimea. Princess Elincia herself is skilled at both riding and swordsmanship. As a child, she was granted permission to train in case the need for her to fight ever arose.

speaker: Bastian
text: Behold the pegasus and uniform! All treasures of our House Crimea fair. We did fear much that we would never see a chance to use them in their proper stead. Oh, muse of fire! I cannot find the words! Behold a light that dares to shame the sun! Our princess clad in raiments fair and fine, gives courage, love, and vigor to our cause.

speaker: Ike
text: I'm surprised you were able to hide armor and a flying horse from the Daein army.

speaker: Bastian
text: Ahem...Prince Renning foresaw a time when the princess would need them, and bade us convey them from the palace. Prince Renning's thoughts were always of the princess, even as his life abandoned him. Be true to your heart, and live life as it dictates. Those were his final words to her.

speaker: Elincia
text: My lord uncle was always the one person who understood me best...Even though I'm dressed like this, I have no experience, and do not expect to fight as well as the rest of you. But...this constant waiting behind and doing nothing...it sets my heart beating with such unease I fear it may burst. Even if I cannot fight, I could use a staff to heal the wounded. If I could save just one soldier, it would mean so much to me. Please, my lord Ike. I promise to obey orders and stay out of harm's way as best I can.

speaker: Geoffrey
text: Lord Ike, we will take responsibility and guard the princess.

speaker: Lucia
text: It is her heartfelt wish...

speaker: Ike
text: This is not something that I can allow or disallow. She is my employer. If this is what the princess wants, all I can do is comply. Be careful, will you?

speaker: Elincia
text: Oh, thank you so much!

speaker: Bastian
text: Let us go forth like sunlight to the dawn. Elincia fights, and Crimea wins the day!

speaker: Ike
text: Soren, do you have any information on the enemy general?

speaker: Soren
text: Our intelligence reports say the commander of this army is Bertram, one of Daein's Four Riders.

speaker: Ike
text: One of the Four Riders? So he's on par with that woman we fought earlier, General Petrine?

speaker: Soren
text: ...That's not necessarily so. The name Four Riders is given to the four persons of highest ability among the king's advisors.

speaker: Titania
text: So the members can change, is that it? Who are the current Four Riders?

speaker: Soren
text: First, there was General Petrine, whom we defeated at Riven Bridge. Then the man we face today, General Bertram. Next is General Bryce, who served the previous king. And finally, the enigmatic general known as the Black Knight. Those are the four.

speaker: Titania
text: This is the same Black Knight who murdered Commander Greil?

speaker: Soren
text: Of that, there appears to be little doubt.

speaker: Titania
text: Tell us, Soren, do you have any more information on General Bertram?

speaker: Soren
text: I know not where he hails from. He appeared after the fall of Crimea and has quickly gained Ashnard's favor.

speaker: Titania
text: So he's a man of no mean ability.

speaker: Soren
text: Like the Black Knight, he always wears his armor and never shows his face unhelmed. Some say he's not even in his armor, but that it's inhabited by an ancient spectre or a demonic creature. It's all just superstition and rumor designed to heighten fear of the man.

speaker: Ike
text: It's not important. Once we cross swords, we'll know the truth. Then we can discover for ourselves if he's just a loudmouthed braggart or truly a monster. As long as our blades can wound him, I care not either way. Let's go!

speaker: Titania
text: Ike, there are more enemy soldiers than we expected. Just from what I can see now, they are double our numbers.

speaker: Soren
text: And we must assume that the fort houses many more troops. This may prove to be a long battle.

speaker: Ike
text: Even if they have twenty times our numbers, we must overcome them. In this war, there can be no retreat!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: General Bertram! The Crimean army has risen to the bait! Orders, sir?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: ...Your orders, sir?

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: General? Um... How shall we make answer?

speaker: Bertram
text: Turn the ground...ssssoft with blood. Make a graveyard...of thissss place. Bury them all.

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Y-yes, sir!

speaker: Bertram
text: ...Perissssh......Perissssh...

speaker: Bertram
text: ...Ga...aaa... Releasssse...

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: Sir, the enemy troops are fleeing! Shall we give chase?

speaker: Ike
text: No, let them run. We fought enough today. Get our men inside the fort and give everyone a break.

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Ashnard
text: I see. So Crimea's won another victory, have they? Heh heh heh. Heeeee heee heee! Well then, send the rest of our troops to Castle Nados as reinforcements. Put General Hafedd in charge and let him exchange blows with them.

speaker: Bryce
text: Yet, that would leave the capital protected by only the Imperial Guard.

speaker: Ashnard
text: You forget yourself, knight. I will be here as well. If they defeat Hafedd and make it all the way here, then they are worthy to cross swords with me.

speaker: Bryce
text: I would beg a question, Your Highness. Why do you divide our troops and give the enemy the advantage? It's as if you were--

speaker: Ashnard
text: As if I were...? What? Go on.

speaker: Bryce
text: It's as if you desire the Crimean army to continue winning and make its way here to you.

speaker: Ashnard
text: I'll not deny it.

speaker: Bryce
text: Are you saying...that you desire Daein's defeat?

speaker: Ashnard
text: No, I am not. If you think through it clearly, Daein will not lose. We had many plans when we started this war. We went through many scenarios, many predictions...But, as you know, our predictions have been completely overturned by this gang of rabble. Was that luck? Or was it the gap in skill between the individual soldiers? And if it is, aren't you interested in seeing how far they can come?

speaker: Bryce
text: I...do not understand.

speaker: Ashnard
text: Heh heh heh. Heeee heeee heee! Perfect!! Nothing raises my spirits like war! Come, Crimea! Let me be the one to consume your noble hearts!

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: General, may I have a moment of your time?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes? What is it?

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: I'd like your advice on something, sir. Let's say I was faced with an undefeatable enemy. In that case, what should I, as the weaker fighter, do? Should I try to avoid slowing down other better fighters and retreat? Or do I sacrifice myself and try to at least land a single blow on the opponent?

speaker: Ike
text: If it's an enemy general, or just someone that's far too strong for you, there's no need to get yourself killed. But I don't want you to simply run away, either. Study the enemy first, and see if retreating is your only option. I'd like you to do that much, at least.

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: Study the enemy?

speaker: Ike
text: That's right. What type of fighter is he? What kind of weapon is he using? Things like that. If you can learn to do that, you can determine how best to engage your opponent.

speaker: Crimean Soldier
text: Those are the very core of combat fundamentals, aren't they? Oh, I'm a danged fool! It could be...I think all my troubles started because I wasn't paying enough attention to the basics! You've given me something to think about. And some hope, too. Thank you, sir! You're the smartest general ever!

speaker: Ike
text: Huh... What a brave little fella'.

speaker: Ike
text: Are you leaving now?

speaker: Tibarn
text: Yep. We're going to do some reconnaissance and tease those Daeins a bit.

speaker: Ike
text: Good luck.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Pah! You don't need luck when you're as tough as me!

speaker: Reyson
text: Tibarn, about--

speaker: Tibarn
text: Reyson, no. I truly am sorry. Leanne's kidnapping is completely my fault.

speaker: Reyson
text: It's not your fault. Please don't apologize. I know Leanne is alive. These battlefields are filled with chaotic energy, but I can still sense her...It's faint, but I know it's Leanne.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Which is all the more reason for us to hurry. There may be other ways to finish this, but crushing Daein is the surest.

speaker: Reyson
text: Agreed.

speaker: Ike
text: Reyson, is this mysterious power that you use to sense Leanne something only herons possess?

speaker: Tibarn
text: It's not something any of the hawk clans have! That is a certainty!

speaker: Reyson
text: That's not true, Tibarn. The power may differ in potency between us, but all laguz possess it to some degree.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Ah, so it's just that my sense isn't developed, is that it?

speaker: Reyson
text: The power is distributed something like this...Among the bird tribes, it's very strong in the heron clan. Among the beast tribes, I've heard it's most developed in the cat clan, though not as strongly as in the herons. As for the dragon tribes... It's said they may be equal to, or even surpass, the strength of the herons.

speaker: Ike
text: Even though I knew that all laguz were not alike, there are even more differences than I'd imagined.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Your eyes should have told you that. Once we change, we don't look alike do we?

speaker: Ike
text: Good point.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Enough pleasantries. It's time for me and my men to take wing.

speaker: Ike
text: Right. See you later then.

speaker: Reyson
text: Tibarn, may the fortunes of war be with you.

speaker: Tibarn
text: And you as well. Don't try anything too dangerous.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Reyson?

speaker: Reyson
text: My apologies, Ike. Though I knew this was coming... It's still...difficult.

speaker: Ike
text: Don't apologize. You've nothing left to prove to me.

speaker: Nasir
text: Ike, there's someone here claiming to be an envoy from the theocracy of Begnion. She's been asking if the princess of Crimea is aboard...What do you want to do?

speaker: Ike
text: A Begnion envoy? How did she know about this ship?

speaker: Nasir
text: Hmmm...Perhaps she had word from King Gallia...On the other hand, this is Begnion we're speaking of. I imagine it has spies in every corner of the continent. Perhaps one of those spies is the source of her information.

speaker: Ike
text: So we shouldn't be surprised that she knows about Princess Elincia, right?

speaker: Soren
text: No, but it's extremely unusual for Begnion to send an envoy to meet a princess whom they do not even acknowledge.

speaker: Ike
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Soren
text: It is a complicated matter. You see, the envoy is essentially an extension of the empress herself. Both Crimea and Daein were once part of Begnion. Both nations have only recently splintered from the theocracy. I can't fathom why the empress would extend the courtesy of an envoy to a nation she must consider somewhat beneath her. She must be planning something.

speaker: Nasir
text: Beneath her? That is somewhat harsh, don't you think?

speaker: Soren
text: Harsh, perhaps, but it's true. Clothing it in sweet words will not hide its bitterness, will it?

speaker: Ike
text: Soren, even I would question the tactfulness of your words.

speaker: Soren
text: I will try to be more diplomatic.

speaker: Elincia
text: Ike, Nasir. You've no need to scold Soren. His words are just that. They do me no harm.

speaker: Nasir
text: I'm glad to hear that, Princess, but he should mind his manners.

speaker: Ike
text: Deciding how we ought to treat with this envoy is a more pressing issue. Princess, will you meet her and hear her message?

speaker: Elincia
text: I believe I must. We gain nothing by refusing to see her. Let us meet with the envoy.

speaker: Tanith
text: Princess Elincia of Crimea, I presume...

speaker: Elincia
text: Yes.

speaker: Tanith
text: It is an honor to meet you. My name is Tanith. I am deputy commanding officer of Begnion's holy guard.

speaker: Elincia
text: I must ask, what would Begnion want of me that she would send her holy guard to greet me?

speaker: Tanith
text: The apostle has learned of you, Princess Elincia, and she has come here to meet with you personally. The duty falls upon me to take you to her now.

speaker: Elincia
text: The apostle? Am I to meet--Surely the apostle has better things to do than...

speaker: Tanith
text: Will you accompany me?

speaker: Elincia
