text: I suppose that I...

speaker: Ike
text: We are the princess's escorts, and we will be coming with her. I hope you understand.

speaker: Tanith
text: Of course.

speaker: Elincia
text: Then yes, I will go with you. Thank you.

speaker: Pegasus Knight
text: Bad news,ma'am. We've sighted laguz near the apostle's position. Birdmen. Crows, most likely.

speaker: Tanith
text: Hmph! We've seen their kind before. They fancy themselves pirates without a ship, but they're thieves plain and simple. Commander Sigrun is with the apostle, and it will take more than a few winged scavengers to get past her. Let's remain calm.

speaker: Pegasus Knight
text: I... Actually, I'm afraid we aren't quite sure where the apostle is.

speaker: Tanith
text: What!? They've kidnapped the apostle!?

speaker: Pegasus Knight
text: No, no! I...From what the commander said, the apostle grew impatient and had another of her more...willful moments. I asked at the docks, and sure enough, one of the longshoremen heard her order the ship to set sail without us.

speaker: Tanith
text: What!? Where were her attendants? What was she doing without her guard? Why can she never just stay put? I've told her time and time again that the seaports here are rampant with pirates and crow thugs!...Right. Where is she now?

speaker: Pegasus Knight
text: The wind is poor today, so we think her ship should not be too far from us. I came here as quickly as I could.

speaker: Tanith
text: Understood. We'll move immediately.

speaker: Elincia
text: Excuse me, but is something wrong?

speaker: Tanith
text: Your Highness, I must apologize, but an urgent matter has arisen, and I must attend to it immediately. I will return for you later. Await my return!

speaker: Ike
text: What was that all about?

speaker: Titania
text: Judging from her expression, I'd say something has happened to the person she's meant to be protecting.

speaker: Mist
text: Say, do you think that ship over there is involved? The envoy is flying in that direction.

speaker: Ike
text: If so, then the pegasus knight's fears have already been realized...They're under attack. It's the ravens they spoke of, isn't it?

speaker: Soren
text: Ike, why don't we go lend them a hand?

speaker: Ike
text: Are you feeling all right, Soren? It's not like you to offer to help anyone.

speaker: Soren
text: It's a great opportunity to put the empress in our debt. We'd be fools to pass that up, wouldn't we?

speaker: Ike
text: I should have known you'd have an angle. What do you want to do, Titania?

speaker: Titania
text: I don't approve of Soren's motivations, but I agree that we should help.

speaker: Ike
text: Well, then that's what we'll do. Will you be all right on your own, Princess?

speaker: Elincia
text: You're doing the right thing. I would not dream of stopping you. I know those pirates are no match for your strength.

speaker: Elincia
text: Give them...Give them a sound thrashing!

speaker: Ike
text: Huh...You're starting to sound like one of us, aren't you? All right then, we'd better go!

speaker: Tanith
text: Ugh! No matter how many we defeat, there are more waiting to attack! And not just those ravens of Kilvas, either--there are beorc, too. What do they all want here!?

speaker: Ike
text: Need a little help?

speaker: Tanith
text: You! Aren't you Princess Crimea's escort?

speaker: Ike
text: Yes. The princess ordered us to come to your aid. May we join the fray?

speaker: Tanith
text: That would be appreciated. We'll keep the ravens at bay. In the interim, why don't you go ahead and move onto that ship. The big vessel is ours. I'm not sure who the small one belongs to.

speaker: Tanith
text: There are human soldiers aboard, but if they're in this part of the sea, they must be pirates. Cut them down!

speaker: Ike
text: Right. We'll take care of them!

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Oh, no! There are more of them!? We're doomed!!

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: No, don't panic! We must protect the apostle no matter what!! Listen up, pirate scum! You may outnumber us, but we will not yield an inch!

speaker: Ike
text: Wait, wait! Don't get confused. We're here to help you! We're your reinforcements. The deputy commander of the holy guard asked us to help drive the enemy from this ship.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Oh! Commander Tanith sent you? We're saved! The apostle has taken refuge in the cabin belowdecks.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Where on earth is the holy guard? Between those crows and the pirates, we're outnumbered! It's only a matter of time before we're overwhelmed.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Lady Astrid! Allow me to serve as your shield!

speaker: Astrid
text: Gatrie...I'm so sorry that I've gotten you involved in this, too...

speaker: Gatrie
text: Oh, please! This is nothing. I'm fine!! Before I was hired as your bodyguard, I was a top-notch mercenary! I can handle this many opponents all by myself. This is nothing.

speaker: Astrid
text: Is that so? Your confidence is impressive, to say the least...

speaker: Gatrie
text: Tee hee! Well...trust me, my confidence is backed with my blade! I'm ready to fight!

speaker: Astrid
text: I will fight, too.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Y-you...You're one of the passengers from House Damiell, aren't you? I can't permit someone of your stature to throw herself into harm's way!

speaker: Astrid
text: I was once a knight of Begnion, albeit for only a short while...I won't get in your way.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: No, I can't--

speaker: Astrid
text: We must defend the apostle, right? We do not have the luxury of choosing how to do so. Come, we must get ready. The enemy is coming!

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: You are right. We need every able fighter. Accept my apologies, and thank you for your help.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Until the holy guard arrives, we need you to defend the entrance to the ship's cabins.

speaker: Ike
text: Got it! Weapons ready, everyone!

speaker: Astrid
text: Who are you?

speaker: Ike
text: My name's Ike. I'm with the Greil Mercenaries. I came to defend this ship--and the apostle, if I can.

speaker: Astrid
text: Is that so? I am Astrid, of House Damiell.

speaker: Ike
text: A blueblood, huh? Well, unless you're good with a sword, you'd better hide yourself in a cabin.

speaker: Astrid
text: I'll do no such thing. I once trained with knights and cavaliers. I may be of noble birth...but I know something of battle. I can fight.

speaker: Ike
text: Well, if you can fight, we can use you. Let's work together. You going to be all right with that?

speaker: Astrid
text: More so than I would be with hiding belowdecks, certainly.

speaker: Astrid
text: Gatrie...

speaker: Gatrie
text: Lady Astrid! Are you all right?

speaker: Astrid
text: What do you mean? I'm fine. Why shouldn't I be?

speaker: Gatrie
text: I saw you talking to that rough, blue-haired lad earlier..What did he say to you? Was he rude? Did he try to tell you to run for safety while he fought for your honor?

speaker: Astrid
text: ...Words to that effect, yes.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Oh, what a fool! I tell you, he'll never learn! You already have an unbeatable bodyguard--me! I'll have to remind him of that later.

speaker: Astrid
text: You know that Ike person?

speaker: Gatrie
text: He is the son of a man under whom I had the honor of serving. He's not a bad person, by any means. But he has no manners whatsoever...

speaker: Astrid
text: I see. Well, he seemed more concerned than rude. When I told him I would prefer to fight, he seemed to understand.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Hm...Oh. Oh, of course! I see it now! How silly of me. Not rude, you say? I should have known my presence would have changed the boy for the better! I'm the ideal role model!

speaker: Gatrie
text: Well, if it isn't Ike! Good to see you. You're looking well, my boy.

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Well, I'm glad to see it. I've been worried sick about how the Greil Mercenaries held up after I left. Did you ever recover?

speaker: Ike
text: We managed just fine. Uh...What are you doing here, anyway?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Me? Oh, I'm on a vital mission. Absolutely critical, I am. You see, these men keep attacking this ship, and I am to continue driving them back!

speaker: Ike
text: I see...Are you working for the Begnion apostle?

speaker: Gatrie
text: No, no. My employer is far more charming!

speaker: Ike
text: Is that so...From the sound of it, it must be a young lady.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Aye, after a fashion. Judging by the look of things, you must be on Begnion's side, yes? I certainly hope so. I'd hate to have to slay you after all we've been through.

speaker: Ike
text: No, you're right. We're here to defend the apostle.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Well, that's a relief. There's nothing more awkward than having to kill a friend because of his poor taste in employers, I tell you. Still, I guess that's the hazard of life as a mercenary. It's good to see you, Ike. Let's finish this together!

speaker: Ike
text: I'm with you, Gatrie

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, Gatrie! What's with that sour look on your face?

speaker: Gatrie
text: You know, I think it must be fate. Why else would we be here, fighting side by side once again? It makes me wish I hadn't abandoned you so quickly after your father, Commander Greil, died.

speaker: Ike
text: It's not like you to say things like that, Gatrie...

speaker: Gatrie
text: You look like none of this matters to you. Aren't you mad at me or anything? I abandoned you all!

speaker: Ike
text: No. I understand how you must have felt when you left. And it's only because you left that you met this nice new employer. I see no problem.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Yes, you do have a point. So I guess it all worked out! I can't believe I wasted all this time worrying!

speaker: Ike
text: The fact that you worried tells me that you never really abandoned us after all.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Hm. You're right again! I am truly glad to see you, Ike.

speaker: Titania
text: Gatrie? Is that you? Well, I'll be. It IS you!

speaker: Gatrie
text: Oh! Titania! It's been such a long time! How have you been?

speaker: Titania
text: Busy, of course. The mercenary life is a busy one. Have you been doing well since you left us?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Yes! In fact, I'm on a very serious mission right now! I can't afford to lose. A life hangs in the balance!

speaker: Titania
text: My...I've never seen you so serious before. Whoever your new employer is, he must be quite special...or...would I be safe in saying she?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Tee hee! You know me too well! But I do love the work she gives me. I'm so happy, I don't know what to do! Well, it is nice seeing you again!

speaker: Titania
text: You, too. Good luck, Gatrie!

speaker: Gatrie
text: Hm? Hey, it's you!

speaker: Soren
text: ...Hello, Gatrie.

speaker: Gatrie
text: What's wrong? Are you still holding a grudge because I abandoned the Greil Mercenaries so abruptly?

speaker: Soren
text: No, not really. I'm just waiting to find out which side you're working for. If you're on our side, fine...Please fight till you drop. It will only improve our chances of winning.

speaker: Gatrie
text: I, uh...Of course! You know, you can always count on me!

speaker: Soren
text: Hm. Always. Of course.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Phew...That boy hasn't changed a bit.

speaker: Mist
text: Gatrie? That is you, isn't it?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Well, if it isn't Mist! Long time, no see! How have you been?

speaker: Mist
text: Oh, you know! Hanging in there.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Look at you! You're out here on the battlefield now? How do you like it?

speaker: Mist
text: No worries...Not so far, anyway. How about you? Are you doing well?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Yes! In fact, I'm on a very serious mission right now! I can't afford to lose. A life hangs in the balance!

speaker: Mist
text: I'm glad things are working out. I knew they would, but I was worried...Just a little.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Tee hee hee. You never need to worry about me, dear Mist. I've never been happier!

speaker: Mist
text: I'm glad to hear that.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Well, the battle awaits. Stay sharp, and stay safe!

speaker: Mist
text: The same goes for you, Gatrie!

speaker: Oscar
text: ...Well if it isn't Gatrie!

speaker: Gatrie
text: Is...Is that you, Oscar!? My word, Oscar! So, how is it going?

speaker: Oscar
text: Well, I'm hanging in there. How about you? How have you been? Is everything going well with your job?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Yes! In fact, I'm on a very serious mission right now! I can't afford to lose. A life hangs in the balance!

speaker: Oscar
text: I'm glad to hear that. I knew you'd be fine, but I still worried about you.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Oh, there's never any need to worry about me. Why, I can't recall ever having been happier.

speaker: Oscar
text: Is that right?

speaker: Gatrie
text: But enough chitchat. There's a battle to finish!

speaker: Oscar
text: You got that right.

speaker: Boyd
text: It can't be...Gatrie!?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Boyd? Why, Boyd! Long time, no see! How have you been?

speaker: Boyd
text: Since you left? I've been fine, thanks. We've all been just fine. Uh...What are you doing here?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Working, of course! I'm on a very serious mission right now. I can't afford to lose. A life hangs in the balance!

speaker: Boyd
text: Hm. Well, I am glad to hear that. You do seem much happier now than when you were when you left us.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Ha ha ha. You always were an observant one. Let me tell you, I've never been happier.

speaker: Boyd
text: If I know you, this has something to do with a woman, doesn't it?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Huh? What was that?

speaker: Boyd
text: Oh, nothing. I was just talking to myself.

speaker: Gatrie
text: But enough chitchat. There's a battle to finish!

speaker: Boyd
text: You got that right.

speaker: Rolf
text: Gatrie? It IS you!

speaker: Gatrie
text: Hey! Rolf? Rolf! It's been a long time! How have you been?

speaker: Rolf
text: Well...Yes. I've been well!

speaker: Gatrie
text: They have you fighting for them, too, do they...Are you doing all right?

speaker: Rolf
text: Oh, yeah. I'm fine. I've been doing just fine. How about you, Gatrie?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Great! In fact, I'm on a very serious mission right now! I can't afford to lose. A life hangs in the balance!

speaker: Rolf
text: Sounds exciting! I guess I didn't need to worry about you after all.

speaker: Gatrie
text: You were worried? That's nice, but to tell the truth, I've never been happier, my boy!

speaker: Rolf
text: I'm glad to hear that.

speaker: Gatrie
text: But enough chitchat. There's a battle to finish!

speaker: Rolf
text: I'll second that.

speaker: Rhys
text: Hm? Is that...Gatrie, is that you?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Hm? Rhys? Rhys, look at you! It's been so long! How are you doing?

speaker: Rhys
text: Oh...I'm hanging in there. And you? How has it been since you left? Is the new job going well?

speaker: Gatrie
text: You bet! In fact,I'm on a very serious mission right now! I can't afford to lose. A life hangs in the balance!

speaker: Rhys
text: I'm glad to hear everything's going well for you. I knew it would, but I was worried...Just a little.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Tee hee! You don't need to worry about me. Why, I can't remember when I've been this happy.

speaker: Rhys
text: I'm relieved to hear that.

speaker: Gatrie
text: But enough chitchat! There's a battle that needs fighting.

speaker: Rhys
text: Agreed. It's nice to fight at your side again, even if we're working for different people.

speaker: Naesala
text: Tell me, walker, are my soldiers proving useful?

speaker: Norris
text: K-King Kilvas!

speaker: Naesala
text: What? Aren't you happy to see me?

speaker: Norris
text: Grrr...Look at this mess! I paid you good money to help me outmaneuver everyone else and catch the Crimean princess's ship first. Everything seemed to be going exactly as we'd planned. But now, we're being attacked by a squad of pegasus knights! We're flying no flags! We've stripped our armor of any crests! They should have no clue who we are! Why are they attacking us!?

speaker: Naesala
text: Didn't you know? That is a Begnion ship you're attacking.

speaker: Norris
text: What?!? That's...a Begnion ship? It was your featherbrained lackey who told us that Princess Crimea was aboard that vessel!

speaker: Naesala
text: Call it a miscommunication...One of those unfortunate misunderstandings that seem to happen now and again.

speaker: Norris
text: You deceitful...King Kilvas! I wouldn't be surprised if you'd planned this treachery from the start!

speaker: Naesala
text: Such unkind words! You wound me. I would never intentionally lie to you. And as proof, I bring good news. I have it on unshakable authority that the ship that just sailed up alongside Begnion's carries the Crimean princess.

speaker: Norris
text: Oh...But unless we can break through the Begnion ranks, there's nothing we can do...

speaker: Naesala
text: Would you care for some assistance?

speaker: Norris
text: And what would it cost me this time?

speaker: Naesala
text: You learn quickly, my friend. Let's see, you'd be receiving my own royal assistance, so...double--no, triple rates.

speaker: Norris
text: Ludicrous! So much gold... Where would I...

speaker: Naesala
text: I suppose I could defer payment until later. Of course, that does bring up the question of interest...

speaker: Norris
text: Leave my sight! I wouldn't seek your aid if the world were burning down around me!

speaker: Naesala
text: Very well, we've no more to discuss. Call me if you change your mind. I'll find a nice perch and enjoy the show.

speaker: Norris
text: Curse you! You're no better than your feral cousins!

speaker: Naesala
text: Those humans take themselves far too seriously. It's almost as though being obstinate is a way of life to them. They let their foolish pride stand in the way, and what do they get in the end? A swift and stupid death. Now I'm getting terribly bored merely watching their foolishness.

speaker: Nealuchi
text: Ne-Ne-Nestling! I can sense you're up to no good again!

speaker: Naesala
text: Stop calling me Nestling...Really, how many times must I tell you that, Nealuchi?

speaker: Nealuchi
text: To me, you will always be Nestling, Nestling. You can tell me as many times as you like, but I can't stop. You may be king now, but in my eyes, you will ever be my little nestling with eggshell stuck to your tail feathers!

speaker: Naesala
text: Oh...curses! Senile old fool. Forget it.

speaker: Naesala
text: Hey, you there!

speaker: Raven Laguz
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Naesala
text: We should take advantage of the confusion of battle to help ourselves to the cargo. These humans seem interested only in fighting their fellow men. If they can't be bothered to defend their treasure, I think it fair to say they've lost their claim to it.

speaker: Raven Laguz
text: Right you are, sir!

speaker: Naesala
text: Hmph. Fight. Fight till you drop, ground-bound humans. We Kilvas will be sharpening our black beaks in the mean.

speaker: Tibarn
text: Hm. A battle...Tell me what you see, Janaff.

speaker: Janaff
text: It's a bit far off, but with no fog, it shouldn't be a problem. Hmm...The middle ship... I see beorc aboard. By their crests, I'd say they serve the hated Begnion empire. And the other ships...I'm not sure who they belong to. Neither flies any flag...and I see no crest, but I can make out more beorc. From their behavior...I would say that one side fights Begnion, while the other rushes to Begnion's aid.

speaker: Tibarn
text: A battle between beorc ships? I do not understand this at all. Ulki, tell me what they are saying.

speaker: Ulki
text: Just a minute, sir......The apostle is...aboard the Begnion ship. And coming to her aid...Soldiers serving Crimea's princess? They appear to be mercenaries. And on that last ship...More soldiers, although I do not know which country they serve. It seems they had a contract of some sort with the raven king.

speaker: Tibarn
text: The apostle!? That would explain the presence of those graceless pegasus knights.

speaker: Ulki
text: What would you like to do, Your Majesty? We will fight if you give the word.

speaker: Tibarn
text: The apostle...This is a tempting opportunity. However, we are no scavengers, feeding on others' scraps. When we fight, it will be with honor. We're going back home. Do some scouting and report back to me with what you find.

speaker: Ulki
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Norris
text: Blast! All my plans are falling apart. I'll cut you all down!

speaker: Norris
text: Accursed crows...You ruined...all of...my plans...

speaker: Sigrun
text: Finally! There they are! I hope we'll find Empress Sanaki...safe and sound...Ladies, chaaaarge! Show them what we've got!!

speaker: Ike
text: Oh, no!!

speaker: Norris
text: Pegasus knights? Begnion sent their holy guard here? Blast! Accursed crows...My plan was perfect! It's over...Men, into the seas! Swim for your lives! And if you get caught, tell 'em nothing! Not a word about our homeland, or your life is forfeit!

speaker: Naesala
text: I saw this coming, of course. You know...If they'd just paid me more, I'd have been willing to lend a hand. Oh, well. What do a few human lives matter to us? They're none of our concern. We're done here. Let's go.

speaker: Raven Laguz
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Titania
text: That's it. It looks like the dust is finally starting to settle.

speaker: Soren
text: Looks like those crows took flight as soon as the holy guard arrived. The other assailants fled, too.

speaker: Ike
text: Then our job here is done. Crows are one thing, but what were those men doing with them?

speaker: Titania
text: Yes, I thought that was odd, too.

speaker: Ike
text: They looked like pirates, but they certainly didn't act like them.

speaker: Titania
text: True. They weren't interested in treasure, and their soldiers definitely were trained fighters. But who were they? Which country did they serve? Was this an attempt on the apostle's life?

speaker: Nasir
text: It's possible. The apostle is the symbol of the Begnion Empire itself. The apostle is its empress. If she were to perish, it's fair to say Begnion itself would perish as well.

speaker: Ike
text: I see...

speaker: Unknown
text: The apostle is missing!? What do you mean!?

speaker: Nasir
text: That voice...

speaker: Ike
text: Something must have happened. Let's go find out.

speaker: Tanith
text: ...Ugh. This business is becoming quite the headache.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: I-I'm sorry, ma'am! If I can offer up my life in repentance for--

speaker: Tanith
text: Oh, stop it. If you want to repent, go do something useful and find the apostle.

speaker: Begnion Soldier
text: Yes, ma'am!

speaker: Ike
text: Did I hear correctly? Is the apostle missing again?

speaker: Tanith
text: Oh, you're that mercenary...

speaker: Ike
text: My men guarded the cabin entrance. As far as I know, we kept it safe from the enemy...

speaker: Tanith
text: From what I have been told, the apostle slipped out of the cabin on her own in the chaos...

speaker: Ike
text: On her own? Now why would anyone called the apostle do something as stupid as that?

speaker: Titania
text: Hey, Ike! Watch your words. You're being rude.

speaker: Tanith
text: It's all right, dame knight. I have more important matters on my mind. I hate to ask, but would I be able to enlist your help in searching for the apostle?

speaker: Titania
text: Of course! You don't mind helping, do you, Ike?

speaker: Ike
text: Nah.

speaker: Tanith
text: We'll search the enemy ship. Would you search your ship, just to be sure? I would appreciate it.

speaker: Ike
text: I'll do what I can to find her, but I don't even know who I'm looking for...

speaker: Soren
text: I think it's safe to assume she will be a woman of stature, a noblewoman of some sort.

speaker: Ike
text: Huh.

speaker: Titania
text: Well, I suppose all I have to do is keep my eyes peeled for any stowaway--anyone I don't know. Let's split up. It will go faster if we search separately. Mist and I will check this side.

speaker: Ike
text: Then Soren and I will search the rest of the ship.

speaker: Ike
text: Soren...About what I said this morning...

speaker: Soren
text: Yes?

speaker: Ike
text: About the way you phrase things.

speaker: Soren
text: I...I ought to apologize for that.

speaker: Ike
text: No, don't apologize. I know you. I know it's been bothering you, hasn't it?

speaker: Soren
text: No. Well...

speaker: Ike
text: Don't take it personally. I'm no better, you know. Your ability to speak plainly the things others won't is part of what makes you brilliant. Others are too bound by courtesy...With you, I trust that what you say is exactly what you think.

speaker: Soren
text: Well...yes... Thank you, Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: Now, about that missing apostle...

speaker: Ike
text: You found her?

speaker: Soren
text: No, I don't think so. But there's a child stowing away in here!

speaker: Ike
text: What!? What is a child doing hiding on our ship!?

speaker: Soren
text: She must be some aristocrat's daughter. Probably slipped on from the Begnion ship...It was a hectic battle. She must have been frightened and hid herself here in the confusion. Are you going to help her?

speaker: Ike
text: Well, we can't just leave her.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, are you all right?

speaker: Sanaki
text: I-I'm...fine...

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, don't be scared!

speaker: Sanaki
text: Uh...Wh-who might you be? You don't look like a laguz. Perhaps a new recruit?

speaker: Ike
text: No. I'm a mercenary. I was hired by Princess Elincia.

speaker: Sanaki
text: The Crimean princess? Ouch!

speaker: Ike
text: What's wrong? Oh, you hurt your foot. Let me see.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Hold! Do not approach me! Hey, I told you not to--Oooouch! You're hurting me! You fool!!

speaker: Ike
text: Looks like the bone's not broken. Still, we'd better have Mist take a look at it just in case.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Oh? What? What are you doing!?

speaker: Ike
text: Just hush up and hold on to me. There's my sister. She can heal that foot of yours right up.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Are you trying to help me? Shouldn't you be elsewhere?

speaker: Ike
text: I'm supposed to be looking for some sort of apostle person. But I think there are enough other people looking, and I'd rather help the injured first.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Ha...I see. This is indeed...

speaker: Ike
text: Hm? What is it?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Oh, nothing. If that's the case, I accept your help.

speaker: Mist
text: Ike! Any luck finding the apostle?

speaker: Ike
text: Nope. All I found was a little lost child.

speaker: Titania
text: Hey, she's quite a cutie.

speaker: Ike
text: Mist, do you think you could use your staff to heal this kid?

speaker: Mist
text: Yeah. Is she hurt?

speaker: Ike
text: Just her foot...But maybe she bumped her head, too. She's been mumbling complete gibberish since I picked her up.

speaker: Sanaki
text: I kept silent, blaming these antics on your ignorance, but I can no longer tolerate your manners!

speaker: Ike
text: Huh? What's wrong? It's your foot, isn't it?

speaker: Sanaki
text: Prepare yourselves, peasants!

speaker: Ike
text: Prepare? For what?

speaker: Sanaki
text: You stand in the presence of Sanaki, empress of Begnion! I am the apostle, the voice of the goddess!

speaker: Ike
text: Empress? What did she say?

speaker: Titania
text: What? Then she is...

speaker: Mist
text: Oh, no... Is she really...?

speaker: Ike
text: No, she can't be.

speaker: Soren
text: No way

speaker: Titania
text: Hold your judgment...Even if she's lying, there must be a reason...

speaker: Sanaki
text: Y-you...ignorant...!

speaker: Unknown
text: Are you all right, Empress!?

speaker: Sigrun
text: My apologies! We were unable to reach you, and we left you in terrible peril. I accept full responsibility.

speaker: Sanaki
text: You're late, Sigrun! What would you have done had something happened to me?

speaker: Sigrun
text: Please, Empress, I beg your forgiveness.

speaker: Sanaki
text: That won't be necessary. I am also partly to blame for what happened.

speaker: Sanaki
text: Let's focus instead on our rescuers. As a reward for rescuing me, I would like to invite them to visit our court. And be sure that the one they serve, that girl who claims to be the princess of Crimea, is invited as well.

speaker: Sigrun
text: Princess Elincia's bodyguards, I presume. I am sorry for the trouble you've gone to.

speaker: Ike
text: And you are...?

speaker: Sigrun
text: I beg your pardon. My name is Sigrun. I'm a commander of Begnion's holy guard. No word of thanks will ever repay you for saving the empress.

speaker: Mist
text: Wait...So it's true?

speaker: Titania
text: Are you saying that little child...

speaker: Ike
text: is Begnion's...

speaker: Soren
text: Empress...Hm. It appears so. I can't say I quite believe it, but she seems sincere. Besides, how many people do you know who command a legion of pegasus knights?

speaker: Sigrun
text: The empress has invited us to join her at Sienne, the capital of Begnion. I think we should go. Where is the princess? We should ask her permission before agreeing.

speaker: Ike
text: She must be in the cabin. I'll take you to her.

speaker: Daniel
text: Commander, how are you? Staring at the sea, I see...

speaker: Ike
text: I know you...You're Jorge, right? You make weapons for us.

speaker: Daniel
text: No. Jorge buys used ware. I'm his twin brother. Well, mostly his twin. He has blond hair, you see. My name is Daniel. Just remember that I have brown hair and that Jorge has blond, and you'll be fine.

speaker: Ike
text: Brown hair, Daniel, and weapons...Blond hair, Jorge, and items...I think I'll remember.

speaker: Daniel
text: Fantastic. Say, can I ask you a quick question? You're a battle expert, right? You've fought a lot?

speaker: Ike
text: Enough, yeah. What is it?

speaker: Daniel
text: Picture this. Let's say there are two ships. And suppose there are planks connecting the ships at three different points.

speaker: Ike
text: All right. I'm picturing it.

speaker: Daniel
text: Now then, soldiers from one ship are about to attack the other one. Imagine that the defending side has fewer soldiers. If they want to mount a solid defense, what should they do?

speaker: Ike
text: It seems clear enough to me. Position the soldiers with the best defense on the planks, soldiers like cavaliers and knights.

speaker: Daniel
text: I see. So you would hold the enemy at bay by using your strongest allies to block the primary crossing points!

speaker: Ike
text: Then, you'd want to have your long-range attackers line up behind the tougher units barring the bridges. I'm talking about anyone with javelins, axes, or magic. You'd be able to do a lot of damage without much risk.

speaker: Daniel
text: Sounds like a good plan but...it seems rough on the soldiers defending the bridges.

speaker: Ike
text: You would want to heal them often,obviously, but maybe there's a way to reduce how much damage they take.

speaker: Daniel
text: It's a stretch, but what if I don't have them attack at all? That way, they won't run the risk of getting any counterattacks!

speaker: Ike
text: Hmm... That's not a bad idea.

speaker: Daniel
text: Great! Thanks. That gave me some good ideas.

speaker: Ike
text: Ideas? For what?

speaker: Daniel
text: Oh, my brother and I have been playing a wargame. I've lost four times in a row.

speaker: Ike
text: A wargame?

speaker: Daniel
text: We'll let you join if you bring some parchment and a quill. Come see us anytime if you're curious. See you later.

speaker: Ike
text: Maybe I shouldn't have been so serious with him...

speaker: Aimee
text: Well, well! If it isn't our commander! What brings you down here?

speaker: Ike
text: I was just on my way to the deck.

speaker: Aimee
text: Oh, I see. That's too bad. I had a story I wanted to share with you.

speaker: Ike
text: A story?

speaker: Aimee
text: Hm mm. And quite a ripping yarn it is, too. Interested?

speaker: Ike
text: Well... Not really.

speaker: Aimee
text: Oh, you're so rude! And after you were so sweet the other day!

speaker: Ike
text: What are you going on about?

speaker: Aimee
text: When those crows attacked... I had wanted to see what they looked like, so I was hiding on the deck, watching. I had heard they could fly, of course, but I had no idea they could fight! I thought one of them had the drop on you, and I couldn't help myself! I cried out, Commander, watch out!

speaker: Ike
text: I thought I'd heard a strange, shrieking sound. That was you?

speaker: Aimee
text: And upon hearing my sweet voice, Commander, you turned around and brought down that crow with one shot! It was awe inspiring.

speaker: Ike
text: Not really. He was exhausted from the battle. He could barely move.

speaker: Aimee
text: And that's when you first caught my eye, my dynamic young commander!

speaker: Ike
text: Is that why your hand always lingers on mine when you hand me my equipment?

speaker: Aimee
text: Oh, no! Have I been too...obvious?

speaker: Ike
text: Maybe I should send one of the others down to pick up our gear from now on...

speaker: Aimee
text: Hm. You're embarrassed, aren't you? You're so cute when you're being coy! But once I set my sights on a man,I never let him get away. Remember that.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey.

speaker: Jill
text: What do you want?

speaker: Ike
text: Is there any reason you're still on our ship? The crows are gone. The truce is over, isn't it?

speaker: Jill
text: ...I have a duty. As a Daein soldier, I cannot allow a Crimean princess and her band of mercenaries to run free where they will.

speaker: Ike
text: If you want to start a fight,you're on the right path. Think you can take us all on your own? Because if you want to get your friends, I won't stop you from leaving the ship.

speaker: Jill
text: Watching you all fight those crows like a band of street rats with sticks,I could see you were no match for me. But even if I were to leave this ship, the land is too far away for me to reach.

speaker: Ike
text: Nonsense. I can see land in the distance from time to time, and I thought you could go anywhere on that wyvern of yours.

speaker: Jill
text: No wyvern could fly that far without resting, and these islands are thick with half-beast scum. Even if I wanted to, I couldn't leave this ship.

speaker: Ike
text: Then let me ask you, why did you follow us alone knowing that?

speaker: Jill
text: I wanted to be recognized...I wanted my deeds to earn me fame. A soldier has little else to strive for...

speaker: Ike
text: And yet you soldiers sneer at mercenaries. At least we fight for something real. There are some dumb soldiers in this world.

speaker: Ike
text: You leave us no choice. I'll take you as far as Begnion.

speaker: Ike
text: But as long as you're on my ship, you will not utter the phrase half-beast. If you can't agree to this condition, I'll kick you off the ship right now.

speaker: Boyd
text: I'm just saying, there has to be something more we can do.

speaker: Oscar
text: Boyd... You're not making any sense. I understand your enthusiasm to help , but try to explain what you mean...We can't do anything until we know exactly what it is you want to do.

speaker: Boyd
text: You're so impatient, Oscar. I was just getting to it, all right?

speaker: Oscar
text: Impatient? You're calling me impatient? You're so impatient you can barely be bothered to put your armor on!

speaker: Boyd
text: Nag, nag, nag. Listen, I think we should come up with an unstoppable killer attack, something only we can do!

speaker: Rolf
text: An unstoppable attack!? That sounds good...

speaker: Boyd
text: Doesn't it? I'm glad you approve, peewee!

speaker: Rolf
text: Don't call me peewee!

speaker: Oscar
text: It is a fine plan, but you haven't explained what this new attack is supposed to be. How do we do it?

speaker: Boyd
text: Hey, I came up with the idea. It's your job to figure out the details. Make it cool, though, Oscar.

speaker: Oscar
text: Boyd, this plan sounds...Oh, dear... How do I put it?

speaker: Rolf
text: Let me do it! I'll think up a great one!

speaker: Boyd
text: No way. Forget that. It's too much for your little peewee brain.

speaker: Rolf
text: I told you, don't call me that!

speaker: Ike
text: They may not like to admit it, but they certainly are close.

speaker: Boyd
text: No fair playing the martyr! Nobody made me go with you. I left of my own free will! I’m ready to accept my punishment, too! Wait, what am I saying?

speaker: Rhys
text: Please, Commander Greil! Titania entrusted me with her orders. If anyone’s to blame for this mess, it’s me. I’m the one who should be punished...

speaker: Oscar
text: I set a poor example, Commander Greil. Any punishment should be mine alone.

speaker: Greil
text: Regardless of your reasons, you disobeyed the orders of a superior officer. You are confined to quarters for ten days.

speaker: Mist
text: But, Father! They did what they did to help me and Rolf!

speaker: Greil
text: Rules exist for a reason, Mist. Men won’t survive on a battlefield if they do as the, wish without so much as a by-your-leave.

speaker: Ike
text: ...I understand. And accept the reprimand.

speaker: Greil
text: That being said, we’ve got more work than we can handle. Your punishment is deferred until things calm down.

speaker: Greil
text: I’m pleased to see that you are willing to shield one another. However...

speaker: Greil
text: Oscar, Boyd, Rhys. You come with me.

speaker: Titania
text: Shinon, Gatrie, and you, Ike. You’re with me.

speaker: Havetti
text: Yar har ho! Me belly’s emptier ‘n me first mate’s head! Fetch me some grub!

speaker: Titania
text: Are you all ready? Greil Mercenaries, move out!

speaker: Shinon
text: On my way!

speaker: Gatrie
text: Here we go!

speaker: Ike
text: ...Ready!

speaker: Titania
text: That’s the pirate ship in question, isn’t it?

speaker: Mayor
text: Aye. They sailed into port a few days ago and have been causing trouble ever since. I pray that you and your companions can drive them away.

speaker: Titania
text: I understand. We’ll do all we can.

speaker: Shinon
text: Feathering sea scum is like shooting apples off a tree. Let’s do the job and get out of here.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Ho, Deputy Commander! You want standard thunder and lightning maneuvers here?

speaker: Ike
text: Er...Thunder and lightning?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Yeah! I crash into ’em like thunder, and Shinon rains arrows down on ’em like lightning!

speaker: Titania
text: Sounds good.

speaker: Ike
text: What should I do?

speaker: Titania
text: Let’s hold back and let Shinon and Gatrie soften them up. Once they’ve whittled down the numbers, we’ll all rush the ship and wipe out whatever’s left.

speaker: Nasir
text: This town seems quite unruly, wouldn’t you say? Is it always this dangerous? Oh...So it’s plagued by pirates, is it? I see. That would explain why the people here seem so anxious. You seem so very...young. And you claim you were hired to rid the town of these pesky pirates? Here, perhaps you should take this. It might help you if you run into trouble contending with the pirates. But do hurry. I came all this way to see the world-famous fish market, and I’ll never do so with those ruffians around. Best of luck to you.

speaker: Marcia
text: Hey! You! Boat monkey! You tricked me, didn’t you?

speaker: Havetti
text: Tricked ye? What a vile and nasty thing that is to be sayin’. Don’t ye agree, matey?

speaker: Pirate
text: Yar, that I do! There be nothing but honest pirates aboard this ship, missy.

speaker: Marcia
text: You said you knew the whereabouts of my older brother. That’s why I came all the way to your ship.

speaker: Havetti
text: Aye, and we do know! He was on board for a while, and then...Do ye recall where he went, matey?

speaker: Pirate
text: Yar, that I do. He was a penniless oaf, so we tossed his worthless carcass into the rolling waves. Yar har ho!

speaker: Marcia
text: My... My brother? That’s horrid!

speaker: Pirate
text: Horrid? Did ye say horrid? Yer scurvy brother was the horrid one! He lost a game o’ chance, he did. If ye lose, ye must pay...And the scallywag tried to cheat me! By Shanty Pete he did!

speaker: Havetti
text: Arr, calm yerself, me hearty!

speaker: Pirate
text: Yar!...Yar?...Yar.

speaker: Havetti
text: After all, his darling sister’s come to pay us a visit. What say ye work off yer brother’s debt?

speaker: Marcia
text: What say I run you through with my lance and call it a day?!

speaker: Pirate
text: Yo ho har! It matters not that ye be a pegasus knight, lassie.

speaker: Havetti
text: A wee minnow like yerself is no match for us sea dogs! Prepare yourself, ye flying wench!

speaker: Marcia
text: Pfff! I’m not afraid of you, clambake! If your axe is as dull as your wit,this will be over in no time!

speaker: Marcia
text: Oh, crackers! There’s too many of them. I don’t want to die here...Brother...this might be the end!

speaker: Ike
text: Hey! Are you all right?

speaker: Marcia
text: ...So cold...So...Huh?

speaker: Ike
text: Don’t give up!

speaker: Marcia
text: Wh-who are you?

speaker: Ike
text: I’m a mercenary. The villagers hired us to get rid of these pirates.

speaker: Marcia
text: Are you...Are you going to help me?

speaker: Ike
text: Of course. Let me and my companions take it from here. You can escape while the pirates are distracted.

speaker: Marcia
text: Oh, hey, that would be fantastic! Thanks so much! I don’t know what to say.

speaker: Ike
text: You don’t have to say anything. It’s all in a day’s work.

speaker: Marcia
text: Pshaw! You’re helping me out! I should show my gratitude somehow.

speaker: Ike
text: That’s...nice, but I can’t think of anything off the top of my head. Just get yourself somewhere safe, please.

speaker: Marcia
text: Well then...I’ll come talk to you about repaying my debt later. What’s your name, handsome?

speaker: Ike
text: Um... I’m Ike. I’m with the Greil Mercenaries.

speaker: Marcia
text: Ike! Got it! And I am Marcia, a pegasus knight of Begnion. Don’t forget me! All right, I’ll be seeing you later!

speaker: Marcia
text: Urrr... Ah, nuts...Bro-Brother...I’ll be with you soon.

speaker: Havetti
text: Yahar har harrr! Yer bustin’ me gut, ye rudderless fool! Do ya truly think ye can face me mighty axe and live?

speaker: Havetti
text: Yaaaarr...arrr...Help me...

speaker: Titania
text: We’ve driven off all the pirates. Your people will suffer no more indignities at their hands.

speaker: Mayor
text: Oh! That is joyful news! Here is your pay, as promised.

speaker: Titania
text: Thank you very much. And if you find yourself in need again, do not hesitate to send word.

speaker: Mayor
text: Of course, of course. All of you put on a most marvelous show–such combat skills! To be honest,I was expecting Commander Greil to be here today. When I saw just you, nothing more than, no offense, a band of children...Well, I will admit to being a tad nervous!

speaker: Titania
text: I apologize for troubling you. Unfortunately, Commander Greil had other pressing matters to attend to.

speaker: Mayor
text: Oh, no. Don’t apologize. There’s no need. After all, you got rid of those brigands, and you did it impeccably well!

speaker: Titania
text: It’s a fine compliment you pay, sir, but it was our pleasure.

speaker: Mayor
text: As a matter of fact, you’re more than good enough to be in the royal army if you so desired. Especially your Commander Greil. He’s far and away better than most any general I’ve seen hereabouts. Er... What I mean to say is...Don’t you think running off pirates is a bit...beneath you?

speaker: Titania
text: That’s not–

speaker: Mayor
text: Don’t get me wrong, now. You certainly helped all of us simple folk out. Even so, it seems to me the proper place for you and your Commander Greil is in the service of the Crimean throne! Well, that’s what this old man thinks.

speaker: Titania
text: We–and Commander Greil–are quite satisfied with the work we do now.

speaker: Mayor
text: You’ve nary a selfish bone among you. Well then, rest assured we’ll speak again if any problems arise. Thank you again.

speaker: Titania
text: Hmm...

speaker: Ike
text: Titania? Is something amiss?

speaker: Titania
text: No, of course not. Our mission is complete, and that’s all that matters. You did well today, every one of you.

speaker: Shinon
text: Pah! Jobs like this barely make a dent in my incurable boredom! It’s like that old buzzard said, there’s better work out there Something with a bit of challenge.

speaker: Titania
text: Shinon!

speaker: Shinon
text: I’m joking. J-O-K-ing.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Come, Titania. Be honest. Don’t you find the work we do to be a bit...disheartening? Unglamorous?

speaker: Titania
text: What? You too, Gatrie? What’s gotten into you?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Please! Look, we’re not a band of money-hungry recruits. We’re professionals, and we’re very good at what we do. Shinon and I have discussed this at length. All of this mundane mercenary work is unworthy of us. We’re wasting our talents.

speaker: Titania
text: I see. You’re telling me that you think Commander Greil is mismanaging us. Do I have that right?

speaker: Gatrie
text: Whoa! Hold it right there! That’s not what I’m saying at all!

speaker: Ike
text: What is it, Titania?

speaker: Titania
text: What’s what?

speaker: Ike
text: You seem so angry. It’s not like you.

speaker: Titania
text: Hmph...

speaker: Gatrie
text: Exactly! Ike’s got the right of it!

speaker: Titania
text: It’s just that I...Look, we do good work, and we help people. I want you to be proud of that. I felt like you were saying work that doesn’t bring fame and fortune isn’t worth doing, that’s all. Sorry.

speaker: Gatrie
text: No...you’re right. We are the ones who ought to apologize.

speaker: Titania
text: Enough. Let’s get going, shall we? Rest is part of our jobs, too. We can’t go into the next battle exhausted.

speaker: Gatrie
text: Now that’s a plan! I’m so hungry, I could eat a wyvern!

speaker: Ike
text: Titania!

speaker: Titania
text: What is it?

speaker: Ike
text: If you’re looking for pride...I have it.

speaker: Titania
text: Hm?

speaker: Ike
text: You and my father have kept this mercenary group together. And I’m...just...proud to be a part of it. That’s all.

speaker: Titania
text: Ike...

speaker: Shinon
text: Pah. I’m surrounded by idealistic fools. What’s so wrong with fame? What’s wrong with having money to live well?

speaker: Mist
text: Ike! Ike! I’ve got to tell you something! Listen to this!

speaker: Ike
text: Settle down, Mist. It’s too early for you to be yelling like that. Now, what’s going on?

speaker: Mist
text: Soren’s back! He just arrived.

speaker: Ike
text: Really? That’s odd. He wasn’t supposed to return for a while yet.

speaker: Mist
text: I know! I wonder what he’s doing back so soon...

speaker: Ike
text: It’s probably nothing to worry about. I’ll go and talk to him. Where is he?

speaker: Mist
text: In the mess hall. I think he wanted to talk to Father.

speaker: Ike
text: Right. I’ll go check there.

speaker: Greil
text: ...Troubling news indeed. Gather the troops.

speaker: Titania
text: Yes, Commander.

speaker: Greil
text: Ike, if you’ve got time to waste, you’ve got time to work. Get over to the briefing room.

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Ike
text: Hey! What’s going on around here?

speaker: Soren
text: Bad news. Something big is happening, and we need to formulate a plan of action.

speaker: Ike
text: Soren!

speaker: Soren
text: Hello, Ike. Long time, no see.

speaker: Ike
text: I’m happy to see you’re back. But hat happened? I thought you were going to be studying for a while longer.

speaker: Soren
text: It’s a long story...

speaker: Greil
text: What’s the hold up? Get over here now!

speaker: Soren
text: Let’s go. I’ll fill you in later.

speaker: Greil
text: You probably remember that Soren’s been training with another mercenary group. Well, he’s back now. And he has some unbelievable news.

speaker: Ike
text: What news is that?

speaker: Greil
text: It’s Crimea and Daein. They’ve gone to war.

speaker: Mist
text: War?! It...It can’t be!

speaker: Greil
text: That’s why I’ve called everyone here. Soren has some more information. Go ahead, Soren.

speaker: Soren
text: All right.

speaker: Soren
text: Take a look at this map.

speaker: Greil
text: Ah. It’s a map of Crimea. Quite detailed, from the looks of it.

speaker: Soren
text: Yes. This is the Melior, Crimea’s capital. Our base of operations is...

speaker: Soren
text: Everything started three days ago. I needed to do some research, so I went to the archives of Melior’s royal library.

speaker: Soren
text: Without warning, the scream of a terrible beast–a wyvern, perhaps–rent the air, and the building was rocked by a tremor.

speaker: Soren
text: I rushed outside and saw wave after wave of knights, cavalry, and wyvern riders, each clad in glistening ebon armor, black as night.

speaker: Greil
text: The Daein army?

speaker: Soren
text: Correct.

speaker: Greil
text: Was there provocation?

speaker: Soren
text: As you know, relations between Crimea and Daein have never been...friendly. However, the past centuries have seen only minor skirmishes, nothing that has ever approached the scale of this attack. It was brutal and without warning. Daein laid the capital to waste. I’ve never seen destruction on this scale before.

speaker: Titania
text: A swift attack, devastating and brutal...A daring gambit, indeed.

speaker: Greil
text: But if it succeeds, a very well-chosen one at that.

speaker: Greil
text: Yes, the king of Daein would not hesitate to employ such treacherous tactics. What happened next?

speaker: Soren
text: King Crimea’s brother deployed the Crimean army to meet the attack. The king ordered his people to flee the city before the battle reached them. Fearing the worst, I also fled and made my way here.

speaker: Greil
text: So we don’t know how the tides of battle flow now, do we?

speaker: Greil
text: That’s all right. Word of the war cannot have traveled far yet. We may well be the first ones who know of it out here. You did well to bring us this information, Soren. I know some risk was involved.

speaker: Soren
text: It was nothing.

speaker: Titania
text: Daein has invaded Crimea...We may be mercenaries, but this still affects us.

speaker: Ike
text: What are we going to do?

speaker: Greil
text: That’s the question of the day. How do you see it, Titania?

speaker: Titania
text: Crimea is the closest thing our company has to a homeland The Crimean royal family and noble houses have been generous, providing us with many lucrative jobs. From a moral standpoint as well as a business one, it’s in our best interest to help Crimea.

speaker: Greil
text: And you, Soren?

speaker: Soren
text: I agree on one point: we are mercenaries.We are not Crimea’s private militia. No coin has crossed our palms, so I think we should stay out of it.

speaker: Greil
text: So you would have us sit and watch as Crimea is overrun?

speaker: Soren
text: I would. Daein’s troops are superior in both numbers and morale. The chances of a Crimean victory are slim indeed.

speaker: Titania
text: But Crimea is ruled by King Ramon, who is known throughout the land for his wisdom. And his brother, Duke Renning, is said t possess peerless valor and courage. Daein may not find victory so easily.

speaker: Soren
text: Valor and courage are for children’s tales. In terms of military prowess, Daein’s King Ashnard is every bit Lord Renning’s equal. Victory will hinge on troop numbers and supplies, and Daein is superior in both. I think the outcome is painfully obvious.

speaker: Titania
text: Curse you, Soren! Crimea is not doomed! If they can turn aside Daein’s initial thrust and turn it into a test of endurance...

speaker: Soren
text: With the Crimean army both demoralized and ill prepared? They simply will not be able to hold out that long.

speaker: Greil
text: All right. That’s enough. Both of you.

speaker: Greil
text: I hear what you say. However, we must ascertain the current situation before we decide on any action. We’ll send a scouting party to get a closer look at Melior.

speaker: Greil
text: Ike, I want you in charge of this. Assemble your men and get going.

speaker: Ike
text: What? Me?

speaker: Greil
text: Titania will accompany you as an advisor.

speaker: Shinon
text: Commander, you must be joking! He’s just a boy, and he’s had barely more than a taste of battle. What do you expect a whelp like him to accomplish?

speaker: Greil
text: Ah, Shinon. Since you’re so concerned, you can go as well.

speaker: Shinon
text: Wait, that’s not what I...Blast.

speaker: Greil
text: Who else...Gatrie Rhys, and Soren. That should do.

speaker: Ike
text: Father, wait...Why do you want me–

speaker: Greil
text: That was an order. Get moving. There’s no time to waste.

speaker: Ike
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Greil
text: Titania, I’m going out for a bit. I want you to give Ike some direction.

speaker: Titania
text: Understood.

speaker: Soren
text: ...Yes, sir.

speaker: Mist
text: Ike! Wait up!

speaker: Ike
text: What?

speaker: Mist
text: Here! This is for you.

speaker: Ike
text: A sword? Where did you get it?

speaker: Mist
text: From Father. He told me to come and give it to you.

speaker: Ike
text: It’s beautiful.

speaker: Mist
text: This is the first sword you’ve gotten that wasn’t a hand-me-down from somebody, isn’t it? That’s great!

speaker: Ike
text: Yeah...

speaker: Mist
text: Well, be careful! Oh, and bring me a souvenir! Something nice. I’ve never been to Melior before...

speaker: Ike
text: Mist, I’m not going on vacation. Sheesh!

speaker: Rhys
text: Are you feeling all right, Ike? You haven’t said a word in quite some time.

speaker: Ike
text: I don’t understand what my father’s doing. Why put a new recruit like me in charge of something so important?

speaker: Rhys
text: You’re going to succeed him as our commander one day. Don’t you think he wants you to know how to lead?

speaker: Ike
text: Me? I don’t... I don’t know if I’m capable. And even if I am, that day’s a long way off, right? I mean, I’m inexperienced. Weak. I’m nothing compared to my father.

speaker: Rhys
text: I’m not so sure about that. When I look at you, I see a young man full of promise. Commander Greil is a great man, but...I think you’ll be every bit his equal.In time, you might even surpass him.

speaker: Ike
text: Don’t be ridiculous!

speaker: Rhys
text: It’s just my opinion. You need not pay it any mind. Yet, if you fear your own weakness, why not take this chance to go out and better yourself? That would be more in keeping with your personality, no?

speaker: Ike
text: I suppose you’re right.

speaker: Ike
text: How did things look over there, Soren?

speaker: Soren
text: Same as here. There are corpses strewn everywhere. There are quite a lot of them, especially when you consider how far we are from the capital.

speaker: Titania
text: Are they Crimean?

speaker: Rhys
text: ...Judging by the armor, the vast majority of the dead are Daein soldiers.

speaker: Ike
text: So Crimea has the upper hand?

speaker: Soren
text: Just the opposite, I think. The Crimean soldiers were members of the Imperial Guard. That means King Ramon–or another member of the royal family–was on the move when Daein soldiers fell on them.

speaker: Titania
text: Could it have been Lord Renning?

speaker: Soren
text: No. As long as the Crimean army still draws breath, Lord Renning will not leave their command. Perhaps another member of the court...

speaker: Gatrie
text: We’ve got Daein soldiers moving in on our location! And they don’t look happy!

speaker: Maijin
text: You there! Who are you? What are you doing here?

speaker: Titania
text: We’re no one you need–

speaker: Maijin
text: You’re armed! Heed me! Drop your weapons and surrender! Act quickly, or else!

speaker: Shinon
text: Listen to me, fool. You’re making a mistake. We’re not...

speaker: Maijin
text: Ah, not going to cooperate, eh? Ready your weapons, men! Move in and kill them all!

speaker: Maijin
text: Tsk! Headstrong fools!

speaker: Soren
text: Getting caught up in some skirmish is not art of the plan...

speaker: Ike
text: But they’re obviously not going to listen to us. Greil Mercenaries! Get ready to fight!

speaker: Shinon
text: All right, Ike. Let’s see how you handle the role of captain. Well? What are your orders, boy? We’ll do what you say, so long as you hurry up and spit it out!

speaker: Ike
text: I know, I know! I’m thinking! Give me a moment, will you, Shinon?

speaker: Shinon
text: Bah. Useless! We’d be better led with Mist than this soft, untested whelp.

speaker: Ike
text: Let’s see...We’re in the middle of the road, and there’s not much cover. Soren and Rhys are vulnerable, so we have to protect them from enemy attacks...Right?

speaker: Soren
text: That’s a sound strategy, Ike. I can attack from behind your defenses. Good thinking.

speaker: Ike
text: Do you mean that? Um...all right! Let’s do that then.

speaker: Maijin
text: Grrr! Blasted mercenaries. They’re better than I expected. Even so, they’ll not prove a match for Daein’s finest!

speaker: Maijin
text: Gwaa haa...Wretched curs...You will regret your decision to oppose Daein...

speaker: Maijin
text: Bah! You’re nothing more than a bunch of ragtag sellswords. Who are you to oppose Daein!? You are so terribly ignorant of your position in this world.

speaker: Ike
text: You refused to listen to us, and then you attacked without provocation! Is this the way of the Daein army?

speaker: Maijin
text: You’re a cheeky little monkey, aren’t you? Once you’re dead, you’ll regret sassing me!

speaker: Maijin
text: A mage, eh I’ll have to keep my guard up around you, no matter how young you look.

speaker: Soren
text: You forced this combat. We cannot allow you to return home. Are you ready to die?

speaker: Maijin
text: I’ve fought the Crimean army before. The Imperial Guard has some skill, but the rest are a poor joke. Which will you prove to be? Hmm? Perhaps you’ll offer me some entertainment after all.

speaker: Titania
text: If you attacked us because you thought we were with the Crimean army, you made a mistake. I left my post years ago. Now, I’m nothing more than a common mercenary.

speaker: Maijin
text: That means nothing to me. You’re not of Daein, you’re armed, and you’re here. It’s our job to destroy you. Simple, wouldn’t you say? Come, dog! Prepare yourself!

speaker: Titania
text: I’d just as soon avoid this bloodshed, but that seems unlikely. If that’s the way it is, I’ll not hold back!

speaker: Ike
text: Did we suffer any casualties?

speaker: Titania
text: Any wounded or dead? No? Excellent! Well done!

speaker: Gatrie
text: I don’t know...Taking out these Daein soldiers may have been a bad move. Um...Hey, Shinon? What are you doing?

speaker: Shinon
text: This swine’s got some nice weapons. Besides, he ain’t gonna complain. He won’t need them where he’s going.

speaker: Ike
text: Shinon!

speaker: Soren
text: Get ahold of yourself! We can’t afford such behavior right now. Steal from the dead on your own time.

speaker: Shinon
text: What? You judgmental little–

speaker: Titania
text: Soren! Shinon! Stop this at once! This is no place for us to waste time bickering amongst ourselves!

speaker: Ike
text: Let’s clear out of here. We have to tell the commander what happened.

speaker: Soren
text: Let’s take this road. We should be able to cut through the forest and...Huh?

speaker: Ike
text: Something wrong?

speaker: Soren
text: No, as I said, this road...

speaker: Rhys
text: Wait! Ike, I just saw something move on the far side of that thicket!

speaker: Ike
text: A wounded soldier, perhaps? Let’s go have a look. Careful, now.

speaker: Rhys
text: Oh, no...

speaker: Ike
text: Did you find anything, Rhys?

speaker: Rhys
text: ...It’s a woman...

speaker: Soren
text: Leave her. We shouldn’t get involved in matters that don’t concern us.

speaker: Elincia
text: Oooh...

speaker: Rhys
text: Thank goodness...It looks like she’s merely fainted.

speaker: Ike
text: Right. We’d better take her with us for now and make sure she’s all right. Give me a hand, will you, Rhys?

speaker: Rhys
text: Of course.

speaker: Soren
text: ...I don’t like this...

speaker: Greil
text: What’s wrong, Ike? Done already? Come on, Son! You’ll never beat me with that attitude!

speaker: Greil
text: Ha ha ha! Think you’re as stubborn as your mule-headed father?

speaker: Greil
text: Ike. Grow up big and strong. I believe you’ve got the makings of a great warrior.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Father. This isn’t a dream, is it? This... This is all real.

speaker: Ike
text: Mist. The sun’s going down, and it’s getting cold. Come on. Let’s go.

speaker: Ike
text: Mist?

speaker: Mist
text: Oh...Oh, Ike...sniff...

speaker: Ike
text: Mist...

speaker: Mist
text: ...W-why...Why?

speaker: Ike
text: I was at his side, but...I couldn’t save him. I’m sorry.

speaker: Mist
text: ...Sniff...

speaker: Ike
text: It’s... It’s so unreal...

speaker: Mist
text: Dad’s gone... He’s gone, Ike. Sniff...And...I...don’t...I don’t know what to do...

speaker: Ike
text: Don’t worry. I’m here.

speaker: Mist
text: Bro-Brother...

speaker: Ike
text: I’ll lead the company...In Father’s stead...And I’ll protect you all. You, the princess...everyone. I’ll protect you. You’ll see.

speaker: Mist
text: Brother...Ike... No...

speaker: Ike
text: Mist?

speaker: Mist
text: I won’t allow it... I can’t lose you. Don’t you see? If you go, then I’ll be all alone...I won’t allow it.

speaker: Ike
text: I’m not going anywhere. I promise you, Mist...

speaker: Titania
text: Commander...Greil...Why is this happening? Why is any of this happening? Why now? First, Crimea...And now you...

speaker: Soren
text: Ike...

speaker: Titania
text: Oh, Ike! Where’s Mist?

speaker: Ike
text: She’s resting in her room. Rhys and Rolf are with her.

speaker: Titania
text: That’s good...She needs to sleep. She’s been through too much. We all have...You should rest too, Ike.

speaker: Ike
text: I’ll be all right. Grief won’t bring my father back to life.

speaker: Ike
text: I know I’ve been a burden on the both of you. Titania, Soren, I just need to thank you both for staying here with me.

speaker: Soren
text: Not at all...

speaker: Titania
text: There’s no need. Don’t trouble yourself.

speaker: Ike
text: So...where is everyone?

speaker: Titania
text: Ike, to tell the truth...

speaker: Ike
text: Yes?

speaker: Oscar
text: Boyd and I are back.

speaker: Titania
text: How did it go?

speaker: Boyd
text: I can’t believe it! They just left, and they didn’t take one look back! Heartless scum! I’ll never forgive them!

speaker: Ike
text: Boyd? What’s going on?

speaker: Boyd
text: Ike! Are you all right?

speaker: Ike
text: I’m fine. Tell me what’s happened. Start talking.

speaker: Boyd
text: Well, uh, it’s...What I mean to say is...Uh...

speaker: Soren
text: Shinon and Gatrie have left us.

speaker: Boyd
text: Soren!

speaker: Soren
text: What? There’s nothing to hide, is there?

speaker: Ike
text: They left? Both of them? Why did they–Oh, I see. They left because of me, didn’t they?

speaker: Titania
text: Ike...

speaker: Boyd
text: Titania told us you were going to be the new commander. Shinon just about exploded...He and Gatrie left not long ago.

speaker: Oscar
text: We went after them. We tried to talk things out, but it was a waste of time.

speaker: Soren
text: We all knew that Ike was going to inherit command of the company, didn’t we? It just happened sooner than we wanted. It was Greil’s decision. If some of us aren’t satisfied with that, there’s no reason we should stop them from leaving. As far as losing fighting strength is concerned, we can solve that by adding new members.

speaker: Boyd
text: How can you say that? After all the battles we’ve been through together, how can you say that?

speaker: Titania
text: Forgive me, Ike. I wasn’t able to stop any of this...

speaker: Ike
text: It’s not your fault, Titania. They did what they felt they had to do They didn’t want to lose their lives to an inexperienced commander.

speaker: Titania
text: Ike! Don’t talk about yourself like that.

speaker: Ike
text: I’m not saying that to gain anyone’s pity. It’s the truth. But even so, I have no intention of giving up command of this company.

speaker: Titania
text: Ike? Then what will you–

speaker: Ike
text: I’m going to follow my father’s wishes. I’m going to assume command. If everyone will accept me, that’s what I’d like to do.

speaker: Titania
text: Of course!

speaker: Oscar
text: I’d already made up my mind. That’s what I was going to do all along.

speaker: Boyd
text: What, so now you want me to start calling you Boss? Is that it? Well, I can do that. Boss it is!

speaker: Rhys
text: I’m in, too.

speaker: Ike
text: Rhys!

speaker: Rhys
text: Mist’s asleep. I know I missed most of the conversation, but I have a good idea of what you’ve been discussing. Commander Ike...Yes, it does have a nice ring to it.

speaker: Ike
text: What about you, Soren?

speaker: Soren
text: ...Ike. I’m not sure what help I could be to you. What place is there for me in a mercenary company, anyway?

speaker: Ike
text: You are so weird...I’ve always depended on you, haven’t I? I need your tactical knowledge. I need your objectivity. You’re not going to leave me, are you, Soren?

speaker: Soren
text: Don’t worry. I’ll be here, watching over you.

speaker: Ike
text: Thank you. I know I’m not as experienced as most of you. I’m going to make some mistakes, but I’ll try not to let you down.

speaker: Titania
text: Well, you’re going to have a lot to learn about being commander. I’m glad you’re serious, because it’s a lot of work.

speaker: Ike
text: Tell me everything.

speaker: Titania
text: First, you’ll need to understand company expenditures. Then we’ll talk about ensuring that everyone is properly outfitted. And we can’t forget the need to gather good intelligence. Oh, and you’ll want to know everyone’s abilities and relationships.

speaker: Ike
text: Uh-huh...

speaker: Titania
text: Earlier, I spoke with a merchant caravan that’s taken refuge here in the castle. They fled Crimea at the same time we did. I told them who we are, and they asked if they could travel with us. I think they’re worried about protection from Daein. In exchange, they’ve offered us a good rate on items and weapons. They’ll also buy items and forge weapons for us.

speaker: Ike
text: Uh-huh...

speaker: Titania
text: They also said we could use their wagons to store our goods. That’s one more worry off our minds.

speaker: Ike
text: Uh-huh...

speaker: Titania
text: So anyway–

speaker: Ike
text: Titania!

speaker: Titania
text: Yes?

speaker: Ike
text: I know I said tell me everything, but...This is too much. I can’t keep up. Maybe I shouldn’t learn everything in one sitting. Can you show me the ropes along the way? Is that all right?

speaker: Titania
text: Oh...yes, of course. Sorry. I got a bit carried away.

speaker: Ike
text: I’ll take over for now. Why don’t you get some rest?

speaker: Titania
text: I’m all right...

speaker: Ike
text: You worry too much. Get some rest. That’s an order. I’ll do my best to manage.

speaker: Titania
text: Yes...Commander.

speaker: Titania
text: Good morning, Ike. How are things going? Does everything look good?

speaker: Ike
text: That’s not what I think, is it?

speaker: Rhys
text: If I’m not imagining things, that’s a squad of Daein soldiers. Why do they have to show up now?

speaker: Boyd
text: What gives? We’re inside Gallia’s borders, aren’t we? They must be out of their minds to pursue us this far!

speaker: Oscar
text: If they’ve come this far, I’m sure getting out of here alive was never one of their priorities.

speaker: Soren
text: We’re in trouble. They have us completely surrounded. We cannot escape

speaker: Titania
text: So many of them...and so few of us...It doesn’t look good, does it

speaker: Ike
text: Doesn’t matter. We have to fight. Greil Mercenaries, ready yourselves!

speaker: Titania
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Soren
text: I’ll begin formulating a strategy immediately.

speaker: Mist
text: Ike! Brother!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist! I want you and Rolf to go in the back and hide!

speaker: Mist
text: But, Ike...

speaker: Ike
text: Just do it now! Everything will be fine, but I need you to do this, all right?

speaker: Mist
text: Mm...All right. Be careful...

speaker: Mist
text: ...It’s happening again...My medallion’s glowing.

speaker: Mist
text: Mother...Father...If you can hear me, please watch over Ike. Please. Will you protect him?

speaker: Ike
text: All right, everyone, are you ready? Greil Mercenaries, move out!

speaker: Ike
text: Huh? Who are you?

speaker: Ilyana
text: I...I...I’m a traveling mage. My name is Ilyana. This castle...Oh...

speaker: Ike
text: Hey, are you all right?

speaker: Ilyana
text: I’m sorry...This rain is so c-cold. I feel like I’m f-freezing...

speaker: Ike
text: You don’t look too good. Are you sick? Do you need medicine?

speaker: Ilyana
text: You’re awfully kind, aren’t you?

speaker: Ike
text: You know, you don’t look like any Daein soldier I’ve ever seen. Are you really one of them, or have they press-ganged you into service?

speaker: Ilyana
text: I was traveling with some merchants, but we got separated. I came here to escape this rain, but some soldiers in black found me. They thought I was a Crimean refugee.

speaker: Ike
text: Oh?

speaker: Ilyana
text: I tried to tell them who I was, but they wouldn’t believe me. They said they would put me to the sword if I didn’t help fight you. I’m...very sorry...

speaker: Ike
text: Don’t apologize. You didn’t have any choice. If it had been me, I’d have done the same. But listen, I think I’ve seen the merchant convoy you were traveling with in the castle! There was a weapons vendor named Muston, and I think a woman named Aimee sold items...

speaker: Ilyana
text: That’s them! Oh, that’s incredible! Are they all unharmed? Where are they?

speaker: Ike
text: They’re fine, they’re fine! In fact, we’ve all come to an agreement, and they’re traveling with us now. I don’t see any reason we should go on fighting. If you’re with them, we can protect you from Daein.

speaker: Ilyana
text: You’re right! Yes, would you please allow me to join your company, too?

speaker: Ike
text: That sounds fine, Ilyana. This is a dangerous place. Go ahead and seek safety within the castle. We’ll hold off the enemy troops.

speaker: Ilyana
text: No...I’ll fight, too.

speaker: Ike
text: But you’re sick...You’ll need some help.

speaker: Ilyana
text: This isn’t the full force of Daein soldiers. More of them are waiting in the forest. You need me.

speaker: Ike
text: ...Well, I wish you weren’t right, but it sounds like we will need your help.

speaker: Ilyana
text: I’m just glad to get away from those awful black-clad soldiers.

speaker: Kamura
text: What? They still resist? Impossible! Fight, dogs! ! Focus and press forward!

speaker: Kamura
text: Urgh...aaa...Glory to...to...Daein...

speaker: Ilyana
text: Forgive me…

speaker: Soren
text: Ike! The enemy has taken the castle!

speaker: Ike
text: No! Mist and the others...

speaker: Titania
text: Ike...I’m sorry, but...We’ve lost.

speaker: Ike
text: I’ve lost... I’ve lost Mist. Father, forgive me...

speaker: Ike
text: Haa...There are..still more of them...Haa...Everyone, fall back to the castle! Regroup! Regroup within the castle!

speaker: Ike
text: Haa...haa...Ah...

speaker: Ike
text: Blast! Not yet...Not yet...We will not fall!

speaker: Mist
text: Brother!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist? You’re not supposed to be out here! I told you to stay–

speaker: Mist
text: I don’t care!

speaker: Ike
text: Mist?

speaker: Mist
text: There’s no way we can escape! This is it, isn’t it? We’re all going to die here, aren’t we?

speaker: Ike
text: Don’t be foolish! No matter what happens, I’m making sure you and Rolf get out of here alive! Once you’re out of danger, you go straight to the palace and stay with Princess Elincia.

speaker: Mist
text: No! I’m not going anywhere. I’m staying here with everyone! I’m staying with you!

speaker: Mist
text: As long as I’m with you, I’m not afraid to die. We’ll see Mother and Father. We’ll all be together again. So, please...Stop telling me to leave you. I can’t. I can’t leave any of you again. All right?

speaker: Ike
text: All right Don’t leave my side.

speaker: Mist
text: Thank you, Brother.

speaker: Ike
text: But one thing...you’re not going to see Mother just yet.

speaker: Mist
text: What?

speaker: Ike
text: I’m going to protect you. I’m not going to let you die. I gave Father my word.

speaker: Mist
text: Ike...

speaker: Ike
text: ...Haa...haa...

speaker: Kamura
text: You took on the Daein army with meager numbers, and you’ve fought well. My compliments. However, it ends now. Prepare to die!

speaker: Daein Soldier
text: Aaah! Noooo!!!

speaker: Kamura
text: What was that? What happened?

speaker: Kamura
text: Cursed Gallian beasts...There are only two of them! How could they have brought my army to its knees!? How...How are they so strong?

speaker: Ike
text: Is that why people fear the laguz?

speaker: Ike
text: So, uh...Are you two from the palace? Did the king of Gallia send you?

speaker: Mordecai
text: He did. I am Mordecai, warrior of Gallia. Your hair is blue. You are Ike. Is this correct?

speaker: Ike
text: That’s right–I’m Ike. You saved us back there. Thank you.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ranulf told me Ike is not a bad stranger. Mordecai and Ike...We will become friends.

speaker: Lethe
text: You don’t know that. You don’t know if we can trust him. It’s too soon to tell. He’s a beorc. A human. You know all humans have two faces.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Lethe!

speaker: Ike
text: Beorc? What’s that?

speaker: Lethe
text: That’s what you are.We with the power are laguz. You soft, hairless things with no power at all, you are called beorc.

speaker: Ike
text: What did you say?

speaker: Mordecai
text: Lethe! You are being bad. The king forbids this. We cannot fight with beorc!

speaker: Lethe
text: Most beorc call us by hated names, look at us with eyes filled with scorn. Sub-human? Hss! Is that how beorc treat their friends? Is that how beorc treat their allies?

speaker: Ike
text: You’re right...Some of us use that name far too readily. I guess if we had thought about it, we’d have realized it’s not a polite term, but we didn’t know you by any other name. I’m sorry.

speaker: Lethe
text: You knew no other name for us? Are we really so little to you, human? You, who forced us into slavery? How easily you forget. But we laguz! We remember. We remember how we have suffered at your hands. The king can say whatever he likes, I will not trust you. I warn you now...never speak to me in such a way!

speaker: Mordecai
text: Lethe...

speaker: Soren
text: What’s your point? Did you come all this way to complain to us? Ha ha...Typical sub-humans.

speaker: Lethe
text: Scum! Those who use that name are enemies of Gallia!

speaker: Mordecai
text: Grrr, grraa, sub-human...Enemy...He is enemy...

speaker: Soren
text: You think you’re humans? The only thing human about you is your conceit You filthy, hairy sub-human!

speaker: Mordecai
text: Graaaaoooooooow!

speaker: Lethe
text: Mordecai! Kill him!!

speaker: Soren
text: Ike!

speaker: Ike
text: Ow...

speaker: Lethe
text: What?

speaker: Mordecai
text: I...Ike...

speaker: Mordecai
text: ...Ike, I’m sorry...I have hurt you...I did not intend to hurt you.

speaker: Ike
text: Mordecai, this injury is nothing. I’m fine.

speaker: Soren
text: You’re nothing but a beast.

speaker: Ike
text: Soren! Stand down!

speaker: Soren
text: Why did you stop me? He hurt you! He could have killed you! We can’t let him get away–

speaker: Ike
text: If you hadn’t provoked him, none of this would have happened. Right?

speaker: Soren
text: But–I only... I’m sorry...

speaker: Ike
text: Mordecai, Lethe, I apologize on behalf of my company. Please forgive Soren. It’s a poor excuse, but we recently lost...some companions. We’re tired, and we’re not thinking clearly.

speaker: Mordecai
text: Ike forgave Mordecai. So now I forgive Soren. No one need be angry.

speaker: Lethe
text: I apologize as well. My behavior has been unkind. I forgot our mission, and I have blundered terribly.

speaker: Ike
text: Mission?

speaker: Lethe
text: The king wants to see you. We are here to guide you to the royal palace.

speaker: Petrine
text: Naesala! King Naesala of Kilvas! I would speak with you now!

speaker: Naesala
text: Oh, if it isn't General Petrine. What brings you up to these frosty mountain peaks?

speaker: Petrine
text: I've no time for pleasantries. Is it true? Has Crimea's army breached Tor Garen?

speaker: Naesala
text: Though I am loathe to report it, this appears to be the case.

speaker: Petrine
text: Bah! Kayachey, you worthless dog! Being defeated by that girl's motley band just proves how useless he was.

speaker: Naesala
text: Surely it's not the general's fault alone. He was told that Crimea's army was weak and that Tor Garen was impregnable. And yet...he was defeated. I'd say that someone severely underestimated our enemy. Wouldn't you?

speaker: Petrine
text: What was that? Do you dare to insult Daein, crow? Men have forfeited their lives for less.

speaker: Naesala
text: Insult Daein? Never! Come now, General Petrine. I'm merely stating the facts. Regardless of the previous battle's outcome, Crimea's army will be stopped here. I will be taking the field myself.

speaker: Petrine
text: ...Hmph. Sounds like you've set the stage for a grand performance.

speaker: Naesala
text: General Petrine, Kilvas will always stand at Daein's side... As long as we receive our payment, of course.

speaker: Petrine
text: If gold is all it takes, then may our friendship never end. See to it that your performance warrants such consideration! Homasa! Come here!

speaker: Homasa
text: Yes.

speaker: Petrine
text: Work with King Kilvas and put a stop to Crimea's army. No screw ups! Or else!

speaker: Homasa
text: Leave it to me, General.

speaker: Petrine
text: I will not suffer another failure, King Kilvas. You must finish them, and do so quickly...Are we clear? Arrr! I am sick to death of being made a fool by that Crimean floozy and her pathetic band of sellswords!

speaker: Naesala
text: And the remaining portion of my fee?

speaker: Petrine
text: Don't worry, we have it ready. You'll get paid when the job is done.

speaker: Naesala
text: As long as we're clear on that point, everything's settled. Well then, I'm off.

speaker: Petrine
text: Dog's breath! Even by half-breed standards, those crows are complete scum! Give that one even the smallest opening, and he'll steal the eyes from your skull. What an untrustworthy wretch.

speaker: Janaff
text: So, General...there look to be a lot of enemy soldiers ahead. Mostly Daein, but there are some crows from Kilvas as well.

speaker: Ike
text: More than our last fight?

speaker: Janaff
text: Yeah, there's a lot, but the most troubling thing is that King Kilvas is with them.

speaker: Ike
text: The crow king himself is cooperating with Daein?

speaker: Janaff
text: Yep. And compared to the other crows, the king is in a class by himself. Obviously, he's no match for our king, but... Anyway, you should move carefully.

speaker: Ulki
